Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Linda K
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends and I stayed here for a few days to celebrate our long-standing friendship. We had the 2 king beds with kitchenette units. Bathroom a bit small for 3 women's toiletries on the counter but we managed. We loved the location since it was minutes away from the parks we chose to visit, yet still in a quiet little area that cut down on noisy traffic. The staff was exceptionally accommodating. The pool was a perfect temp and the poolside bar and grill stayed open until 11 PM. You don't find that very often. We all agreed we would stay there again. One tip: there is a Keurig coffee maker in the room and only 3 complimentary k-cups......if you like the use of k-cups, bring your own for the remainder of your stay otherwise you'll need to purchase them at the check-in desk.

Reviews.Title: “Geat resort.”
Reviews.Author: TeresaBenji T
Reviews.Content: Me and my family spent 4 days here and it was great, The staff was great as well as the suites. Great location, close to everything, but still quiet,Will deffently stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Shellane
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort. It was close to everything yet away from all of the chaos. It was elegant, rich looking and the bed was comfy! After being at the Convention Center, I needed to relax and The Point was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family”
Reviews.Author: CakeNine
Reviews.Content: We are just back from four days at the Point in Orlando. The hotel was ideal for our group of four: mom, two kids and grandmother. We had the Two-Bedroom Deluxe Suite with three king-sized beds and a pull-out couch. Having a full-sized kitchen that was spotlessly clean and perfectly outfitted was a godsend. Staff was exceedingly helpful and friendly and the pool, hot tub and outdoor bar/resto was delightful. The hotel is also VERY quiet. The only very minor downside was that there is no wi-fi in the rooms but that's hardly a dealbreaker. Kind of nice to be unplugged on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Tony A
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights there and it was perfect. We had a view of the Pool Area and could see Fireworks from Disney at night. We had a 1 bedroom Grand Suite and breakfast was included. Great Location to International Drive and it provided Shuttle to Themes Parks. Loved the Full Kitchen, Washer/Dryer and the Beautiful Bathroom. Will stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: sueguillot
Reviews.Content: Loved the full kitchen and washer/dryer. Staff very friendly. Close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with family with easy access to the parks.”
Reviews.Author: kriv99
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here and found it to be perfect for us with our kids, a 6 year old and 2 year old. We booked through AmEx travel and the breakfest was included with our room. Universal is about a mile away, there is a waterpark across the street and Disney was about 20-30 minutes away (depending on traffic). Having the kitchen and washer/dryer was a huge help. I found it easiest to ship our luggage instead of bringing it on the plane. Our packages were safely secured in a locked closet. The only think I didn't like was the food from the poolside bar. The orders were wrong and the food didn't taste very good. Traffic in that area coming to/from I-4 on W Sand Lake Rd (482) is terrible. We found it much easier to Universal Blvd exit on I-4 (about 1 mile north of the W Sand Lake Rd exit).

Reviews.Title: “Had short stay,wished it was longer there!.”
Reviews.Author: Craig L
Reviews.Content: I was amazed how large the rooms were,everything clean,very comfortable. Coffee machine didnt work but was easily supplied a kettle for tea which was my preference so service was great and overall id stay there anytime i visit again as every aspect was organised and relaxed. Highly recommended,thankyou so very much for finishing my holiday on a high for me.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly really good.”
Reviews.Author: Mrs. M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. The room was very nice and the mini kitchen was really handy. The pool was large and nice and the food at the pool bar was really good. Free parking, internet (by the pool) and shuttle to attractions was really handy. Fabio at the front desk was really helpful and bent over backwards to help us when asked. The room price was really reasonable (pre-paid on Expedia to get the best rate) but there were a couple of little things that bothered me about this hotel. The second bed was a pull out sofa and it had the worst excuse for a mattres that I have ever seen. It really didn't "match" the nice decor otherwise. Upon request they brought me another mattress to double the thickness, but it was still a bit lame and the one blanket allocated to this sad little bed had a big hole in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stay, lacking for week long holiday”
Reviews.Author: QBGAP
Reviews.Content: My mom, sis and I stayed here for a week long getaway to Orlando, with the intention of spending a bit of time at Universal. We picked this hotel as part of a vacation package through Universal Orlando Vacations, that including flights, hotel stay, passes for the parks and a few other perks. The hotel was fairly well priced and its location was ideal since we did not want to pay the extra to stay within Universal itself. It was about a $5 cab ride to and from the park. It was also a $5-10 cab ride to the Premium Outlet Shops and within walking distance to several restaurants. The hotel was a distance from Disney and I would not recommend it for people planning to spend more than one day at Disney. They do offer a complimentary shuttle, but it takes at least an hour to go from hotel to park because it stops at about another dozen hotels along the way. If you want to skip the shuttle and take a cab, it costs about $45. The hotel was fresh and new and extremely clean. If I was staying for only one or two nights, I would have been very happy as I do not consider myself an overly picky traveler. However, we stayed for a week and I felt that this hotel was missing a few basic things that make a week-long stay a bit more comfortable: 1. The hotel did not have a proper restaurant. They served pub style food until 10:00pm around the pool bar. We went there one night after a very tiring day shopping. We waited over an hour for the food, the service was terrible, the food was expensive and when we received it, it was undercooked, cold and inedible. 2. There was no mirror in our room. We didn't notice on the first day but after a morning of three people trying to get ready at the same time, it became an issue. 3. There was no safe in our room. This really surprised us. My sis and I are fairly seasoned travelers and we've never stayed in a hotel in a touristy location that did not have a safe for passports, jewelry, valuables. 4. Breakfast was not included in the price and was very expensive compared to similar breakfasts in the area. The breakfast bar was set up in the lobby and, good or bad, as a result, the entire main level of the hotel smelled like bacon and sausage 24/7. 5. The front desk staff were not forthcoming with information about the area and what it had to offer. Finding out about transportation, places to eat, etc. was a bit of a chore. They did not have any kind of pamphlets or anything available for tourists. 6. The housekeeping service was TERRIBLE. While the hotel was very clean, they offered only 'light housekeeping duties' during your stay. What this meant was they changed the towels and made the beds. They did not restock the facial or bathroom tissue - we had to call the front desk for refills every time we ran out. We didn't get service at all on our first day - we had to call the front desk when we returned late in the evening to get fresh towels for the next morning. 7. None of the cab drivers seemed to know where our hotel was. I don't know if it recently changed names or what, but it became annoying to try to give the drivers directions when we didn't know the area at all. Overall, the hotel felt like an airport hotel or a one-nighter business hotel. It definitely didn't add anything positive to our Orlando vacation. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Weaselmcpuppy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here April 18 & 19. The hotel was spotless, the staff very friendly. We were just minutes from Universal Studios and only about 15 min from Disney. Last year we stayed at Disney's Port Orleans and it was dirty, loud and expensive. I would highly recommend staying at The Point instead of almost any Disney property. the only negative was that there was no wireless internet in the room. there was an ethernet hook up, but our tablet didn't have a port for that. There was free wireless in the lobby and by the pool. We plan on staying here on our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: newsh0es
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week with my husband. This is a good hotel for a family as it has a large kitchen in the rooms and a nice size family room/ extra bedroom. However the hotel staff was very unfriendly, all I require is to be courteous and to smile. They seemed burdened by my few questions. They had cleaned the carpets in the hallway and did not have any signs warning that the floor was slippery. Naturally I slipped. The smell of the chemicals was awful too. The king size bed and linens were nice. I want to say clean.... But I found a hair on a pillow. Not my hair. But still I liked the bedroom. The bathroom was large and clean and very nice, however, every night the toilet would randomly groan loud and wake me. It was strange and very annoying. As a result, I would never stay here again. Let's face it there are many hotels in orlAndo so why stay anywhere that you don't like. Lastly, the sliding glass door to the third floor balcony was broken and had no working lock. I wedged a garden chair in the track of the door to stop intruders. It was creepy at night. Enough said. And the breakfast was rubbery eggs. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “point”
Reviews.Author: katab27
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was superb!! The staff made sure to get us anything and everything we needed! Food from room service was delicious and came quickly. Wish they had wireless internet in the rooms but it wasn't that big of deal using the eathernet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous choice, could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights during our 2 week holiday in Florida, We chose The point because of its location as we wanted a few days at Universal. It turned out to be a fabulous choice, the location was excellent, the double king suite was very spacious and modern. The staff were very friendly and it was one of the only hotels we didn't feel we were being charged for everything. A very relaxing stay and we would have happily stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: family_17
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family of four in early March and found no major faults with this property. The room layout worked well (full kitchen, pull out in living room and king bed in bedroom). It was fine, nothing fancy, no problems. Paint on the walls was tired. The bathroom shower was great, nice tiles and roomy. The pull out sofa mattress was of poor quality and I was glad that it was just for kids - an adult would not have had a good sleep on that! It was a drag not to have free wireless in the rooms, but we hung out poolside to go online, so the kids were happy as it meant more swimming time. Great location for seeing Orlando and lots of parking too.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely maintained hotel with courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: LsDano
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a convention and found the hotel to be quite nice. My room was huge with a jetted tub, separate shower, and full kitchen. Any requests I made of the staff were immediately handled. Although I didn't get to enjoy the pool area, my room did overlook it and it looked quite nice. There are some quirks though. Because my room was low (3rd floor) I had a lot of noise from the pool until 11PM each night. After 11 it was very quiet but you may want to keep that in mind and ask for a higher floor if you sleep during the day. The wireless internet was only in the lobby, the rooms had wired internet. The business center cost $0.25/minute and $0.75 per printout to use the computer so it cost about $3 to print out my boarding pass. There is no shuttle service to the airport and a cab was $50 + tip. Expect a long walk to anywhere but Wet and Wild (although the I-Ride shuttle stops right in from of the hotel from 8AM - 10:30PM and a 5 day pass is only $8). There is a mandatory $11/night 'resort fee' so factor that into the price. The breakfast buffet was tasty but cost $12 which is a little steep. The pillows in my room were very squishy and uncomfortable but, in fairness, I didn't ask for new ones. On the positive side, my room was well stocked with dishes, glasses, and utensils and even has a Keurig for making coffee (additional K-cups are available from the front desk). My room was stylishly decorated and everything was in working order. Getting around on Universal and International Drive was easy from there by using the shuttle or even on foot if you're fit. All of the staff I interacted with were very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel; poor 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: Poppyreynolds
Reviews.Content: For the cost of the hotel; unfortunetly it did not live up to the standards expected. Staff were friendly and helpful but small details such as help with our toone of luggage and the fact we had to call 3 times to get some extra hangers did get missed. The rooms were clean and nice enough - the bathroom was quite small but did not cause us any issues. Breakfast really let the hotel down; for $10 a person - which seemed quite reasonable; there was very little choice; some cereal; toast; melon; burnt bacon and scrambled egg was about it and all was very average. Had to pay extra for tea or coffee served in a paper cup - just not what we expected from a 4 star hotel. The pool was nice and there is a restaurant on site but only serves burgers and sandwiches really. Location was okay fairly easy to get around but we did have to get a taxi to quite a few places. All in all the hotel was clean and the rooms pretty good - just not a 4 star by any stretch of the imagination

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: 4rkidz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of the Hogwarts hotel deal with Universal and we were not disappointed. The rooms are really beautiful and we enjoyed the pool.. the location isn't great as limited to walk to places but close to universal..

Reviews.Title: “Home from home!”
Reviews.Author: SLF123
Reviews.Content: We booked a two week stay in a two bedroom suite over Easter. Our room was in Tower 1 and overlooked the pool. The rooms were spacious and spotless and well furnished with everything you could possibly need. The living/kitchen area gave us freedom over when we ate and room to chill. There is wired Internet but we lucky enough to receive the free wifi from the pool area too! We had a balcony in the master suite and this afforded a view over the pool and towards I Drive. It caught the sun in the evening and it was a fantastic place to relax, also useful to dry swimwear etc! For eating out I would recommend TGI Fridays which is within sight of the hotel and Outback Steakhouse which is not! Cabana bar food a bit overpriced and not that tasty. Handy if you are happy enough to stay by the pool and enjoy the pleasant ambience there. Sun loungers and towels are free and plentiful. There is also a jacuzzi and a fitness suite but I was not tempted to use it! I would say if you are going to Disney parks then hire a car. I had never driven on the right before this holiday but soon got used to it. The cars was an automatic and the roads are well signed and American drivers very courteous. You can also use it to go shopping and eating out. Stock up in Walmart! Great shopping in Florida Mall. Premium Outlet Malls were a disappointment. I Drive great for eating out but also full of rubbish shops whose ethics are questionable, beware! Avoid Searz Camera store!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice, Very Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: martygmercman
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this is trip number 19 to Orlando in 21 years. Please see my previous reviews for greater detail of the orlando area if needed. This was a very last minute Easter Break and, to be honest, there was not an awful lot of choice left (that stood out) on the conventional hotel websites (hotels.com, etc) so, I noticed The Point was available. I booked it directly on the hotels website in $USD. Its location is great. A quater of a mile in each direction, out of the gate, you have either Sand Lake Road, with its easy access to International Drive, north and south and I4 (Disney) or Wet and Wild and just further along, Universal. As always, I would suggest you dont consider most properties without a car. For old times sake, we decided to take the hotel shuttle to EPCOT (it only goes there) and leave the car. Errrr, dont miss doing that. The bus had seen better days and stopped at about six other properties before hitting I4. On the way back (6PM) the bus was way overcrowded and some people didnt get on. what did they do?. Dont know?. I had to stand for 45 minutes, which wasnt much fun. However, this wasnt the Hotels Fault. The staff are very friendly and helpful and nothing seemed too much trouble. To settle in for two weeks we needed extra things and this was taken care of quickly and with a polite smile. The Hotel has a Nice Pool and Cabana Bar, which is very resonably priced and the food surprisingly good. We had a One Bedroom Executive Suite, so, seperate bedroom with King Sized Bed, a great mini kitchen and really good family sized bathroom. Everything was clean and tidy. This is a general observation, and not a criticism of the hotel, but we have two teenage girls and we had never stayed anywhere without another bedroom before. With the Gift of Hindsight, I probably would only consider a two bed unit, not just here, but anywhere. I thought we might be able to get away with the sofa bed, but, it was cramped and uncomfortable for the girls with a really skinny mattress. Angela from the Hotel Reception organised a second mattress which made it "just" acceptable for the two weeks stay. So, my recommendation would be that sofa beds for a family of 4 are only really suitable for a couple of kids, say up to 10 or 1 child only. Older than that, I believe they need their own beds. The Point is a very good choice for those visiting orlando for the first time and experienced travellers and therefore I would not hesitate to recommend it or consider it again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ViliH
Reviews.Content: The Point Resort is a great place to stay at in Orlando. It's conveniently located near Universal Studios, and right by International Drive. The breakfast was also nice, fruits, bread, yogurt, cereal, everything. The pool was very warm, and slightly salty (?). The rooms were large, and the sofa bed was comfortable too. Internet access in rooms, and Universal ticket machines located downstairs. Kind staff, willing to help. Good experience in general. =)

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal Studios.”
Reviews.Author: Eskape96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in March, 2012. Arrived late, but made sure that we called to let them know that our plane was delayed. We were hoping that our room would be upgraded, but that did not happen. Used our Orlando Magic card to get a one night stay for free. Room was spacious and loved that we had access to a fridge. Two days of our stay our room was not cleaned, had to call the front desk for towels etc. The pool is beautiful and the property is very nice. If you want a taxi/cab the hotel has their go - to people that charge a bit more then the usual cab. Don't bother using the shuttle service, the day we used it the driver was 20 minutes late and took 45 minutes to get to Sea World. Catch the trolley in front of Walgreens,. The $1.25 that you have to spend is worth it. The best thing about this hotel is its location and in the end the price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Ann4141
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Booked early and got a great rate for a 2 bedroom suite. Pool looked wonderful but we were too busy to use it. Rooms were very comfortable and had everything. Very spacious. Would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Glenn K
Reviews.Content: It was close to Universl Studio's and restaurants. Walked to Universal from here which was quicker then driving and parking ( it was Easter so iot was busy at the park). Staff were great. The only complaint would be the joint use doorway. It can be noisy when people open and close their doors.

Reviews.Title: “The Points Resort”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne B
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and friendly atmosphere. Would use this hotel next time we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was even better than what you see in the pictures. Great Service and value for money. Location, you are in the heart of the action. I cannot find a fault! Twenty minutes from Magic Kingdom, twenty minutes from the airport. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: alc372
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Great location for Wet N Wild and the Universal Parks and City Walk. Would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Miss this and miss out!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: billmcq
Reviews.Content: An absolute fantastic time was had at this hotel by my wife, son and I. We stayed for 9 nights, had a room on the 10th floor with balcony overlooking the pool and the view was amazing. Hotel was so clean, the staff were very friendly and attentive to any requirements. Our rate included free breakfast which was always superb, you have to pay for coffee though but it's only $1.60 for a regular cup which is hardly extortionate!! My only complaint about the resort would be that the breakfast area is quite small however that is being taken care of within the next few weeks as they are making alterations to accomodate more tables! Pool area always clean and tidy, lovely outdoor sofas beside the bar area, pool temperature was nice and comfortable. Would highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nedyahr
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in that actually lived up to their reputation! Everything was great about this room. Booked a one bedroom suite. Nice to have a washer and a dryer for an 8 day trip with the family. Here's the best tip of all: get an Orlando Magic Card and you can get a free 4th night saving you a couple hundred bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy V
Reviews.Content: We overall had an excellent stay at the hotel for four nights. The staff was friendly and very helpful with any questions you had. The rooms were very clean and stylish. Location of hotel took you off the busy strip, but close enough to all attractions. It was very nice to have the pool/cabana bar open till later evening so you could enjoy after a long day at the parks. The main downfall of our stay was that the mattress was quite uncomfortable. It was evident that they are older and time for an upgrade so that one can have a restful night!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: van123456789
Reviews.Content: The point, is an amazing hotel with some beautiful views.When we got there we had to wait for are room at bit but it was worth it.Our room had a kitchen with a large working fridge, an oven and a cupboards. Our room had a view of the pool and it had a balcony. The sofa had a pull out camp bed and it was like a double bed. there was one other bedroom with a double bed and a TV with hundreds of channels.The bathroom had a fully working shower, a bath and a separate toilet cubical.The cleaners that cleaned our rooms didn't put enough towels in our room and didn't do a good job at cleaning but it had very good service.The reception was nicely furnished and so were the rooms. we would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stuart M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of the reviews and great location. Would definitely recommend. Rooms are clean and well furnished and beds very comfortable. Hotel is very quiet. Staff are all really helpful and responsive to requests. Good value for money. Pool heated nicely and Cabana bar food and drink reasonably priced. A couple of points: would like to see free WI-FI and deal for Free Breakfast only covered the 2 adults, had to pay extra for teenage son staying in our room which we felt was a bit mean and resulted in unexpected cost. Otherwise would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KristaAthens_GA
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay while visiting the Orlando theme parks! We were able to use a Georgia/Florida rate, which was awesome! There were five of us, so the two bedroom worked out very nicely. There was plenty of room, so we weren't on top of each other. I loved having the kitchen, b/c we were able to make our own breakfast. The pool was very nice. You could bring your own drinks down or make use of the cabana if you wanted to. The alcoholic drinks are a little pricey. We did get some cheese fries from there at one point. They were really delicious. Everything was very clean, and the staff was friendly. The bathroom adjacent to the master bedroom was enormous. It had a huge jacuzzi tub and large walk-in shower--plenty of room for more than one person to get ready. There is a free shuttle to the parks. My only complaint was that there are not very many trips to each park, so you can't be too flexible about when you leave/come home if you want to use the shuttle. All in all, it's a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: farriesgc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point for the first 5 nights of our holiday. Our rooms were clean and very functional. The pool was heated, very comfortable and clean. We loved being so close to Universal but away from the noise. It was nice to have a kitchen to help keep food costs down a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for families!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hojsam
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for $$? The rooms were clean and the amenities are amazing. We've been here twice and would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: FDJC
Reviews.Content: All of the great reviews are correct! We had a very nice stay in this hotel. I actually wish we would have booked one more day to just spend at the pool. Great value, close to Universal Studios, and I would very likely stay again. There was only one thing I would like to see change; the condition of the mattress inside the pull out couch...tattered and worn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Autresejour
Reviews.Content: Stayed on two occasions a week apart each for one night. Rooms spacious,very clean,beds comfortable,room well maintained,in a good location.Most important reason I would return and also recommend was the helpful attitude and customer oriented focus of Hotel Staff.A pleasant relief from the staff indifference in many large hotels.Hotel is 3 yrs old and is well maintained...does not show the wear and tear of a highly trafficked destination hotel. Recommend without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Easter Vacation in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Tom A
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (2A+2C) from Northern Ireland and we took the children to Orlando for the 1st time and have just returned from a 2 week stay in the Point Resort. We had a 2 bedroom apartment which allowed the children to have their own space. The facilities in the rooms were of a high standard. The kitchen was fully equipped including a dishwasher and washer/dryer. We didn't hire a car as we used the courtesy bus, the I-ride and the local lynx bus. There is a convenience store across from wet&wild about 10mins walk away which we used for our basic provisions. You can buy breakfast and light meals at the cabana bar and the children loved the smoothies. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful especially the reception staff who were able to advise us on local attractions and how to get their and back. You can walk to wet&wild. Universal studios is 10mins by taxi or you can get the courtesy bus. Disney is 8 miles away but takes approx and hour on the courtesy bus as it stops at 3-4 other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: kalis-dad
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze,everything I was promised was there and ready for us.The rooms were great,very spacious.The bathroom was the size of some hotel rooms we've stayed in before.The Point must be fairly new.I highly recommend this place and will stay here on my next visit to Orlando. Don't count on taking their shuttle to the parks.You can walk to Universal from here.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at The Point.”
Reviews.Author: CWoolven
Reviews.Content: What an amazing Hotel! The rooms are clean, spacious and extremely comfortable. The overall location of the hotel is perfect, so close to the best restaurants on I-Drive and really close to all the main attractions of Orlando; right next door to wet and wild (which we could see from our room) and we actually walked to Universal too. Best of all the staff are brilliant, they're polite, helpful and have a great knowledge of the local area and further away they knew everything we needed to know. We had a great stay and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I feel I got duped with RESORT FEES and wasn't provided a good value”
Reviews.Author: Mason M
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days at this resort mid-week in February to visit Universal. Pros include cleanliness of room, full kitchen, large bath with a one-person jetted tub, towels at the pool, and being on the I drive Trolley route. The cons included non-disclosed fees, on-site food, advertised shuttle, management communication. I booked this trip through SouthWest vacations looking for a good quality hotel close to Universal for the $. I was looking in the 4-star category. In Orlando there are a lot of nice hotels and heavy competition for the tourist $ with prices being very competitive. The stay was in the OK to Good range. Nothing really special but it was nice. It wasn't very busy. 1-5 in pool or at outside bar/grill. Upon check-in this hotel required a $75 deposit for "incidentals" which some hotels do...No problem but no additional fees discussed. Standard check-in process. We had breakfast for two at the hotel which was $22. I felt it was a little expensive for a small spread and had to pay for coffee separate but not a huge deal. The advertised free shuttle only ran once per day in each direction leaving at 7:45AM and pick up was scheduled 1.5 hours after the park closed which was 7:30PM. No other options for free...ended up taking a cab($10). My surprise came at check-out when I expected to pay that $22 for breakfast and found my room tab was the breakfast plus $39 additional in RESORT FEES. $13 / day that wasn't disclosed to me up front / during the booking process on Southwest / or anytime. I asked what the $13 paid for and was told it was a fee always charged. I asked why they don't include it in the price they advertise and was met with blank stares. I needed to leave for the airport so I decided I would call management upon my return home. I did 3 times and was transferred to a management company (no manager on site?) and each time my call wasn't returned. I would not recommend staying here based off these underhanded business practices. If this is legal I don't know why every hotel doesn't charge $100s in Resort Fees and still be able to advertise low prices. This place charges $91 EXTRA / WEEK for standard hotel amenities

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: cblimb
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a 6 day stay at the Point Orlando and must say that the whole experience exceeded our expectations. We had a 2 bedroom suite which felt like home from home and gave the 4 of us the space to spread out and unwind after a day at the parks. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is visiting Orlando and we will return ourselves in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ComfortLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple for 4 night. Staff were very helpful the pool was great the poolside bar a lot of fun. Walking distance to resteraunts bus to the theme Parks

Reviews.Title: “Spring break to Disney”
Reviews.Author: BristowMOM
Reviews.Content: Great place! We stayed for 7 days over spring break with our six year old. We visited all the Disney parks and it was a 15 minute drive to all the parks. We didn't use their shuttle service because it was our first visit to Disney and didnt know how much our daughter could handle. Condo was just right for us, bed was not too comfortable but it worked out, pool was great and pool bar was convenient although a bit expensive. The only disappointment was that we had to pay for coffee for the kurig. Overall we had a great time when we were there and not at the parks!

Reviews.Title: “On Point!”
Reviews.Author: Bermytraveller
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Point has been a pleasant one. Our 1 bedroom suite was well-appointed - king bed, massive bathroom, sitting area, washer/dryer, fridge, stove, balcony... Did a take-out breakfast from The Bistro and a light dinner from The Cabana Bar and Grill - nothing fancy but both were good. Hotel is within walking distance of International Drive where you can catch the I-ride trolley, less than a minute from Wet n Wild and 15 minutes from the Florida Mall. Front desk staff - Juan, Pablo, Stephanie et al, went out of their way to ensure our stay was a good one. If you are traveling by taxi to and from the hotel, be sure to ask for a metered taxi or you will get ripped off! As mentioned in other reviews, there is no wi-fi in rooms, only in the lobby and by the pool. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid experience”
Reviews.Author: rojopowerranger
Reviews.Content: stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. size is good for the price. Because there is a refrigerator in the room, it kicked on at night and was pretty loud for those in the living room area. Air con was also really loud but that helps to drown out other noise. We only had issues with the age of some of the things in the room --mattress and sleeper sofa, dishwasher. The bar service was a little disorganized which I think they want to appear as laid back -- but just seems bad. We had to ask for our food and found it was done and sitting behind the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Point Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Dale L
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a vacation in Orlando, and stayed at the Point Orlando Resort for a couple of days so that we could visit Wet N Wild. The waterpark is within walking distance of the resort which saved us the $15 parking fee. The Point Orlando is more of a condo hotel and therefore doesn't have all the amenities of a true hotel. There wasn't a small market, and the restaurant was outside by the pool---which was a drag if you wanted to order food when it was raining. Since there wasn't a restaurant or shopping next door, the location was maybe just a little inconvenient. The service was great and all the staff were very helpful. We had a 1BR suite---the bed was comfortable, and the bath was large with a separate shower, jetted tub, and spacious counter. The unit had a kitchen with all the appliances, and also a washer/dryer in the unit. The drawback is that the washer and dryer were really loud in operation---I think everyone on the 7th floor knew that I was doing laundry. The one trouble that I had was that the shower seemed to take a long time to drain, but that's probably just our room and not a problem with the hotel (#704). We did have a balcony, but didn't spend too much time on it. The view wasn't really of anything interesting or spectacular except an auto repair shop and some open field. The general condition of the rooms and the hallways were a little dirty. The carpets could use a good cleaning in the hallways and guest rooms. The furnishings were just a little tired, too, but everything was working fine. Internet service in the room was perfect for me because I had a wired connection on my laptop.....we didn't try wireless, but I remember reading that it's not available except in the lobby. Overall, a good experience, and a really good value. I'd consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Point Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl H
Reviews.Content: we were traveling with teenagers, the room was very spacious, however, the bed was not very comfortable. this is a nice hotel, very convenient if you are going to Universal Studios, not so much if you are going to Disney. The pool area is great, nice Cabana bar with reasonable prices...would stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Recommend to Others”
Reviews.Author: PradoFamily
Reviews.Content: We originally booked their smallest room to save money for our 7 night stay. But we got upgraded when there was a problem for us getting into the room. They upgraded us to a single suite, and it was wonderful! I know we wouldn't have been able to afford it otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: honneebun
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel/condo with a kind of "pay for what you want" setup. For me, I didn't mind the basic daily housekeeping refresher (trash emptied, bed made). I brought my own coffee and was disappointed to learn there were single-serving coffee makers in the rooms. If I wanted more more coffee, I would have to pay $1/serving (2 regular and 1 decaf were provided for free). I definitely would've preferred a traditional coffee maker, but it wasn't a big deal. The one thing that knocked one point off my reivew was that I called the front desk for a bellhop twice, and no one ever came. I'm disabled and have difficulty carrying a lot, so I had to make several trips myself. The location was great for me (off of I-4, by I-Drive and Universal). I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbara F
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor in selecting The Point for my vacation in January. What a great choice I made. It was spotless and the staff was very welcoming. We stayed 2 nights and would choose to stay here again in the future. It was close to Universal and an easy drive to Disney. It was clean and comfortable for 3 adults. I loved the huge bathroom and having the washer and dryer in our room. We enjoyed the pool and hottub and the Tiki Bar. It was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanderersCheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point for 4 nights around mid March. We had a one bedroom suite which was very spacious and comfortable, with a huge bed and lovely bathroom. The kitchen area was very well stocked and the washer/dryer was very handy. We had a higher level room overlooking the pool and heard no outside noise or anything from any of the other rooms. The hotel is well located for reaching the theme parks and we made use of the free shuttle to Universal. Staff were very helpful. We got a rate which included breakfast and although the choice was a little limited and didn't include hot drinks, it was fine for us and we were always able to get a table in the relatively small breakfast area. We also ate at the outside bar one night which was nice. The only negative for us was lack of wifi in the rooms, although there was a wired connection for the laptop, but in the world of smart phones, it was a bit of a nuisance to have to download email in the lobby before going up to our room. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at the Point, it was just nice to be able to prepare a light meal and watch TV after a long day at the parks. Would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Like Home”
Reviews.Author: croozinsoozin
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed being able to spread out in a one-bedroom suite. We found everything we needed in the kitchen and the bathroom was gorgeous! The washer and dryer were convenient (if a little noisy) and we left with clean clothes. A very nice experience overall!

Reviews.Title: “Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: Patrick H
Reviews.Content: The Pointe Resort is not a resort. One should conjugate the verb "resort" instead. 1) I resort---to having cleaning service that only takes out the garbage and makes the beds. So it is a lot like home. You get the level cleaning your kid may do and then you do the rest! 2) You resort-to having queen size beds a foot away from flimsy windows. Perfect for giving parents heart attacks when toddlers are jumping on beds. I was told this set-up was in "all of their rooms." 3) He, she, it resorts-to no WIFI. They will say they do but it is only in the lobby. Nice. I have a million dollars in the bank, it is just not in my bank account. But they do offer Ethernet cords which would be helpful in 1998. 4) We resort-to the lowest common denominator. It was our wedding anniversary. We asked for a bottle of wine. BTW- There is no room service so we were transferred to their "bistro." You would think I was asking for gold. They couldn't make that happened. Also, the basic free continental breakfast was great. Only it was 9 dollars per person. But this was unnecessary for us as the aroma of breakfast lingered in our room for our first day. It smelled like hash browns. We were told it was probably our neighbors. Dem da breaks! So yes, it is a resort. This should be your last resort. I have no idea where the place these folks stayed that was four or five stars. I travel quite a bit and had better accommodations in Siberia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zo R
Reviews.Content: Spacious, comfortable and clean accommodation. Well equipt kitchen which included washer, dryer, microwave & dishwasher. Decent pool and towels provided though no mattresses for sunbeds! 20 minutes car drive from Dysney World and close to shopping centres. Would definately rebook and well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Andrea1984_12
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Point Orlando Resort and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! We received a very good price for the 4 star hotel. The location was perfect since we were planning on going to Universal Studios. The hotel is right up the street from Universal Studios. The room was very nice and the King size bed was very comfortable. We absolutely loved the pool area and enjoyed the jacuzzi! The staff was very friendly. We would definitely stay again! See you this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Review, places to eat, all via walking !!!”
Reviews.Author: wudwork
Reviews.Content: Others document the extra charges that all properties near resorts/airport/atttractions seem to charge. No need repeating. The tub shower seemed like 3 inches above bathroom floor; somewhat ackward. Shower curtain was a piece of junk. I alerted manager and he promptly addressed it. Pressure and hot water were just right! We had the room with microwave and fridge & krup coffee maker, but did not use them. They supply materials for 1 night, if you stay for > 1 nite, you pay for all used materials starting on 2nd nite. We love to walk and found the Wet-n-Wild a very easy 10 minute walk. On the same road as Wet-n-Wild entrance, about a 1/3 mile (after crossing back over Universal Blvd) on the left is a HUGE salad bar restaurant where you pay a low price and eat all you want. Hot/cold lunch, ice cream, deserts and a huge salad bar are all EXCELLENT ! and low price. To walk to it, leave hotel going towards Wet-n-Wild. At the Wet-n-Wild light, make right. Place in in shopping center, on front corner, of left side about a 1/3 mile down. Right at the light. Looks and feels like a Denny's type place. We at breakfast buffet at place right across from Wet-n-Wild entrance. Too pricey when you add juice, coffee and such. We walked to Universal. I would easily do this again and again. It is a mile or so with all sidewalks. Keep in mind, the cab ride to airport is around $40 each way and that was easily cheaper than a car that stays parked at Universal all day. Wet-n-wild ? Go after 3pm, its half day rate. We also did the sky-diving simulator (yes we easily walk to it). WOW was that something you must experience.

Reviews.Title: “grand suite very spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: aliceAdkins
Reviews.Content: we had 3 other couples that stated at the Point Resort. Everyone had a great time there. The Hotel is exactly shown on the pictures. this is a very beautiful hotel and the grand suite rooms are very spacious. we recommend this hotel. we will recommend other friends to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando fun”
Reviews.Author: Scrapbookfan
Reviews.Content: Orlando is not a very relaxing place with all the attractions, the people and the traffic. Because of this, you need a very good place to unwind. I was very pleased with the Orlando Point Resort. The price was good for what we were using it for. It is close to Universal Studios, shopping and restaurants. It's even better if you have a car to get to and from. The hotel, pool area and the gym is clean. We did not eat there during our stay therefore cannot comment on the food. Our room was comfortable and adequate for our needs. The room doors are behind a door adjacent to the hallway so it was extremely quiet. We loved having the king beds, the mini fridge and microwave. I would recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Point Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: Dfla29
Reviews.Content: I arrived a couple hours before check in and was greeted by Stephanie, a Front Desk Clerk. She was very friendly and managed to get us into a room about 1.5 hours before our supposed check-in time. Upon entering the room, a One-Bedroom Grand Suite, I was pleasantly surprised. For once, it looked just as it appeared on the hotel website's photo gallery. The room was very clean, and very nicely furnished. The kitchen was fully stocked (plates, utensils, blender, toaster, full-size fridge, stove, etc.). There is a common area with a pull-out couch and television, a balcony, a master bedroom (with a king-size bed and a TV). The bathroom has a tub as well as a shower, and separate entrances for the master bedroom and common areas. The room itself was very spacious. It could easily sleep 4 comfortably. Also located in the One-Bedroom Grand Suite was a washer/dryer. The resort itself was well maintained. Everything was clean, and the staff was very courteous. The pool area took me by surprise. Not only does the pool look brand new, but it's accompanied by a poolside bar/grille..which was fantastic! If you don't have a car, you'll need to take a shuttle or taxi to get to the theme parks (if that's where you're heading). The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to the parks (the downside being it only travels once in the morning and once at night). However, if you do have a car.. it's about a 5 minute drive to Universal Orlando, and a 15 minute drive to Disney World. I actually really enjoyed the location of the hotel. It's a couple blocks off International Drive, making it close to many attractions but also quiet so you can end your day with some needed peace, quietness, rest, and relaxation. I would recommend this hotel to a friend. You definitely get a good bang for your buck. Fabio was also very professional and friendly when it was time to check-out. I will be coming back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A mini condo at a mini price”
Reviews.Author: kjbgsb
Reviews.Content: As it was only two of us, we stayed in the studio. Agree with everyone that the space is nicely set up and it is an excellent value considering the convenience of the location. We had a car so can't comment on using shuttle. Didn't seem like there would be much within walking distance either in terms of attractions or restaurants. Just be aware that the kitchen in the studio is only a microwave and a small refrigerator so hard to make a true meal. Kitchen was very minimally equipped - two glasses, two mugs etc. We were there for five nights. I think that warrants the room being cleaned once during that time. Many days came back at 4, after having been gone from 8 am, and bed had not been made nor towels refreshed. Also wish they had ice machines on floors. Find it an inconvenience to have to go to front desk to have someone go get you ice and didn't feel right to call to have ice brought up. Also agree with other reviewers that in this day and age there should be wifi in rooms. Many people in lobby and pool area using their ipads, etc. Pool area was pleasant, without any bells and whistles, but not a problem to find a lounge or seating. The exercise room was rather basic, lacking a television, mats, weights, but also did not seem to be in big demand. Parking is crowded and many spaces a bit of a hike from the front door. Realized after the first night that people were parking on the lawn next to the building. So not perfect, (but what is), but overall still a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarieVito
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy with our stay. the staff was awesome and went out of their way to see to it that we were happy and had everything we needed. Angela and Fabio made our stay extremely unforgettable with their assistance. I would greatly recommend to eveyone to choose The Point Orlando for their stay in Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shhhh... don't tell anyone. Great location, great pricing, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RussellAlabama
Reviews.Content: I will stay here again without a doubt. It is strategically located, just minutes from anywhere you want to be. Why stay in a one room hotel when you can get a one bedroom suite for the same money? The property is a great size, not too large - not too small. The furnishings in the units are fine, it has a nice big bathroom area, along with a full kitchen, should you be inclined to cook. Although I would have preferred a room facing the pool, I still had a small balcony where I could relax. All in all, a great place to stay, and I was in town on business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Diana P
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom executive suite. Included breakfast and was very good with a good choice. Bed was great and pull out was fine. Very nice room with large bathroom, separate toilet. Excellent location to Universal, outlet shopping and restaurants. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Would highly recomment and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: I never bother reviewing hotels but the Point Orlando really exceeded our expectations. Pay extra for the one bedroom suite as it is ABSOLUTELY worth it. The room was clean and spacious, the pool bar had great drinks and the pool was full without being overcrowded. To our delight the pool was salt water!! My husband is allergic to most chlorinated pools and can never swim with us but he was able to here! We had a car so travel was easy - we went to Pointe Orlando for dinner and a movie, and went to Sea World the next day. I wish we would have booked a longer stay - we will ABSOLUTELY stay again. We live in Georgia and visit Orlando 5+ times a year (often staying on Disney property) and this is our new go - to hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely so worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Svarah
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to say. The staff was very friendly, the rooms and upkeep of the place was incredible. I enjoyed having a kitchenette, Walgreen's was within walking distance and we were able to keep the fridge stocked as to not need to eat "park food" or fast food for every meal. Flatware and silverware were made available as well in the cupboards so no need to by disposable. Each night we went down the the pool which was kept very tidy. The king-sized beds were very comfortable. I have no reason to complain and would encourage anyone to stay. Whether using the shuttle or calling a cab the distance from just about every park was reasonable. Cab fare was usually 20bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: April1004
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here for the first week of March. Upon check in, we were greeted by Fabio, who couldn't have been nicer. Because we were staying six nights, Fabio gave us a complimentary upgrade to a 1 bdrm suite, from an executive studio. This seriously made the trip for us! The room was beautiful and very comfortable. The pool and hot tub were fantastic after a long day in the parks. Even the food from the bar was tasty and very reasonably priced. Also, the Point is only about a mile from the Universal Parks. We were able to walk there, when we didn't get up in time for the complimentary shuttle. This could not have worked out better! We were seriously thrilled with this property. Having a full kitchen and a separate bdrm made our stay just that much more comfortable! We also found it to be very clean and VERY quiet. I am not sure if we had no one staying on either side of us or if the walls are that good because we never heard a peep out of anyone around us and we were there for 6 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Some minor irritants, but will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Canuck_Travel_Mom
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at the Point Orlando Resort. We had a grand one bedroom suite, which was very affordable because of a special sale they were having...got a great deal through Travelocity. I may not have found this hotel otherwise. Overall, very nice hotel with wonderful staff - would definitely stay again. The hotel is clean, and the rooms (especially the suites) are wonderful. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Some strong points: - the staff: friendly, always willing to help, most will go out of their way to help you. Bell staff is particularly excellent. - the rooms: large, with full kitchen and washer/dryer, iron and ironing board. This is a great way to save money and since you can do a load or two of laundry while there, you can pack less clothes. All have central air AND ceiling fans. Ask for a room with a pool view, which is nicer than the parking lot/lagoon view. - the free breakfast: not just continental; they have eggs, bacon, pancakes, etc. Standard fare and nothing special, but the breakfast here is much better than a number of other hotels which only offer muffins and pastries and such. The one odd thing that needs to be mentioned - coffee isn't included. Brew your coffee in your room and bring it with you if you don't want to pay. - the pool area: piped-in music, which helps drown out some of the traffic noise from Carrier Drive, which runs behind the hotel. Nice bistro, great for a lunch or late-afternoon snack, open from just before lunch until 10:00 at night. - the free shuttle to major theme parks. But it's not all "good" news for the shuttle, I'm afraid. See warnings below. - room "supplies": the hotel provides paper towels, a dish sponge and some small size packages of laundry detergent and dishwashing liquid. Enough for one load of laundry and a week's worth of dishes. The 1 and 2 bedroom suites also have a dishwasher, but no dishwasher detergent is provided. So if you plan to use the dishwasher, bring your own supply of dishwasher detergent. We did the dishes by hand using the provided dishwashing liquid, and we used the dishwasher as a drying rack - perfect solution. Also, no fabric softener or dryer sheets are available, so remember to bring some from home if you plan on doing a load of laundry and don't want your clothes to be stiff and scratchy. Some less than perfect points: - the location: yes, it's a few minutes from Universal, but since they have a shuttle, so what? There's not much within walking distance. There's a Walgreen's about a 15 min walk away, but that's pretty much it. Unless you have a car, be ready to spend major bucks on taxicabs. Remember, you have a full kitchen and you'll want some groceries...but there is no supermarket anywhere close. If you don't have a car, expect to pay $30 round trip to get to the nearest Publix by taxicab. - lack of front desk staff: during the entire week I was there, there was only one staff member manning the front desk at a time. During peak arrival/departure and shuttle departure hours, this resulted in a long line at the front desk. Only once did I see two employees at the front desk at the same time. The Point needs to fix this if they don't want angry guests on their hands...I saw many people starting to lose their patience while I was having breakfast - the breakfast area is right across from the front desk area. - the "extra" charges: maid service is limited to a "room refresh" only. This means making the bed, providing fresh towels and supplies (toilet paper, kleenex, etc.) and taking out the trash. Nothing and I mean NOTHING else. Leave an empty kleenex box on the floor beside the bed, and it'll still be there when you come back. Anything beyond the room refresh will cost you $15 a pop. The hotel doesn't provide a broom/dustpan in the room, and they should if they aren't going to clean the rooms daily. - the "resort" fee: about $11 per day...for what I'm not sure since they don't clean the rooms and don't have free wi-fi in the rooms (more about that in a minute). Perhaps to cover the "free" breakfast? If that's the case, then the breakfast isn't really free, is it? - the "pay" business center: this is no longer the norm for most hotels - most provide free wi-fi everywhere in the hotel or at least have a business centre that can be used free of charge. Not so at The Point. Want to reserve some Disney tickets online? It'll cost you $0.25 per minute to use a computer, and $0.75 per page to print out the confirmation. This is 2012, and charging for these services is unreasonable. This isn't some budget motel, it's a four-star resort. The hotel does have free wi-fi available, but only in the pool area and in the lobby. Next time I'll bring my laptop - didn't think I had to for a vacation, but it's a MUST at The Point if you want to research restaurants and attractions or buy tickets online. - the free shuttle to major theme parks: for Universal, it's great as you're the first to get off. For Disney, not so much. You will be taken on a tour of a large number of hotels on the way, and expect the trip to take well over an hour. On the plus side, you will get a seat since you're the first to get on, but the shuttle will be crowded and standing room only by the time you're done picking people up. Also, there's only ONE shuttle per day for Universal and Sea World - one departure and one pick up. Miss it or want to come back early? You'll have to find your own way back to the hotel. Best way from Universal is to cab it as it's pretty close. With fare & tip, this will cost you about $20. There are three departure and pick up times for Disney, which is much better. And that's a good thing, because a taxicab from Disney to The Point will cost you at least $60 - $75, depending on the traffic. Be sure to plan your day around the shuttle times if you don't have a car. All in all, a great stay and would definitely stay again. As mentioned above, there are a number of things that could be improved, but these are all minor and not enough to prevent me from returning. I felt it was important to mention these little irritants, if only to help prepare other folks heading to The Point. One final word of advice...bring your own hairdryer. The hairdryer provided by the hotel just doesn't cut it. I could have dried my hair faster by sitting in front of a fan or asking my daughter to blow on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation! Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicole C
Reviews.Content: My family of four just got back from a week at The Point Orlando. What a perfect location and the rooms were clean, large and well appointed. It is in the centre of everything and within walking distance to food, convenience stores and International Drive. The staff were friendly and helpful. The pool is like bathwater and very clean with lots of towels and seating available. I would definately recommend this location to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollchar
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel room was spacious, clean, the pool is lovely area, the only down side is the only bar is at the pool area, there are no restaurants in the hotel, when we arrived we asked where were the restaurants and bars located, a few seats in the corner of the lobby for a bistro area, we went out for breakfast each day. only two minutes walk from International drive, very good location, staff were very helpful overall a very enjoyable stay. try to get a room overlooking the pool area otherwise you have no view

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, with an unusual layout”
Reviews.Author: gc54
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here recently while attending an Elton John concert. The room was a little over $100 with AAA discount. It was fine, nothing special. On the plus side, the hotel is on Universal Blvd. just south of Wet and Wild, and so it's away from the insanity which is International Drive. However, the set-up is weird. We opened the door to what we thought was our room, only to find a tiny foyer with two doors. To the right was the door to our room, to the left a door to another room (a one bedroom suite, as I later discovered). As I said, a little weird, in that you have to go through two doors to get into your room. Fortunately, our neighbors were pretty quiet. However, I imagine it could be a pain if the neighbors came banging in and out through those two doors with any frequency. Aside from that, the pool area was nice, complete with hot tub and poolside bar. The front desk was friendly and helpful and, as I said, the location was central without being in the midst of the craziness of International Dr. All in all, solidly average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tommywood
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay. Pool area is very clean and nice. Only negative was the bed is not the best. Felt like an upgraded rollaway mattress

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Wonderful Rooms... Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob K
Reviews.Content: From the moment my family checked in to the Hotel we had a feeling like we had arrived to our second home. Staff was very help, nice and welcoming. Room are very spacious and clean with everything a vacationer would need and more. The kitchen was a huge help in saving money expecially with having a 5 year old with us. I haven't seen customer service like i experienced in this hotel in a very very long time. We stayed indoors one day because my daughter was under the weather. Went down to get breakfast and happened to mention my daughters not feeling well to the food manager... he tells me to hang on and comes back with a antioxyidant fruit/veg drink for her and gives it on the house. I was stunned at how nice they are. All the staff is just as good. The manager of the hotel (Angela i believe) was amazing too. Very helpful, courteous and all around friendly. If we needed anything she was on top of it within minutes. This place is a hidden jem that you can't go wrong in chosing. We loved it so much that we came back stayed there a few days after doing DisneyWorld. BTW - Tip for all travellers... There is another hotel there just called "The Point" a few mins away... for this hotel you have to ask for "The Point Orlando Resort" otherwise your taxi may take you to the wrong one. Thank you Angela and thank you Point Orlando Resort Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cydny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 days at the Point while visiting Universal Studios theme parks. The hotel is in a very convenient location, a block or so away from major traffic, but close enough to the parks, restaurants, drug stores, etc. Our room faced the pool and was immaculate and well-kept--all the appliances and TVs were in great shape. The bathroom was huge. It was very quiet at night, so we got a good night's sleep in the comfy bed. The only thing that bothered me was the fact that you only get a one-day supply of Kcups for the Keurig coffeemaker. After that you had to buy the cups for $1.50 at the front desk. Every other hotel we've stayed at with an in-room coffeemaker replenished coffee daily. A small thing, I know, but it's nickel-and-diming the guest. That said, I'd stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the parks.”
Reviews.Author: Sn0wm0nkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we were touring the parks. There's a bus service, with a stop very near to the hotel, that runs in regularly in both directions (buy a pass from the nearby Walgreen), and the hotel also provides access to a free (although creaking at the seams with passengers) bus to Universal Studios. It's a brilliant location. Our room was nice and very clean, and had a full kitchen with a dishwasher. We had a view over the pond outside, which has turtles swimming in it. Recommended for anyone wanting to visit all the Florida parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah Y
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here multiple times and will probably stay here every time we visit Orlando. It is so close to every attraction in Orlando. It was so great to be staying in a clean secure one bedroom suite for half the price of any Disney hotel. Plus there wasn't a rediculous amount of people. Very quiet. The most comfortable bed ever, didn't want to get up.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for a anniversary when we where dating we got a one bedroom suite it was amazing. We recently stayed for her and her sisters birthday and once again amazing Fabio was the best person we incountered there he treated us like royalty this is the only hotel we stay at in orlando and we love it Fabio thank you for everything you do for us.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: FIRMSPHANTOM
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Orlando, perfect weather & quiet hotel. Booked a one bedroom suite which was clean & comfy. My husband found the bed to be too soft for his bad back. The suite had everything we needed & used the washer/dryer a few times. We knew about the Keurig coffee maker so brought our own K- cups. The shuttle to Universal left at 820 a.m. & the cab back to The Point about 7$ unless you stayed until 7:30 pm for the bus back. The pool was warm & we loved it! Breakfast was good (downstairs by the lobby) but you could shop at Publix a couple miles away & make your own. The ethernet worked great for my laptop! We did have a resort fee of 11$ daily which is much less than other hotels including parking , newspaper & ethernet in our room. Staff was always wonderful, polite & helpful, other businesses should take note! One negative was the extra price for our room on Friday & Saturday because of the NBA being in town. Firmer beds & a flatscreen in the bedroom would have made it purfect. After many busy days in the theme parks we like to relax in our bedroom. We would stay again, but check for anything big going on in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AngeMoh
Reviews.Content: We quite enjoyed our stay at The Point. We were offered a discounted room upgrade which was worth the money. Our one bedroom suite was clean and spacious. Having been a room attendant for hotels myself, I always inspect the room upon arrival. Overall it was clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful and the price was very reasonable for the quality accommodations. The pool was very nice, however it was heated a bit high for my liking but still enjoyable. I found the location good, not right in the hussle-bussle but just around the corner. All around a great stay for a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: susan b
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip kind of last minute than usual. Have always stayed at a Disney resort and decided against it this time. Was a little comprehensive to stay somewhere new but I found an advertisement in the magazine Visit Florida for The Point. We booked a one bedroom suite and the room was perfect size. Huge bathroom and the kitchen was great to have for when you want to make breakfast or even dinner. Bedroom was a nice size and the bed was really comfortable. I got better sleep in that bed than i do at home. The staff was very friendly. Would book again next trip to Florida and will be recommending it to anyone who is making a trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: gk681
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite. Room had full kitchen, small living room, large bathroom, and nice sized bedroom. We enjoyed the privacy of the rooms. Pool was excellent. Not crowed, very warm, maybe 90 degrees. Very enjoyable. Skip the breakfast buffett. Limited choices and exensive at $9.95 each for what you get. Nice bar at the pool with light dining options. The only thing the room was missing was a comfortable chair or recliner in the living room area,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: wbk1711
Reviews.Content: Our room was wonderful. Huge bathroom, nice bedroom, wonderful, full furnished kitchen and an OK living room. Lots of TV channels. Very reasonable rate as compared to other places we researched. Paid $125 a night for a suite with seperate bedroom. The bed was very comfortable. One complaint - the pool was way too hot. It must have been 95* I can understand that we went in the winter and they wanted the water warm, but it was just uncomfortable to be in the pool during the day because it was so hot. We did go in at night but it was like being in a huge hot tub. It is very near Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful property with wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelcoleen
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property that I will return to. We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen, living room, balcony with a view of the pool. The bathroom was very large with a separate shower and a jetted tub. We had one issue and it was taken care of as soon as it was brought to the attention of the manager. The pool area is a great place to unwind after a long day. I liked the variety of comfy lounge areas and the bistro food was delicious. Great poolside drinks as well. We didn't do the breakfast buffet, but it looked hearty. We had most of our breakfasts and lunches in the suite, so we really took advantage of the full kitchen. There are many attractions nearby and also good restaurants. I am pretty fussy when it comes to hotels, this one passed my test, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection is the word!!”
Reviews.Author: Yessikita
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Point for two awesome nights! I had originally booked The Wyndham, but after reading the reviews here I searched for another hotel and came accross The Point. The hotel is BEAUTIFUL!! The best I've stayed in in Orlando. Service was spot on. Very clean, pool area is great and the hotel is close to everything, yet secluded and quite. I recommend 1000%! You will not be dissapointed!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: topgunlady
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Point, after a 5 night stay. IMMACULATE rooms, great view of the pool area, helpful staff, perfect location, warm pool, tons of towels..................full sized appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (one cup), nice dishes and glasses. Great for all!

Reviews.Title: “Great plae and Price for exploring Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mdcouple1014
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point for a long weekend getaway, while visiting sites around Orlando. We were traveling as a couple without kids for a change. This place was perfect and the brest place we have stayed in Orlando, for the 5 trips we have taken there. The room- Was very spacious. We were in a one bedroom suite. It was perfect. It had full kitchen for making snacks and holding groceries we bought at local grocery store. we are on health kick, so fruits and veggies to snack on was important for us. they had a mixer in the kithcen so we could make our own fresh smoothies every morning. The bathroom was nice with seperate showere and jetted tub. perfect way to relax after full day of hitting the parks. The bed was very comfortable and there were extra pillows and blankets for us. Ther ewas a tv in the bedroom as well as living room, for watching movie together too. The washer and dryer was nice as well in the room. we were able to take all our clothes home clean versus having laundry to do after we got bac kfrom our trip. The hotel- Was perfect for hanging out at. the pool/hot tub were nice for hanging out in the morning to catchsome sun, and the hot tub was great for relaxing in th evening. There was a bar/grill area by the pool that served great snacks and bar food. was great for light meal or snacking for lunch or dinner. The workout room was great and had all the equipment we needed to keep to our routine while on our trip. The breakfast area- This area was a little small, and since hotel was fully booked the weekend we were there, it was crowded wiht not enough seats. No problem for us, as we just took the food back up to our room when we got something from down there. they serve Starbucks coffee for you coffe lovers. I recommend getting a break fast plan if you are going to eat at hotel, versus paying the $11 or 12 a person in the monring every time you came down. If not interested in that, IHOP and Dennys are within 2 miles of the hotel. Location- It is literally 5 minuts or less from Universal Studios, so very convenient, if visiting that park. IF you are going to use the complimentary shuttle, please be aware that they only pick up and drop off once a day, so you need to sign up for this wiht front desk. I think people think that shuttles run consistently all day and were disappointed when they found out otherwise. For the price you pay for this place, I htink them offering the shuttle once a day is more than fair. they do have to make some money or they wont be around for long. Overall, this resort is awesome and I think priced low for the value of the room, amenities and location for the area. I would saty here sooner versus later, beacuse these prices will go up once more people know about this place. It ids the best place to stay in Orlando, I think. we booked through bookit.com to get the rate we did, which was unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Way more than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: cmacky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days before we went on a cruise. I had read a few reviews so I was expecting it to be fine but it was way better than fine! We arrived very late and the lady at the counter sold us some juice and water even though that area wasn't open. When we entered the room, the first little touch that blew my mind was a Keurig coffee maker - wow! The rooms were clean and spacious and the balcony was wonderful. The pool area is incredible. It has a gorgeous bar/food area, fantastic furniture and it was never very busy so our kids really enjoyed themselves. While we were there our son leaned on the toilet paper holder and pulled it right off the wall. We told the cleaning staff right away knowing it was going to cost us something for the damages. Well, we went out to do a little shopping and came home to find it totally repaired - you'd never have known it happened AND they didn't charge us for the damage. My husband called the manager to say how pleased we were and at first the manager was more worried that it hadn't been fixed than that the damage occurred in the first place! The only downside is probably the expensive brunch that was only so so but thats my fault since I had read that on here and forgot! All in all just an fabulous experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Point Resort Orlando”
Reviews.Author: peo_norman
Reviews.Content: Nice room, fine kitchen. Lots of restaurants nearby. Nice and helpfull staff, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot0
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Point for several years, and they just keep getting better every year! We had some special needs, and the staff (not just one, but several of them) went above and beyond to help us with our predicament and made a difficult situation into a "can do" opportunity. They give excellent service without the exorbitant price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax and enjoy Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: Nice room, great staff, free shuttle to all Disney venues and Seaworld. Golfing nearby, wide array of restaurants nearby. Heated pool was great. There is no restaurant, just the poolside snackshop (burgers and such). No worrys about safety/security, nice section of town. Near the trolley line.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: wildsnaps
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel and were really impressed with it. A great location (very close to Universal Studios and International Drive.) The room was spacious, with a very useful kitchen area, complete with fridge, microwave oven, cutlery and crockery. The staff were attentive and friendly. My only complaint would be the bed: it was very, very soft. That's fine for some folks, but I prefer a harder mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kate L
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, except housekeeping never came to replenish towels, empty trash, etc. Front desk deducted resort fee from my bill, though, which was a nice way to compensate me. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Michealdoody
Reviews.Content: No matter where you stay in Orlando places are going to be a bit of a trek. With that in mind we booked The Point Orlando Resort because it looked like a fantastic hotel and also due to the fantastic reviews on tripadvisor. We weren't to be disappointed Right from the word go the staff were excellent, especially those on the front desk. Always extremely helpful in offering advise on all things Orlando. The hotel is clean right throughout. The rooms are suites and contain everything you would want. We stayed in a one bed suite which had a kitchenette, including a sink and wicrowave. The room also had a table and chairs and a sofa. The bed was king size and extremely comfortable. The hotel pool was brilliant. It was never overcrowded and had plenty of sun loungers.There is also an outside bar serving cocktails etc. The hotel is located a couple of mins drive from Universal or a 20 minute walk.
