Disney is about a half hour drive away. Seaworld was about 20 mins drive away. The hotel offers a shuttle to the parks which is very conveinient. As i say, no matter where you stay in Orlando something will be far away. The i-ride trolley service also has a stop outside the hotel. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anybody. It is clean and comfortable and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: SirRead
Reviews.Content: It's a small apartment with a full size kitchen - lots of room! It is clean and the staff is friendly. The location is just far enough to make it difficult to walk to the many area attractions and dining. A little leary of the safety as a car had been broken into in the parking lot. But a great value at under $100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: vampire69
Reviews.Content: The Point was everything it said it would be,the rooms are amazing,the location brilliant and the staff,top class! Its only a five minute(slow) walk to international drive and they have free shuttles to most of the parks. On a side note, whatever price you have been quoted on any site for your stay,add around 380 dollars(if staying a week or more) as the resort has tax as well as service charges. But if you want a bit of luxury and a lot of comfort, the Point is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A great all-suite hotel - a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: TraveljunkieTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Point this past weekend for a business trip. The resort feels new and in very good condition. The rooms are all suites and are in very good condition. They are not opulent but are well furnished. I would watch the reviews over the next 5-10 years to make sure they are maintained properly, as the finish-out appears to be cheap and not durable. Our suite had a full kitchen which would be great for families on a budget. There were utensils and everything you would need to cook a full meal. There was also a stacker type washer/dryer with a small box of detergent. During our entire stay, I never heard a sound outside of our room. Nothing from next door our in the hallway. That's unusual in my experience, and welcome. The view from our room was not great. We faced East. We overlooked an auto repair shop, a vacant field and as far as the eye could see, vegetation and brush. it had a very industrial feel to it. Try to get a room facing the pool area if you can. There is very limited dining in this hotel. They serve virtually the same breakfast daily, for $9.95 per person plus coffee. The first day, it seemed pretty good. The second day of over-cooked egg curds and baked bacon was not pleasant. The third day we hiked about a mile to Denny's (yes it was that bad). There is a limited menu outside at the pool bar for lunch and dinner, and a full bar there too. The pool area was nice and well maintained. The service there was pretty good, but you have to go to the bar to get service, as there is no waitstaff to serve you at the pool. You will need a car or a taxi to go anywhere you want to go. Be careful to ask for a town car or a licensed cab. We unintentionally got into an unlicensed cab and that was a mistake. The driver didn't know where our restaurant was and we ended up having to use our phones to navigate for him. Overall, for the price and the space, this was a great bargain. If you "have stayed there before" you can get a discounted room rate. There is no requirement to prove when you stayed there, but if you mention that fact it works. Again, in the future, I'm not so sure that this property will hold up very well, as the construction is cheaper and seems like it might not be durable, but for the time being it is really quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place”
Reviews.Author: Jen F
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be close to Disney but away from the chaos this is the place. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are large and very clean. The cost is affordable, it's a win win!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: brodyn97
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a family vacation. We booked 4 rooms for all of us and most everything was perfect! Check in was a breeze and the rooms were very roomy and clean! We especially loved the washer and dryer in the rooms! We didn't eat the breakfast offered because it was $10 a person and they really didn't have much to offer. The pool area is wonderful and has very nice and clean restrooms and plenty of towels for use. My only complaints were I wouldn't recommend eating at the cabana bar unless you don't mind waiting an hour for your food! VERY slow service!!! The food is very good though so as long as you don't mind the wait... it is tasty! One evening my Aunt ordered a hamburger and it was served on regular bread. When she asked about it, he told her they ran out of buns so deal with it. She was a bit annoyed about that! They should have asked her if it would be ok to put her burger on bread first! They allow you to drink your own liquor outside at the pool so if you want to save some money you can always bring your own and sit at a table! Also I had reserved 2 of the rooms on my credit card (just to hold them) and when we arrived my parents changed the credit card info on one of the rooms to their card and yet when they checked out the room it still got charged to my credit card. When they did the reversal, I somehow got screwed out of $30. When I brought this to their attention they would not do anything for me even though the mistake was theirs in the first place. The room should have NEVER been charged to my credit card in the first place! Also if you like housekeeping at a hotel, this is not the place for you! They come daily to make your bed and give you towels - that's it. That would have been fine enough for me anyways but everyday I had to call for extra towels because she only ever left me 3 towels and there were 4 of us in the room???? After the first 2 days you'd think she'd get the hint...but never did! If you like having your coffee every morning like I do, bring extra Keurig cups. They give you 3 to start and after that they are $1 each at the front desk. No big deal for me as I brought extras. I'm giving sleep quality a 4 only because the pillows they have are brutal! But the beds were excellent! We stayed twice in the 2 weeks (before and after our cruise) and before we left the first time we had arranged what rooms we were to be in so we'd be together and yet when we returned they had given our rooms away so I though that was distasteful of them. They did get us into other rooms we were happy with but I just feel for the amount of money we dropped over 8 nights x 4, they shouldn't have done that! When we checked out, my ride I had arranged failed to show and the man at the front desk quickly got us alternate transportation so that was very nice! Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for the comfort and price! Was a great stay beside the few glitches. Had they made any attempt to reimburse me the $30 for the mistake I would have given it 5 out of 5!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MuchtravelledEngland
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the end of January for an eight night stay and were totally amazed at the quality and cleanliness of the resort. The location is very quiet. We had a spacious studio room on the ground floor, with a view of the car park from our window, but the quality of the room more than made up for it. The room was well presented, tastefully decorated and very clean. There is a full-size fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron & board, tea-towel and cloths. The crockery and cutlery were immaculate and there was a selection of glasses. Even a bottle and tin opener. There was no kettle or toaster. The air-con was extremely quiet, we didn't even notice it was on. The bed was comfortable which gave us a good nights sleep. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Buffet breakfast is available in the lobby, which we tried on the first morning, and cost $25 for two. Because of the variety of eateries in Orlando we ate out for the rest of the holiday. There are restaurants for every taste around the I.Drive area, and also a Publix supermarket at Stop 41 on the I-Trolley route. The resort is located on the intersection of Universal Blvd and Carrier Drive, one block from I. Drive. It took around ten minutes to walk along Carrier Drive to I.Drive. Getting around couldn't be easier - just hop on the I-Trolley (Green Stop G6) outside the resort and you can get anywhere along the main tourist route. Single fare $1.25 or Senior 0.25c. Exact fare is required. We purchased an Unlimited Ride Pass for seven days cost $10. Once we understood the Green and Red routes we hopped on and hopped off allday. A useful booklet to have is the International Drive Official Visitors Guide, it lists everything you need to know. To travel further than the I.Drive area, pop into the Official Visitor Center on Austrian Court (Red Stop 20) and pick-up Lynx schedules, which give information on all routes further afield. Again, you need exact fare, usually $2 adult/$1 Senior. Our journey required us to change buses so we asked for a "Transfer" ticket on the first bus and we used it for both buses. Still only costing $1. The drivers were all very helpful, and we certainly got value for money. We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday and would certainly stay at The Point Orlando Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: custardNottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a group as a result of exhibiting at the PGA Golf Show. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Location was a taxi ride to the convention center and taxi to the restaurants. All in all a good hotel for exhibitors but I wouldn't necessarily saty if I were not on holiday. The breakfast area was basic and cramped and the pool area was basic. On the plus side food was delivered fast. The rooms were comfortable but basic- great for a family on a budget. I would recommend this hotel but there are tons to choose from in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Superb accomodations, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orlando on Feb 10th. Our plan was to stay at the Point our first 3 nights, left to go to Fort Myers, for 5 nights, then back to the Point for the last 2 nights before flying back home. We started out at the Point in the Executive suite. It was a perfect size for 2 adults, very well appointed, and very clean. When we checked in we found out that these were really privately owned condos, that are rented out on a daily basis when not being used by the owners. The quality of the furnishings was much better than your basic mid-range hotel rooms. The pool area was always clean and inviting, and the front desk staff was top notch. We dealt with Fabio and Angela (the manager), and they couldn't have done more for us. When we reached Fort Myers, we checked into a Best Western for our stay there. After getting into our room, we directly called back to the Point and asked them to add 3 more nights to our reservation, because the Best Western Hotel was, in our minds, sub-standard, old, and not kept up. We stayed there 2 nights, and headed back to Orlando where we were greeted by Fabio, and our room was upgraded to a beautiful 1 bedroom suite, for all nights, at no extra charge. Apparently, returning guests get an upgrade. The 1 bedroom suite has all the amenities of home, full size fridge, range, dishwasher and even washer and dryer. Any time that we are in the Orlando area, this is the only hotel we would ever consider going to, as you are close to the attractions, shopping and restaurants. Again, I would like to thank Fabio and Angela for taking care of us. Tony Brindle Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: heathbarr
Reviews.Content: I don't have a single thing to complain about! The location was absolutely perfect for our needs, right near International Drive and close to the parks and other activities. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Universal and Disney which is perfect to avoid paying for parking and it drops you off/picks you up at the perfect times! The room was spacious, VERY clean, and just what we needed. Definitely would stay here again and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shaheer Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 17 nights at the point Orlando. The room was clean, nice amenities, but the true gem of this hotel is the staff! Fabio, Rosie, and Angela at front desk were super nice, professional and attentive to all our requests. Very close to wet and wild and universal and they have shuttle service too! Enjoyed the stay to the max and would certainly go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jl75
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a good size and well furnished. Staff friendly and welcoming. Just be aware of resort tax that you have to pay at end of stay to which we were not made aware of.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AMAZING !”
Reviews.Author: jammiex
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a wonderful 15 night stay at The Point . We have been to Orlando several times before staying at various hotels on I Drive but booked this on the strength of the reviews on Trip Advisor. We took our 4 month old baby with us and found the room facilities excellent for all our needs. The suite we had was spacious and immaculate , it had a full kitchen with dishwasher , washing machine and tumble dryer , cooker microwave and huge fridge freezer , food blender and coffee machine . The little 'extras ' like free coffee and dish and laundry washing powder were great. The bathroom was huge with shower and jacuzzi bath which was a real treat after a day at the parks !! The point is located just a few blacks back from I Drive and only 10 minutes walk from Wet n Wild , there is a complimentary shuttle to Universal & Disney which is a gr8 bonus ( can be a bit bumpy thou!!) . Overall we cannot recommend this high enough , the quality of the hotel & service made it worth every penny !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic week at the point”
Reviews.Author: Hilary K
Reviews.Content: We had a grand one bedroom suite and it could not have been better. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the hotel was comfortable and clean. Transfers to the theme parks were useful and well organised but be prepared for some lengthy journeys, as they have to pick up from a lot of other hotels. For sea world, we found it better to use the i-trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kenny S
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. We stayed in January 2012 and stayed in a one bedroom suite. The location is great as it is close to shopping and the theme parks and the staff go above and beyond to make your stay the best it can be. We absolutely recommend this great resort for your stay in Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet D
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an excellent stay in the Point Orlando. I can honestly say that I have no problem recomendending this to anyone wishing to stay in a clean ,safe hotel that is within easy walking distance to I drive. Staff were excellent, food in bar area was good and not expensive. Pool area spotless and rooms that are a home away from home. I will stay again and would recommend that you pay the little bit extra for a one bed suite. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevedoggy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,great friendly helpful staff and great location.special thanks to fabio

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..location location location”
Reviews.Author: ShauntheSheep
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pointe Orlando Resort for 16 nights back in Oct/Nov 2011 so I am a bit late posting this review! Room: We booked a one bed apartment, and requested a pool view on an upper floor which we got. The apartment was very well equipped for a self catering holiday. The kitchen had a full cooker and over, large fridge freezer, dishwasher (the hotel provide detergent), washing machine & dryer, coffee machine and sink (the hotel provide a cloth & washing up liquid). The hotel also provide kitchen paper and toilet paper! The bedroom was large with a large bed, TV and plenty of storage space. The bathroom was bit with a Jacuzzi bath and walk in shower, it also had storage and a large vanity area around the wash hand basin (this is the only mirror in the apartment). The living room had a TV, dining table with 4 chairs, storage and a two seater couch. There was a small balcony with 2 chairs which came in handy for drying clothes. The apartment was spotless, and we had the bins emptied and new towels provided every day. The hotel itself is also very clean. We were on a room only rate so didn’t have the breakfast but did use the coffee shop! There is a ‘cabana bar’ out by the pool which serves drink and basic bar food – not the best but OK if there is nothing else available or its late. The pool was very clean and there were plenty sun loungers and pool towels are provided on a ‘help yourself’ basis. Tip: Before we arrived I ordered groceries from Garden Grocer online. These arrived before we did and were delivered to our apartment! Great for the heavy things like water, soft drinks etc! Hotel Shuttle: The hotel provides daily shuttles to Disney, Sea World and Universal. The Disney shuttle took about 1 hour and the only drawback was the return times were not very good. The Sea World shuttle also took an hour which was long considering how near the hotel it to it – you would be better of using the I RIDE trolley. We didn’t use the Universal shuttle as it is only about a 25 min walk to Universal which was nice in the morning. There is sidewalk all the way to Universal but you do have to cross a few busy roads. We also walked back at night and it seemed safe enough. Location: The hotel is less than 5 mins walk from Wet n Wild and International Drive so it could not be better. It is away from the main road so nice and peaceful if staying by the pool for the day. There are shops nearby and a lovey Deli call ‘Green Tomatoes’ which does lovely salads, breads, pastas etc – a lovely alternative to fast food! There are a few crazy golf places within a 5 minute walk and the I-RIDE stop to go up and down I Drive is also close by. Would I stay there again? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tjf_2010
Reviews.Content: We got in early and were able to check in and we were upgraded. Very clean and such a nice hotel. Good location. Close to a few theme parks and short ride to airport. Nice and helpful staff. Very impressed and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keaters
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Florida. We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed. Lovely clean suite overlooking the pool - view over Orlando was fantastic. Staff very friendly and extremely helpful. Pool and bar were very nice. Just wish there were more quality restaurants within walking distance.....you don't always want to drive. You can get the I Trolley though to Pointe Orlando (only $1.25) where there are some excellent restaurants (Maggianos in particular). Overall a great hotel - would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a good value! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Carla C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights in The Point Orlando Resort and we really liked the hotel! The rooms are very big and comfortable. The decoration is very nice and the staff was friendly. The bathroom is also big. Everything in the hotel looks new and preserved. The hotel is clean, but the only thing that I felt that could be better is the cleaning service. They only refresh the room (take out the trash and trade towels), so there is no cleaning. (That only matters if you are staying longer than 3 days). I do recommend to everybody and I would certainly stay in The Point again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the suite !”
Reviews.Author: webbknight
Reviews.Content: Great 1 bedroom condo just down the street from Universal Studios. I choose The Point because of all the great reviews and because of price and all was so true .. the suite even had a washer and dryer !! Big bathroom and gorgeous walk in shower (for 2) and separate tub with jets !! I felt like I rented a friends condo for 2 days including a full kitchen and living room . Very impressed for the money and til someone can beat all this that you get ... and the location ... The Point is hard to beat !! p.s. the King size bed was as good as the Orlando Hilton we had last summer !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: Check in was super easy, the one-bedroom room was fantastic and big. The bathroom was huge and the full kitchen with the washer and dryer rocked! We did not eat breakfast there as we were on the go, but it looked and smelled wonderful. The pool was very nice, too. The only complaint I have is the pillow cases on the extra pillows were not clean, they had a previous guests hair on them (barf), so we took them off and put our clean t-shirts over them because the kids were too tired to wait for new linens. Everything else was clean and lovely. It was literally 5 minutes from Universal and about 15-30 from Disney (depending on traffic). You cannot walk to any restaurants, but there are plenty within a 5 minute or less drive. The parking kinda stinks, the main lot is way to the side of the building, but we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ginger R
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The entire staff was fabulous. The rooms were clean and comfortable and very family friendly.The washer and dryer in the two bedroom was an added plus. I will definitely stay at the Point again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Chrisab44
Reviews.Content: The rooms were big and clean. The staff was great. Wi-fi in the rooms would be nice, but everything else about the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have stayed in Orlando!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patty412
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando each January for a conference at the Orange County Convention Center. I have stayed in several different hotels and have been ALWAYS been disappointed for various reasons (e.g., lack of cleanliness, noisy rooms, lack of hotel services). This January, however, I spent four days/nights at The Point Orlando Resort and was in a one-bedroom apartment (with full kitchen) on the 10th floor and had an exceptionally positive experience. It was quiet and clean with a large bathroom (with a separate shower) and a small balcony with a pleasant, colorful evening view of Orlando sites. It was tastefully decorated (nothing fancy) and comfortable. ALL of my interactions with the staff were positive and pleasant, and the resort was very reasonably priced. I did wish that there was wireless in the room, but the living room was wired for internet and the wire was long enough to bring it to the dining table or the couch. There was wireless in the lobby and by the pool, but I didn't use it. I will ABSOLUTELY stay in this hotel again. (Note: This is the first online review, but I was so pleased with my experience that I decided to share it with others.)

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed three times and love the resort!”
Reviews.Author: cindy m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Point Orlando Resort four times .Three of those times we were celebrating our wedding anniversary.As Floridians ,we enjoy escaping for a fun filled weekend in Orlando. This resort puts you right in the heart of all of the fun .The hotel is clean,classy,roomy and is wonderfully staffed.It was a breeze for us to catch a cab over to City Walk Red Coconut and dance the night away .Then the next night take a drive to one of the great restaurants around town such as Ruth Chris Steak House, our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Robin N
Reviews.Content: The service was SUPERB!! From the front desk to the Cabana bar. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. After a long day at Universal studios it was very relaxing sitting by the pool and hot tub. The out door furniture was very clean and comfortable. I can't wait until my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “"2nd visit still fabulous"”
Reviews.Author: PoppyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Florida and our 2nd stay at The Point, the room is an apartment with all the benefits of staying in a hotel, we stayed in room 1009 (tower 2) the views were amazing, the staff very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Close to International drive, universal studios, sea world and all disney parks, free parking on site, why stay anywhere else, have fun, we did.

Reviews.Title: “A good Point!”
Reviews.Author: 74Carrots
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orlando Point Resort after New York, and -as per the previous hotel - we looked up the reviews and we found a nice hotel, with a very helpful staff; we did not tried all the facilities, like the pool, or restaurant..and we decided to have the breakfast out because prices were too high and there was no breakfast room, just a corner in the lobby, and therefore the lobby smelled of bacon and egg, equipped for breakfast by Starbucks..it did not worth the price. Anyway the room was fully equipped for eating, because there was a very large studio with sofa, a big microwave, fridge and everything...but we always ate at the Studios so it was ok for our purpose: being close to the Universal Studios. Clean, with a spacious bathroom, we stayed there just for 2 nights but was a pleasant stay. Moreover, when we learned the proper way to reach the studios, we simply walked there (it's a 15m far); if you are too tired to walk (and after a day at the Studios..you really are!) you can take the taxi for just 6-7 dollars. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: pitubs
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable suite. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Very good breakfast buffet. Nice pool. Only issue was no wi fi in room only in lobby and pool area

Reviews.Title: “Just Great - Made our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: leemond
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 14 Nights in November. We wanted the convenience of an apartment with cooking and laundry facilities but the security of a hotel. This seemed to be a good choice from the reviews we read here and elsewhere. The location is excellent and right in the heart of the International Drive attractions, 5 mins from Sand Lake Rd and the multitude of restaurants on offer. Close enough to TGI Fridays, Chili's and some others in order to leave the car and have a few beers with dinner. We had a one bedroom apartment which was very spacious, well furnished and maintained. The bathroom was excellent with separate walk-in shower and tub. The kitchen was well equipped and had everything we needed to make snacks, breakfast and lunches to take out with us. It was great to have the huge fridge stocked with beverages and snacks after the long days out at theme parks. In the lounge we had a comfortable sofa and small dining table, and a balcony with great views over the area. We found the housekeeping service to be perfect, just a daily trash and tidy and then a full clean at the end of the first week. The housekeeping staff were always friendly and courteous, and were able to help out getting us more laundry detergent when we needed it. The pool area was nicely maintained and made a great base for relaxing on our non-theme park days. Front desk staff were also very helpful and pleasant, and made our stay one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Floridian15
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel in the past and returned because of the great location and the rooms. Bathroon and kitchens are large fully equiped great for long or short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but they need to update the TV in the bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Lynniexo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean. The kitchen had most everything you need to cook with. The bathroom had a jetted tub which was nice to relax in. The front desk staff was very friendly and nice. The only complaint was that there was not a flat screen TV in the bedroom...it was an old fashioned big TV and so we had had to go into the living room to watch the football games and the couch was not that comfortable. Also the Internet only worked in the bedroom, not in the living room and it was very slow. Overall the hotel was good value but if you like to watch a good TV in your bedroom this is not the hotel to pick. If you like to cook your own meals this is the hotel to pick.

Reviews.Title: “Others have said it all ...”
Reviews.Author: Grams_59
Reviews.Content: great service, nice beds, kitchen and bath. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch employees plus an insanely good value”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: The employees: We're the best, from bartenders to front desk to cleaning crew. Every single employee we encountered in our 4 day stay was gracious and every request we had was completed with a smile. The rooms: The value was excellent. When we saw the room for the price we paid, we were completely happy with our purchase. One night we cooked a great dinner in our fully stocked, just like home, kitchen and ate it out on our private deck. That meal was followed up with a dip in our two person jacuzzi in the bathroom... all for a little over a $100/night! The food: The breakfast food was average, but fairly priced, which is I guess what you would expect at a hotel breakfast. The bar food was reasonably priced, fresh, and tasty for a hotel bar, with good selection. We were not satisfied with the drinks though. They were far over priced for their size and weak strength. But, they do allow you to bring your own booze down to the pool, which saved us a lot of money during our day drinking in the hot tub. Overall we loved our stay and will 100% be back, especially since we found out that returning customers get 20% off.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel That Does It "Right"”
Reviews.Author: shamus84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 2 nights (12/24/11 and 12/25/11) and give it a five stars plus rating. The hotel is extremely clean, comfortable, and met all of our needs. The pool is fantastic. Fabio, who works at the front desk, went above and beyond to make sure are stay was “special”. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Point Resort - Quality Hotel & VFM”
Reviews.Author: GolfNutScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Point for two nights, in a 2x King-bedded room. The room was very comfortable with all required amenities. The pool area was clean; both Pool and Spa were lovely and warm. The service, from all members of staff, was prompt and courteous. The little kitchenette in our room was good - it even included a mini keurig coffee machine, but no tea! The hotel’s location was good, walking distance to International Drive (and Wet’n’Wild) and a very short Taxi to Universal Studios. The only negative detail I had with The Point Resort is that the 2x King-bedded room would be too small if we were staying any longer than 2-3 nights; one of the resort’s suites would be required. Overall the hotel was excellent value we all had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Point Orlando”
Reviews.Author: bluesPower
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, kitchen is beautiful and very well-equipped. Cabana bar food is excellent. We traveled with a 1-1/2 year old and the hotel was very accommodating of her - crib and high-chair were setup and ready to go in the room when we arrived. Pool area is nice as well. The staff was helpful and very friendly with whatever requests or questions we had. There weren't any programs for kids or anything but the pool area kept our little girl entertained.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i have been too”
Reviews.Author: poppyo47
Reviews.Content: Hi i stayed at the point last year with my husband and a few friends we enjoyed so much we returned dis year with more friends we have just returned home from a 12 night stay we had a brilliant time and will be returning with our grandkids this coming december . I could not fault this hotel in any way this will be our 6th year coming to florida i wont be staying anywhere else other than the point for future holidays .Fabio and the rest of the staff at the reception area were very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyPippa
Reviews.Content: Very functional lay-out for our family of five in 2 BR unit, and nice furnishings. Easy parking and nice pool. No wifi in rooms and not always strong in lobby which was frustrating. Room wasn't ready at check-in time and didn't always find staff helpful. Beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, and very comfortable visit!”
Reviews.Author: aidakiwi24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Point for two nights. Our studio suite was very comfortable, and we could not hear people in other rooms or in the hallway. The pool area was clean, and the cabana offered good prices and good service. There were no ice machines or vending machines that we could find, but the little kitchenette in our room was good - it even included a mini keurig coffee machine! The location was good - we decided to take a taxi to and from Universal Studios - about $6 each way. Overall we had a wonderful experience. I recommend that you "like" their page on facebook for a cheaper rate!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: simoma
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodation in Orlando but a bit overpriced for the service provided (a bit unpersonal and cold). Good location in Orlando area to access the parks, downtown and shopping facilities. Very nice pool area. The room was big and comfortable, with a small but equipped kitchen and a living area with table and sofa. Complimentary coffee in the room (coffee machine) Plus: - room - cleaninless (one of the best ever) - free parking Minus: - price - breakfast not included (add 9$ for continental breakfast) - no wifi in the room! that was the worst minus for me. Wifi available only in the lobby and pool area, in rooms only wired (wired internet is useless nowadays) Overall very good but a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Poole-McKenna”
Reviews.Author: Tricia M
Reviews.Content: Recent visit December 2011. The rooms are so well equip with all the appliances you need. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and staff are friendly and helpful. We had a two bedroom suite which enabled the children to have their own bedroom and bathroom. Pool was well used by the children. Breakfast is more expensive but better quality.

Reviews.Title: “We can't rate the Point Orlando Resort Highly Enough!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarenandJ0hn
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner John stayed at the Point Orlando from 30th Oct-14 Nov 2011. We loved staying there!!!!! Staff were amazing, facilities out of this world, rooms fantastic and location was spot on. We will be booking for this year too and we wouldn't consider any other resort. Fabio is worth his weight in gold as his knowledge and enthusiasm made us feel so welcome and comfortable. Do not book anywhere else as this is the place to be and we look forward to seeing you all on the 29th October. Can't wait!!!!! Karen and John McNair xxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Service as it should be”
Reviews.Author: LooandWaldo
Reviews.Content: Extremely courteous and accommodating to every request. Accommodation larger then average with clean and refreshing suites. There is no question or issue that is to great for the Front desk staff, Fabio in particular will the full low down on any issue you may wish to discuss. Have now stayed there twice and have booked our next holiday with the Pointe. Not just a suite, more a personal holiday service. Everything about our stay made us feel special and personally catered for.

Reviews.Title: “The Point Hotel & Resort - Orlando, FL”
Reviews.Author: Jackie P
Reviews.Content: Lived up to our expectations. Our one-bedroom suite was spacious, clean and everything we needed was right there. The ONLY uncomfortable spot was the sofa-pull-out-bed/mattress = too thin and our daughters could feel the springs and wires. After 2 days @ Universal Studios, they were too tired to feel it at bed-time, but still noticeably uncomfrtable. Again, the ONLY part of our stay in the suite that was not most comfortable. We can't wait to go back! :)

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: suga_8
Reviews.Content: me, my husband, my daughter, and my niece stayed here last year for 2 weeks. The reception is very clean and has a small coffee bar. Also, there is a little internet "cafe" in the bottom area. The pool area is directly behind the building, and is very clean. The pool itself clean and large and there is plenty of sunbeds for everyone. Also, there is a large circular hot tub which we spent most of our hours in whilst round thepool area; its so hot-you never want to get out. Also, there is a ver large, clean and modern gym located at the back of the pool area; this has an age restriction on it. There a fresh clean towels located pool side. tip-you cannot get out of the building and into the pool with out one hotel room card, so carry that with you. snacks and drinks are also located poolside. The rooms- the best part-were spacious, we wasn't expecting what we got (as we are only a 4 part family) but we recieved a massive apartment for outr duration. The kids had there own room which was fitted with a small Kitchenette and a large en-suite bathroom, free internet contection (only in there room), 1 king sized bed - super comfy!- and one sofa pull-out double bed (this was also comfy too!) and a large tv and 2 walk in wardrobes. In the living room, the kitchen was large and also was the fridge, the lough area was again large and spacious. Furthermore, fro the balcony you can see sea world and aquatica which is about a 5 min drive away-great location, espacially if you are looking to go to the universal or "busch" parks. ANd wet and wild water park was in a 5 min walking distance, which was great! The master bed is large and is complete with alot of wardrobe space and a large tv. AND THE BATHROOM WAS MASSIVE. very clean, very spacious and modern. would recomment this hotel to all age groups and people. great great hotel x

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: samlydia
Reviews.Content: The Point lived up to my expectations. Me and husband went for a weekend getaway and booked here to see if we would like it for family vacation we are planning for this summer.Location is awesome especially if you are going to Wet-n-Wild (half a block away) and Universal. Must say was impressed with room and decor and bed was comfortable (not Hilton though those beds are awesome) but comfortable. Pool was nice size not huge.Only drawbacks would be no vending machines or 24 hour store but that's ok because Walgreen is right on corner and plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Nice stay we will be bringing our family in the summer

Reviews.Title: “Kids and Adults liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: tony n
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Very comfortable Rooms. Clean and spacious. Staff was wonderful. Our 16 and 9 yr old really loved this place. Breakfast was very good. Tiki bar was nice with good food, drinks and prices. Staff was very friendly. Nice casual pool and hot tub with lots of towels. Altoghether, very nice stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Accomodation ....will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: lesgib
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed 20th Dec - 27th Dec and have no complaints at all. We had a one bedroom apartment which was spotless, very spacious and had everything you could possibly need to stay self-catering. The pool bar served snacks until late if we didn't feel like making anything. All of the staff were warm, friendly and very helpful. It was located right beside Universal Studios and really handy to International Drive.....haven't never driven in the USA before I found the hotel ideally located to all major roads for Disney, Florida Mall etc. Busch Gardens was a lot further away but the hotel arranged shuttle transfers for us with the pick up point being a short distance away from hotel just. Can honestly say no complaints from us at all......perhaps not the place if you are looking for somewhere lively but definitely ideal if you are on a typical busy Orlando holiday and want to relax in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed - expected more!!”
Reviews.Author: SLG1984
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews on this hotel were quite positive and I had high expectations when I booked my trip. Unfortunately I was disappointed in my overall experience. My husband and I were going to Orlando for a getaway - just the two of us, no kids. The hotel was originally a condo building but the builder could no longer make the payments so another ownership group came in and turned it into a hotel - at least that is what I was told by the staff when I inquired. So the rooms are accommodating - they offer a full kitchen and a small washer and dryer which would be great for longer visits. We were only there for 3 days so we didn't use these amenities that much. This would be ideal for someone staying in Orlando for over a week with kids though. Furthermore, the atmosphere at the "hotel" was very dead. Although it is very close to Universal it is not within walking distance and the hotel does not have a real restaurant so there is no reason that someone that wasn't staying there would come to the hotel. They do have a pool and a pool "bar" but there are very few people there and the bar is extremely overpriced. There is no room service either. There is a small cafe but when I requested a breakfast sandwich I was told that they could not accommodate my request. So, there isn't anything to do at the hotel besides swim in the pool BUT they do not provide quick shuttle service multiple times during the day to any of the parks including Universal which is very close to the hotel. They do have a shuttle that comes once in the morning to pick you up and take you to the parks - it is free - but the one time we tried to use it the shuttle was over 30 minutes late and we decided to take a cab because we wanted to get to the parks - that cost $50. We went to City Walk at Universal each night and also had to take a cab there - $10 each way. For what I ended up spending in cab fare the discounted rate on the hotel was not really worth it. Overall, the atmosphere and amenities of the hotel were not suited for a couple taking a vacation and would be more suited to families who put more emphasis on the kitchen and laundry room. As someone who frequents Universal often I was very disappointed and can say confidently that there are much better places to stay. The biggest disappointment for me was that this is a "Universal Family Hotel" and they don't provide regular transportation to Universal - which their website would lead you to believe. Worst of all, my husband got very sick on our last day (I guess that just topped off the lackluster vacation experience) and I asked if I could get some kind of credit for my last night there since we had to check out early but I was told no, even though we left before noon. I expect more from hotels with the "Universal Family" brand and would not recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a fun destination with plenty of things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite for family to stay”
Reviews.Author: ZHEN Q
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Orlando. Besides the amazing Disney world, we also had great experience with The Point Resort. We reserved a suite for 7 nights, and it was awesome. The rooms were as clean as home, and every thing we needed was provided. The room service was wonderful, too. It's a super nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: dianauoft
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from Nov 28 - Dec 4th, one-bedroom suite, high floor, facing Universal Studios. The location is great, very close to Universal, Prime Outlet mall, Millenia mall, restaurants, Whole Foods, Costco, Walmart, Target, etc. Hotel room is awesome, felt like home. Kitchen is pretty big, stacked with everything you could need while on vacation. The bathroom is huge and has a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The tub could be bigger, it's only meant for 1 person. There's a king bed in the bedroom; the mattress could be replaced, it's pretty worn out. We chose to have daily breakfast included with our stay, and it was pretty good value. We didn't use the pool because it was too cold outside. Overall it was a great hotel, excellent location and value and would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone who visits Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Betty T
Reviews.Content: just like an apartment. fantastic location. quiet. beautiful pool. very nice staff. only flaw was: bedroom window doesn't open but deck door does, and there is a ceiling fan in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: annie725
Reviews.Content: I made our reservations through expedia.com. Had a great stay. The hotel was in excellent condition, the staff were very polite and very efficient. The prices at the Cabana for drinks were high, other than that we had a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at high season, in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Allan K
Reviews.Content: Even with the "resort fee" added to room rate, the property is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Universal Parks and shopping malls”
Reviews.Author: fabiobrsp
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night at the begining of December. My stay was smooth and all packages I have ordered were duly delivered and the hotel did not charge any fee (some hotels do charge a fee for each received package, specially in Orlando, so ask upfront). Room was clean and furniture/decor is good. The only reason I did not give five stars is because, during my one-day stay, I left my hotel room with the non-disturb sign at the door and, when I returned, there were several towels I did not order on the table. Also, the sink cabinet in the washroom was open and I could see several fresh towels stored there, as one would like to give me the following message: "why did you order towels if there was plenty in the sink cabinet?". Even if it was not intentional, they should not enter the room in first place with the "non-disturb" sign on the door (probably the room ordering the towels was my neighboor, as some rooms appear to share the same number with different letters).

Reviews.Title: “Stay Only If You Don't Need The Pullout”
Reviews.Author: Paul Z
Reviews.Content: We were planning for a 2 night stay but left after the 1st night. The pull-out sleeper has a mattress about 5 inches thick and is totally uncomfortable. We barely slept a wink and I'm exhausted and in pain.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in orlando”
Reviews.Author: daisymiami
Reviews.Content: Room clean and spacious, well equipped, quick and free internet, parking ample, near universal, fast and easy check in and out , friendly and helpful staff, very peaceful and quiet although there were many guests, comfortable beds and good insulation, very reasonable price. perfect place to stay during a visit to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelhelper
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay from 12-19 through 12-22-11 with the family in a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was huge and well-equipped. The beds were very comfortable, and the place is very quiet. Excellent location - less than a mile from Universal, and very short drives to Sea World, Disney and the airport. Conveniently located near I-4 and Universal Drive. The rates are surprisingly reasonable. We've stayed at a number of Disney Resorts, and they are nice, but it is hard to beat The Point Orlando on a "bang for the buck" basis. TIP: booking directly through the Resort's website using your AAA rate will get you the best rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: SaraHeidi
Reviews.Content: Being very anal about hygiene, I hardly ever walk around barefoot in a hotel nor soak myself in a bathtub. However, The Point Resort Orlando gave me the luxury to do both. The carpet was diligently vacuumed as were the bedsheets and bathtub spotless. Although the air conditioning system did not run as smoothly as I had hoped, my stay here was generally pleasant. Definitely value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and comfortable!! Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Jennnnnnnnn
Reviews.Content: The resort was very very clean and the rooms were spectacular! Hotel price was good and well worth the money. I am very picky about beds and bathrooms and this place was perfect! The bed was clean and did not have the appearance if a hotel. The bathroom was also clean and unlike any other hotel bathroom. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is picky like me! :)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: angel2576
Reviews.Content: I just got back last night from Orlando and I wanted to share my experience about this hotel. It is AWESOME, :)... The staff, beds, and pillows were excellent. This hotel is good for both a short or extended stay. The next time we visit Orlando, we are staying at this wonderful hotel, :)...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: vampslayer01
Reviews.Content: stayed here for awhile in a apartment suite room, it was great and roomy and had everything you needed all in the room, the restaurant was very nice and reasonably priced. the rooms were very clean and serviced daily, they were roomy, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful with all our questions. the only thing i would mention was the transport to and from parks was not as good as others we have stayed at, there were not enough services at the right times i felt to meet out needs so we got our rental early, there was always plenty of free parking as well, all in all i would defiantly stay again and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Simply NO Better Value Near Universal Studios!”
Reviews.Author: Livinglifefull
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the 1 bedroom suite on more than one occasion. The spaciousness is WONDERFUL as is the upscale feel. To have a completely outfitted kitchen including cake pans and cookie sheets is crazy. How nice it is to have a cup of coffee in a ceramic cup on the balcony in the morning. Especially after a good nights sleep due in part to the luxurious feel of the linens on the bed. Also, The bathroom has a Jacuzzi tub with a seperate and huge tiled shower. Also the italian marble tile floors are rich. Lots of space. The really GREAT thing about this resort is We foud it to be as nice if not better than the first time we stayed here about 4 years ago! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS RESORT!

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: SMLO
Reviews.Content: It was absolutely fantastic hotel with great location! Just near by was Outlet -shops, Universal Studios, Disney World, Wet 'n wild and Sea World and many many restaurants. We did rent a car and we drove to Kennedy Space Center which was also great experience. Suite was great, only thing what i missed was a hair dryer. we were able to wash dishes and clothes in your very own room. TV was in bedroom and living room. Internet wasnt working in our room, but my friend's room it did, bad karma? We spend at this hotel 7 nights. Staff was really helpful and when we did need something, we got help right away. Maybe one thing what i wish that hotel would get, is real restaurant. Near the pool was a bar, where you could get finger food, but nothing else. But anyway i recommend this to anyone, i was there with my friends, but i believe that everyone would find something to do and see, everyday. If i go Orlando again, this will be my choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Good longer stay option”
Reviews.Author: travellersnb
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the 1bedroom unit. Great staff, upgrade at check in. Gorgeous unit with luxury bathroom, comfy king sized bed, leather furniture, granite kitchen, balcony over looking the pool. Only negative was no full service restaurant on site. But otherwise perfect great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: vegasluvr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay and this resort was one of the nicest places we've ever stayed in Orlando. We were in a one bedroom suite with a balcony with a nice view which overlooked the pool. Bathroom was huge with a jetted tub and separate shower. We didn't use the kitchen much, but it seemed to have everything necessary if you wanted to cook a meal. Living room had a nice flat screen and the bedroom had a regular tv, but we never used that one anyway. Everything was very clean and comfortable. Location was right off I-Drive...very close to everything, including Universal Studios. Disney was about a 10 minute drive away. Did not try the breakfast or the restaurant, so can't comment on those. Also, didn't use the pool, but the pool area looked very nice. I believe they provide a shuttle to Universal, but we had a car. Pros: Excellent value for what you receive Nice flat screen tv Beautiful, huge bathroom with jetted tub Fully equipped kitchens with ice maker in fridge Great location Comfortable bed Very clean! Front desk staff was friendly and helpful Washer/Dryer in room Cons: No wifi in rooms. Had wired internet, but the cable was short and did not reach to the sofa, so had to sit at the dining rm table. This is my only major complaint. Doors were all out of level, so didn't stay closed/open properly. Had to prop bedroom door open. Other units may not have this issue. Shower floor was slippery. They should have used a rougher tile on the floor. Maid service is basic and does not include cleaning the kitchen area, so you will need to do that yourself, or pay extra. All in all, I loved this place and will definitely return the next time I'm in Orlando. Just a side note, the Christmas tree and decorations in the lobby were absolutely beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “It feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Chris1466
Reviews.Content: It is such a great place to stay..if u have to stay a longer period than a few days,it has everything you need..full kitchen etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kate m
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pointe Orlando at the end of November 2011. The Resort is located on Universal Boulevard only couple minutes in a taxi to Universal Studios and a short walk onto International drive. We found it a great location for getting around and catching the IRide. The Resort itself was lovely. We stayed in a 1 bedroom master suite (their term for an apartment). Everything from decor to cleanliness was 5 star quality and the apartment was better equipped then my apartment at home. It had every type of cooking utensil you could think of. Loads of cuttlery and crockery. Dishwasher, dryer, washing machine (put this on when you're going out and not late at night as they are very noisey), juicer and coffee making machine. Washing up liquid/powder and detergant are replace daily along with the towels, shamoo ad soap. The apartment had two tvs with a great selection of channels and a balcony. When you make your reservation you can also give your floor and view preferance which is a nice touch. The staff here are friendly, efficient and accomodating and all staff from accommodation to reception greeted you and smiled when you passed them. The only small downside was the high price of the breakfast for a very poor selection. In saying that you can cook your breakfast in the apartment or find a local spot with better value down the road. The hotel has free wifi but only in the lobby and the meeting rooms and the cost of using guest computers was a bit expensive. We stayed in a three star hotel up the road where internet access and guest computers and printing was free. These are more points for business traveller as we didnt need to use internet that much. All in all we had a great stay in this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: kerry b
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, the kitchen was nice we were able to pick up a few groceries and drinks to have in the room when you didn't feel like eating out The rooms were cleaned each day, and we always had fresh towels. We had a car rental so the free parking was nice and you can get to any of the area parks etc. very easily. Over all, excellent value for the money and great service.

Reviews.Title: “my experiance”
Reviews.Author: rita b
Reviews.Content: the stay provided everything we wished for from cleanliness of accomadation to friendliness and efficency of staff

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in orlando”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel403
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the end of November, checked out on Dec. 1. The one bedroom suite was perfect for our needs. Nice to have a kitchen and washer/dryer (even though we didn't use the washer/dryer). Room was clean. Hotel amenities are very nice. Reservation and check-in went smoothly. Front desk person, when we checked-in, was really nice and helpful after a long drive from Cape Coral in the pouring rain. I think his name was Fabio. The staff in the breakfast room each day were very friendly and do an excellent job of keeping the food items topped up. The day we checked out the General Manager Jerry Slatton greeted us in the breakfast room to ensure that our stay went well. A really nice touch. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality- Close To It All!”
Reviews.Author: kallakat
Reviews.Content: We arrived late (as planned) and our room was fresh and ready for us. Staff was pleasant and especially Tim a maintenance peron who was very friendly and cheerful! Room as a one bedroom suite with excellent view of International Drive and had a nice balcony overlooking pool. Ask for tower 2 on floor above 6 if you like a great view! Bathroom was terrific- glassed in shower and huge jacuzzi tub..very clean and no problems. Bed pillows are a bit small but you get several.... Did not eat on premises due to business, but seemed popular with guests each day. Thanks for a great 3 day stay..we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: cin4321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort with our daughter and her boyfriend. The suite was very nice and lots of space. The bathroom was very spacious. We had originally booked for two nights and had to change to one night and they were gracious adn understanding with teh change. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: davencary
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice in the past year, while on business. Staff is always attentive and facility has all you could hope for.

Reviews.Title: “"Walking distance to Universal Studios"”
Reviews.Author: OJM17
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after doing a lot of research on a lot of travel websites. I wanted to plan a trip to the universal studios with my wife and wanted a hotel that was both near and in a good price-range. The hotel had a special running so we got the 1 bedroom suite for the price of a studio. The suite was very spacious, welcoming and had all the kitchen stuff to have a quick meal. The laundry machine came in handy and the hotel gladly replenished the detergent several times over. It was a 20 minute walk to Universal Studios so we walked in the morning and took a cab on the way back. The hotel could do better with having more frequent shuttles to/from Universal Studios. On our morning walks we spotted a few more hotels closer to the theme parks so if you mind walking 20 minutes do look around! For the most part the hotel staff was friendly. The resort fee though a bit high does help if you plan on parking a car. With smartphones and hardly much of the day spent in your room you probably wouldnt need to use the phone or internet much. We had a car and used some internet at night so the fee paid off for itself. Take WATER from the nearby Walgreens unless you are OK with drinking tap water. The hotel does not have a vending machine and sells water bottles at the bar untill 11pm for 2.25. We would certainly visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: redz81
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here, and really enjoyed it. Our room was on the 6th floor, and we found it to be very spacious. Bathroom was huge, although only one basin. Kitchen, washer, dryer were all in the room, which was great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We ate at the poolside bar once, and thought the food was good. Wanted to eat there again but ran out of time. The hotel provides shuttles to the main theme parks, we went to Disneyworld - Epcot, and Universal Studios. There was only one shuttle to Epcot, and it was at 11:15am which was later than we wanted. Maybe a shuttle that gets there at opening and again at lunchtime would of been better. The location was fine, although there is nothing else around it other than hotels, next time I would stay at a hotel in International blvd just to reduce the walking. Its not a short walk to Universal, so I'd recommend the shuttle, otherwise a taxi is around $10. Only issue I had was there is no wifi in the room. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Rick W
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Florida and we booked online.I was having a hard time choosing as there are many places to stay in Orlando.When I saw this hotel the location and price sounded to good to be true.It totally lived up to all my expectations,the staff was friendly and helpful,the pool area is gorgeous and the balcony allowed wonderful views of the city.Free shuttle to Universal and short cab ride back if you chose not to wait for shuttle.3 flat screen tvs at the Cabana Bar poolside,food was very good but if you are looking for other options for dining there are several restaurants nearby on International Dr.I will definitely recommend The Point to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome & Worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: Kay P
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff (Fabio,Steph, Thomas & Hernadiaz)!! We had a 1 Bd suite this past wkend, the rooms are extremely clean and very well taken care of (no repairs spotted any where) & I LOVED the kitchen w/ full stove, refrigerator & microwave. Great Price too!!It also had an "apartment" size washer & dryer which was WONDERFUL. Beds, pillow & hide a bed couch were also in great shape!! We spent days @ Universal studios (less than $10 cab ride away) and loved relaxing @ hotel afterwards!! Perfect Hidden secret & I will be recommending to my family(in Tx & MO) to stay there next year (instead of renting a house) when we get together for the holidays. Only drawback, restaurant on-hand is "bar food" type for dinner but many options for restaurant close by!! Breakfast option seemed very good but we opted out due to other plans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Heather D
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for Thanksgiving break with the kids. There are 6 of us in our family so it's always a challenge to find a comfortable hotel for us to stay in. I admit we were skeptical of how "perfect" this hotel sounded for us but when we checked into our room, every doubt I had was replaced with all the necessaties of home. It had everything any family would need to go out of town. It was VERY clean, VERY upscale and VERY much what we needed to accommadate our large family. The pool was heated so the kids were able to enjoy a night of swimming while my husband and I enjoy a cocktail at the poolside bar/restaurant. It was close to Sea World and had lots of restaurants to choose from nearby. We will definitely stay there again and I am recommending it to everyone I know looking to go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding :)”
Reviews.Author: KarenandKarl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic hotel. Gorgeous room. Everything you needed was in there. Nice and spacious and really clean. Gorgeous bathroom and lovely, relaxing spa bath. Comfy beds. Great sleep. Peaceful location and great access to I 4 and really anywhere you wanted to go in Orlando. Staff were also really friendly. We had a fantastic stay here and will definately be back in the future. Lovely holiday. Thanks to all :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: RITravelingMama
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night on 11/13/11. I wish we could have stayed longer! The grand one bedroom suite was a mini-apartment. It was fully equipped with everything you would ever need to stay there for weeks. What a deal we got for the price! My favorite part was the pool and outside pool bar. It was very relaxing and our bartender Josh made fabulous drinks all night. We saw Josh again the next morning working hard as if he'd never left! I would recommend this property to anyone looking for some relaxation in a fun atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family base.”
Reviews.Author: caithness-1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Orlando and found the point to be an excellent base for our family stay. Our main problem when booking accomodation was most hotels are geared up for 2 + 2 families and with us having 3 kids found it very expensive for two rooms and did not want a villa. Our local travel agent suggested this location and it could not have been better. We stayed in the double suite and there was loads of room and a lot more privacy for everyone in comparison to a hotel. The staff were all very nice and nothing was a problem. The i-ride passes outside and taxis are very reasonable. Give it a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stews_Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother-in-law and myself stayed here in June we had one of the 2 bedroom suites and it was amazing. Having the kitchen was great for nights when you didn't feel like going out. It was very handy for visiting Universal Studios and Sea World. We never paid more than $10 for a cab to universal and we used the hotel shuttle bus transportation to Disney, it had to be booked the night before, and sometimes the return journey was a bit packed and meant we had to stand but it did the job! The hotel was very clean and spacious, we had a bar snack by the pool one night which was ok for just a snack. The pool was lovely as was the jacuzzi and it was never very busy only ever 5-10 people in whenever we went down to the pool. There's music played out by the pool and the bar and patio furniture is nice just to relax by the pool. Plenty of Sunbeds available for those who want them and always a pile of fresh towels for you to help yourself near the pool. There is a gym but we never used it. There is a wallgreens which is about 10 mins walk from the hotel, there is also ihop and other restaurants nearby. Its on the i-ride route but its not the busiest route and we found we often wasted more time waiting for the trolley bus! The rooms are lovely and spacious and well equipped. There are only two things that could improve this already fantastic hotel and they are a proper restaurant and some patio furniture on the balcony so that you have somewhere to sit if you want to go and enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “all round good hotel”
Reviews.Author: me-and-monkey
Reviews.Content: First time in Orlando so cannot compare this hotel to any of the other 350 listed, However being extensive travellers staying in many hotels we should be able to give a fair review. Booked via travel counsellors "Edinburgh John" who got me a great deal on entire package and saved me the hassle of booking. The hotel seems new and consists of two tower blocks, decent size pool, jet pool and bar, Both pool and jet pool were a nice temp for swimming and relaxing. Sitting on Universal blvd close to International drive it is within walking distance of many shops, restaurants the wet'n'wild water park and universal theme parks, Unlike many who travel Orlando we did not hire a car "a holiday is for relaxing eating and drinking not driving" and the position of this hotel along with the i-hop buses and park shuttles we did not find this a problem. Our room was a large exec single suite "107H" on the ground floor block 2, very large bed small kitchen area "sink,fridge and microwave" with seating/pull bed, dining table and small bathroom, The room was of a good size larger than most and all furnishing in good condition, The bathroom however was on the small side with no bidet. All the staff were very nice ,decent and seemed pleased to help you our only faults with the hotel were no bidet in bathroom, Dressing robes should be provided for the first 2 floors as they overlook both car park and swimming pool and you cannot open your curtain fully as people could see into your room, Also the hotel states that your room is fully serviced twice during your stay, However this includes the room being clean when you arrive which you would expect then a full clean half way through, A clean room to start then 2 full cleans during stay would be better, Coffee machine provided with weak coffee and no tea. These are only minor faults however and it would not stop me returning to this hotel or recommending it. well done The point and it's staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Joseph S
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here Nov 12th 2011 - Nov. 20th 2011 and truly enjoyed our stay. We were in Orlando looking for homes and a mini vacation. This Hotel is a perfect location for Universal, SeaWorld and Wet n Wild. To Universal a cab ride for six is $12.00, well worth it. Restaurants are not really in walking distance but only minutes by car and plenty of selection. We were upgraded to a stand alone suite after some confusion on our part about the connecting suites. Fabio, Stephanie, and Hamid were unbelievably accommodating though the complete staff here from bartenders to maids was also very nice. We also enjoyed the very nice pool one afternoon with music in the background and drinks from the bar; want to be there right now soooo badly. The only downfall was no vending machines but would never stop us from going back as the full kitchen more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ashley C
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic. But not walking distance to much. It was easy to find without GPS. Room was large and clean. Not great water pressure in shower. Great price. Found the best price booking directly through the hotel. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Patrick Kearney”
Reviews.Author: pjk2623
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here, and we're already planning our third. It's by far the best place we have stayed at in Orlando. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were spotless and the location, and price ideal. We never tried the breakfast, but just went for coffee in the morning, but the breakfast area was always popular with other families.

Reviews.Title: “We are very picky but we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Amin M
Reviews.Content: Great location and price. We were very happy with our stay Positives: Location Price Service Clean The pool Negatives: Breakfast buffet not very good definitely not worth the price much better food around

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BL007
Reviews.Content: Room was of very good size, clean and kitchen was of excellent quality. May be I have a different expectation of a "resort", Point Orlando Resort was an excellent hotel with a nice swimming pool, pool side bar, fitness room. I did not use the spa. That was it. Breakfast area was small but adequate. I would put this in the category of an excellent family hotel and would recommend highly to anyone who is visiting orlando universal area. It is almost walking distance to Universal studios (about 1 mile), walking distance to "wet and wild". The staff were very welcoming and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “An obsolute pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our 1 week stay. Having a kitchen helped us better relax for the time we were there at a price most hotels charge without nearly the space.

Reviews.Title: “More than your money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: csi19
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my extended family (including 3 kids 5-13) in August 2010. We stayed in an amazing 2 bedroom suite that generously accommodated 4 adults and 3 kids. The pool was right near our room, which the kids loved, but there was hardly any noise. The suite had a fully stocked kitchen as well as a washer/dryer combo, which was really handy to have. The second bedroom had a smaller kitchenette. Both rooms had sleeper couches, so there was enough room for everyone. Everything was very clean, and the staff was very helpful. There was parking on site, but they also had a free shuttle to Universal Studios. After our first stay, we decided we would definitely return for future visits, and my parents went back in May 2011 and had another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: rshoults
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 4 nights at The Point and had a marvelous time. We've been to Orlando many times and this visit was just a short get away from the hustle and bustle of the office. We enjoyed a one bedroom suite that was more than enough room for the two of us. We didn't cook, but having the full kitchen available was a big plus for doing breakfast in the room and snacking at night. The pool area was lovely and clean. I enjoyed use of the fitness center treadmill. The weather was good for us, but if it'd been bad, only having access to the hotel through one door could have been a problem since if you return to the hotel late at night you will likely be parking a long way from the door. I guess it's necessary for security, but it would be better if you could get into some of the other doors. Other than that, I have no real criticism to offer. We had a great visit at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in orlando”
Reviews.Author: martina f
Reviews.Content: stayed at the point orlando for the fourth time in the last two years. this is the most welcoming clean friendly family orientated hotel in orlando. staff are all very helpful and can not do enough for their guests. we feel now that this is a home away from home. the rooms are very well equipped hotel is close to all ammenities and we cooked a few dinners in our fully equipped kitchen. the pool area is clean and we love the new cabana grill serves great snacks cocktails and smoothies.This is my number one hotel in orlando thanks to angela fabio stephanie and amir and to all the staff who made our holiday very enjoyable. martina and gillian.

Reviews.Title: “orlando trip 2011”
Reviews.Author: john d
Reviews.Content: very clean with great staff always greeted with a smile very pleasant to deal with, agree with other review bout breakfast over priced for what you get best to do your own or head for i drive where you can avail of a buffet style breakfast fot less than $5. althou food at the cabana/pool was very reasonable & excellent . kids enjoyed the pool when we werent at the parks but not much else for them to do.gym available and was used, supplied with towels and drinking water enjoyed it Only gripe that i do have is that they dont seem to recognise the republic of ireland as a country it seems they believe we are part of the UK . they told me at the front desk when i was checking out and getting my receipt that had the uk as my address and not EIRE that the computer wouldn't allow for it to be changed and i had the same issue last year. and if your reading this can you please change it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: essalp
Reviews.Content: We, a family of four, stayed at the hotel for a week in a grand bedroom suite. The room was very well equipped with a dishwasher, washing machine and a dryer (on top of the ordenary stuff like big fridge/coffe machine/stove/iron board). The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to the parks and just outside the door from the hotel there is a bus stop for the I-Trolly (green line) and one block away (5-10 minutes walk) to International Drive you have I-Trolly (red line). The I-Trolly is a very cheap way of transport yourself (1,25 USD/ride or 10 USD for a week) if you don't have a car and it takes you to the shopping and restaurants. The service at the hotel was excellent. Many thanks to Mr Fabio Garcia, who helped us make ticket reservations at Discovery Cove (don't miss that if you want to swim with dolphins and rays and other fishes!) and transportation to Port Canaveral. We also found the sofabed to hard for our kids to sleep on, but there was no hassle to get an extra mattress. A small drawback was the breakfast. The breakfast area and the tables are to small. We could hardly sit at one table. And the price (9.95 USD) did not include coffe or tea :-(. We solved that by making out own breakfast in our room. The hotel also has a pool (big but not enormous), a bubble pool and a poolbar.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: bootsf10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take our 10 year anniversary trip to Orlando. Yes we went there without our kids! After much research on where to stay, we chose to stay 6 days at The Point Orlando Resort and we could not have been happier. We had a one bedroom condo with a full kitchen, balcony and jacuzzi tub. Absolutely beautiful with granite countertops in the bathroom and kitchen. Our bed was very very comfortable except it did sink to one side which was weird, but that is my only complaint. The pool and hot tub were great along with the cabana grill. We enjoyed being able to bring our own drinks and snacks to the pool which saved us some serious money since my husband and I love to have cocktails. It was great being able to get some of our food at Walmart which was very close to our hotel. That also saved us money on lunches and dinners. There is a shuttle to the parks provided by the hotel but it only leaves at certain times so be aware of that. We had a rental car so it did not matter to us. There is a resort fee which includes towels, parking, and other things for about $11.00 per day. There is not a lot of things to do for kids like the disney hotels, but the pool and hot tub were great! This hotel is very close to attractions like Universal Studios, Citywalk, Ripleys, lots of mini golf places, tons of restaurants. Make sure to get a lot of food at Walmart or Piblix to save money!!

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes.......”
Reviews.Author: Christopher W
Reviews.Content: The only reason I haven't given this 5 stars is because this isn't (and doesn't pretend to be) a luxury 5 star hotel. It is however exceptionally good value. The general hotel and the room itself were clean and relaxed. The location was perfect for accessing International Drive and all the parks, but set back enough so that you could get some escape at the end of the day. The staff were courteous and very helpful. I would happily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: Gagay555
