Reviews.Content: Rented an executive suite. Didn't realised it doesn't have the things you need in a kitchen. The room is just suitable for transient/one-night stay. I only give 4 for the cleanliness as the coffee-maker doesn't look like it has been dusted before the room was given for occupancy. There was no air-conditioning and the fan is quite noisy.but then service is good.. If you are a family even if your children are still small, I think, best you get a bigger room than the executive suite.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Dublin and stayed at the point hotel for one week with our three children. We had a two bedroom suite. It was spotlessly clean and very spacious and well equipped. After our energetic days at Universal (only 10 mins max by taxi) or Shopping we found the pool are most relaxing. Staff were very friendly and attentive. We were facilitaed with a 2pm check out. The hotel was very good value. )))

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggiew1961
Reviews.Content: this Hotel is in such a good location, a 15 minute walk from the Universal Parks and a great free shuttle service to the Disney Parks. We had a junior executive room which included a small kitchenette area (microwave/fridge/coffee machine) which was very convenient. It's a bit of a walk or cab journey/bus ride to any decent restaurants but the staff are more than willing to assist with recommendations and arranging travel for you. The hotel was spotlessly clean in all areas. Although we did not get to use the pool it looked well tended and family friendly. Without exception all the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. A great location for a hotel and good value, we would definitely stay again. If using the shuttle from the airport as we did make sure that they drop you off at the correct Point hotel not the Rosen inn at the Point.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and still as good”
Reviews.Author: Mandapanz
Reviews.Content: This is our second time in 2 years that we have stayed here in a 2 bedroom suite. It is just as described on the website, and our family of 5 certainly use its full facilities. With the luggage allowance getting less and less on airlines having a washer/dryer in your kitchen is one of the big plus points for us, all the more space to bring back stuff! Staff were as friendly as ever, maybe those with negative comments go in with a negative attitude and staff pick up on this, who knows, but we couldn't have faulted anyone. Even though we had a hire car we still used the i-ride trolley as it is at the entrance to the car park and it meant no one had to be designated driver! Would recommend to anyone and would stay here again without question. And for anyone wondering, they have a hairdryer in each of the bathrooms, it doesn't say anywhere and I couldn't remember. Great location for Universal, Wet 'n Wild and a straight run out to Seaworld and the Premium outlets. Couldn't comment on location with respect to Disney as my children prefer the rides at Universal. All in all FAB. Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at The Point Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: Hootnanny_7
Reviews.Content: We reserved the one bedroom suite and it was fantastic. We certainly made use of the kitchen, eating breakfast and dinner in the room which saved us a bundle. The hotel is so convenient to all the parks, and my husband was attending a conference which was also nearby. I thought the limited shuttle service to the parks may be an inconvenience, but the times worked out fine for us, though we did get to one park an hour after it opened just because the shuttle bus made so many stops along the way. My one complaint would be the cleaning service. We didn't know they only freshened the room, meaning they didn't clean the bathroom sink after my daughter got her make up powder all over, and didn't sweep the kitchen floor of popcorn kernels. One day they still hadn't been in our room by the time we got back that night, so it didn't get cleaned at all. Yet, overall it was a great deal for the price, we would definitely plan to stay there on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel indeed + great staff”
Reviews.Author: Eirikur E
Reviews.Content: great hotel clean rooms with evrything pool eria and the cabana bar by the pool where great also the staff is fantastic best staff on a hotel i have ever come a cross on our travels specialy the assistance manager i think his name is fabio or something simmilar gonna stay on this hotel again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin!? We have stayed here twice now, and it is way ahead of any ordinary hotel. The prices are lower than regular hotels, but everything here is better. We stayed in the one-bedroom suite both times. Very spacious, clean with excellent quality furniture. Our grad kids slept two nights very comfortably on the pull-out bed. The king bed is as comfortable as our new bed at home. Very large bathroom with both large shower and turbo-tub. Excellent maid service. Our kitchen had everything we needed. We had a problem getting the pull-out bed set up one night. Called the desk at 11:00 pm. In 3 minutes a courteous young man was at the door and fixed it in just a moment. In about five more minutes, the desk called back just to confirm that it was fixed to our satisfaction! We ordered food and drinks from the new outdoor bar area. Everything was very nicely done. The pool is large and clean, and hasn't been crowded at any time. I used the treadmill -- everything seemed to work fine in the exercise room. Location is convenient to International drive and Sand Lake Road which has many good restaurants. 20 minutes to the Magic Kingdom, and that is good for any of these hotels on International drive. You'll love The Point. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: allsport00
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, my family and I came down for vacation and really enjoyed ourselves. Facilities were clean and kept up well. Rooms were well layed out. Staff was tremendous, Juan checking us in was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingmanOhio
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well worth the price. Free Internet, washer and dryer. Large rooms and very clean. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JC1501
Reviews.Content: Just recently back from a 2 week stay at the Point and its the best hotel we have stayed in Orlando to date having visited orlando 4 times before we had a 2 bedroom apartment which had lots of space and 1 Bedroom aparment ( 6 of us travelled in total ) , all mod cons hugh fridge freezer , washer dryer , dishwasher everything we needed and more , light maid sevice of changing towels each day and beds made , Its nicely tucked away just off International Drive , behind Wet and Wild and if you wanted you could walk to Universal . We didnt hire a car this time ans used the Shuttle buses provided by the hotel which for me was the only downside of the hotel as the shuttle times were crazy 8.15 and 11.15 am morning times only to drop of at Epcot only and we had to get other disney buses and monorails to other disney parks but it meant we had to time the buses right to get back for the 6pm hotel shuttle bus as if we missed we had a 3 hour wait ouside Epcot or 100 dollars in a taxi as hotel shuttle collection from Epcot was at 6pm 9pm and 10pm and some disney parks closed at 6pm , Seaworld is located on the I ride so you didnt have to time yourself you could just get the I ride home . I have to thank the reception desk staff who went out of their way to help us and I have to thank Mr Jerry Slatton who organised the Man Utd Match to be shown at 8.30am at the pool bar , and for allowing us to stay longer in our rooms on check out day normal check out is 11am but as we were going to be picked up by Mears Transport back to the airport he let us check out at 2pm which was fantastic as we had a young child with us . Will definately be back to stay and have recommended the hotel to family and friends who are travelling out next year , will also hire a car next time . Brilliant hotel , most welcoming and friendly staff and mangement Thank you we had a brillant time in Orlando and at the hotel we hope to be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: debswood
Reviews.Content: We returned to the UK from Florida 4 weeks ago and stayed in The Point Orlando Resort. We had an executive suite as there were 4 adults and 1 child. It was so spacious! The rooms had everything and I mean everything we needed! cutlery, glasses, plates, iron, washing machine and dryer, dish washer! It was fantastic. The staff were all very helpful and polite. WE had a problem with our lights one day, went to reception to report it and within minutes there was an electrician there to sort it. The rooms and the hotel itself was very clean and bright. We didn't have breakfast there as we were out early most mornings, however the poolside bar was perfect for a basic meal if your simply too tired to go out in the evening. The pool was also very clean with ample sun loungers and fresh towels. We used the transport to the parks on a few occasions, and it was fine as this hotel is the first pickup so you are guaranteed a seat. The times of the bus didn't always suit us, as we like to be at the parks for opening times. It is only 10 mins from Universal and a taxi only cost about 8-10 dollars, and is within walking distance of Wet 'n' wild. The location of this hotel is a little out of the way in terms of restaurants for an evening meal. A good 15 minute walk to International drive, which isn't really that far, but after an exhausting day in the parks is a killer on the feet! lol. If you drive, then this hotel/suites is perfect! It is in a very pretty, quiet location, not too far from any of the parks and restaurants, and is by far the best suites we have stayed in, in Orlando! Would I stay here again?? Definately without a doubt. Just wish I was there now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation if you want to stay near I drive”
Reviews.Author: PeteCav
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bed suite. Fittings all new, nice kitchen, seating area, huge bathroom, good bedroom. Plenty of space, hotel staff were really good, maid was great. pool area is nice, overall really worth it. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: fpache84
Reviews.Content: I read quite a few reviews here before making my reservations at The Point Orlando Resort and had high expectations I must say upon my arrival I am so pleased my expectations were exceeded. We arrived in Orlando earlier than expected, around 2pm check in time was at 4 but the front desk attendant informed us that our room was already clean and ready for us if we wanted yo check on early. We were there for Halloween horror night at universal studios and the early check in gave us a chance to get acclimated to our room, which was nearly immaculately clean, and for have lunch and rest before the long and exciting night. The staff was exceptionally pleasant and offered us late check out due to our late night. My fiance and I agree that we've found our new Orlando hotel and cannot wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: daniel b
Reviews.Content: We held a small meeting at the Point Orlando and could not have been more satisfied. The hotel rooms were excellent with lots of room and nice amenities. The meeting room was spacious and equipped with all of our needs and the staff was truly outstanding in their attention to our requests. I would recommend this hotel for the family travelers as well as the small meeting groups.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Val35007
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at "The Point" last weekend. Had a friend come up from south florida and I drove down from Alabama. Very roomy accomadations with every item you might need in the kitchen and bath. Loved the jacuzzi tub! The only complaint I had was the sofabed was not the most comfortable but none of them are so I expected that going in. Next visit, I will make my friend sleep there. Staff was great and location is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were hoping for...”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelbug05
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at The Point Orlando because of the pictures I had seen on their website. I must say, I was disappointed. The room was not well maintained. The shower curtain was stained and had snags all over it and the bathroom counter didn't appear very clean either. The sheets on the bed were clean, so we stayed. We had only booked it for two nights before moving on to Disney. On a positive note, it is very conveniently located to Universal Studios. I believe this is a time share resort and I can definitley say we would NOT buy this timeshare!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed yet again with the Point !!”
Reviews.Author: Flowerbomb79
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Point Resort this year having previously stayed in February and more recently October. We have stayed in both the junior suite but upgraded second time round to a one bedroom suite. Would highly recommend both, but one bedroom apartment if staying longer than 1 week. Junior suite has everything you need and quiet large in comparison to other hotel rooms. One bedroom suite has full kitchen with all mod cons such as washer/dryer, very convenient and a lovely balcony with great views of pool etc. Housekeeping calls every day with clean towels, empties trash and make the bed. The staff in the hotel are second to none, in particular I must mention Fabio and Stephanie who have always provided us with great recommendations around the area. All other staff were also very friendly and helpful with any queries we had. Pool area was very relaxing, always lounge chairs available and fresh pool towels. Nice pool bar now open. Having been to Florida on a few occasions and stayed elsewhere, I would highly recommend the Point to everyone. Location is perfect, about 7 mins to Intl Drive and 15 min walk to Universal Parks. Already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here after returning from an overseas trip. It was quite adequate. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and the price was very reasonable. My kids liked the pool and hot tub, I liked the exercise room. I also appreciated the wired internet connection in the room! They have a shuttle to and from Universal (which is 1 mile away) twice a day. My only grip is no free breakfast in the lobby. But with the full kitchen in the room, really not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Resort for convenience and location”
Reviews.Author: Rasberrymohito
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Point Orlando was in early October 2011. For our travel needs, this resort was perfect. The staff met our every needs and were very professional. We stayed at this resort for 7 days. We found it very convenient to the grocery store, the shopping venues, restaurants and mostly 5minutes from Universal Studios and 15minutes from Disney. The pool area was very nice and clean with lots of towels available. The room was very comfortable, we upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which we enjoyed very much. The kitchen had everything we needed and I especially loved having a washer and dryer in my room. We would definitely come here again but next time would prefer the view of the pool instead of the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Immaculate Room, Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Orlando for our sons graduation from Full Sail University. We found The Point Orlando as a wonderful immaculately clean home away from home (King Size Suite) . The staff was friendly and helpful. We recommend this resort and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Accessibility at the Point”
Reviews.Author: thatsnufpiggy
Reviews.Content: Went to Florida past summer. We booked a wheelchair accessible room at the Point. First impression was that it was very clean. When you open the curtain you have a view of the pool area. We went by the pool a few times and laid out on the plastic chairs. There are no lifts at the pool. The room is located on the first floor and the layout is a one bedroom layout except for the bathroom which has a roll in shower with a curtain and grab bars. No bathtub. As for the bathroom, there are grab bars by the toilet. The space next to the toilet is not too wide and a mini wheelchair did not fit. They have plastic shower chairs with arms and back that you can ask for. The bed is very comfortable. It's a little bit high. We tried the sofa bed. No funky smell but it is thin so you would need to put extra blankets to cushion it. Housekeeping was very good and kept our room very clean thoughout our stay. Over all the experience was great. Staff is excellent, very friendly and willing to help. There is a Walmart nearby if you need to pick up food or other necessities during the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place ... Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bob C
Reviews.Content: Wonderful rooms .. staff focused on your requests and comfort .. the Cabana Bar is great ..

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: colmw123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in May 2011 after a Carribean cruise. The staff at reception were fantastic, really pleasant and always eager to help with any questions we had. The studio apartment we had was great. Modern, very clean, spacious, kitchen area, comfortable king-size bed and a big tv. The pool area is great, large pool, lots of sunbeds, free towels and a nice bar that serves food. There is ample free parking for guests and free wifi in the reception and pool areas which was great. There is a Starbucks in the reception also. The location is brilliant, wet n wild is across the street and Universal is a 5 minute drive away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families as kids will love the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Needs 2 beds. sofa beds are terrible”
Reviews.Author: Misssamhannah
Reviews.Content: Great holiday... hotel was ok only down side was the terrible pull out sofa bed it was thin and smelt terrible another bed would have been better. And would completely improve this hotel. I Got family going out to this hotel June 2012 let's hope this problem will be sorted by then as there will be another unhappy customer

Reviews.Title: “The Point, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: G W
Reviews.Content: The Point Resort Hotel was brilliant. My family and I stayed for two weeks. The rooms (2 bed apartment) were massive, 3 tv's, 2 microwaves,dryer, washer more space than you could shake a stick at. Fabio on the reception was a gentleman. I could not fault the service. Only 1 mile from Universal, 6 dollars in a taxi if you miss the free shuttle bus. very clean, good sized pool only a short walk to restaurants. I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. we watched an excellent young English magician called Sebastian Walton in this hotel, check him out on You Tube.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a couple to stay, but not child friendly.”
Reviews.Author: DonnaKronmiller
Reviews.Content: The room with a kitchen has a very small kitchen with very little room to move or store food. They had plenty of pots/pans to use though. If you get more than one room for your family it is not attached. You actually have to go outside of your room and use a key to go into the room for your family/children. This is not for us because they are not in the same area as us. The pool is not very big and they have nothing there for small children to play with. The hot tub is way too hot and we could not enjoy it. The building/rooms are old and smells when you come down the hall. We had to pay extra for them to come make our beds, replace towels, and take out the trash and they only came twice in a 6 day stay. We would not recommend or stay here again. It also has a view of the top of old abandoned buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at The Point Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: JeanneMinnesotaUSA
Reviews.Content: Very nice suites for the price. Located on Universal Boulevard & Sand Lake Road, a direct route to the airport or freeways, on the I-tram route, only 5-10 minutes ride to the Convention Center without the traffic of International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “I have to say: "dissapointed"”
Reviews.Author: SaskaR
Reviews.Content: After reading only positive reviews of this hotel my husband and I decided to book 3 nights here. We stayed at the suite as we like to have a separate room to sit in and chill out. But we expected to be able to sleep too. Hmm, if I could turn back time.. Well, let's start with the positives: Good location, quiet, enjoyed sitting on the balcony overlooking the pool area and listening to the music, spacious rooms, good equiped modern kitchen, wasching mashine, dryer, dishwasher (they provide you washing powder as well as the dishwasher powder), high speed internet (excellent), great bathroom- good shower, jacuzzi bath (or whatever you want to call it) was great fun too! The guys at the reception were really really nice! One of them (sorry forgot your name-the tall guy) was so kind, he printed out our tickets to Seaworld we purchased online. That's what I call a customer service! Very helful. Thank you Now what could have been better: First of all you go for holiday to relax, to have a good sleep, right? 1. Well we stayed here 3 nights and 3 nights we didn't manage to sleep properly. The bed matress was weird- too soft, you feel every move of the other person. The bed is big so I tried to sleep on the edge, so did my husband but it didnt help. I ended up on the sofa. Sad. To be fair, after the second night we spoke to the front desk and the guy offered us to bring another matress or to try a different room. We agreed to try a bed in a different room but unfortunatelly we soon found out that all the matrasses were the same. First we thought it might be us but we didn't have this problem anywhere else we stayed during this holiday on Florida- Holiday Inn nor Hilton. 2. Plastic cutlery at the breakfast- Yes, I am serious!! And the breakfast doesnt look anything like the one advertised in the lift, huge dissapointment. 3. No SAFE in the room. Usually you have a place where you can put your valuables. Our room didn't have any. I looked everywhere, so did my husband and no mention of this servvice in the booklet either. 4. They offer a shuttle service to the parks. It's 1 shuttle per day to each park. So you have to go at 9:30 or other similar times to certain parks. If you want to have a longer sleep you have to find your own way. And I noticed they are picking you up almost 1 hour after the closing time. What are you supposed to do if you had enough at 3pm? Just sit and wait until 7pm?No thanks! We didn't want to feel restricted, so we drove our car and paid an extra for the parking at the theme park (yes, that is sad too, those expensive tickets dont include parking). Overall, nicely presented hotel, with hard working staff but lack of quality (bed, pillows, breakfast and plastic cutlery) brings it down. Sorry, won't be coming back here..

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sandy P
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean and quiet resort. We had a two room suite that was excellent. There was plenty of room for six people. Everyone working there was very courteous and professional. The only thing I was discouraged with was the food at the Cabana Bar, although there are plenty of restaurants close by so you do have other options. Transportation was easy to and from Disney and Universal. We didn't have a rental car so we used the free shuttle and also taxis, which were very reasonable to Universal, ten dollars, but a bit spendy to Disney, around fifty. Overall we loved our two bedroom suite and the location is very quiet after a busy day at the parks. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: NativeofToronto
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful and professional. There are not many hotels where the front desk staff are dressed in suits! The room was spacious, clean, and had everything you need for a great vacation. Everything worked! We enjoyed the whirlpool. Everyone we talked to at the hotel really liked it. We have stayed in Orlando many times over the years and this was our best hotel experience

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: larryoberly
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the pool, the cabana bar, the nice staff and the spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 100Alan
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite. It was very nice. Everything you needed was there. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They Went Above And Beyond”
Reviews.Author: NelsonJon
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our honeymoon and we were very pleased. They placed the rose pedals and campaign that i ordered exactly as i wanted. The even put the wine up there just 10 min before we got back so the ice didn't melt. They made two swans out of the towels for us which was priceless and completely unexpected. They provided excellent advice on attractions and local dinning. We had a one bedroom suite for a bit over $100 a night. It was also clean and quiet. I greatly loved the full kitchen and in-room laundry what a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Clean.”
Reviews.Author: 2texanstraveling
Reviews.Content: Bed fluffy and comfy. Clean. Good location. Rooms small. Had main door to room which split off into two separate rooms creating a foyer so your door did not open into main hall which was nice but if the people next to you were loud, it echoed. Would have been better if room foyers were carpeted. It made it noisy since we were next to LOUD people but would be great for large families. I think there are better hotels for the same price range so shop around. Shuttle to Universal only at 8:15a and returns 7:30p. Fee for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good average hotel for your themepark visits”
Reviews.Author: ralfvd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Universal's bunch of themeparks. Disney is about 20-25 minutes drive by car, but easy to find. Hotelroom entrace is somewhat funky; you share an entrance door with your neighbours. In the small hall, there is a second entrance to your own room. One night, our neighbours locked the first door by accident from the inside. Since we came in pretty late, they had to be woken up by staff by telephone. They should be able to remove the fixed lock on this first door to avoid these kind of mistakes; given the reaction of the staff when I approach reception, this lockout happens quite frequently. The hotel charges a resort fee, and you can upgrade to full maid service. Be sure to know if you need this; their information is a bit flaky on what to expect within the normal resort fee; towels are changed, although they don't state it like that. Read between the lines or ask clarification before deciding which level of service you need. The internet connection in the room is wired; wireless is available in the lobby and around the pool, it is free and I never experienced a problem with it. I didn't ease breakfast at the hotel, so I cannot comment on that. The gym is tiny, but features all necesarry equipment and I usually was alone in the gym. The bed is comfortable although a bit short. I am not a tall person but most days I woke up with my feet dangling out of the end of the bed. For the price of the hotel, it is an OK stay. There is better, and there is worst in this area filled with hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel let down by lack of restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Charkle
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and must say it was a great hotel - good room, friendly staff and close to transportation. The place was set back from the busy International Boulevarde on a quieter part of Universal Parade which meant there was little traffic and no noisy nightlife nearby. The main problem for visitors like us without a car - there was no restaurant, only a bar meal menu. We found the dual entry to rooms through one main access door a bit odd - one door led to two room entry, each with their own key lock access. We got locked out one night by the other guests! Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst hotel but surely not the best.....”
Reviews.Author: Joe A
Reviews.Content: So I booked a 4 night stay at the point orlando and requested a free upgrade to a larger room for choosing their hotel over the hundreds of hotels in Orlando. The manager said no problem we can go ahead and do that for you. As you can imagine, when we got to the hotel they were magically filled to 98% capacity. The hotel never seemed to be packed with people at any point. Even at breakfast the next morning we only saw about 5 people eating breakfast. Our room was small and shared a small foyer or hallway with another room so when your neighbor comes in and out of their room you hear everything. The laundry room used by the cleaning ladies was at the end of my hall so all night long I heard what sounded like a helicoptor out side my window for 45 minutes was my guess to be the dryer going all night long. My wife and I also didn't like the area at all. It seemed runned down and of a low class. Area was also very very busy and tough to get around in. Traffic was horrible so waiting for the trollies was quite a wait somtimes. One of the reasons we booked our stay at The Point was their close proximity to Universal Studios which they offer a free shuttle to. Well their free shuttle only drops you off and picks you up early before the park opens and then well after the park closes. So in the morning you have to wait an hour and a half for the park to open and then, assuming you want to stay the whole 9 hours the park is open, you have to wait an hour and half after the park closes to be picked up. What good is that?! We canceled the rest of our stay at the Point and went back to the Buena Vista Palace located inside disney. It should serve as a red flag when you post a video on your website of a customer stating that she has appsolutely no complaints about The Point Orlando....obviously! their not going to put someone on their website listing negative complaints about their own hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Weekend”
Reviews.Author: DiamondBlue2
Reviews.Content: I would like say that our stay at this Resort was Awesome! The Resort Staff was really nice. Everything was really clean and updated. We were right near everything but not right in the mist of all the noise and busy traffic. I am so glad we chose this Resort. We plan to return to the Resort soon:) Nice weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “This is my second stay at this site, my overall stay was comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Connie S
Reviews.Content: I did not eat in the restaurant, but I like the comfort of a full kitchen. It would be nice to have free Wi-Fi in the rooms and not just in the lobby. I would use the facility again. The location is very good, close to most things.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom71_Tina76
Reviews.Content: Just back unfortunately from 3 weeks in Florida, 2 weeks were spent here in the Point Resort. Great hotel in a wonderful location. 5 mins walk to WetNWild and 7 mins walk right to the center of International Drive.Loads of restaurants and Bars nearby. Less than 5 Mins drive to the front gates of Universal. Right in the hub of everything. Pool is perfect with new bar for a nice cocktail to cool down.Towels provided at pool. Resort is also spotless and rooms have fully fitted kitchen. Beds are huge and comfy. Can't complain at all really,It was my second time to stay and I will be back.Special mention for 2 staff members.Fabio and Angela are just wonderful and helpful, Genuinely cannot do enough for you.Any questions please feel free to ask?? Regards, Tom.

Reviews.Title: “The Point Orlando Resort, great service & value”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: Great place, location and quality and nice to have a warm feeling condo to stay in at the price of a regular hotel.....I hope I can get the same great price for this hotel the next time I book it !

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Picky_traveling
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviews have mentioned, the staff and the cleanliness of The Point are outstanding. But that's about the only thing that sets this apart from any other hotel. The breakfast is $9, and the eggs are powdered. Coffee is $2.75 per cup. There are no vending machines...so make sure you bring your own groceries. The washer and dryer were very nice to have in room, but not necessary. The suite was very big and spacious, and the bathroom was too! The shower was huge, but the shower head was awful with little pressure. This "resort" charges a $10/day resort fee..I'm not really sure for what. The maid only empties the trash and makes the bed, breakfast is average (fine if free, but not worth paying), and they claim to have a shuttle to Universal, but it only runs once in the morning and once in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “our holiday”
Reviews.Author: sue b
Reviews.Content: we had booked this hotel on all the reviews. we have travelled to orlando 33 times and like to always stay in different hotels. So the one and two bedrooms are very well equiped, the only thing missing from the sudio lockoff is a toaster not a big deal but if you are a brit and fancy breakfast in toast is on the menu. The reception staff are lovely especially angela who was so helpfully when we wanted our friend to move from the best western gateway orlando to the point. All very clean pool is lovely very cold but who cares when your hot. the only problem we had was the bar.There wasnt one inside the hotel at all they had a cabana bar outside with no cover but when you are ready for an evening out or you have just come back to the hotal and fancy a night cap who really wants to sit drinking out iof plastic cups ok if the weather is nice to be outside but there is nowhere relaxing to go if its raining like it was when we were there, also it is not a restaurant no proper cutlery the food was served in a plastic containers with plastic cutery. I know this isnt a big deal to some but we found ourselfs back in our room with nowhere to go as there is nothing around the hotel you can pop to when the weather is bad..I would say that the nearest restaurant to walk to is tgi fridays which is about a 10min walk to get to the main hub of i drive is a good 15 min walk. My friend came with us and she walked to i drive with her 10 year old but didnt like it not, the walk it was a tiny bit isolated. To get a taxi to the pointe orlando where all the best nightlife is costs 7 dollars so we spent a lot of the evenings there lots of lovely restaurants and bars.We were told there is a inside bar going to be built plus a restaurant on that basis i would go back.......mrs brace

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely, and clean. The staff made us feel welcome and were eager to help. Great price for a suite. This was our second stay with them and we will stay with them again the next time we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “no 17”
Reviews.Author: keith1888
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from THE POINT ORLANDO, stayed an amazing 17 nights with our 2 kids who balled their eyes out when we were leaving, not one complaint from any of us. The place is top notch and Fabio and all the staff were brill - friendly and helpful. Great location, great atmosphere and lovely relaxed feel around the place. Only thing to point out - the pool bar is quite pricey and the food could be better. We will deffo stay again can't wait !!!!!!....

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jessica r
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. Our one room suite was awesome. I loved the bathroom, very large with jacuzzi tub. We never went to the pool/bar but could see it being used by others from our balcony. The full kitchen was also a plus. We even did laundry in our room. The only minor downfall was that there is only one entrance. So when you come home at night you have to park alittle far and walk to the front, and have your car brought around to get your stuff when you check in/out instead of walking it to the lot. Over all it was awesome, very quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SailorJerry645
Reviews.Content: Wow! Fantastic! Beautiful, clean room (2-bedroom suite). Amazing staff! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: WAJ1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in september the hotel was amazing everything you could want the kitchen had every utensil you could think of . Plenty of parking spaces. the bathroom was HUGE and very clean. We had a balcony overlooking the pool which was really nice but i think anywhere you stayed had a good view. I would definately return to the point. We got a good deal for the point compared to other hotels in the area but we are trying to book again with family for a 2bed suite for next year and its actually 3 times more than we would have paid this year so a little disspointed

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Friendly Staff, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Maice_S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 2010 (so like my other two reviews so far - this is late; my apologies as I just signed up recently... I always go to Trip Advisor to read reviews but only got myself to sign up and write my own reviews today :) ). We loved it! The rooms were great, and the staff were AMAZING. They paid great attention to us, were so friendly and helpful, and really went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed in Orlando. They were prompt, they were professional and warm, and they really gave us no reason to complain. Next time we go to Universal Orlando - will definitely book here again! No complaints. Great experience! P.S. Same as my other review that was a bit too late - selected Nov 2010 as when I stayed because May 2010 just wasn't in the dropdown anymore - that late I guess :p

Reviews.Title: “Great value well run complex”
Reviews.Author: finn22SheffieldUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two weeks here with our two grandaughters age 6 and 7. we had a one bedroom app it had every thing you needed to self cater great coffee free wash powder and dish washer powder our beds made every day clean towels ect.what more could you want.my husband and I are well traveled we have been to orlando six times now this is the best acc we have stayed in I am very fussy but the bed was very comfy better than my own bed every thing very clean.my grandaughters loved the pool and dident want to get out.the staff were very friendly nothing was too much trouble if you needed anything you just picked up the phone and it was there.my only gripe is about the free shuttle great for universal got you there in two mins but disney took to long nearly two hours as they picked up at other hotels and coming back if you didnt get there early you had to stand up.overall a great base for a fantastic holiday we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “It has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Londonersunseeker
Reviews.Content: This was mine and hubby's 6th visit to Orlando and have stayed mostly in hotels directly on I-Drive. We chose this resort because of all the favourable reviews and so glad we did. We had booked a 1-bed suite and was accommodated on the 8th floor overlooking the pool. What first impressed us when we walked in was how clean the suite was. It was very well equipped with everything you would wish for in a SC apartment....large cooker with oven, microwave, enormous fridge/freezer, dishwasher, washing machine and dryer, kettle, coffee maker, blender/liquidiser, cutlery, china, etc. Other things provided were packets of coffee for the coffee maker, small bottle of washing up liquid, small boxes of washing powder and dishwasher detergtent, washing up sponge and kitchen paper. The dining area/lounge is a good size and has a flat screen tv. The bedroom also has a tv, clock radio, lots of drawer space, a good size wardrobe, and most importantly being a bad back sufferer, a really comfy bed. The air conditioning works well + you also have ceiling fans over the bed and in the lounge area. The bathroom has more cupboard space, a fantastic walk-in shower (which was very powerful) and the toilet has a door to separate it from the bathroom. Went to the gym a couple of times and as I only used the treadmill (it has 2) it was fine for me. The hotel staff are fantastic...really helpful and nothing too much trouble for them. They always had a cheerful smile and greeting for you whenever they saw you. One morning we used the free shuttle bus to Universal which left at 8.15 with about 15 of us from the resort. We were the only ones on-board and didn't stop to pick others up - we were in IoA by 8.30 (not sure if this would be the case during other months). We didn't hire a car, so used the Lynx buses and cabs. A cab from Orlando Airport was approx $38, from Mall of Millenia $15, Walmart at S John Parkway $12. It took us about 10 mins to walk to I-Drive and where Wet 'n' Wild is. The only thing I would have liked is a room safe - maybe these will be fitted in the near future. Hubby played golf at the Rosen Shingle Creek Resort so we stayed there for one night. I can honestly say I was very happy to return 'home' to the Point Orlando Resort the next morning and we'll definitely book to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. I did read some reviews about this place before making the reservation. I have learned that reviews are very important...I wish I had used them in the past. There is always going to be someone that isn't pleased, but this particular hotel was clean and comfortable. I loved having a microwave and refrigerator in the room. My husband and I would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nadeine M
Reviews.Content: Nice room and great price. Nice location. This hotel s especially great if you are saying for more than 3 days. Kitchen equipped with utensils,dishes. The safe was very friendly

Reviews.Title: “"A home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: Sonja E
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Point Orlando Resort. I came to Orlando for Halloween Horror Nights and was thoroughly pleased with my accommodations. This was my first experience with the hotel and every aspect was delightful. The rates for the room were unbelievable considering the amount of appliances available to us. The full kitchen was very helpful. The hotel staff was very kind, knowledgeable and outgoing, and directed us to all the best locations around the area. I will stay here again in the future, and I will refer others to stay as well! Thank you for such a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but a resort? No”
Reviews.Author: 6tareg
Reviews.Content: First, I rated this property average because it does not in any way fit the classification of a "resort." Since there were so many reviews on this hotel, I failed to notice the handful of ones that highlighted these shortcomings. Originally, this was built to be a condo complex NOT a hotel, and it showed. We had not even arrived yet when I knew something was off. I was expecting at least some acreage, nice landscaping, as such, but it was a standard turn onto a road that led to a parking lot. It was a very typical set-up, no different than a Marriott Courtyard. As we proceeded with check-in and got settled, these were our observations: -No doorman, bell hop, or any staff around to greet us. Which meant no help with our luggage and no self serve carts in sight. -Check in was quick as there was no one else and we did experience some minor hiccups which resulted in a change of rooms. -Lobby was nice, small and unassuming. Again, something reminiscent of a mid-value chain hotel. There was no concierge, no room service and no valet parking. Since the only entrance to the hotel was through the lobby, it was often a long walk to our parked car. -The interior was clean yet unremarkable. The one bedroom suite was decent, but we have stayed at Hilton's Homewood Suites or Marriott's Residence Inns that were nicer. Kitchen was well stocked and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very large and had a separate bath/shower. There was ample storage, since again, this was supposed to be a condo, designed for longer stays. Let's just say, I was expecting something different as we were kind of treating ourselves to a last minute get away during a difficult time. I guess I was envisioning some pampering but it was definitely a do it yourself kind of place. -Minimal housekeeping. Beds were made, towels changed and trash removed. That is it. Dirty cups remained, toiletries were not replenished, carpet not vacuumed, counters not cleaned, etc. No big deal, but again, my expectations from their advertising led me to believe I would have a much different experience. -Resort fee. When I was quoted this added expensive, I didn't think much of it as most resorts have this. I was told amongst other things, that this is to offset things like free shuttles to Universal. I was pleased with that, as parking costs $15. When we inquired about the shuttle, we were told it leaves at 8:15 AM and picks up at around 7:00 PM . Nothing in between. Well, we drove ourselves. -Breakfast. We were able to secure a AAA rate that included breakfast, otherwise I would have not paid the $9-$10 they charged. There were scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cereals, breads, coffee, tea, and juices. Yogurt was from large tubs, that just didn't look appealing. The food was completely unremarkable and we even skipped it one morning even though we had a voucher for a free meal. Some of the good points about this property included the pool area, in suite washer/dryer, small balcony, and a very cordial and helpful assistant manager. Again, had I signed up for a Residence Inn, I would have rated this a "Very Good", but I thought I booked a full service resort. Just know what you are buying.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Eamonnn
Reviews.Content: Just back today after spending 9 nights in Point Orlando Resort, we had a wonderful time although i probably wouldnt go back. My reason for this is solely the food and drink situation. First of all the poolside bar is the only bar on the premises therfore if u want a drink at a bar u have to pay poolside rates and when thats 7.50 for a corona and 10 dollars for a pina colada with a decent shot of rum it soon becomes probihibitivly expensive. And worse of all is the fact that the bar closes at 11pm. The bar food we bought(kids chicken and chips) was fine the rest of the menu didnt inspire me at all. The breakfast buffet looked and smelled bad so we stayed away and the so called starbucks is 2 pots of brewed coffee with starbucks stickers on them. So my complaints are only about the food and drink situation. Everything else was spot on, clean hotel, clean room and pleasant staff. We had a fantastic holiday and we made great memories that we will have forever.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort, exceptional staff - close to everything but feels like you're away from it all”
Reviews.Author: tamaragham
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Point exceeded all of my expectations. The 1 Br suite was beautifully decorated without being overly dramatic. It felt like home. It was very quiet to be right in the heart of everything. To top everything off, the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Truth in advertising?”
Reviews.Author: cruisefamily
Reviews.Content: I chose The Point recently for an overnight stay in Orlando because it advertised itself as a "new, boutique" property. It is not. It is a condo-hotel and it is neither new or a boutique property, as the old-fashioned TV and furnishings will attest. Luckily for us, we just needed a place to stay for one night and it was quite adequate but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Point Orlando is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget M
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the great pricing and most importantly, because of the reviews. The hotel truly did live up to my expectations. The breakfast buffet was very reasonable as well as the Cabana Bar & Grill. I only wish I would have checked the prices earlier in our stay so we could have eaten there! It was convenient to have a complimentary shuttle to Universal, but I do wish there had been an additional time added for the return (only one shuttle to/from the park per day). We made it work though. Our room was very clean, everything worked properly, and it was very nice having a refridgerator, microwave, & dishes, utensils, etc. If you need wifi, be prepared that you can only access it in the lobby and pool. Internet access is available in the room, but through a LAN cord. I would definitely return to The Point Orlando Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, within walking distance from Universal & International Drive, would recommend to couples, groups & f”
Reviews.Author: Aligrogan
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, within walking distance from Universal & International Drive, would recommend to couples, groups & families...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but service could be much better.”
Reviews.Author: AlexG71
Reviews.Content: It is in a strategic position (walking distance from International Road), the rooms are clean, big and very well equipped. Unfortunately the table had a broken leg and the rail where the towels were hanged was broken (I risked to get cut by the rail which falled down when I took the towel the first time). I left the broken pieces on the lavabo but nobody neither replaced nor repaired it. The room was done every day, but the floor was never cleaned during our stay (3 days).

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: simmonereid
Reviews.Content: ive just got back from a 3 week stay at the hotel and u could not ask for better i love it we sayed in a 2 bed appartment and it had all u could need and more its like being at home could not falt it at all i went with family and we had kids with us and they loved it to . The walk to i-drive is only 5 mins and u can get the i-ride just outside the hotel .The staff could not do more for u they are great and friendly no probles with them at all i will be defo staying there when i next stay in florida i carnt wait to go back u wont be disapointed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: unknown u
Reviews.Content: Found hotel very comfortable and convenient to international drive. However, if you intend using the sofa bed, advise staff. If you dont, you will have to make it, even if its obvious that someone has slept in it. Other than that, the only problem we encountered was with the shuttle bus we ordered to take us to the airport, which went to another hotel. So be very clear on the address. When we had this problem the assistant manager was extremely helpful in contacting the company for us.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Tango1England
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for those wanting to stay on or near International Drive. Booked with Destination America (Recommended to) Just back from two weeks Hols here. Staff superb, Rooms Excellent, Location is walking distance to Wet and Wild and Universal Studios. You wont be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on here, me & my husband decided to 'bite the bullet' & book The Point Orlando Resort. We were thankfully not disappointed!!! Location is great... it's about a block away from International Drive, 5 minute walk from Wet & Wild & 5 minute drive from Universal. We had a a quick, easy check in by the very friendly staff. They were always around to answer any questions & give some 'local' advice & recommendations. A particular mention for 'Britney' who always greeted us with a friendly smile, always asked how our day was going & gave some great recommendations!!! We stayed in a one bed apartment which included a kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, oven, toaster, washer & dryer. The bedroom had a large Kingsize bed, TV & plenty of cupboard space. The bathroom was large with a hot tub & walk-in shower. The living area included a comfy sofa (which is also an extra bed apparently), flat screen TV, & dining table. The whole place was spotless & the kitchen had all your essentials. The pool & bar area was also impressive. The pool was lovely & at a great temperature. The bar was nice & friendly & offered a variety of snacks & meals!!! The resort also had a fitness suite!! There is a bistro where you can buy breakfast but we never did as we bought cereals & toast for our room. A few other reviews mentioned the taxi fares being higher if you order them from the hotel. The difference is about $2!!!! You can of course walk down to the main road & wait for a taxi to pass in the hope that it's available to save your $2!!! ;-) Overall, this is a brilliant hotel which I would visit again & recommend to a friend! I have no negatives!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Annie_Paul
Reviews.Content: this was our second stay at point orlando and again was an excellent stay! all our requests were met, very clean and well kept rooms, lots of space in the one bedroom suite, excellent location, very friendly front desk staff, Fabio/Stephanie/Britney all gave excellent service. Would without doubt recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the I-drive area. We hope to be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: jambogaz1011
Reviews.Content: I really just have to reiterate what other travellers have said, the Point is a wonderful hotel in a great location. My wife and myself stayed here at the end of August for 2 weeks, we stayed in a one bedroom apartment which was spacious with a full kitchen and large bathroom and balcony. the kitchen had every utensil or gadget you would have at home including an ice-maker (which was a god send for cooling your beer at the pool) the reception staff were extremely helpful especially Britney and dealt with any requests promptly. The pool was great and hardly ever full the sofa's by the bar were great to lounge out on. It was only a ten minute walk to I - Drive and about 20 minutes to Universal studios if you required to go further afield there was always the i trolley or lynx buses which are very inexpensive (ie Airport to I-Drive by lynx bus no42 was only $2 each compared to transfers that would have cost £30 each return). This was best we have stayed at in four trips to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Orlando for the price by far”
Reviews.Author: 32teeth
Reviews.Content: Me and the hubby have just returned from a two week stay at The Point Orlando and I have to say out of the 6 times we've visited Orlando this has been the best by far!..this was due to several factors..the reception staff (britney, Stephanie, Thomas and fabio..sorry if i've missed anyone else out) were so friendly and couldn't do enough to help, and I know their job is customer service and as such they have to 'be nice and polite' but I got the feeling they were genuinely nice, helpful people and have been chosen wisely by their employers! The hotel location was great...just off I drive on universal boulevard It was just a five minute walk to wet and wild and a fifteen minute walk to universal studios/islands of adventure (both of which could be seen from our hotel room 912 tower block 2) The rooms are fairly new, modern and of a decent size and were a welcoming sanctuary after a long day of theme parking/shopping  Beds were made daily and towels changed if need be but any other cleaning incurred an additional fee(we chose not to opt for this and managed to keep the room to a reasonable level of cleanliness with not much effort) The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable (although I think I'd have slept on a washing line given how tired I was by the end of the day!) The pool and pool area were kept immaculate and clean towels were provided for use around the pool I did use the gym a few times and although adequate it wasn't great (but let's face it, you don't need a state of the art gym whilst on holiday..right?!!) Having stayed in some shall we say 'less salubrious ' accommodations in the area we will no longer be prepared to 'slum it' ...yes I know it's just a room and you're only really there to sleep but it makes a difference to come back to a nice clean room, to not have to worry about cockroaches or other nasties that might be lurking... ...for all those reasons we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start but turned out ok.”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and professional but at check in miscoded our keys so I had to go back to the lobby. Then when I got back to the room took one step in and was blown away by the smell of cigarette smoke! It reaked. It's supposed to be a non smoking hotel. Went back to the front desk and they did not waste any time in giving us a new upgraded room. Everything else after that was was ok. The room was very nice. For the price we paid I would not hesitate staying there again. I'd even pay the extra for the upgraded room next time. Only negatives would be the minimal room service, lack of a decent shuttle to Universal and the resort fee. Resort fee is just a way of making it look like the room rates are lower than they really are. There is nothing extra included in it that you wouldn't normally get at a hotel like this. We stayed there for five days and the bottom line is they turned out to be a very good hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Resort with Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ferg1664
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean resort, but more than that they have excellent customer service. I had a work emergency and needed access to a fax in a hurry at 11:00pm. The front desk employee took time to help me with my situation. She received my document through email, printed it off and then faxed it for me. All the time she was helping me, she was also helping other guest that came to the counter. Good customer service like this is more the exception, than the rule anymore. I appreciate the extra mile!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value at The Point Orlando”
Reviews.Author: stauggyguy
Reviews.Content: Nothing better than getting a real suite for the price of a regular hotel room and that's what i get when I stay at The Point Orlando. The staff is always friendly, rooms are great, clean and have everything I like and need. They recently opened a new pool bar which is a great place to relax. Anyways... I highly recommend the hotel and always look there when I'm headed to Orlando. It's convenient to the convention center, attractions and restaurants, can't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location for Universal Studios area”
Reviews.Author: NurseCarrie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night here on a Thursday night with our 1 yr old baby. Hotel room was nicely updated with a "living room" area and kitchenette. Gorgeous lobby and pool area. We ordered food to go from the cabana bar and when my husband accidentally dropped one of the containers on the ground, they made us another one for no charge. Rooms were quiet. Only detractor was the carpet in our room was stained/dirty looking. Also, when you enter into your room, you go through one door from the hallway and then the entrance to your room and one other adjoining room are side by side. At one point when we were heading out, the shared outer door to the hallway was locked with the latch from the inside, which could have posed a problem if we were trying to get in from the hallway. Luckily, when we returned that evening, it was not latched. Not sure why they have that latch there if they are booking out the rooms to two different sets of guests. Overall, great place to stay as a base of operations for the Universal Studios/ International Drive area!

Reviews.Title: “One word .....Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: Luize69
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel from the word go, we were upgraded on arrival and had the luxury of having all the amenities we needed, it was like a home from home !! Our view was great, pool was lush, and we were minutes away from absolutely everything. The hotel is very clean and the staff were extremely helpful, a lady called Brittany was super helpful ! I would recommend this hotel to anyone from families to couples ! I can't say enough good things !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckeyguy
Reviews.Content: Found this Hotel by chance and what a hotel it turned out to be. The Rooms and public area's were spotless, the staff were so friendly and helpfull, especially the assistant manager Fabio who went far and beyond his duty to help my Wife and I, thanks again. The resort fee is well worth every cent for the attention to detail. I have no problem what so ever in recommending this Hotel, and already I am looking forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christopher A
Reviews.Content: I could not fault this hotel, very clean, great facilities and the staff are excellent. I found the location to be really good, just down the road from Wet and Wild and Universal, but not too close to anything that made it a nice quiet spot without being far away from anything we needed. Nice little pool and bar, and breakfast was pretty good too, a little pricier than going out to eat but reasonable and good quality. Maid service was minimal but would not complain beds made, fresh towels, dishwasher powder, washing powder replaced etc every day, if room was messy it was down to us being messy. Britney on the front desk was a star, very friendly and helpful, and would always try and go the extra mile for you. It was a great stay and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Orlando looking for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Sharon
Reviews.Content: Having been disapointed in the past we chose this hotel on the basis of the reviews given by other guest's on this excellent site, We have had a fantastic two week vacation and the hotel deserves all the praise that it receives in these reviews. The staff are very friendly and will go out of their way to help you, The resort fee paid is worth every cent for the level of service and cleanliness in both the room's and public area's. I would advise this hotel to anyone who is looking for a good holiday base in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L
Reviews.Content: Very nice property,very quiet and away form the business of international drive. Do not agree with the resort fee because they do not have room service i think if you have to pay that fee you should have access to room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: boomer2s
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a geat resort in a pretty good location. It is within walking distance of the huge Wet and Wild waterpark and is also close to quite a few restaurants including T.G.I. Fridays, Pizza Hut, Buffalo Wild Wings and other burger joints and privately owned family style restaurants. We chose a king suite which for lack of a better term was a "one bedroom apartment" and included king size bet, huge bathroom with whirlpool tub, large tile shower and seperate water closet, full size fridge, microwave, stove and cooktop, blender, toaster, washer and dryer, and icemaker in the fridge. There was ample silverware, plates, bowls, glasses and coffee cups, oh, and a coffee maker of course. There was a couch in the living area that folded to a bed and a four chair dining table. Housekeeping included touch up cleaning which was making the bed everyday, clean towels and very minor cleaning if needed. We never saw the cleaning crew in our room the entire length of our stay. They were very fast and effecient. The view from our balcony was a nice view of the pool area and the size was nice. This an incredible place to stay for the price that we paid. I have paid more for a single hotel room in less desireable locations. HUGE bang for the buck!!!!!!! I almost feel guilty for pointing out a couple of drawbacks but I feel that I must for the sake of prudence. Just be mindful that these things would by no means keep me from going back in the future but I think could easily be improved. First, the fitness center is...... well, just bad. It consisted of two treadmills, and ellipitical machine and a broken "weight machine". It did include towels and a water cooler though. The breakfast, which buy the way, was included in our package deal but the staff at the front desk forgot to give us our vouchers at check in, was... well..... not very good at all. The regular price was about 10 bucks and included coffee, oatmeal, scrambled eggs and egg whites, cereal, yogurt,bagels and bread for toast. If you requested them you could also have fruit and microwave pancakes or french toast. There were also a couple of different juices that were usually watered down because of the ice melting and that was about it. I was very disappointed because with just a few additions this could be a great breakfast but it just wasn't. I actually ate fruit and yogurt every morning for breakfast. Internet service is a little bit of a challenge in that that the only wireless is in the lobby and it is hardwired in the rooms. We asked if we could print an email at the front desk and were told that the business center was operated independently and charged for usage. There were one or two small things that were just slightly annoying but nothing major at all. The bar that is at the pool is fantastic and the bartenders are pretty fun. A little advice about location. If you are planning on going to the major theme parks, the outlet malls, better restaurants, ect. Go ahead and rent a car and pick it up at the airport. Our cab ride to the hotel was approximately 70 bucks. The rental car for the rest of the trip was only 300 bucks. You cant take your chances with the shuttles to the theme parks but they leave at a certian time and return at a certian time. Waiting is just part of the free ride. The staff at this resort is very pleasn't and accomidating. My friend dropped a wine bottle on the floor while we were there and the stafff was up immediately and cleaned up the mess. It was a great trip and I would love to stay at this resort again. I can't imagine finding a better value anywhere in Orlando!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and very friendly hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: tlso
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful facilities and very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in orlando”
Reviews.Author: rachaelcoll1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in august for two weeks with my boyfriend and it was brilliant.we stayed in the one bedroom apartment.it was very spacious and modern.the bathroom was huge and we had a hot tub and a seperate shower.the staff here are so nice espically fabio he is so helpful.the pool is big and stays open til 11.theres also a pool bar which serves gorgeous foods to snack on.they provide a shuttle service to all the big theme parks which is great.id stay here again in a heartbeat and iv been to orlando 3 times now but this is the hotel il keep going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kad1234
Reviews.Content: Had conference here, staff very helpful and polite. Food for conference very good. Rooms clean, good bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: nae_mair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point Resort and were pleasantly surprised with the room that we had. A single bedroom "mini suite" that consisted of a large room that had small kitchen facilities, a small dining area and a decent sized bathroom. The resort is a couple of blocks from International drive and is easy walking distance to I-Drive and attractions such as Wet n Wild. Universal Studios is a little longer walk. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Some people might complain at the resort fee which you are charged for parking and high-speed internet in the rooms but at $9 a day it's really not that bad considering you don't even get any of that at other Orlando hotels. We would recommend this hotel/resort for couples or families as they have large suites that have multiple rooms. As stated previously it's perfectly situated for walking to restaurants, attractions and the all important crazy golf.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL WILL EXCEED YOUR EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: e-golden
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom suite in this hotel for my husband and I and our grown up daughter and were thrilled with the luxury and space we had. We were located on the fifth floor overlooking the pool which was excellent. I cannot praise the accommodation enough, the kitchen was well equipped, we had a spacious living area and balcony off it. Our bedroom was perfect with a large bathroom. Our daughters room was perfect and was in fact a self contained suite, the design of the two bedded suites mean you enter through one door from the hall, but inside there are two separate doors, one side has the kitchen, living and master bedroom with large bathroom and the other, with its own separate entrance, had a double bedroom with a living area with kitchenette and bathroom. The layout is excellent where family members want to be together, but at the same time have their own space. The pool, which we used every morning, was a great size and never really that busy which was very pleasant. There are multiple seating areas and plenty of beach size towels available and a hot tub, and small gym. The cabana (located near the pool) is very handy for drinks, though they are expensive, and if you get peckish they serve a nice selection of food. The location is amazing, we were not far from any place, sea world and universal is close by and Disney only a short drive, shopping of course is just wonderful and the malls seem to stay open late most evenings, Florida Mall, International Drive outlet mall, and many others all just a short drive away. We loved the peace at the hotel we never heard anyone else in the other suites, which was terrific. The internet access in the rooms was very helpful for looking up addresses of places to visit and then enter them into the sat. navigation. The staff were the absolute best, I could not fault them at all, from the moment we entered the hotel, they helped with everything and were always on hand in the background if we needed anything. A lovely lady in reception (on our last night) printed our boarding passes, nothing was too much trouble. The cleaning staff were great, always remembering to replace little things, like kitchen paper towel, they had a huge amount of work to do with the size of the hotel, yet everything was excellently cleaned, towels replaced and trash taken away like magic every day. The pool guys seem to be cleaning and brushing and tidying all the time, and were very cheery and pleasant, especially one older guy who greeted us every morning. Overall a great and wonderful experience, which we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay. I will return. Read my review...it will help.”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth N
Reviews.Content: I live an hour and a half away. I brought my son and nephew (who was visiting from WA state) over for a two day visit to Universal. We had our own vehicle and season passes at Univ. so we were fine with the transportation and parking. The staff was very helpful and attentive. Stephanie at check in was very accommodating and the servers in the morning for breakfast were friendly and ready to laugh. The pool, bar, fitness center...all were good. The room was clean and well tended to. The only negative we had was if an adult needed to sleep on the pullout...it might be a little uncomfy. Throw a 14 and 15 year old boy on it and they are good! I really enjoyed staying there especially because we were 5 minutes from the parking lot at Universal. We could see all of the rides from the lobby of the elevator! I'll definitely bring my wife to The Pointe...she'll enjoy herself as well. The ONLY negative is the lack of convenient walking distance restaurants. You need to hike a few blocks which is no big deal for me but for some it might be.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious rooms at a very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Mongo22
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and the location was Ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the pull out bed”
Reviews.Author: RobbieW57
Reviews.Content: We initially booked a one bedroom suite, and when we walked in we were impressed. The kitchen is fully equipped including dishwasher, washing machine and dryer. The master bedroom had an enormous bed and the bathroom was beautiful. Then we had a look at the pull out bed for the kids (age 12 and 14) and realised that it would not permit them to sleep. If we were staying for one night we would have made do, but 3 nights was too much. So I went down to reception and upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite. This gave us 2 king sized beds so was perfect. We went right round southern Florida over 2 weeks and stayed in 5 different hotels. This was the only hotel where we had a problem with the second bed. If you are with a family do not book the one bedroom. On the positive side the facilities were excellent, the kitchen and dining area allowed us to have a cheap breakfast by stocking up at the local wal mart. And the location is excellent. We had combi universal and wet n wild tickets. We took the taxi to universal, 8 dollars each way, and walked to wet n wild, the location does not get a lot better. The service was fine, without being outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lorelei W
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place to stay. It had everything. Walking distance to lots of places to eat. Shuttle service to Disney world and Universal Studios. You can walk to Universal though, its not that far. Maybe a 15-20 minute walk. The room was very clean. It also had a washer and dryer in the room which was nice. Staff was very friendly. Pool is really nice. I would stay here again and I recommend it fully. The room is very updated. Very nice! you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: trevwag
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bed room condo facing universal on floor 9. Condo was very well equipped and clean. Only slight niggle was marks on walls where people had obviously been scuffing their cases but nothing major. Pool and surrounding area was well maintained and bar area good if a touch expensive. Reception staff always very friendly and helpful. Don't use the taxi company provided by the resort as it's seriously overpriced. The resort needs to provide in room safes as the deposit boxes are very small and no good for iPads etc also the in-room Internet has to be upgraded to wi-fi. On balance a very good resort and we are already booked for 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Abbeytravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Executive suite here for 2 weeks in August 2011. For the extra that you pay the Executive suite is exceptional value as it has all mod cons (all kitchen equipment, washer/dryer, jacuzzi bath, flat screen TV, nice balcony) and is absolutely huge, so i'd definitely recommend upgrading. If you can get a suite overlooking the pool. The room was fabulous as were the staff - couldn't have been more helpful and the staff at the bar were great fun. The breakfast was good value and was well tasty and the pool area was fantastic. Just a few negative points but nothing too serious - the hotel could do with having an indoor bar and restaurant as the outdoor pool bar tends to close during the frequent thunder storms and if you want to stay in to eat the menu there is very limited (although the food was good). Also the bar closes at 11pm - we're on holiday people!!!! Finally if you don't fancy sticking to your training regime in the styfling Orlando heat the gym is very small and basic for a hotel of this size. On a seperate note if you're visiting the theme parks avoid the i-ride like the plague - it's a disaster, takes forever to arrive and is very uncomfortable. Hire a car or get taxis - the hotel staff will gladly do this for you (ask them to order a yellow cab as they're way cheaper) In summary if I was staying in Orlando again I'd go straight back to the Point as it's a very relaxing place to stay and is very good value.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: moogig
Reviews.Content: It wasn't as good as it rated on tripadvisor. The front desk staff were cold and distant. Overall it was average 3 star hotel, not 4 star for sure. A lso not sure how it got rated 5 out of 300 something hotels in orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and incredibly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Canada025
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, and what added to the experience was the great and helpful staff, especially the manager Angela. The hotel is clean, pretty, and the one-bedroom suite we stayed in had great amenities, including a full kitchen and a washer and dryer. The location is fantastic - a few minutes from Universal, Wet'n'Wild is across the street, and for travelers who keep kosher, the restaurant Kosher Culinary in one block away. It's very quiet, even though it's centrally located. Truly, a really nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Zweikinder
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to Orlando. We booked through Travelocity, sight unseen, after reading reviews. I was nervous but hopeful. First impression of our 1 bedroom unit was very positive. Staff was friendly, granite counter tops, room was clean, stocked with immediate needs (laundry soap. dish washer soap, etc.). Not large sizes but enough to get by until we could go to the nearby Super Walmart. * Kids LOVED the pool. No fancy slides, just a good. clean, pool to cool off in after a long day at Amusement parks. * Not knowing city layout, you may like to know that hotel was 1 1/2 miles from Universal and about a 15 minute drive to Disney Parks. I initially thought that we would take the free shuttle provided but am REALLY glad I changed my mind last minute and rented a car. After a tiring day walking, the last thing I wanted to do was wait for a bus. People waiting at stops never looked happy. * I liked being able to eat meals at hotel (saving $) rather than a Disney. We ate breakfast in our room, spent the morning/early afternoon at park and bought a snack there, and came home for a late lunch/early dinner and would return to parks for evening parades and fireworks. Worked out great and kept us relaxed and happy. . The hotel does offer a breakfast for a fee.
