I recommend just buying some cereal or bagels to eat in your own kitchen. * Laundry in unit allowed us to pack light! * Close to action but far enough away from it that we didn't have to live with it 24/7. Quiet at night time. * No push to have you buy a condo. Just a sign in elevator that they were available if you were interested. I did notice that there was a sign outside that they were building more units in the near future so expect some construction sometime soon. Overall, very pleased. If we return to Disney, this would be my "go to" place.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: cynthia d
Reviews.Content: My Husband,and I stayed at the Point for a week . We liked the One-bedroom suite we stayed in. It was very spacious,and clean, I do think they can update the living area, to match the bathroom, and kitchen area. The bathroom was beautiful,and large, double vanities would have been nice, and some towels racks,or hooks. Loved the Kitchen area, everything you needed was there, Maybe some nightlight under the counters, or under stove. We loved the pool and the bar area, was great!! The Staff was excellent, especially Brittney, she was very kind, and professional, can't say enough about her. We would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull Holiday enjoyed it will be back”
Reviews.Author: Dawn491
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was wonderful very friendly staff it was base on international drive opposite wet and Wild the I ride stop was right outside the hotel which ran every 20 minutes up and down International Drive it was fantisc i would recoomed this Hotel and locatation to all my riend and family

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: spitoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Point Orlando for a week in August 2011. Our suite was great with a big kitchen, and a very nicely appointed bathroom. The pool area was great as well. My only complaint would be about the pull out bed in the living room. The matress is very thin and makes the bed almost unuseable. The hotel staff was helpful in providing an extra matress so that our two daughters could get a bit of sleep. The king bed in the master suite was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Resort”
Reviews.Author: 2ticketstopardice
Reviews.Content: I came for a girls weekend and this was a perfect hotel. Lot's of room , clan as could be, nice pool and pool bar. What more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok - could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Roxand
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a long period of approximately 15 days because we wanted to figure out a place to move into after it. But we left much before the time could have been completed. Breakfast was monotonous, there wasn't much variety. Rooms were neat and clean and well equipped. House keeping is on call only, so that was slightly difficult to manage. Its close to attractions and close to International Drive where most of the action for tourists happen. A big negative was the gymnasium - which had a lot of out of order equipment and there was not much effort from the hotel staff to get it fixed as well..The swimming pool was always filled with guests, guess there wasn't much to look forward to other than chilling at the pool. The experience could have been better only if the food was slightly different some days at-least or the fitness center was in place too ..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & helpful staff, perfect location, would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: Toggs16
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks in august, didn't have a car so location was perfect. Lots of shops & restaurants nearby. Trolley bus stop right outside, takes you the full length of international drive. 5 minutes from universal, 10 minutes from sea world & aquatica. Staff were very friendly & informative, also. Complementary transportation to the local attractions. All in all a great holiday would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Haven't got a bad word to say”
Reviews.Author: Scruff_UK
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here based on some other good reviews; more importantly that it was cheap and near Universal. It was SUCH a good stay. The rooms, though not 5* luxury, are HUGE and have everything that you'd need and then some; especially when you consider the price in comparison to other hotels. Never heard our neighbours once. The pool is a lot bigger than you'd expect and there was no traffic noise despite being so close to the road - there's also a nice little gym tucked away by the pool with enough in there to ensure you don't miss your workouts. The location itself is perfect; just off International Drive but not right in the middle of everything. And the staff were amazing; five days after leaving here, due to a slight miscalculation between 'coming back from Miami' and 'going to Orlando Airport', we were left with a few hours stranded in Orlando with our cases. The reception staff at The Point were only too happy to look after our cases and let us lounge around the pool, even though we'd checked out days ago. Already decided we're staying here again next year and we're bringing our friends with us! Tips: -Make sure you specify "The Point on Universal Boulevard" to taxi drivers; a few times we were almost taken to a different hotel called The Rosen Point which is quite far from this one! -Don't use the hotel-provided shuttles to Universal; they leave too late, return too early, and never seemed to be on time (though that's not the hotel's fault). Either walk it (it's about 30 minutes away on foot) or get a taxi which will only set you back $6 each way. -Try and find an evening to head to nearby Pizza Xtreme for dinner, a tiny little family-run pizza joint that provided the best pizza I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - but avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Robin R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for Orlando. For a decent price, we got a suite with a large living room and a fully equipped kitchen. The hotel is clean and spacious. There are shuttles to Seaworld, Universal and Disney. My only regret is that I prepaid for breakfast. In turns out we could have made ourselves great breakfast in the room, but the hotel breakfast is rather limited and is served in plastic cutlery. You can easily buy everything you need for breakfast nearby. If you are planning to cook dinner as well, you will need a car: the large supermarkets are a couple of miles away.

Reviews.Title: “WELL WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Douglas63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Point Resort in Orlando Florida from August 7th-13th. Upon arrival the check-in was efficient and fast. I had rented a 1 bedroom suite which included a full kitchen and a sleep sofa. The bathroom was very large and included at shower and a whirlpool tub. There is WiFi available in the lobby of the hotel and a wired internet connection in the rooms. I booked my room through Bookit.com and there was a resort fee that was collected by the resort at the end of my stay. My reservation included breakfast for 2. The breakfast included scrambled eggs, bacon, bagels, bread, oatmeal, juice and coffee. Nothing grand but it hit the spot. The rooms and property was very clean. Housecleaning was included in the price. The pool area was clean. The pool loungers were not plentiful so I could see that at some point that could be a problem. There was a bar and grill poolside. The Point is located very close to Universal Studios and The Funspot. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay at The Point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: emmiik
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights during our holiday in Orlando. It is a perfect location, in close proximity to universal studios and several waterparks. Wet n'Wild is walking distance just across the street. Even if I say it is a great location, you HAVE to drive to everything, for us Europeans that is not something we are used to. Our rental was a great investment, and the hotel has free parking. We had a small suite, a studio apartment really, on the smalish side with no balcony, so a bigger family (we only had a 8 month old baby) would be well advised to get something larger. The swimming pool was great, not too crowded and pleasant in the very hot weather. We made our own breakfast most days, but you can also have breakfast in a room by the lobby. THey have a fair selection of bread, juice and fruits for sale, and cofees and teas from starbucks. The staff was very nice, they even let us have several packages be sent to us via the hotel lobby, and delivered them in our room. Over all the quality is great, the building and rooms are clean and well kept. Only thing I would say was a little bit negative was the surroundings, since the hotel is situated in the middle of an intersection, and concrete are all you see around you. But that is the prize you pay for a central location I guess.

Reviews.Title: “overall GREAT stay”
Reviews.Author: Juns5
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this hotel was not so good. However, the people who greeted us disappointingly turned out to be reservations staff (not working in the hotel) and one lady from the hotel desk. Another negative point was another lady at the hotel desk who said she called us a cab but it turns out, she didn't. A nice man also at the desk finally helped us out after we had waited for this cab for over 30 minutes... Other than those staff members, the rest were courteous and helpful. The hotel amenities themselves were amazing. Especially compared to the non-existent amenities we got staying in Disney's Pop Century Resort, which was only a TINY BIT cheaper than this hotel. (definitely NOT worth the small difference in price). There's a laundry machine and dryer, which we did NOT expect, a LOT of kitchen utensils (most of them unnecessary, but some people might find them useful ) ...there's even a salad spinner and measuring cups! spacious room (we got the Grand One Bedroom Suite) quiet, relaxing outdoor pool and hot tub, which we found perfect for our stay, and the shuttles to and from universal were o.k. although we missed them several times, by the way its a GREAT location -- walking distance from International Drive, where you can either take the I-Ride Trolley or just walk to a restaurant (we went to Sweet Tomatoes all the time which we 100% RECOMMEND, it's a really good, healthy, tasty buffet) It's also REALLY close to Wet and Wild, so if you want to go to a waterpark you can try it out.. we took a taxi to disney world after six nights at the Point, to transfer to Pop Century hotel inside disney, but we greatly regretted this decision...Pop did not compare to the Point and it was much less clean. The Point was really a very clean, well kept hotel. Giving it 4/5 instead of 5/5 because of -the rude/unhelpful employees we encountered (2 at the desk , 2 reservation staff) -OUR HOTEL MAID..who stole my earrings, which I accidentally left on the bathroom counter --although she didn't touch anything else in the bathroom or even the room -- and didn't change towels/shampoo bottles until we asked. So be careful to look out for your things especially if they are valuables! Otherwise we definitely recommend the Point and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all aspects.”
Reviews.Author: bkfiend
Reviews.Content: Friendly, professional staff, comfortable rooms, excellent service and a good value...close to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at "The Point"!”
Reviews.Author: forshawn
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip this year and it lived up to our expectations again. The property is in great shape and the value we received is excellent. We asked for a pool view but was originally given a room on the other side. The front desk clerk found us a room as we requested with no problem. The rooms have everything you need and would expect in a suite. Housekeeping was somewhat attentive to our needs as we were short on towels a couple of days but we called the front desk and they sent some up. Overall a great stay. One area of improvement needed is the breakfast selections. Very little variety and not very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE”
Reviews.Author: JumpseatDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July with my wife and 2 children. On the first day we had some problems with the room, the main one was the sofa bed was broke. We felt uncomfortable complaining but Fabio at reception dealt with us in the most professional manner and sorted everything out. The room was very spacious had everything we needed. If you stay here with kids make sure to get the One or Two Bed Suite. The location was ideal and meant we did not have to rent a car. Plenty of restaurants nearby and the I-Ride stops outside! Highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Tx_born2000
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the hotel. The pool and bar areas were fantastic also. The suite I had was bigger than expected which made my stay even better. I will definitely go back next time I'm in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gdoublev
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The suite was very nice. Very clean and comfortable. Staff was always very nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Darrenandhayley
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms good service ideal location what more to say! Would definitely go back and already planning too!

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok - Not as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: triplovernj
Reviews.Content: The Point Orlando Resort was clean and comfortable for the 2 night trip we planned to see Harry Potter World. The "suite" was a single room with a wet bar more than a kitchenette We picked this hotel because of its close proximity to Universal Studios, the breakfast option, and because it advertised it had a shuttle to the park therefore I did not rent a car for such a short trip. Unfortunately the shuttle runs once in the morning (and not even to get you there at the opening), and once at 9:30pm to bring you back. Very inconvenient for a day when the temperature feels like 110 in the shade. The breakfast was not worth the $9. Get a coffee and head somewhere else or plan to have a breakfast snack in your refrigerator. This is a condo resort so the amenities are thin at best. Pool was nice as was the bar & grill situated next to it. Although it was nice for the price we ended up spending more than expected on cab rides to eat and get back and forth to Universal than we planned.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!! Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: petlovergirll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. Right up the street from Universal, I-Fly, and tons of restaurants. Exceptionally clean. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family stays...”
Reviews.Author: AjaKing
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the room, service and the pool area. Location was pretty close to Universal Studios. The room was compacted but well organized. I loved the bathroom, high quality materials. Kitchen had all the essentials if you plan some meals in the room.  Naturally you don't spend much time in hotels when in Orlando /all the parks and fun/ but after a long day we spent our time by the pool, where the boys  couldn't get enough water and my partner and I loved the couches and bar.  Cozy feel, friendly service, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but watch for incidental charges”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler020
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point Orlando Resort at the end of July. We were in Orlando for a ballet performance and were not interested in the Disney Parks - if we had been, then this would be a great location for those activities. We were in the Junior Executive Suite and it is spacious. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were nice and my daughter slept on the pullout couch without complaints. They did provide a small coffee maker and did provide packets of coffee on request. The room was quiet and we were not bothered by noise from guests (we were on the 2nd floor directly above the pool) after 10:00 at night. Cons: There was only one mirror in the entire "condo" (in the bathroom) and this proved difficult for three women. There was only one outlet in the bathroom. When you turn on the light in the bathroom, the fan automatically turns on - this made it difficult to hear above the fan if you are talking to someone outside the bathroom. If someone wakes earlier than the others, the only way to not disturb the others who are sleeping is to sit in the bathroom because of the way the lighting is arranged. There is no continental breakfast provided or free coffee in the lobby. There is a charge for using the business facilities or using the computer in the business room. There is a charge for using the phone in the room. You may be charged if you over use your towels. There seemed to be a lot of hidden charges and we were careful to not do anything to incur a charge. The staff was not as friendly as most hotels where I have stayed. This hotel is less hotel and more condo oriented. I would have preferred a Hampton Inn even though a Hampton Inn room is not as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms, Poor Facilities and Dont Book Hotel Taxi Company - Rip Off!”
Reviews.Author: annmarie99
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a family holiday in The Point Orlando Resort. My husband, 13 years old son and myself stayed in a one bedroom apartment which was very spacious, however bit of an inconvenience having to pull out the sofa bed every evening. The beds and pillows were so comfortable and fresh towels provided daily, however if you want your bed changed or bathroom cleaned, it is at an extra cost My 20 years old son and his girlfriend were in a studio apartment which was also very nice, however don't expect the same standard as the one bedroom, they asked for a toaster several times over the two week stay and although advised they would get one, never did. There is very little for teenagers to do at the hotel other than the swimming pool, no pool tables or games room, although there is an internet room but you have to pay 25 cents a minute for the pleasure. I was really surprised with previous comments stating that the breakfast was good. We only had breakfast once and this was only because we were given tokens by the hotel. The breakfast was awful, consisted of chewy scrambled egg and fatty streaky bacon, cereal, toast or bagel, definitely not worth $8.95 a day, also there are only 5 tables in the breakfast area that is in the reception area, not ideal. We were only thankful that we did not include breakfast within our package. The reason the hotel gave us breakfast tokens was because we were over-charged by the Hotel Taxi Company, One Way, who do not have meters and charged $35 for a journey to the Florida Mall, however on the way back we jumped in a yellow taxi, with a meter, they charged $13. I was shocked at the response from the hotel staff who stated that they are aware that the taxi company they use charge per person and not just for the miles travelled and continue to call this company anytime you need a taxi. Don't not use the hotel taxis absolute rip-off! There is no restaurant as such, there is a pool bar where us can purchased snacks, burgers, chicken sandwich, fries etc. There was also a bit of sting in the tail on checking out, we were charged $78 per room for services i.e., provision of pool towels and free coffee in your room?? WARNING: What ever you do, do not go anywhere near I-Electronics, 6550 International Drive. We were sold a video camera, $425, apparently Hitachi with all mod cons, however on getting it back to the hotel and trying out the camera we discovered it did none of the things described by the con-man who sold us it. We took it back to the shop and he refused to give us a refund, stay well clear.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Surprise on Universal Bvld.”
Reviews.Author: jats61
Reviews.Content: Nice and tidy room with equipped kitchen. Ample space for chilling out after long and tiring walks in the theme parks. Pool could be more tidy and clean. Good bar by the pool. They should include the airport transfers, that was a big put off. Should be more flexible to accomodate guests changing plans like our wet n wild package was not refunded on our request as we did not want to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to everything. I'd definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: pianogirl650
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in late July 2011. The front desk staff was very courteous, check-in was quicker than any other hotel I've ever stayed at. Our package gave us free breakfast every morning; the food was pretty good, but frankly if it had not been included we would have gone down the road to Perkins or IHOP, ordered exactly what we wanted and paid a lot less. Our room was very nice, we stayed in a one bedroom grand suite. Room highlights: full kitchen with big fridge, stove (not that I cooked!), toaster, coffeemaker, blender and dishwasher. Cabinets were stocked with dishes, glasses and silverware. And pots and pans, if you wanted to cook. King size bed was very comfortable. Ceiling fans in both the bedroom and living room area were very nice. Absolute best: efficiency washer and dryer IN THE ROOM!!!! We were able to pack much lighter and just wash and rewear our clothes. the bathroom was also nice, roomy with a shower stall and a separate whirlpool tub. Room minuses: the sofabed was dismal. The mattress was thin and ratty looking, and the whole thing bowed in the middle so your head and feet were high while your bottom sagged low. Luckily we brought a couple of air mattresses to sleep on, so it was fine. Also, the only mirror in the entire suite was in the bathroom. We would definitely stay here again. The pool was very nice and clean, they offer pool towels so we didn't have to use our own beach towels every day. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. the hotel was within walking distance of Wet 'n Wild, and a 2-minute car ride to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure. It is right in the middle of everything, yet it sits far enough back off the road that there is very little traffic noise. Last note: we had a choice of a pool view or a Universal Studios view from our room. We chose Universal, figuring we could look at a pool anywhere. However, Universal is far off in the distance, and up close is a small man made lake/drainage area that looks like the dead marshes from LOTR. And just beyond that is the back lot of Veolia waste company. Not attractive. If we stay again, we'll definitely choose the pool view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: Fluffysparkles
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 14 nights at the Point. We had a 1 bedroom apartment and our stay was a most pleasurable one. The staff at reception were most efficient and pleasant, the room was excellent with everything you would need for an extended stay. We especially liked the washer and dryer that was provided as it saved on bringing home the dirty washing. The pool area is well laid out and the bar is excellent. The big plus is the location, 5 minute walk from Wet and Wild, $10 taxi ride to Universal and Pointe Orlando. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: smaya1993
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort my family and i enjoyed our stay here we had the two bedroom suite and was very big and clean the kitchen had everything that you need and i mean everything don't listen to the negative reviews you won't be sorry to book here and most of all its close to universal.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Olando”
Reviews.Author: predz0612
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from The Pointe Orlando, and having visited Orlando on four previous occassions found this resort to be the best so far. We are a family of four, 2 adults and boys of 9 and17 . We booked a one bedroom suite which was spotless and provides a lot more space than your standard hotel room. The pool area was more than adequate with plenty of clean towels and a small gym which was a handy for my eldest son. The Pointe is situated on Universal Boulevard which runs parallel to int drive so all the attractions and amenities are close at hand. I didn't drive this time around but used the I trolley to get around which was cheap and covers the whole of int drive. I would recommend this Resort without any hesitation. My only slight disappointment was that the sofa bed mattress was a little thin to accommodate a 17 and a 9 year old for 12 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Tremendous Value”
Reviews.Author: fossil2u
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando for a Universal Vacation - no Disney. This place was wonderful. We had a 2 bedrooms suite - Parents on one side, our 16 y.o. daughter and her BFF in the other half; a room with it's own kitchenette & bath. Dishes, and equipment - including dishwasher & soap - to satisfy our needs. Staff was friendly & helpful at any request. Never waited for anything more than 7 minutes - pillows, linens, a replacement remote control, etc. A very international group of guests seemed to be there during our stay - we heard languages we couldn't recognize along with French, and Spanish. The girls were able to walk to Universal in about 30 minutes; a cab ride took 5 minutes and with tip was $10/$12; the provided shuttle never seemed to suit our schedule. Pool area was clean & pleasant, with a hot tub; towels were plentiful. I will look to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: calimerox
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hoytel, our expectations were high, but on arrival we were amazed as to how good it actually was. everything from check in till check out was first class. The reception staff were great with advice on where to eat and where to play golf. We used taxis to get to Universal as it was only $16 return and to take the car would have cost us $15 ( this was again on advice from reception). The one bedroomed suite was spotless and finished to a very high standard, there was even soap powder and washing up liquid supplied 2 TVs and a silent air conditioner plus a balcony. The kitchen had all the utensils ever needed to cook meals if thats what is required, but for us the fridge was more than enough to hold Gin and tonic and some beers, the bathroom had a whirlpool bath and a large seperate walk in shower. The pool area and pool bar were very good with plenty of sunbeds and pool towels. The food from the pool bar and breakfast in the hotel were superb and a great price.($9 for breakfast) All in all this hotel is a great place to stay at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: out2seetheworld
Reviews.Content: We all liked this hotel. It was close to Universal and had a great pool and whirlpool. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with all our questions and needs. I was disappointed with the $10 resort fee they tacked on at checkout. Details were in the "small print" before I clicked OK for the reservation, the clerk said. Guess I didn't see that. I do think that was tacky. This was not a resort. They said this fee was for towels, the pool, in-room internet service - all amenities I would think are just standard. Overall we were pleased with this hotel. Very clean and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, had a great time”
Reviews.Author: ComfortLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point May 2011. We had some issues with a flight and I had to call to change a date at the last minute and also I had to check in at about 4 in the morning. This was all fine. Booking and checking was painless. Rooms where clean and nice. The desk staff where very helpful and friendly. The price was great. Had alot of fun at the bar near the pool and the pool was warm and inviting. A great place to stay for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Room was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cbrent20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night b/c we decided to stay one more night in Orlando. It was pricey but nice. The quality of the accommodations and cleanliness were probably the best of our nine-day trip. Still, the Starbucks coffee in the lobby isn't free at breakfast, nor is the breakfast (that's fine). But, the business center isn't free either. Charging to use the Internet on a desktop and pay per print (for tickets, etc.) is a bit excessive. The pool looked great during the day, but by evening, it needed a little clean-up (smashed-out cigarettes, empty plastic cups rolling around, and napkins littered the pool area). The hot tub had a newspaper that had sunk down, covering the drain. Everything else at this facility was immaculate! The front desk was very friendly and very accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base - world recommend”
Reviews.Author: Michael69Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed from June 25th to July 11th 2011 - Thanks to Fabio and Stephanie for their excellent customer service. Room was exactly as it looked in the hotel photos. Pool depth ranged from 3 - 5 feet, perfect for kids. Excellent base for visiting Universal and Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Def worth the vacation that I needed”
Reviews.Author: BlacScorp
Reviews.Content: My overall experience at this new resort was def a good one. I had no problems with the room, the staff was attentive, and the location was really good couple miles from sea world and a couple minutes from universal. The room was kinda small but I can't complain for the price and the amenities we received, next time I will pay the couple extra dollars for an upgrade *notice I said next time* cause I would consider staying here again, didn't get to check out the lil restaurant but it smelled delicious everytime we passed by.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: hhhfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. It has the NICEST rooms and the bathroom was to die for. My husband and I stayed with our two year old son and the room set up was absolutely perfect. The bathroom was a dream with a glass shower seperate from the huge whirlpool tub. The pool is open for swimming from early am to late at night. All personnel were extremely friendly and helpful. I would stay no where else than here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay and will be back”
Reviews.Author: emptymind2k7
Reviews.Content: We loved this place!! Close to everything you need and want. Will defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “we all loved it and will definately go back”
Reviews.Author: joan706
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel we were checked in quickly,we stayed in two bedroomed suite and it was fab really spacious very clean our room was tidied every day fresh towels. pool was a good size,food at pool was also good,staff couldn't be nicer and always greet you when you come in can't say enough about it.Worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “The Point of It All”
Reviews.Author: myblutiger
Reviews.Content: The Point Orlando was Prime....in terms of location, price, suite amenities, and personal preferences. For a week, we took full advantage of the city and local attractions. From Downtown Disney, to Premier Outlet Mall, to Universal Studios, to Clearwater Beach. Not to mention.....the new Harry Potter attraction at Universal. After long days, being able to return and relax at The Point Orlando Resort was the beginning of Good mornings and Great nights. The resort was quite but had just the right vine for adults and children to have a wonderful experience. The Cabanna and pool was absolutely Perfecto. I can honestly say, "The Point Orlando Resort was definitely on Point for T, Nas & ME"! I will certainly revisit The Point.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay when visiting Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: MrsKSamuels
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my hotel stay so much that I didn't want to leave. Some reviews lead you to believe it is in the middle of nowhere. There are several hotels on this street and Wet and Wild is on the corner. Universal Studios is really close. Disney is less than 15 min away. Plenty of shopping and resteraunts nearby. The hotel staff is the best. They answer any questions with a smile. The maintanance man was at the front desk as I was about to leave to go to Universal and he stopped doing what he was doing to give me directions. I requested a crib and it wasn't in the room when I got there, but before I could finish unpacking the car we had the crib. I had a really nice 2 bedroom suite, my mom was traveling with my husband and I and she had her own private space. The rooms were clean and very modern. They had everything I needed while I was there. The rooms are very large. The pool area is very nice and modern. I usually only stay at Marriott but this hotel is my only choice when visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: dldeputy
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. The first was back in 2009 and most recently the week of July 16th. A few things have changed since our first visit back in 2009, with those welcome changes being the addition of a restaurant and availability of a on premise breakfast option. Additional lounging furniture, tables and a pool-side bar/cabana has been added with several flat screen televisions for viewing. We stayed in the Grand One Bedroom Suite. I would highly recommend this if you have children. This room comes with a full kitchen with washer & dryer. There is a separate sitting room with a sofa bed and table. We chose a "Universal view" with the room facing towards Universal Studios. The Grand Suite also contains a large bathroom with a Jacuzzi. In 2009 our room faced the pool however we changed this year because in 2009 the noise of late night and early morning swimmers were loud (in one case someone brought the radio out to the pool and it was blarring!). You should also be aware that the hotel offers room "refreshes". After arriving back from a day on the town we were disappointed to find that our room had not been "refreshed". We called down for fresh towels, which were brought up promptly. Some great things about our stay: * We had an early flight into Orlando and when we arrived at the hotel to inform them we were here and to ask to be contacted as soon as our room became available (check-in is not until 4pm) we surprised to be told that they did have a room available and allowed us to check-in right away. This allowed us time to freshen up from our flight and get ready for our night a Medieval Times. * This hotel is in a GREAT location. Getting in and out of the hotel property, via car, is simple and not congested as some hotels along the I-Drive or Sandlake Road. It is within walking distance of Wet-n-Wild water park and five minutes from Universal Studios. It is also minutes from a ton of attractions on International Drive, Disney and stores. A few things I did not like about this stay. * While there is free in-room internet access there is no in-room WiFi. This is important because many people, such as myself, have substituted laptops with ethernet ports for iPhones, Androids and iPads (and other mobile devices), which function much more efficiently using WiFi. * Our room had an older model TV while the living/sitting room had a newer flat screen TV. The older TV greatly limited the channels available in the bedroom to about a dozen with other channels such as Animal Planet, Cooking Chanel, News Networks etc... unavailable. This may seem small, however if you have small children you will spend more time in the hotel room than you may have spent if you were there with no children. * Back in 2009 a business conference area was made available. I used this to do early check-in from the hotel AND print our tickets. This room is no longer available (or at least I did not see it). * We purchased a daily breakfast option for two people. Upon check-in there were not enough breakfast vouchers printed and we only received vouchers for two days. The young lady who checked us in said she would send up the remaining three, however they never arrived. SORRY WE DID EAT AT THE RESTAURANT! WE JUST PLANNED TO EAT OUT DURING OUR VACATION. In summary, if we decide to vacation in Orlando again we will most likely stay at the Point again. The price, location and quality outweighed any issues we had with our most recent stay but we also anticipate that the hotel will continue to make more improvements to make visitors’ stays comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: Rescue1captain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1BR suite. It had a full kitchen, washer/dryer & pullout sofa. CLEAN! Nice, basic pool. Nice bed. Very close to universal & wet n wild. Staff was very nice & helpful. We have been to Orlando many times & stayed in a variety of places. We have never had a better stay and/or value for our dollar. We called the front desk asking for extra towels & within minutes there was a knock at the door! We have stayed at the Disney family suite & had adjoining rooms also at Disney. Both were more expensive than the Point & inferior in quality. We will be back! With friends!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way!”
Reviews.Author: james_mommie
Reviews.Content: We stayed from July 13th to the 17th. The location is great, right off of international drive, the look inside and out is beautiful and the staff is the friendliest I've ever encountered at a hotel. The rooms are great, and one bedroom and up feature all the comforts of home, even a washer/dryer which is a big plus for parents of young children. The pool area is great and as long as you don't need a big selection of workout equipment, the gym will suit just fine. This place really surprised me. Thank you to everyone who works there. I'll be sure to tell everyone I know and we'll be back next time we come to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Will definatley recommend, and will be back”
Reviews.Author: D1sc0
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in July. The room was excelent, good size and comfortable. We upgraded to the smaller of the two suites they have, which for the money is excelent value for the extras you get (approx £50 for 2 weeks I think it was) EVerything was in separate rooms, more like an apartment, then just a hotel room with everything in. The staff were fantastic, helpful with anything from wether requests about anything hotel wise, or help and advice as to where places were, directions, recommendations etc etc. Compared to the cost of a Hotel at Disney, or Universal, this hotel is 5 mins walk away from hustle and bustle of international drive if you want it and a short drive to either Universal or Disney. However the cost is a lot less than the hotels at Disney and Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhansel
Reviews.Content: A great hotel close to Universal Studios and Adventure Island. Very clean and spacious rooms. We loved having a kitchen and washer/dryer. We stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mrklean1911
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, clean rooms, great staff, great cost and an amazing location. I say rent a car a car and you won't even use a half a tank. It's perfect for couples or families. We had the one bed room suite and loved it. If you on the fence go ahead and book it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, just needs a few tweaks to minor details.”
Reviews.Author: Jennl586
Reviews.Content: The resort was nice, very clean with friendly staff. Deserves nothing short of 5 stars. The only issues I encountered were the fact that there was only one shuttle to universal on the date of my stay, no ice machines (it sucks having to carry a cold bag of ice from the bar up 11 floors), and the shared entrance always had the light on because the other party never turned it off (they should consider motion sensitive light switches). None of these were major enough to stop me from having an excellent stay. PS The talking elevator floor announcement voice is really creepy, LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with nice kitchen and dishwasher but lacks everything else”
Reviews.Author: Clintonfam
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this place the 4 stars it almost deserves. It really is a beautiful hotel with very nice rooms. The kitchen is beautiful! Brand new appliances, nice dishes, and a washer and dryer which was a huge bonus. Nice pool area. They have a cool interactive tv thing at the front desk where you can read news and do other cool stuff. The food and beverage manager is a really nice guy and the breakfast crew are super sweet and very hard workers and do a great job. Front desk staff is extremely nice! Now for the downside: Big bulky tv's that made me feel I was in the 90's, the cable flickered on and off and kept cutting out at very frustrating times of the news programs I was watching, not enough pillows in room, they didn't give us enough towels (occupation of 4 and we got 3 towels upon arrival and only 2 the next day from housekeeping) they did send more up eventually but couldn't right away when we needed them because "the linens hadn't arrived yet." Other downsides: the furniture in the living area had a good amount of dust on it upon arrival, the breakfast was the same every day (okay if it's free but at $9 I would like to see some variety) the outside pool bar was really bad service (the guy was great but the girl was really ditzy and gave horrible service i.e. didn't know liquor's they carried, charged us for a 7-up back even thought we ordered a shot of vodka, no plates with the pizza we ordered. She said she could go in and get some if we wanted. Um, we wouldn't of asked if we didn't want them!), no wireless internet in rooms so we couldn't both be on our computers at the same time, the coffee maker didn't work, small breakfast area in lobby and there weren't always enough seats, the shuttle to Disney was a selling point for us to stay there but we never used it because they ran at horrible times. Overall it was a good experience. It was definitely worth it for the price. The rooms are nice and if you don't mind not receiving top-notch customer service you'll love it. I'm not sure I would stay there again. With so many hotel options Orlando I would probably try another hotel. I think the managment is very close to getting right they just need to tweek it a little bit more. In a year I may give them another chance to see if they have improved.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Point! Believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: jlbmusician
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the Point, where we stayed on our honeymoon. The room was very clean, and all amenities were there. The walk in shower was big, and great to use. Jetted tub was fairly nice, but not big enough for two (though it's advertised as a single tub, so not a real surprise). The kitchen was GREAT. All the appliances were in new condition and worked great. The hotel provided us with dish detergent, a sponge, and the kitchen is furnished with dishes. There is a washer and dryer, with detergent provided. The room is great, the front room was nice, and the internet worked very well, which was a plus since we watched Netflix a lot (we brought our own wireless network though, since it's wired internet there). Only complaint is that they don't have a DVD player in the front room, or the ability to order movies, but you can always bring your own dvd player or a cord to connect your laptop. Hotel staff were courteous, and in fact, when we checked in, we asked about promotions and the hotel desk changed the promotion on our order, saving us $100 on our reservation! (8-night stay). Needless to say, this was a great start :) We would highly recommend the hotel and plan to stay there again! It is down the street from International Drive, so it's walking distance to restaurants (or a cheap taxi ride). It's also just over a mile from Universal Studios which is great. However, it's about 13 miles from Disney, so if that's where you're headed, you may want to reconsider, although they do offer a few complimentary Disney shuttles, so that's great!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: D-LJ55
Reviews.Content: Grest location - Clean - Staff very helpful and friendly. Only one small complaint - not enough shade/umbrellas around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jennym2525
Reviews.Content: The stay was very comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very spacious and clean. I also liked the location, we were so close to everything. I would stay again. Jenny

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay and would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Jet_86_11
Reviews.Content: We found all the staff to be very friendly and welcoming. Our two bedroom suite at the hotel exceeded our expectations. We were pleased with the size of the suite and all the facilities that were provided (including a full kitchen area with a washer and dryer). It was also extremely clean and had a balcony with a nice view of the pool area below. We were allowed a later check out time which we found very useful due to our early evening flight. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: GK4Merritts
Reviews.Content: My family and I found this hotel by checking out reviews and looking at their web site. We were greeted by friendly service and checking in was a breeze. For us the hotel's location was excellent. They had a shuttle bus for Universal theme park which was a great perk. We often times called from the car to the front desk to ask for restaurant and other recommendations and each time the staff was friendly and very helpful. The Cabana Bar by the pool is really nice. The only issue we had is that the bartender also had to prepare the food which made the waiting time between drinks a bit longer than we would have liked. But that is not enough to drop this hotel below five stars in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: eddiek18
Reviews.Content: We were to stay here in June for three weeks. Unfortunately due to family bereavement we had to cut our stay to two weeks and return home early. The time we stayed here could not have been better. The staff so friendly and helpful. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The beds so comfy and large. Could not fault this place and sure we will be returning soon for our full stay this time.

Reviews.Title: “fantasic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mbquince2669
Reviews.Content: The staff were very welcoming and helpful answering all our needs plus a great location only a stones throw away from wet and wild, Universal and International Drive. A good size pool with pool bar, very tidy and well kept property very roomy inside unfortunately no indoor bar only a breakfast bar / drink bar at night for bottles non draught but this should not put anybody off. Overall we would stay here again without a thought.

Reviews.Title: “"fantastic hotel we will be back”
Reviews.Author: dotty186487
Reviews.Content: hotel was great we stayed for 21nights cannot fault this hotel, staff were very helpful and this was our second stay at the point and we will be booking again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Moondancerst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Pointe over spring break and had a great stay. The rooms are clean, quiet, and well appointed. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and will definitely do so again. The staff was friendly and attentive, check in and out was quick and efficient, and the location could not have been better. We did Universal, Sea World, and Discovery Cove; all are close. We also found a Whole Foods and Golds Gym nearby. The pool is nothing spectacular, but is adequate. Also, the restaurant really isn't: more like a snack bar, but there are plenty of places to eat nearby. We also utilized the kitchen in the room to prepare some meals. We highly recommend The Pointe and can't wait to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Two Days in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mediarep
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely courteous, and helpful. Great location for the area. Excellent accommodations. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dancerhayley
Reviews.Content: loved every bit of it but be aware that you will be charged and additional resort fee which although minimal was unexpected as we checked out. I would still go back though. Staff was awesome and so was the pool and the room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent amenities and value for $$$, Best hotel we stayed at in USA”
Reviews.Author: Gluten_Free_chic
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a great find this hotel was! Every room is a suite and has more amenities than any other we stayed at in America. We stayed in a Studio suite which was identical to the one pictured on the hotel website. We only stayed 2 nights before going to Disneyworld and we were actually sad to leave such a comfortable room! We asked the staff at the front desk about places to eat and places to visit as well as where we could do our laundry and they were very helpful indeed. We did our Laundry at the Four Points Sheraton which was just across the road and went to a nearby supermarket for breakfast essentials and snacks. The hotel and its rooms are exactly as described and shown on the website. Being in Australia made booking some parts of our holiday difficult as we couldn't just make a phone call but I boked this hotel online and asked questions of the staff via email and had no issues at all. It was an absolute pleasure to stay at the Point and we will definitely return and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: jdcarrkirkcaldy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant and the service if secind to none. We booked through Ocean Florida and got a great Fly Drive deal with them. The receptionists are very welcoming, very knowledgable and helpful with any request. The pool area is very nice and has a relaxed atmosphere as there wasn't any children running about and the children that were there were well behaved. Next to the pool area was the jaccuzzi which was pleasant but was very hot although this was nice later on in the evening. The gym is also next to the pool area an is well appointed with all the usual macines and equipment. We only used the pool bar on a few occasions and the drinks were ok and the food was nice on the first time we ate there but on the second we ordered a pizza which was under cooked and we could not eat it. While at the Point Resort we stayed in a one bed apartment which was massive. There was a well appointed kitchen area with dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, microwave and huge fridge freezer and oven with hob. All utensils that you need are provided. The living area was comfortable and had a large screen TV. The bedroom had a queen size bed in it which was on the hard side for us but was not uncomfortable, there was another TV in the bedroom. The bathroom is massive and had a jaccuzzi bath in it, a hairdryer is also provided. There are internet connections in the living area and the bedroom. The location of the hotel is on Carrier Drive just off International Drive and only a short walk from Wet'n'Wild. Driving in Florida is an experience and it took me a day or two to get used to it but after that I really enjoyed it. Driving to the parks is really easy as they are all just off International Drive, that is the universal parks (we did not do any Disney Parks). One tip is to take a photo of the car park lane you are parked in as the car parks are like everything else in Florida (Massive). This is especially useful when in Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure. We also went to to some of the shopping malls, we got directions from the reception and these were easy to find as well. The day after we arrived we attended a Thomas Cook welcome meeting at the Nascar Grill in City Walk and we got some useful information here and also some discount vouchers for various attractions on I-Drive. Although if you have booked with someone else you can get some of the vouchers on a I-Drive map available at the hotel reception. All in all we would stay here again as the hotel is nice, the service is great, the facilities are great and the location is ideal for the parks.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved the 1 bedroom suite, we will definitely be back!! the bathrooms were Awesome! Love the shower!!”
Reviews.Author: Pelmore99
Reviews.Content: The resort was very clean and the staff was so nice and helpful!! I was so comfortable I wasn't ready to leave. My Husband and I came with our sons for a Disney vacation and the room was just Awesome!! I loved it! We will be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Croquet89
Reviews.Content: This was a very comfortable stay for us. We travel quite a bit and this was worth writing about. The pool was very welcoming and we spent alot of time there. The rooms are normal in size but very well done. A top pick for our FL stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel close to Harry Potter”
Reviews.Author: hwsincal
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved our stay at The Point. We had a very spacious 2 bedroom suite. I was traveling with my husband, and my 2 girls; 13 and 5. The second bedroom had a queen bed and a pull-out couch so each of my kids even had their own bed. The room was clean and very comfortable. The master bath was huge. Our suite had a full kitchen with all the needed dishes, etc. The washer/dryer was very convenient after swimming. The pool was a nice size which my youngest loved. There was a nice bar poolside with good lunch fair. The bartenders were spotty. The first day our margaritas were fantastic - the second day the woman behind the bar made them like fruity slushies without the slightest hint of tequila - and that was on top of asking (and paying) for top shelf tequila. The Point is conveniently located close to Universal Studios and right across from a fun water park but not much else. We stayed at two other hotels during our Florida vacation (one a Disney resort) and The Point rated as my family's favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: totoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April 2011. We got an upgrade upon arrival by the hotel staff which has been during the stay absolutery adorable. The rooms are very nice, not extraordinary but big and comfy. The pool area is nice and relaxing. It is not a five star hotel but for the price paid, the hotel is really a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KOBB71
Reviews.Content: What a great resort! From the moment we walked through the front door everyone was welcoming and made us feel at home. Everything made for a positive experience. - Very friendly, polite staff. - Very clean, well looked after property - Very quite stay, we were there for a week and no hallway noise etc - Pool area was perfect, lots of room, very clean and well set up - Very close to all attractions, yet just off the I Drive enough to keep things quite - Good food and drink at the Cabana Bar - Visible Security patrolled the property at night - very friendly - Julio at the front desk was a pleasure to deal with, great guy, so friendly and caring - This property costs a little more than some others. But you get alot for your money! In our opinion this is a 5 start property, reasonably priced with great service. We will definetley be back. Thanks for all the great memories!! R&K - Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good place, clean, bright, good value”
Reviews.Author: sos100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business (CTIA) for 5 days in March. Conference was at the Convention Centre nearby - not walking distance, but very convenient (5 minute drive or 10 dollar taxi ride). Staff are very helpful, rooms are large (to my mind), place is clean. There's an outdoor pool, and indoor gym-room with machines. Small bar that services some food and drinks, but really you stay here for the location. Very handy for sightseeing in Orlando, and ideal as a base for business or pleasure excursions. Staff were also very helpful. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sonicbs
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, comfortable room, great access to Universal, great price. We had a great time and enjoyed our stay, in fact we hated to leave! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Its oK”
Reviews.Author: si1972
Reviews.Content: Its as expected, except for the non suite rooms have a shared entrance with the other half of the 2 bed lockoff and if you get a noisy family closing the doors loudly and talking a lot then it can be very annoying. I have stayed at other hotels in orlando with a lower tripadvisor rating that I would consider better for a couple without a family. The pool area had lots of screaming kids too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: SpartyUSA
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I were getting together for a weekend of fun. We located this hotel on Trip Advisor. We booked the 2 bedroom suite which worked out great for our group. The suite has a full kitchen with a washer and dryer. Close to Universal (on the same road, about a mile from the park), Wet and Wild, and International Dr. The hotel has a shuttle that runs to Universal in the morning and back to the hotel in the evening - it does not run at any other time. Nice pool. Everything was clean and well cared for. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “okay till you look a bit closer”
Reviews.Author: ukguyz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point Resort for the first night of our vacation last week and we were put in room 401h (will explain the h later) the room was cleanish of average size and was ok for one night. As our vacation progressed we returned to Orlando for 4 nights on our last week of our vacation and we were booked into room 501h. The h means that you have the bedroom only of a 2 bedroom suite and that you share a door and hall with the adjoining 1 bedroom suite. You also get the pleasure of hearing everyone next door coming and going and the main door slamming every time someone enters of leaves. I also had the pleasure of being woken up by my neighbour making scrambled eggs for breakfast the calling her rather noisy kids to the table and making them eat the aforementioned breakfast. Also if you want a quiet time do not take a studio at this hotel as you will not get any peace at all. As I looked round the room I noticed several things that were not right. Stains on the carpet and overall the carpet looked grubby and in need of a good clean, The top of the microwave was caked in dust that thick you can write your name in it. And why give you an ice bucket in the room when there is no ice machine for guests to use. You have to ask for ice and they get it for you from the restaurant. In the bathroom the towels were all odd and several were discoloured. The main point that really annoyed me was the black mould that was growing all over the tile grout round the bath and I don’t mean little specks I mean large obvious patches of thick black mould. The bed was quite comfortable but the same cannot be said for the pillows, they were of the cheapest quality that gave you no support on your neck at all. They were all synthetic fibre filled pillows. As I have a bad neck I am now in pain because of this. All in I can only advice you with what I have noted from our room. If you stay at this hotel do not have a studio I repeat do not have a studio as you will get not peace if the unit adjoining yours is occupied I could even hear the mom beat the eggs this morning. Not very happy at the so called cleaning and I have put some pictures up to show my points also the carpets in all the hallways are grubby and in need of a good vacuum then a shampoo. All in feel a bit ripped off with this Hotel, if we had known that we would have a room like this we would not have booked and made another choice. Also if you are going to book either a 1 or a 2 bedroom suite please remember that they have yet to break ground on tower 3 so you may have your vacation next to a building site. All in unless you want to fork out for a 1 or 2 bedroom suite do not book this hotel as the studios are not a very good option for anyone to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Short, nice stay at The Point”
Reviews.Author: interpol81
Reviews.Content: Based on the very positive reviews here on TA, i decided to book a two bedroom suite for our visit to Universal parks. We stayed at The Point for just two nights and we loved our huge room. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a really nice living room with a fully equipped kitchen (we never used).. everything were so clean and well maintained! The hotel is conveniently located on I Drive (but in a secluded part of it, so you won't hear anything from the road!), with some restaurants and a Wallgreens nearby. Although Universals are not walking distance (there are closest hotels), it takes just a couple of minutes by car to go there.. and they have a complimentary shuttle bus service every day. Just an episode that happened the first night we were there: while we were in the parking going out for dinner, we saw a very suspicious guy coming out from the hotel running soooo fast with a bag under his arm. Hope he hasn't stolen anything, but it looked like a weird situation! By the way, due to our short stay, we couldn't try the swimming pool and the bar.. Wish i could stay longer in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price...but..”
Reviews.Author: Cherirock
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night stay. June 6& 7 The pro's: The hotel is pleasant and clean.. The staff helpful. The location to Universal Studios great. The cons: very unsecured parking (no tickets or patrolling of lot ( as a woman felt uncomfortable parking at night) The pull out sofa unusable by anyone over the age of 5. Literally 2 1/2 thick, my daughters and I all slept in the one king bed ( age 21 and 14). The comfort level of the bed and pillows mediocre at best. The studio room had older styled tv and no DVD . Odd for a newer complex. Came back in mid afternoon (after day at park) and room had not been serviced had to ask front desk to send housekeeping.. Upon checkout I commented about the resort fee I felt it is unwarranted, did not have to argue. It was removed from bill. Again staff was top notch. I would stay again if only two people. Then again with other properties in the area I will probably check out other locations before I return. (I am a annual ticket holder to Universal and plan several visits to the parks)

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: bbnigri
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Orlando. Friendly staff, comfortable suites and very well equiped kitchen make this a excelent choice to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to the point hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: k_glory384
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for a work convention. We were very happy with the spacious rooms and the outside pool area. The staff is wonderful, they accommodated us very well with watching the basketball game downstairs at the bar. There was no need to go any where for the game. We ate, had a drink, and enjoyed the whole game downstairs by the pool. Most importantly, my husband and I left this morning in a rush to make it on time to our convention. My husband left his wedding band in our room and we did not notice it was missing till about 4hrs after we Checked out. We called the hotel, they put us on a brief hold and 3 minutes later they found it. So thank you for the wonderful stay and honest staff at the point resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: joff16v
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay! Would stay again! Lots of nice things in hotel, is just abit out the way to avoid the hustle and bustle! Dont stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasing stay, WILL RETURN asap!”
Reviews.Author: DraacoPendragon
Reviews.Content: Having never heard of this hotel/resort before, seeing all the positive reviews forced me to check this one out on my last long weekend trip to Universal Studios. When we walked in the door two very cheerful employees were very helpful in assisting with everything needed, and were very knowlegable about evrything on site and off. The entire resort was very beautiful, but not over-done or tacky. The room which we had on the tenth floor was very comfortable, with a beautiful fully equipped and furnished kitchen (down to the plates, silverware, pots, and garbage disposal), a gorgeous washroom, and a very pleasing view overlooking Universal. The pool was at a perfect temperature every time we visited, and the poolside bar had great service and selection. We did not get a chance to sample the cuisine at the local dining area, but in talking to other guests it seems we missed out on some good food, which I will no doubt sample next time! Great service, incredible accomodations, and the perfect location truly made my stay in Orlando a much more enjoyable one. Highly recommended, and inexpensive!

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Dasey83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in october and had to return a few months later. I love the size of the room and the comfort of the bed. Most the rooms have a king size bed. The people at the desk were very helpful in giving us ideas for places to eat. I stayed at the Point for a two night stay with my boyfriend. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL ON I DRIVE”
Reviews.Author: KDIXON32
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 17 night stay and can honestly say this is the best hotel for both service and cleanliness we have ever experienced in Orlando. This is our second visit to this hotel following twelve previous visits to other near by hotels which do not come close to the standards met by the point resort. We have already chosen to return to this hotel once again later this year. The rooms have all the furnishing which you need including a washer dryer, fully equipt kitchen including a dish washer a balcony over looking the pool and even a jacuzzi bath in the one/two bedroom suites, which is ideal after a day in one of the many theme parks located locally. The most recent improvement since our last visit is the welcome addition of a poolside bar to relax around after a long day in the parks. Overall this is by far the best hotel on International drive. All staff are helpful from the cleaning/bar staff to the welcoming reception staff who honestly go out of their way to ensure your stay is as plesant as possible. We look forward to our next vist :O)

Reviews.Title: “Great! Until Theft!”
Reviews.Author: johnnySyosset
Reviews.Content: We were on a family vacation to visit Universal and Disney during spring break. Staying at the Point was fine. We booked a Grand one bedroom suite. It suited our family of four just fine. Though just one bathroom. Rooms were clean. Decent kitchen. Staff was very accommodating, and helpful. But, at checkout I forgot to take my best and favorite "HIND" running jacket. I travel everywhere with it. It is warm, versatile, breathable, indesructible. I called the very next day to inform management about leaving my jacket behind in front room closet. I spoke to "Fabio" who was very helpful, and informed me he would speak to all parties involved with my room and get back to me in a few hours. I was so confident that housekeeping would find it, that I told Fabio when he locates jacket I would be back in a few days to retreive jacket. Fabio called and informed me that he spoke to the room attendant, and room supervisor that room was "checked and cleared" by both and nothing was found. I owned this jacket for many years and many years left. I have many jackets, but you always have that one favorite one. THEFT! Very disappointed with The Point. Great Place! Till THEFT!

Reviews.Title: “WOW....Best choice ever”
Reviews.Author: frankie2405
Reviews.Content: We're still here at the moment but check out tomorrow,we couldn't have made a better choice for the value you get. We had a 2 bed which is fab if you have kids with you as you all have your own space. Rooms are clean and very well appointed. Having a balcony is a real bonus as sometimes you can feel couped up in some hotels with no windows to open. Pool is lovely too and doesn't really get overcrowded even when people are returning from parks. Bar is very handy and also serves bar meals. Great location as it is just off I Drive but close enough to have a short stroll to. Staff cant help enough if you have any enquires. Only downside is that you have to leave at some point:( Would recommend to everyone. Also having a full kitchen was a true gem even though we only used it occasionaly but the washer and dryer were indespensible

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: svaidyar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days here. It is located very close to Universal Studios (less than 5 min drive). The drive to Disney was also less than 20-25 min. This is very close to international drive which has many different types of restaurents. We took the 1 bedroom which was very helpful since it had a full kitchen with dishwasher and also had washer/dryer. The rooms very spacious and clean. The staff at the front desk were very courteous and helpful. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Point is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Wrightman1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Point several times. What an awesome place to stay. You get a Suite for the the price of a regular hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great find - away from hustle but close enough to enjoy Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Mick11002
Reviews.Content: The Point Orlando Resort offers excellent value - we stayed in the one bedroom apartment. Great location - some may say a little too far from the "attractions" but I think that is part of the charrm as you are away from the hustle and crowds. You do need a car to really get around - recommend it for families as well as people travelling together.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevins9462
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel.The rooms where spacious and clean.The staff where nice and friendly.The pool area was lovely and had a bar.The location is good because it is only a five minute walk from international drive.

Reviews.Title: “The Point Orlando Resort was a GREAT first experience in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Cperry09
Reviews.Content: Service was good, clean and reliable. Wish you had room service though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spacious rooms with great facilities, lovely pool area, and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: KatieSmall
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Check-in was quick and friendly and staff were pleasant throughout. The room made it. We had a one-bedroom King suite. The suite was huge, really spacious. The bathroom was massive with jacuzzi bath, double shower and separate toilet and loads of cupboard space. The bed was as wide as it was long. There was a leather sofa and table and chairs in the living area and a balcony. The kitchen had everything you could possibly need. Large oven and microwave, large fridge freezer with ice maker, washer and drier, dish washer, coffee maker, even a blender! We were left coffee, washing powder, dish washer tablets and washing up liquid so didn't need to buy anything like that. The pool area was lovely with a nice pool bar (lovely strawberry daquiris) and free pool towels were provided. Reasonable size gym for anyone that way inclined and a large free car park. We were across the road from Wet n Wild and just over a mile to Universal and City Walk. There is a trolley stop right outside the door which runs up and down Universal Boulevard (which runs nearly parallel with International Drive) or the Drive is just a few minutes walk down a side street (Carrier Drive- which also has the Pirates Dinner Show and a TGI Fridays amongst other restaurants). We were able to walk to any restaurant or bar at night and to all the parks (except Disney) during the day but we could have got the trolley for $1.25. Close to Premier Outlet Mall (North) also - just about 1 mile. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back- would highly recommend especially if on foot and looking for central location, if eating some meals in or if looking for a really lovely spacious room with great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST OPTION”
Reviews.Author: machrix66
Reviews.Content: We allways stay in The Point in Orlando, the hotel an dthe service is the best for the price, you will be so glad to stay there, and we we are going to Orlando at least 4 times per year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Walsh2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent location. Iride stop G6 in front of the hotel, the hotel is in walking distance from Wet n' Wild, and only a $6 cab from Universal. The hotel offers shuttles to all the theme parks as well. There are many places to eat within walking distance as well as. The Premium Outlets (North) are just minutes away on the Iride or a 10 minute walk. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and welcoming. The front desk gave us several coupons for dining around Orlando and made many recommendations of things to do and where to eat. They sincerely want you to enjoy your stay. The rooms are spacious, and clean with a full kitchen & washer and dryer. The pool is big and never crowded. There is also a Tiki Bar & lounge area along side of the pool which was nice in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for 31 year olds and 3 year olds alike!”
Reviews.Author: ChadCurvin
Reviews.Content: I took my almost 3 year-old daughter to Disney World and also attempted to see the last shuttle launch. I decided to get a nice hotel not as close to Disney World so we could also do other things. This place is still very close and extremely accessible from the nearby freeways and highways. Every morning my daughter would wake up and before she even wanted to go see Mickey Mouse she asked if we could swim in the hotel's very nice pool :-) One other thing that was very nice is I like to feed my daughter healthy food and eating out isn't always easy to find that nutritional value. We went shopping for food at a local grocery store and there were dishes as well as a fridge, microwave and sink that we used to prepare our own food each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Dylansmyler
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay because of the good reviews on tripadvisor.com. Rates were reasonable and it was close to Universal, I-Drive and short drive to Disney. Room was clean and very modern in decor. We ate at the bistro once for breakfast, which was sufficient for us. Loved having the pool bar area. Bartender was friendly, prices for food reasonable. Would like to have more of a selection on the menu--what we ordered tasted good. Hotel was quiet and set off a bit from I-Drive, which was great. We loved the pool and hot tub. Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: EdHaas
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Wet N Wild, and Universal Studios, if you don't mind a bit of a hike. Close to Convention Center if you have a conference or seminar. Also close to Giordano's if you like Chicago style pizza. The service was fantastic and very accomodating - everyone was friendly and helpful from the front desk at 1:00AM to the guy who had to move his landry truck when I was trying to leave. The breakfast bistro is a nice bonus and my kids played for what seemed like hours on the interactive touch-screen tv in the lobby. The only knock would be on the fold-out couch for sleeping comfort - you're better off putting the mattress on the floor. But if you have to squeeze 4 people in a room with a full kitchen, this is a good place to do it!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel , couldnt ask for better !!!”
Reviews.Author: jansligo
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel, the staff are very friendly, rooms are spotless and plenty of space esp. as we have a child who is wheelchair bound, just a short walk to i- drive for all the shops and restaurants....... i- ride stop right outside the hotel also. it would be nice if we could purchase our weekly i- ride tickets in the hotel as some of the other hotels do and a small shop selling the basic grocery items would be nice , they are the only down side :) I would highly recomend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Enid_85
Reviews.Content: very clean rooms, great staff. located very close to idrive. plenty of things to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Vacation with great room!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaRF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Disney to celebrate my birthday. We wanted a suite in order for us to be able to buy food for breakfast to have before going to the amusement parks, as well as, a comfortable, clean room to come back to each night after our day out. This suite had EVERYTHING we needed......full kitchen, all applicances, dishwasher, washer/dryer - you name it! The bathroom was huge and had a standup shower (large size) and a large size tub. The room was very clean and the hotel staff very nice. We will definitely stay here again. The only downfall was that there weren't any safes in the room, so we had to take everything valuable with us everyday. This hotel is located perfectly to all Disney Parks and Universal, yet it is not overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with all facilities for a family trip. Great for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: AJadia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with spacious rooms and options for various group sizes. Rooms haev all facilities for short and long stay and staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: toberk
Reviews.Content: The location is great if doing Universal. My son loved the pool. It was nice and clean! I can only say one bad thing, lack of food at hotel. I wasn't impressed with the bistro, and it is only open till lunch. Go for the one bedroom, you have the full kitchen, it is great. We had a universal view on the ninth floor, we enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching Wet-n-Wild and we could watch the roller coasters at Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Rossc007
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in The Point Resort and it was an absolute pleasure as usual. The hotel itself is excellent, cleanliness cant be faulted, excellent pool area, the staff are the most helpful and a credit to the facility. We where immediately recognized, from our stay last year, by a member of staff upon arrival. I was amazed! Its located across the road from Wet and Wild, which while not as well themed as some of the other water parks, definitely has the best rides. You are 3-4 mins in a taxi away from Universal, which has the best nightlife in Orlando imho. If your planning on spending most of your holiday in Universal, then I cannot recommend this Hotel enough. If I had to nit-pick, the lack of a good hotel bar\resteraunt would be the only downside, but in Orlando, you wont be staying in the hotel bar much anyway :D

Reviews.Title: “good choise for shopping and amusment park”
Reviews.Author: TaherAlbaghliJulian
