Reviews.Content: winderful location near universal studio s & international drive,very clean hotel ,very good helpful staff, offer shuttle to disney,sea world & universal studio s, large rom. i do not like house keeping becuase every day forget to put toliet paper or tissues paper or shampoo. they do not have wirless only cable for internet.

Reviews.Title: “great place for couples”
Reviews.Author: todski85
Reviews.Content: Not to be missed, very good customer service and very clean. newer, updated, cool pool area not much as food goes, but does have kitchens in the rooms can walk to universal studios . Business area in the lobby is a total rip off don't use it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations and service”
Reviews.Author: jackie_oKeyLargo
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the one-bedroom suite.. Very comfortable and everything (and more) that we needed. But most importantly the service was the best I've encountered in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly wonderful!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mzchinadoll82
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The suite was wonderful! I'm a very germophobic person and I felt 100% comfortable in this hotel. Great value for the money. Very quiet and clean. I felt Like I was home. The large comfortable bed and the jacuzzi tub in our suite topped it off. Please go experience this! Love love love it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly an awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: notsopunkrock
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Orlando for a conference and was staying at the Disney Yacht Club for the first half of the week, then moving to a different hotel. I hadn't ever been to Orlando before, so I was nervous that I would pick a place that would stink and would end up ultimately being disappointed, but I made the right choice! After checking out NUMEROUS reviews, I decided to The Point Orlando - since it was rated #6 on tripadvisor, I figured it was a safe bet. The Point turned out to be awesome. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The staff was a super friendly crew, always smiling and saying hello. We were lucky enought to be on the 10th floor so we got a cool view of the pool (which even though we didn't swim in it looked nice) and then an amusement park or water park that was off in the distance. Our main goal was to head to Disneyworld, so we tried the free shuttle the first day and it was great. The shuttle driver was even nice enough to wait for me while I was getting my breakfast too (I hope I didn't make anyone else on the shuttle mad!). We were luckily the first stop, so we were able to get seats. The shuttle does stop at quite a few hotels, but the drive is short (maybe 30 minutes tops) so it's a great perk. Make sure you make reservations with the front desk the night before, just in case though! I can't say enough about the great experience we had at The Point. If I ever get the chance to go back to Disneyworld, I wouldn't hesitate to book this property again.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like at home”
Reviews.Author: Joyxer
Reviews.Content: I think I can't remember any bad point about staying at The Point Resort. I really must say that everything was at top level. From front desk, through pool bar, till room amenties. Will definitely recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Rebbie17
Reviews.Content: This place has it all - beautiful rooms, friendly staff, lovely pool with a bar and fresh towels, full amentities!!! We couldn't be happier with our stay. The staff was quick to fix any problems that arose. We were VERY happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: sanfran1st
Reviews.Content: Wow! Just got back from a 4 night stay at Point Orlando and they exceeded my expectations. Everything was spotless from the room to the pool area. Staff was friendly and accomodated our every request with enthusiasm. For the money, this was the nicest hotel I have every stayed at. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here in the future no question”
Reviews.Author: SUZB72
Reviews.Content: The staff on the front desk of this hotel were very helpful and friendly. It is ideally located for Universal, wet and wild and I Drive with everything else easily accessible. We did not hire a car but we used the shuttle service from the hotel which was great and if the times of the shuttle didn't suit then we got a taxi. We had a one bedroom suite and the facilities were fantastic. Although we don't do much self catering when on holiday as we always eat out the washer and dryer were very handy and the other facilities like a large fridge freezer and a dishwasher were still handy to have. The jacuzzi bath was also lovely after a long day in a theme park. The pool area was nice and clean and there were a couple of vending machines which sold cold bottles of water and fizzy drinks plus crisps and sweets all for $1 to $2.50 each which was not a rip off and was handy and convenient. We were a family with 2 boys aged 5 and 8 and we will definitely stay here again when we return in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: madmals
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, with two children aged 8 and 11. We stayed at the Point Resort for 2 weeks in April 2011. The rooms were huge, much bigger than I was expecting - plenty of room for all our gear. We got a two bedroom apartment which would easily have functioned as two separate apartments. The kids room had a big bed, tv, their own separate kitchen and bedroom. We got a separte tv room/kitchen area which had everything you would need, washer, dryer, dishwasher, cooker, cooking pans. We didnt cook but if you are so inclined on holiday then everything is there for you. The second bedroom also had a tv, with a huge ensuite with a jacuzzi bath, shower, separate toilet room, airing press. The beds are v. very comfortable which is important when you come back from parks tired. We had a nice view over the pool area - at night you could see the fireworks at Disney in the distance. Outside there is a nice pool with a lovely hottub which is great after a long day walking in the parks. A new bar pool has just opened which is a nice addition. There is an indoor gym next to the pool area. The hotel is in a good location for parks - wet n wild is 5 mins walk away. Universal Studios is just a mile down the road. We didn't drive, but a free shuttle bus brings you to all the parks. There is a nice TGI Fridays and a Chilis about 5/6 mins walk away. There is a small area in the lobby where you can get breakfast in morning (they serve starbucks coffee) and they serve tapas/snacks in evening. We didn' t eat there as we self-catered for breakfast, but the food looked nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone travelling with children who wants a bit more space than a hotel and some of the comforts of home. It is in a quiet area, away from the madness of I-Drive. I found the staff at the hotel to be very friendly and helpful, we were always greeted with a smile. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, comfy & clean.”
Reviews.Author: mugglemum
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and would recommend. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Mattresses probably need updating and more pillows would be great. Didn't feel there was "added value" worth the resort fee. Should just add that into the cost of the room on the front end.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue527
Reviews.Content: This place is a well run Condo-Hotel and their rooms are reasonably priced. FYI There's a per diem facility charge in additional to the daily rate. Not much but payable upon check out I had a spacious 1 bedroom unit. It was very clean. It had a large bathroom with whirlpool tub & separate shower, a full kitchen (pots, pans, silverware and flatware microwave, coffeemaker, dishwasher fridge, etc,) dinning table and a washer dryer. They provided detergent for the washer I never felt confined when I was in my room. In fact it felt like being home which was great or us. The pool is nice and clean with several sets of lounge furniture (sofas, lounge chairs, patio tables) but no life guard on duty. They have a hot tub and fitness room (I didn't check it out) It is a limited service condo-hotel. There's no spa or on-site entertainment and they only offer a limited menu. Their kitchen and bar are open until 11 PM. But you can always stock up on drinks and food because the kitchen is well equipped, order food and have it delivered, or just eat at the various local restaurants (China Jade was pretty good) The staff is very friendly and ready to assist you with whatever you need. Needed milk alt at night and they opened the kitchen to give me a glass full The hotel is close enough to all supporting amenities: highway, restaurants, shopping, gas station and of course the attractions. It is not on I-Drive, however, being off of International Drive can be a positive thing because it can get congested on I-Drive with all the traffic . Minor things I would have added to the rooms, sheer drapes to let sunlight in without allowing a full view of the inside of the room and a full length mirror in the bedroom (the only mirror was on the bathroom wall) This place is great for families or couples who want to relax as there is not a lot of "hustle & bustle" at this hotel, but by no means is it desolate. I travel to Orlando often (stay mostly at the Hard Rock) and will definitely stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: trionic
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Point; could not wait to re-book after first visit. To our surprise there is now a poolside bar, which is very welcome after a long day at the parkes. The staff are wonderful, especially Hamid, Sophia and Ricardo. Truly a home from home with all your creature comforts We stayed in a two bed suite with our 10yr old son having his own grown up space. Suite could accommodate a family of 6 easily. Shuttle bus takes you to the theme parks at no extra costs apart from a tip for the driver(optional) Public transport is regular and clean; and the drivers are helpful if you are not sure where you want to be dropped off/collected. Restaurants cater for all your tastes All I can say it's a wonderful Hotel, and I hope we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Hojsam
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful. I booked a two bedroom suIte for my family of 6 and there was more than enough room for us all. Plus the kitchen was fully equipped with pots, pans, utensils, etc and the appliances were full sized. My only negative was that one of the pull out sofa beds had an absolutely horrible mattress. Totally uncomfortable and truly unacceptable. I would not let that deter me from booking this hotel and I would highly recommend The Point Orlando Resort.

Reviews.Title: “A 'home' away from home, but...”
Reviews.Author: rae762
Reviews.Content: Maid service is available but if you want the full maid service you have to pay extra to get the room fully cleaned. The beds were made, the garbage was clear (most of the time), but the showers were not cleaned because we didn't pay for the extra full maid service. The kitchen is stocked with almost everything you need to cook. Bring your own herbs and spices; save your take-out packets of soy sauce, salt & pepper packets, you'll need them to flavor your food. Food delivery is available to the hotel. There is coffee and breakfast available for purchase down in the lobby. Internet is not complimentary. Shuttle service to Disney Parks and Universal is available but it's a bus that also goes to other hotels to pick up guests so you're looking at almost an hour to get to Disney when it's just a 20 minute ride to Disney from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews and you will "get the Point"”
Reviews.Author: basildonian
Reviews.Content: Believe all of the great reviews. We took our two teenage children and stayed in the two bedroom suite - which in effect was more like two separate apartments with a private lobby area joining them. All of the staff (including the superb Fabio), could not have done more to make our stay relaxing and memorable. The pool bar opened on our last day and as an added bonus showed live sports and English premier league games. Great selection of cocktails and bar food available. Perfect location for Universal ($6 cab ride or free shuttle) and Wet and Wild - 10 minutes walk. Large selection of restaurants within 20 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great value,make the vacation perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: werner2304
Reviews.Content: Great value,make the vacation perfect!!! We likethe room, the Kitchenette was great, really handy.Good location, close to everything,but 100% quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, nice staff, couple of quirks”
Reviews.Author: Travelovingmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one bed king suite. Place is nice enough but you get the feeling they ran out of money whilst finishing and furnishing it. We like having a kitchen and in room laundry available when we travel so having a well furnished kitchen and small washer/dryer suited us. Possibly the worst sofa bed my children have ever slept in (very poor quality-they sank into the middle and they only weigh 40 and 55 lbs...so wouldn't think it would work well for adults). But the kids were so exhausted after the excitement of the theme parks they slept well anyway. King bed was comfy. Pool was great, kids really enjoyed it. A couple of quirks. Fitness center has only a couple of machines, no clock, no tv and opens only at 7...so not good for us moms who have to fit in fitness before our families wake up! Coffee bar only open certain times (not in the afternoon...which we thought was a bit odd...). No wireless(or even free wireless) which is really backwards. Maid/cleaning service is confusing. Not sure what we should have expected. But they did freshen towels and make beds. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and polite. Overall: will go back. It's not 5 star setting or quality but it isn't 5 star price either. Was a comfortable enough base for exploring the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Komish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 kids, and having the two bedroom unit was great. We loved having all the space when we got back from the day. This is a hotel, not a resort, so it doesn't have a bunch of on-site recreation, but the pool area was nice, and open till 11pm so we could enjoy it at the end of the day if we wanted. All the Orlando attractions are an short easy drive, along with plenty of dining options. If you're going to be busy going to the theme/water parks each day, and just want a nice place to come back to at the end of the day, this is a great choice. I'll definitely consider this hotel again if we come back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Carol4108
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean, friendly, well located, great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Value!”
Reviews.Author: Pokinpo
Reviews.Content: This hotel beat out other moderately-priced hotels on our list based on cost, Tripadvisor member reviews, availability and location. Location: It is secluded from all of the tourist stores and restaurants, but conveniently located within a short drive of most to-do activity in Orlando. It is a short walk away from Wet & Wild. First Overall Impression: The multi-story hotel building has a nice and modern, but reserved and understated design - i.e. no eye-popping features or glitz on the exterior. The lobby/reception area is nice and comfortable. Staff: Cordial and professional. We only needed minimal interaction with the staff during our stay - this was good, since most of what we needed were readily available or easy to locate. Amenities: Free parking, Free high-speed wired internet access in each room, wireless internet access in lobby area. Decent outdoor swimming pool with bar. We did not use the Bistro or fitness room. Room: Wow! We booked a one bedroom suite and got a fully and nicely furnished one bedroom condo - complete with separate bedroom, bathroom, living room, full kitchen, and balcony. The bathroom alone is larger that some hotel rooms. The suite was generously equipped - washer/dryer, dishes and utensils... everything - even a pyrex measuring cup. Summary: Our teenage son slept on the sofa bed, which had a thin mattress. I preferred a bit more padding, but he insisted that all was fine. Other than the sofa bed, this place is a huge winner and of excellent value. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the point orlando florida - great experience, great staff”
Reviews.Author: scgreenwood
Reviews.Content: excellent attentive staff. the new pool bar was a great addition. The attention given by angie at the pool bar was great. and jose had good stories.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed! Don't hesitate to book! Best bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: OhioStBball1
Reviews.Content: This was a combined business and family trip and we needed a suite with a kitchen and the usual amenities of a suite hotel, all at a reasonable price and good location. The Pointe exceeded all expectations in every way. Friendly, courteous and attentive staff who allowed us to check in early, which was a blessing, especially traveling with little ones. Great clean roomy suites with comfy beds, free internet, full kitchens and a jacuzzi tub. Nice heated kid friendly pool with poolside bar and plenty of chairs and shade to lounge around. Convenient location to parks, convention center and highways. Overall, don't hesitate to book the Point, we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value at a very classy condo”
Reviews.Author: soxfan1953
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding value fro a very classy condo unit. Rooms were very spacious and I would highly recomment this wonderful place. The extra security door leading to the main entrance to the rooms were an added bonus and my wife felt secure! There were two only negatives that i could see. A resort fee? > for i did not really consider this a "resort" by any means. Plus, if you go stuck on the back forty for parking, it was a haul to the front entrance. However....I would go out of my way to stay here again! :-) Larry and Linda from Homer Glen, IL ps, plus Sophia was extremely pleasant!!!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Gillian0504
Reviews.Content: just home from a 2 wk holiday in Florida, stayed in the point orlando resort, absolutely fantastic, the staff were brilliant and ever so helpful, but must express many many thanks to Fabio for booking tickets 2 see Orlando Magic.... the hotel is beautiful and very clean, maids in every day with fresh towels ( now that doesn't happen everywhere ) Britney is a wee gem, and Stephanie 2, go on people get booking 2 stay here, wud highly recommend, we will b back.....c ye's soon folks... :0)

Reviews.Title: “The Point Orlando Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: dwater6969
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable experience. The staff was excellent and attended to our every need. They really made us feel special. The room was very nice, clean, and spacious. The pool area, although we did not use it, looked very nice and clean - both around the pool and in the pool. The location is excellent as it is very close to Universal and Wet and Wild - and within a block of many, many restaurants of all price ranges. We would absolutely stay there again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Birhtday Treat”
Reviews.Author: waltdisney040
Reviews.Content: had a great stress free week staying with my daughter for her 15th birthday the staff were all really helpful anything i asked for was no problem and felt safe here & will definitely be back soon. paula&rebecca scolley scotland UK

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Value”
Reviews.Author: CasualTraveler2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met another couple in Orlando and chose this hotel based on the reviews at trip advisor. The high ratings are justified - the hotel is convenient, the staff very helpful, and the rooms are remarkable. We are definitely going to stay there the next time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: betmama
Reviews.Content: Well located within 10 miles of airport, every theme park, convention centre, outlets,, dining, 1 block from wet n wild and 5 minutes to Universal. Very nice people, quiet hotel, balconys for each one, heated pool, hot tub, never crowded, beautiful spacious rooms, walk in shower, jacuzzi tub large bathroom. Kings size comfortable bed, washer dryer, full kitchen, daily replacement of towels and emptying of garbage. Pool towels at pool, small fitness room. Everything was perfect, the weather was as well, it was 85-92 degree and sunny. 1 hour from Daytona Beach, and 45 minutes to Coa Coa beach.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, relaxing safe and friendly”
Reviews.Author: deifer
Reviews.Content: The self catering apartments are very well furnished and they have everything you are likely to need. The staff were genuinely very helpful and friendly and not in a scrounging for a tip way. There are restaurants nearby that you can walk to or take a short taxi ride to. One thing to note however is that it is very much self catering. The bistro in the lobby is very small and has a very limited menu. There is a Walgreens approx ten minute walk from the point.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the point”
Reviews.Author: AndyBrussels
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Point and we were very happy. It's not really a hotel, more a sort of an appartment block with hotel service. Don't expect a full breakfast or a great hotel bar. Only 5 to 10 mins from the parks, it was ideal for a family stay. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful especially when we had to take our youngest daughter to hospital. I can thoroughly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness and customer service is tops”
Reviews.Author: pebblelake
Reviews.Content: This self-sufficient establishment has everything you will need - I had originally booked a studio since it was short stay. Viewing it, I found it a bit dark because of location and no balcony, but the unit itself was certainly well laid. I instead decided to view the 1-bedroom and decided to pay the additional cost to upgrade. A true full size unit, this will be your home away from home with a full size fully-equipped kitchen and in-suite laundry, just make a trip to the grocery store and you'll be set. The bed was comfortable with more than enough pillows, and the bathroom was huge with a jet-tub and separate shower. The internet connection in the room was stable during my entire stay which is great for business purposes. The only drawback is that it is not wireless so the dining room table was the office table too, but it worked out just fine. The pool area is quite large and every morning the pool was cleaned, towels are continually being replenished, and more than enough lounge chairs to go around. There is a small fitness centre that would feel smaller if 4 or more people are in there, but the equipment and space do the job well enough. The thing that impressed me most outside of cleanliness was every staff member being attentive - from the front desk to the outdoor staff who will kick up a conversation to make sure you are enjoying your stay.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING book now or you will regret it!”
Reviews.Author: ellax04
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write a review on here although i do use Tripadvisor when planning a holiday and it was on here that i found this amazing hotel so being as it was sooooooo lovely i felt it was only fair to write a review. This truely is a lovely place to stay. I stayed here for 2 weeks with my boyfriend, When we got to the hotel, which is very easy to find and is within walking distance to wet and wild and universal studios we were greeted by the lovely hotel staff. Look out for Britney at the front desk and Ricardo. They are both the most genuine, friendly and helpful people ever and can not do enough for you to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible, We were given advice and maps on local attractions and where to eat and shop which was very helpful. The hotel is very well kept, the pool area is lovely and there are plenty of complimentry towel available. The gym is basic but does the job. It has 2 treadmills, a weight machine, cross trainer and spin bike. The parking is free and there were always spaces whatever time of day. The rooms are lovely! We very kindly got ungraded to a one bedroom suite which is massive. You have a full kitchen with all mod cons and a washer and dryer which also came in very handy being there for 2 weeks. The bathroom is beautiful and has a walk in shower and whirlpool bath. The maid service is great making your bed and replacing towels etc daily. The bed was massive and very comfy, there was 2 televisions one in the bedroom and one in the living room with plenty of channels too. We were on the 5th floor and had a balcony overlooking the pool which was very pretty. The hotel had free wifi in the reception area and wired in the rooms however there was an internet room which you could pay for that also had a printer. Saying this the front desk staff were super helpful and were more than happy to print the odd bit for us when we asked and even offered to check us in for our flight home and printed our boarding cards free of charge. The staff really go above and beyond for their guests. The hotel is big and busy enough that you dont feel lke your the only guest but not so big you get forgotton. It was the perfect place to stay for a magical holiday to orlando florida. We will without a doubt be visiting all the lovely staff at the point again next year. In conclusion if you want a comfortable place to stay, that is modern, very close to all that Orlando has to offer you cannot go wrong here! I believe this hotel will be number 1 very soon,,,, Thank you to all the staff at the Point for making our 2 weeks away with you one of the best holidays ever!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort away from all the madness...”
Reviews.Author: MrsIrving_2011
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at THE POINT ORLANDO RESORT for one of our many stops for our honeymoon... Neither of us has kids, so while we understood that we were in the heart of Orlando's theme park district, we didn't want to be bothered with them the entire time. So choosing the Point and staying there was definitely a good idea.... everything wasn't perfect but we definitely would return.... The way that the rooms are set up is really nice... makes you feel that you are in an apartment.. Very spacious rooms for the price. The lobby is also very pretty.... The parking lot was never too busy, maybe because we were there during the week, but it was spring break... I did NOT like the stain that was on the floor in front of our room and every now and then it smelled like bad water in the hallways.. At one point I asked hubby did he let one go and he said NO... lol But overall, it was a nice experience and really really close to everything near Universal Studios, Wet n' Wild, carnivals, Downtown Disney, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: egmai510
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic deal for the quality of the rooms and service. Will definitely come back again if I return to orlando. The rooms are clean and spacious and location was close to most attractions by a short car ride. The room service is just enough for basic needs---towels, toilet paper, bed making, trash collection, which is how they can keep costs low. I got this hotel for just under $100 a night...awesome! Would recommend this hotel provided you rent a car cuz there's free parking! The only minor thing is there's not many food choices at the hotel, but food is accessible by car.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: GPounce1
Reviews.Content: Went with my friend for spring break in Orlando and absolutely loved it! They took great care of us and made sure that we had absolutely everything we needed...even if that meant helping us order pizza, because we just didn't know where anything was. The room was great, and the maids did a great job of keeping it clean, even in the midst of two college age guys staying in it. The bed was comfy, bathroom is spacious and not cramped, and having a kitchen with a stove, fridge, and dishwasher were just icing on the cake. Also, being 5 minutes down the street from Universal Studios was pretty awesome as well. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, will stay again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MoCherise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back to our trip from Orlando and we stayed at The Point Resort. This hotel was wonderful and the staff was so pleasant and accommodating. They went out of their way to assist my husband and me in everything we needed. We stayed in an Executive Suite and the room was spacious and the bed was so comfortable. I love how close it was to everything. I would definitely stay again and would recommend to all my family and friends. The only complaint that I have is that they should have more than one shuttle going to Universal Studios, who wants to stay at a theme park for 10 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Superb suite resort opposite Wet n Wild and 10 mins from Universal”
Reviews.Author: SianFord
Reviews.Content: We went to The Point resort on honeymoon, as we love theme parks and thought this would be the ideal place. After looking up many reviews on Tripadvisor, we found The Point resort to have glowing reviews, and rightly so. We chose a one bedroom suite for our stay, complete with full kitchen, jacuzzi bath and separate shower, and we were not disappointed. We arrived at the hotel early, so we stowed our luggage at the reception with the lovely lady who greeted us, and she looked after it for us whilst we went across to the next hotel to hire a car for the day. We couldn't believe how close we were to Wet n Wild, as it is quite literally opposite the hotel! We hired a car and headed off to explore International Drive and find a supermarket to equip our kitchen. When we returned our room was ready, so we loaded up a trolley and headed up to our room on the 11th floor. When we first entered the room we could not believe how large it was, with a full kitchen as advertised, a large front room with French doors out to a balcony with the most amazing view. We then went through to the bedroom, with a huge bed and big windows, and next door was a large bathroom with jacuzzi bath, a separate double size shower, sink with huge mirror and plenty of space for toiletries, and a separate toilet. Our first impressions were very good indeed. The kitchen was fabulous, with a small dining table in the front room which was perfect for two. The hotel provide everything you need in the kitchen, and there is also a washer and dryer which made our holiday so much better - nobody wants to spend their precious holiday time at the launderette! There was a basic maid service every day which included fresh towels, emptying the bins and making the bed, and a full service once a week. We stayed at the resort for 2 weeks, so the space and the amenities were important to us. Half way through our stay our super dooper high speed wired internet and our phone stopped working, so I went down to use the phone in reception to make a call. The receptionist was very apologetic, and explained that one of the transformers (or something similar) had stopped working and the phone company were on their way. He connected my call, and apologised again once I had finished - I said that these things happen, and not to worry about it, but he insisted that the hotel take customer service very seriously and removed the daily hotel service charge from our bill for the rest of our stay. Our internet and phone were only out for one day, it was promptly fixed, and a couple of days later we came home to find a hand-written note from the receptionist again apologising for the inconvenience, with a selection of snacks and some bottled water. Their customer service is second to none and we were very impressed! In terms of location, it is on the same road as Universal, and you could even walk it if you weren't afraid of tired legs by the end of the day! We drove there to use the park during the day (paying crazy parking fees at the theme parks is quite irritating, but not much you can do about that), and a couple of times we went to Universal Boardwalk in the evening and took a cab - it was about $7 each way. The resort is right on International Drive, which has great shops, lots of restaurants and bars, and tons of crazy golf! The I-Trolley runs a route that goes past the hotel, or you can stroll up onto the main road (International Drive) and pick up a trolley very quickly and easily. The Point Hotel has a lovely pool and very hot spa pool too, although they have not yet opened the pool bar next to it. They have plenty of loungers and fresh towels available, and some tables with umbrellas for those who prefer the shade. There is a small gym too. We really enjoyed our stay here, the room was fantastic with the most beautiful views, especially at sunset, the service was brilliant and the location is fab. I think the hotel would also suit families, with the convenience of having a kitchen and washer/dryer, the pool is also great for kids, and the proximity to Universal and Wet n Wild. I would highly recommend this hotel, and like to thank The Point for helping to make our honeymoon so fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice.”
Reviews.Author: Patty0127
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. The only complaint I had was that the maid service did not show up until 5:00 pm on Sunday. When the maid service did come we requested a change of bed sheets because they were dirt and they did not change it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suites”
Reviews.Author: tankyouverymuch
Reviews.Content: It's like having your own modern apartment on vacation, great to have a small kitchen and laundry equip. in closet. The wired internet worked great in room. I found the mattress was nice and soft - very comfortable. After returning home, I missed that mattress. Pool area is very nice too. Well maintained hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: motoho88
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, friendliest staff, convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, huge suites, great location”
Reviews.Author: jedi27
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, got an amazing value for the room, which actually was a suite, living room, bedroom, huge bathroom. Excellent location, minutes away from International Drive and all the restaurants there. Very friendly staff, check-in and out done quickly, very professionnal. Booked via ebookers, had 60% off normal price which made it a $ 100.- per night deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: BillyBar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, the rooms very comfortable, and the location very close to Universal Studios (1 mile) away. Also the staff was very friendly and attentive to requests.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to our friends”
Reviews.Author: windjammer1
Reviews.Content: We booked this place for one week while we were in town for the Arnold Palmer Invitational. Once the Invitational was over we enjoyed our time there so much that we extended our stay for two more days before having to leave for home (Ontario, Canada). Our original plan was to leave on Monday after the tournament and head to the Gulf coast for a couple of days. The staff is very friendly and very accommodating. The bed was made, and we had fresh towels every day. It is very close to most anything that you would need.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: themarkkeegan
Reviews.Content: if you must go to orlando, this place is nice and relatively inexpensive. very very close to universal, literally right up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice- but better for people without young kids”
Reviews.Author: mtngyrl_10
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here but, felt the pool was a bit small and quiet for 2 young kids. The pull out was uncomfortable for adults but, fine for kids. The room was super clean and we really loved having a kitchen and washer/dryer. The location was great as it was quiet but, close to International Drive. I liked it here and would stay again although I felt is was not a true 'resort'. However, the staff was great! OUr friends had a great room overlooking the pool (we did not) and their room was bigger (we had a 2 bedroom lock off)- it did make a big difference having the bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: juneroses
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Having washer and dryer in the kitchen area was really nice. Hotel staff were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “New beautiful, clean, fully stocked kitchen, suite for a bargain price. . .Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: kumee
Reviews.Content: I loved the resort! It was all we imagined and more. The bonus was the staff at the resort. Hamid was the first to greet us and give us the vip treatment, but the entire staff was wonderful and responded quickly and efficiently with a smile to our requests. We didn't get the opportunity to use the pool/work-out facility but there will definitely be a another trip to the Point Orlando Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Carlau
Reviews.Content: Great location for Universal Studios and Island of Adventure. In walking distance to City Walk - about 1 mile, taxi back when we were too tired to walk cost only $6. Stayed in a 1 bed suite, very clean, comfy bed, huge living area with kitchen - cooker, fridge/freezer etc, lovely bathroom. Great pool and hot tub. Unfortunately there are not many nice restaurants within walking distance and we needed to use our car a lot for eating out, but the hotel and room made up for this. I would defo stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “You will want to return!”
Reviews.Author: bandaches
Reviews.Content: Rooms are much better than standard hotel rooms, lots of space, jaccuzi tub, the works. Technically can walk to Uinversal if you are ok with crossing two busy intersections. Outdoor pool is clean and great to use. Shuttle service doesn't exactly match Universal hours and special night events and shuttle service doesn't go direct to Universal, it stops at several other hotels, this is the only reason I gave it a 4 on services instead of a 5. Regardless, it was $8 cab ride to Uinversal so no rent a car and no Universal parking fees!

Reviews.Title: “A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!”
Reviews.Author: NDGirl76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Point for a girls weekend. The Point is clean, staff is beyond friendly and helpful. Fabio at the front desk was amazing! The pool was great and had plenty of chairs and towels. The Point is not right on International Drive, if you are looking to walk a little or take the I-Drive Trolly this is the place to be. Would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Don´t miss this hotel”
Reviews.Author: viajera2000_8
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, cleaniless, great pool area, everything you need for a pleasant stay. Front desk helpful, maid service excellent. Everyone is smiling. Would strongly recommend this hotel. One con: no shuttle to Magic Kingdom (think about it, even a paid shuttle would be great).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: shefo60
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It was a welcome respite from the theme parks. The rooms are so clean and lovely. The bed was cozy, the bathroom sizable and immaculate; the kitchen was well stocked. The pull out sofa bed is only for the young. If we were to return we would request a 2 bedroom suite only for the comfort of real beds. While the hotel was at capacity while we were there we were never bothered by noise. You do need a vehicle if staying here as groceries and theme parks are a drive - which was fine by us! There is a shuttle to Universal but the times are very limited.

Reviews.Title: “This was our home away from home....perfect is all I can say”
Reviews.Author: Sunflowers1973
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome in every way...the cleanliness of the room, the spacious layout, the balcony, the pool area...the staff....everything was perfect....We had a one bedroom suite...what can I say...its nice to have a real cup of coffee in a real cup when you are on vacation in your own room. I had a nice balcony view overlooking the pool....a nice big tub with jets for a relaxing bath after a long day.....if anything to use the full kitchen for...we were not in the rooms long enough during the day for any other meal but breakfast....that saved enough money to be worth it...the bed was super comfy.....they had nice furniture with ceiling fans.....I felt safe with the extra hallway you needed to get into to get to your room....there was a door to your room, and inside that door was 2 doors, one was yours and the other was another room....so it was extra secure....the pool area was beautiful and clean and the water was the perfect temperature. The staff was very friendly ...each night we returned back there was someone by the front door saying welcome back...very nice touch...my 14 year old said one night I am ready to go back home...referring to the hotel...that made me smile...it was our home away from home. I will post some pictures later on when we have a chance to settle back in...but thank you staff, it was a great trip and you had a large role in making that happen.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: elsalawy
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through trip adviser (#7 at that time). Having been to Orland numerous times, I have to admit, we never heard of The Point. We booked this hotel because of it's proximity to Universal (One Republic concert). It did not disappoint. The room was specious. Excellent location (if Universal is your destination). Also in close proximity to I-drive. Details: Room was clean, specious, fast check in and check out, free parking, our 12th floor one bedroom had a very nice view from balcony but no wi-fi signal (a good thing that kept our teenage daughter in communication with us) . Full kitchen, washer and dryer (great/but we are on vacation). Bathroom, is very large/nice with a tub. We enjoyed our stay which was carefree. No noise, comfortable bed...a must in my book. Will be back in April for the 30 seconds to Mars concert, will be staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: JJ0719
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews that it got off of trip advisor. We paid around 130 a night, plus a hotel fee (I think around 10/day). We stayed in a junior suite. The room was nice, but I expected it to have a jetted tub, which it didn't. It did have a kitchenette, but if I had know that was pretty much the only difference, I would have just paid the regular room rate. It was a great location and the pool was beautiful. The hotel fee that I mentioned above was for regular ammenities that you would find elsewhere. Also, the hotel did not sell any tickets to the theme parks, which although not a huge deal, would have been more convienent. The hotel also has a bar located in the lobby, but although the hotel said it was open until 11, we went down at around 10 on one night and the bartender was closing up (plus the drinks were around 8 dollars a piece for just house wine). I would stay here again, but hopefully get a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - with caveat”
Reviews.Author: BahamasJen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom, it was spacious and clean, and a great deal. Our only flag to throw up for future guests is that the sofa bed is completely unuseable. I had this before, but thought perhaps that person ws just extra picky, but no - our son actually closed it back up and tried sleeping on it as a sofa, but even that was too short for him. So, if you have a family of more than 2 people, then get a room bigger than a one-bedroom. Only other thing is that we requested a cab to the park as shuttle is not a convenient time, and they did not confirm with us and cab was ordered for wrong time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SJEdwards86
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the Point Hotel (my second stay there). Everything was wonderful. The 1 bedroom suite is huge- with a full kitchen, washer/dryer, bathtub with jets and a pullout couch. We were close enough to walk to Universal Studios and City Walk and took a short cab back. The location couldn't be better- and the staff was extremely accommodating. The only place I want to stay when I go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ReginaE123
Reviews.Content: The Point Orlando Resort was the best hotel stay for a weekend trip to Universal and Islands of Adventure. My niece LOVED the pool which had the perfect layout with towels included and was open from 7am to 11pm. The location was perfect because it was away from the traffic but not far from Universal Studios. The room was perfect with the fridge and microwave and the best bed with the down comforter and pillows after a long day at the parks. The bathroom was perfect with a hot shower! The entire room was well decorated and lived up to the pictures on the website. I was not disappointed by anything and was glad I did my research because it really paid off. The price was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff went over and above responsibilities in helping us with unexpected situation.”
Reviews.Author: fjcam
Reviews.Content: Hotel was all that we expected. Accommodations were outstanding, suite included washer and dryer. The staff went above and beyond all expectations to help us. Would recomment this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Tamyjo02
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and booked this hotel, and I have to say we were happy we did. We booked this hotel for three nights on a Florida Resident special and it was worth every penny. We were travelling from Florida and met my brother who was travelling from Maryland and requested close rooms the day before. We were not promised they would be able to accomodate the request as the hotel was sold out but would do their best. Upon check-in, we were pleasantly surprised that we were right across from each other, this was all we needed to keep the family close as the kids went back and forth to the rooms. Thank you Point staff for accomodating this request. The hotel and rooms are some of the cleanest we have ever seen, lots of space, we packed everything out (we had alot of stuff -lots of closets with storage)and made ourselves right at home. Great night sleep as the hotel halls were quiet. We were not too concerned with a full restaurant being available in the hotel as we ordered out, and partially cooked. The kitchen was fully stocked with utensils if you chose to cook (i did for my toddler and it was the best thing ever for convenience). The food delivery reccomendations made by the hotel were great. The staff was friendly and very helpful and do try to meet your every request. The hotel has a nice pool and jacuzzi area which the kids loved going to every evening after the long day at the park. Location is perfect for those who want to stay out of the mad rush of i-drive but close enough to get you into it if you wanted to be there. Great locaton to parks (we visited Sea World (6mins) and Universal (9mins) on this trip). Very close to restaurants and Super Walmart (which we found ourselves at late at night for forgotten items). The shuttle service was limited, but once again we chose to drive as we had small children and wanted to be on our own time pace so that was not a issue for us to get to the parks either. Thanks Danielle for your good nature attitude as my toddler threw her stuffed animal at the sign at the front desk :). This is our hotel of choice for our future trips to Orlando. If travelling with young children this is the place to stay. We will be back again soon. Great job Point Staff!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PERFECT PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: happymama80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect for us. The location was ideal for our Disney vacation. We were close enough to it ALL. The room had a full kitchen, Walmart was right down the road...so we cooked our breakfast, packed lunches and prepared diner right out of our hotel room. That allowed us to stay in budget and eat healthy meals :-) throughout our stay. Listen, if you are on a budget and are looking to visit Orlando, you must look at The Point. The staff, the hotel, the amenities are simply great! We had such a GREAT time!!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!! STAFF INCREDIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: TampaBayTraverler3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently, the staff is AMAZING!! Goes out of their way to make sure your stay is perfect & memorable!!! Everyone from the front desk (who even calls you on arrival & the night before you leave to make sure everything with your stay was great!) down to housekeeping!! Always saying hello to you! Our suite way very big and VERY CLEAN, which are extremely important, towels were changed daily along with the trash. I was seriously impressed and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: donn3939
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious rooms with well equiped kitchen. Very friendly, helpful staff, especially when a member of our group had a medical emergency. Great location central to all theme parks. Free shuttle to parks. This was my sixth visit to from Ireland to Orlando and this was by far the best accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jimcooper1
Reviews.Content: The 2 and 3 room suites in this hotel are of a high standard and well appointed; with a fully equipped kitchen we had the option of self-catering. Full laundry facilities in room meant we only needed to bring minimal clothing with us. Generous supply of both bath towels and pool towels. If given a choice avoid a room on the East Side of Tower1 as this overlooks a car repair shop: ask for a room that overlooks the pool. The 3 room suite is effectively a 2 room suite with adjoining single room suite which is great if you've got grown up kids as they can be shut off for complete privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tcbiv
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying here. The staff was extremely helpful prior to and during my stay. Also a pleasant staff who answered my questions and assisted with restaurant recommendations. It is near International Drive and I had a view of Wet N Wild Water park while there. The security for the hotel was awesome! From your hallway there is a door which opens to a foyer with 2 doors/rooms. This is great for extra security from people just knocking on your door. I stayed in the Exec Suite. Not too much for kids other than the pool/hot tub. There is a lobby/bar area for adults and may serve breakfast there...Very nice accommodations; a down Comforter with great mattress, nice dishes & utensils, granite counter tops, and 2 closets! On Thursday in the lobby area they offered complimentary 10 min massages. The staff was friendly and enjoyed the convenience of being close to International Drive. The only downfall is the trolley service. There is a trolley station outside the hotel but it only runs every 30-45 minutes. When I was there it was 35 degrees at night and I froze! International trolley runs every 15 minutes! Great place to stay! Oh, very clean and newer.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable and close to lots of activities.”
Reviews.Author: Ayulyn
Reviews.Content: I went to Orlando with a couple of friends to visit Universal and Islands of Adventure. This hotel wasn't difficult to find and is very tall so it's easy to find from far away. It's very close to Universal..maybe about 8 mins with traffic and just a ride down the road is plenty of restaurants, bars, golf, and other sort of attractions. If you're interested in shopping, there are malls probably about 8-10 mins away. The hotel itself is very nice. Upon walking into the lobby, you see it's very nice inside with a little cafe and bar. The lighting is very nice and welcoming. The staff was very kind and gave me no issues at all! I was on the 8th floor which was great because the view of the pool from that high is really nice. My only complaints about the hotel are very minor and more so personal preference..but there were quite a few stains on the carpet in the living room. Also, a couple of nights you could hear lots of banging and movement upstairs above. The hot tub was great! It was very warm and comfortable and it felt nice to be able to hop in after a long day of walking at amusement parks. Overall, this hotel is wonderful. Very clean and the bed was huge! I'd like to have stayed in the hotel for a whole day just to relax in the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean and spacious resort.”
Reviews.Author: EdH22
Reviews.Content: Our apartment was one bedroom with a separate living/eating area and fully equipped kitchen. It included a washer/ drier and the most spacious bathroom I have ever seen in a resort room.. The room was clean and the staff friendly and most helpful. It has a beautiful pool and lounging deck. The resort is located on a quiet side street, yet convenient to the main highways and Orlando attractions. The overall value for the price we paid was excellent and I have already recommended the Point Orlando to friends. resort location

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel.so clean and only 10 mins walk to international drive”
Reviews.Author: sinead7
Reviews.Content: came over from ireland and stayed for 10 days. loved this hotel. staff were so friendly especially chelsea. just wanted to thank the receptionists for all the info and help. would really recommend this hotel and only 10 minute walk to international drive. really clean and everything was thought of in the rooms. the rooms had plenty of space. really enjoyed it and will recommmend it to everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “THERE ARE MUCH BETTER HOTELS IN ORLANDO. AVOID THIS ONE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gottaluvflying
Reviews.Content: My husband & I made the decision to stay here based on reviews we read on Trip Advisor but have to say that our experience at this hotel was one of the worst we have had. We have never had a problem with any of the hotels we have stayed at in Orlando before. This one disappointed us on every single level - only thing in its favour is the location as it is very convenient for Universal Studios and the International Drive area. However, there are much better hotels to choose from in this area and for much better, lower rates as well!! We figured we would pay more as we wanted to treat ourselves before we went on our cruise but it was such a bad mistake. The hotel was not very clean - in fact the carpets were positively filthy!! Also the bed was the most uncomfortable bed we have ever slept on and the result was that neither one of us got much sleep due to the sagging mattress and poor quality of the bed. They really need to invest in some decent beds in this establishment!!! After all, when you book to stay at a hotel it is in the hope of being able to get some rest before continuing with your onward travel - we were both exhausted after our stay at this hotel and found the staff to be very unhelpful and disinterested when we told them of the problems. There are much much better hotels to choose from in Orlando than this one and the biggest mystery to me is how this hotel is so high in the ratings on Trip Advisor as our experience there bears no relation whatsoever to how some of the reviewers have described it. It is as though they are describing a completely different hotel to the place we stayed at!!! I have to agree with the people who have left poor reviews and the best advice I can give to anyone looking for a place to stay whilst in Orlando is to do yourself a favour and give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler12349
Reviews.Content: Great location close to attractions but off the beaten path. Staff was friendly and condo was new, clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: mhfive
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom unit on the 11th floor with a balcony and a view of Universal Studios and Wet-N-Wild. The king size bed was very comfortable. The bathroom with separate walk-in shower and tub was luxurious. Pool area was very relaxing. Our only complaint is the lounge chairs become uncomfortable after laying in the sun for several hours!

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Universal Studios this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Slugbug7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Orlando for our one year anniversary. We were spending the weekend at Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure parks. If you are looking for a convenient, no hassle trip to the parks this is the place to stay. It is only a mile away and is on the same road the park is on. There are restaurants and everything you may need close by but I love that the hotel sits off the road a bit so the noise level is at a minimum. I never once heard cars driving by. We opted for the one bedroom suite for the extra space and full kitchen. To start off the room is great. We were able to make breakfast every morning before heading to Universal Studios and having the in room washer and dryer was convenient for drying wet towels and cloths from being wet at the parks. The beds were more than comfortable and the comforter was the best I've ever had in a hotel. It wasn't cheap and flat and nothing too it like most hotels. It was a nice fluffy down comforter I think. Very cozy. It was also nice having the balcony and being able to have coffee in the morning or watch the sunset or just relax during the evening hours with a breeze. The staff was very friendly and helpful with everything we needed. They fulfilled all of our special requests, which was a first for me. We requested a high room overlooking the pool. The pool area is great and we spent a couple of nights there. My only complaint about the hotel is that there isn't wi-fi throughout...you have to go down to the lobby or bistro area to use it which isn't very convenient. The other is the cost for the breakfast. Save your money and buy food to make in your room for breakfast. Even if it's just bagels and cream cheese it's worth it. Other than those two minor things this resort is great and we will keep this hotel in mind every time we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MDWfan1
Reviews.Content: Counted heavily on other reviews here and was NOT disappointed. Taking two grandkids to Orlando in February is going to be expensive, but we found this hotel a wonderful value. I think they have may favorite hotel swimming pool ever: the right size, the perfect temperature, and the ideal place to use up any residual energy the youngsters had so that everyone could have a great night's sleep. Other upside items? Charming, attentive, professional staff. Great value (worth repeating to anyone trying to find an hotel in February). Good location. Rooms were clean and well appointed--the refrigerator, large microwave, dishes, and silverware were appreciated. Downside? I wouldn't try putting any adults on the sofa sleeper (but it accomodated the pre-teens nicely). Two gin and tonics shouldn't cost $18. Most of us expect bubbles and some agitation for sore muscles in a "hot tub." View = not much....but it IS Florida. Conclusion: warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoIllinoisKat
Reviews.Content: I always depend on Trip Advisor to guide me on my travel selections, so I think it's fair to give back. This hotel is wonderful. The accomodations were very nice and homey. We rented a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen and balcony overlooking the pool, for 3 days. We were so happy with our choice we had to recommend it to everyone. There isn't an actual restaurant on the property, but there are tons of them very close by. If you're looking for a place in Orlando to stay for any length of time, this would be the place!

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean, Convenient to I-Drive/Universal Attractions”
Reviews.Author: legalmoxy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 2 years old so the buildng is new, and the 1 bedroom suite (though cozy) was very clean. I'm always weary of hotel linens and always bring my own. Must say that I didn't even need to use them so the hotel gets an A+ for cleanliness. Also the location is close to everything. Would definetly stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ladybiztraveler
Reviews.Content: I chose Point Orlando because of reasonable rates and online reviews. I was NOT disappointed. I was here for a business trade show at OCC, and it was a short 10 minute drive down Universal to the convention center. I stayed in the smaller suite, but very clean and perfect for 1-2 people. It is meant as an extended stay property, so limited cleaning services per day, (empty trash, new towels), but they will accomodate more if you wish. The fridge and microwave were new and clean, and nice to have a few dishes and glasses to use in the cupboards, vs. plastic cups etc. They have dish washing soap etc. so you can be sure of clean glasses! Wired internet in the room, but it was very speedy and I had no issues with it. The front desk staff was exceptional! Fabio went out of his way to help with some printing requests I had, along with help with directions etc. All staff were super and helpful, great attitudes. The bistro is nice for light tapas and drinks, I did make dinner out of it one night. I didn't get to take advantage of the pool area, but it looked very inviting. I would give this a big thumbs up as far as value and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Creaky Beds, Dirty Carpets & Below Average”
Reviews.Author: angelwings79
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on hotels.com for £84 per night knowing it was expensive for Orlando out of season however after reading the reviews on tripadvisor figured it was worth the extra. The location is perfect just off International Drive and minutes from Universal Studios however the rooms are mediocre and for us the worst part being the creaky, bad quality bed. As soon as we sat on the bed we knew it wasn't right - it was very creaky and dipped in the middle. It felt like we were on a noisy waterbed! We asked to be moved but as the hotel was full the lady on reception offered to send up the maintenance man to repair it. He admitted the beds were cheap and poor quaity - in fact they were two single beds fixed together and the whole thing looked very bad. Someone had broken the wooden slat which explained the dip and feeling of being on a waterbed! As the maintenace men struggled to repair the bed we were allocated a room across the hall which although the bed wasn't broken was equally uncomfortable and squishy. The bottom line is the beds are cheap and not what you expect of a hotel of this standard. The carpets in the corridors were dirty and looked like they hadn't been vacummed for a long time. I think it would be better to forget the kitchenette (unnecessary in Orlando with the multitude of restaurants and food outlets) and invest in good quality beds. A fridge is always handy for drinks etc but the supersize microwave and sink seemed like a poor choice. The staff were friendly and courteous but our overall impression was that this is a minus 3* property trying to be a 4* and falling far short of the grade. Next time we will stay elsewhere as unless you get a very cheap deal here be prepared for a restless night in a very uncomfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rjreisch
Reviews.Content: The Point Orlando Resort is an excellent place to stay while in Orlando. The accommodations met our every requirement. It was centrally located close to all the attractions our family wanted to see during our vacation. We normally stay at a Residence Inn location when we travel however we elected to try The Point Orlando Resort based on our online research and we were not disappointed! I would highly recommend it to friends and family when visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JoSuIL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was great, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “They denied my reservation.”
Reviews.Author: jakcz
Reviews.Content: Booked at a great rate, several folks / rooms in my party. When I pulled into the hotel at 11P, I was informed that my reservation was canceled (a credit card on my travel profile had expired without my knowledge). Absolutely NO notice from the hotel to me, or to my travel agent over this matter. My agent maintains a 24x7 call center, if they would have called it would have been sorted out immediately. My agent (who books for many fortune 500 companies) has never seen this behavior. All of Orlando was sold out (daytona, holiday weekend, several major conferences...), and my only guess is that they used this as an opportunity to resell my room to someone else at a higher rate. Never again will we consider this location in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: hallfamilyx2
Reviews.Content: I would have never stayed here had I not read prior reviews and noticed that it was recognized as a Univeral Studios partner hotel. We were within 5 min of Universal and within only minutes of anything to eat. Wet and Wild Park is across the street. The hotel was clean, staff helpful, and was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: TraxwazNewcatle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights when we first flew into Orlando before traveling over to Clearwater then onto Key West. Wish we had of booked a 2 bedroom instead of a 1 bedroom, nice and clean - lovely kitchnette - great bathroom a decent size - only negative was the pull-out bed was so uncomfortable. Wi-Fi wouldn't work in room. Getting breakfast was a bit of a pain, had to order toast if staff 1 person only on breakfast was busy seemed to take ages going into kitchen to cut more bread - why couldn't they already have a few slices of bread next to the toaster? 1 morning they didn't have any ordinary breakfast tea! We stayed here again for a couple of nights before our flight home, after our trip from Clearwater & The Keys and managed to get a 2 bedroom suite - absolutley fab. 2 spotlessly clean bathrooms, both bedrooms nice and clean with comfortable beds, sitting area, tv in both bedrooms, kitchnette, washer/ nice decent size fridge freezer.

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Cinipp
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful from the staff to the rooms! It is in a great location, very close to all the attractions and yet it is quiet and feels like home! We had a very relaxing time and have already made our reservations to return! I would highly recommend The Point to everyone, families, couples, young and old! We had a one bedroom with a jet tub and full kitchen and balcony overlooking the pool. We wanted a massage and the hotel recommended BELLA-LEILANI massage who offers in room massage services! The massages were excellent and we will be scheduling them again for our next trip! I checked on Trip Advisor when booking the hotel and it lived up to the excellent reviews it has recieved!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better.”
Reviews.Author: IggySevera
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, space, equipment, furnishings and location. Minutes from Universal and International Drive. A doddle to Disney, Sea World and shopping. Exceeded all our expectations. We constantly felt smug we chose The Point and not an overpriced and impersonal Hotel nearby or ripped off at a Disney Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: moransj
Reviews.Content: We booked a room directly with The Point in January of 2011 for a long weekend stay to visit relatives and go to Universal and Sea World. We booked a one bedroom suite after being told on the phone by the reservations agent that we could also have a cot so that our daughter wouldn't have to share a bed with our son. The agent also told us that they had a great business center and Wifi. When we arrived the front desk personnel were brusque almost to the point of rudeness. They looked like we were inconveniencing them by checking in. When we got upstairs to our room there was not cot. We called down and were told they have no cots. We spoke with the manager on duty and he began to grill me about who I spoke with and was I sure that they told me that and basically called us liars. He then began to negotiate with me to upgrade us to a 2 bedroom suite. I asked to speak with the general manager and was told he wasn't there. I then asked them to call him at home and he said he would think about it. I got a call from the general manager who apologized and then gave us the upgrade. For the remainder of the visit the front desk had the same bad attitude as when we checked in. When we asked about their partnership deal with Universal for tickets which was advertised in their lobby the desk staff knew nothing about it. When we went to check out we asked to use the business center to print our boarding passes for the return trip. The business center had a card system where you had to buy preset amounts of time for a large sum which you lost if you didn't use it all. They also only had wifi in their lobby not the rooms. The rooms did have wired internet service but with limited cord size so you were somewhat restricted as to where you could use it. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone because of the staff attitudes and the general misrepresentation of their facilities and services.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place near Universal and water parks”
Reviews.Author: GeoWashDotCom
Reviews.Content: Very nice and comfortable hotel. Good location near Universal and water parks. Nice full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Would Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: baburke66
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived, I was impressed! The resort is beautiful and the staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The suite was clean, comfortable and very spacious - it felt like home. The location is fantastic. The resort is within minutes of all the popular attractions, and close to restaurants. I was especially impressed with how quiet the hotel is. This was not like a typical hotel where you can hear doors slamming and your neighbors in the next room. The quietness of the hotel absolutely contributed to the relaxation of this vacation. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here - for business or pleasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Opinion of my stay at the Point Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: afavata
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very welcoming right from the start. The staff was extremely helpful in every aspect. The first thing I noticed upon entering my room was the cleanliness which is the single most important thing about staying at any hotel or property. I would highly recommend staying here. Great location as well being anywhere between 5 to 15 minutes from the major attractions. Local favorites are very close as well. One thing that I didnt like was the lack of an in room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: sandgk
Reviews.Content: The Pointe was a great spot for out short Orlando visit. The location was central to the attractions yet the area was quiet without the noise/traffic of other areas. The pool/fitness/hot tub areas were a nice addition, especially since the pool was heated. The rooms are nicely appointed. We stayed in the smaller suite. Everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. The kitchenette was perfect for us. There is no stove but we do not cook in the room so that was not a problem Microwave, fridge, dishes,soap towels,coffeemaker,coffee and utensils were all provided.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!”
Reviews.Author: filhotequerido
Reviews.Content: Warm service, excelent rooms, excelent location, near everywere, very good for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: davepga
Reviews.Content: The best deal for the money anywhere in the Orlando area. Clean comfortable rooms, all amenities, and very accommodating employees. Beautiful pool, easy access parking. It doesn’t get any better. Honestly !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AdrienneF09
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick Orlando getaway and stayed at the wonderful Point Orlando. Convieniently located within 3-4 minutes of Universal, about 10 minutes away from the Disney parks and 1 street over from International Drive, this hotel is a perfect option for anyone looking to escape to the sweet Florida sunshine. The rooms are quite spacious and very clean, with perfectly appointed amenities including a kitchenette. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the assistant manager Fabio who was very welcoming and accomodating. I would recomend this hotel to anyone looking for a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Orlando. I will DEFINITELY return to the Point for my future visits. Excellent value for the price...unmatched in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for suite hotel close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: sveetbananna
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, friendly staff... I just wish they had room service and you could adjust the thermostat in the rooms. Also, the little bottles of moisturizer and shampoo in the room had been half used when we checked in- a bit gross.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location , Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StuartCD
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel for this trip we wanted something close to I Drive and the various shopping outlets and restaurants in the area. We weren't disappointed by this well priced hotel. Booked a one bedroom suite and got 804 in tower one for 7 nights - loved it. Good points All the kitchen stuff you'll need to cater for yourself when you don't want a restaurant(although yet to find a US hotel that has an electric kettle to make a cup of tea :-) Excellent friendly service from all concerned with a special mention to Fabio, for who nothing seemed to be a bother and the lady who helped arrange the pizza delivery for us during the rainstorm one evening - we're English and thought we'd seen enough rain at home without going out in it on holiday. WiFi reception was good in the public areas and the free cabled internet in the room was great Free parking and plenty of it, with good security cover in the car park for peace of mind Good central location for any of the parks in the area. Why not a 5 star review ? It was almost perfect, except that the water in the shower could have been a bit hotter and the towels could have been a bit bigger - neither of these would stop us coming back. Also with the suites having so much room it would have been great if there was a safe in the room. However, the hotel does provide free safety deposit boxes at reception, so again not a big problem. In summary: A great hotel in a good location for everything you might want in Orlando at a good price

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff made our stay enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: gmr13
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando for a show at the Hard Rock and saw the wonderful reviews in TripAdvisor for The Point Orlando Resort. We stayed in the Executive Suite, the smallest of the accomodations, since it was only for two nights and there was plenty of room for two people. The kitchenette was well equipped and when I asked for extra coffee the front desk gave me a bag filled with extra coffee packets, sweeteners, etc. While the room was clean and the rate was good the best thing this property has going for it is the people that work there. Always a smile and warm hello they seem to enjoy working there and making guests happy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, CLEAN rooms, polite staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon J
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from Travelocity and after reading some reviews here on Trip Advisor, was a little worried. I found the hotel to be elegant, nicely appointed, with *clean* rooms and welcoming staff. I had NO issues with my stay. The location was good, right off on International drive, and within 5 minutes to both Universal and Sea World. They didn't have any type of market to get snacks, but you are within minutes of a Walgreens. We took the "complimentary" shuttle to Universal a few times. You actually do pay for this in your $10/day resort fee, which also includes internet and in-room coffee. We took the return shuttle at the end of the day and it stopped first at a Best Western that seemed to be far away. Another couple on the shuttle told us that they had taken a cab to Universal and it was only $6. Since it's $15/day to park at Universal, it's well worth any inconvenience associated with the shuttle times (one AM, one PM). We got coffee (Starbucks) and pastries at the Bistro before leaving for the park, both were good. This was the only time I saw the Bistro open, although they also call it a Martini Bar. I could've used one! The pool was very nice, and heated according to my son. I asked the front desk to refer me to a local seafood buffet and the man suggested Golden Corral or Sizzler. Lol. We ended up at Boston Lobster Feast, which was satisfactory, but not outstanding. All in all, this hotel was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a convenient location to all of Orlando. Amazing room as well!”
Reviews.Author: CTD_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is centrally located to all of the amusement parks and near the highway and turnpike. The room was clean and spacious. The staff is friendly and helpful. We had a great time and definitely will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “affordable hotel with excellent bed and good location”
Reviews.Author: AJ-NL
Reviews.Content: Excellent sleeping experience, good shower, spacious room with small kitchenette, free parking, close to main attractions yet 2 minutes away from the busy International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: princessmermaid27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights for our 10 year anniversary. We loved our Grand One Bedroom Suite! We had all the amenities we needed, and more! It was close to everything Orlando has to offer. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: argwatkins
Reviews.Content: Genuinely great service throughout our stay. The front desk could not have been more welcoming and were there to help throughout our stay. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite!”
Reviews.Author: dmarcy82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a getaway, and it surely was. The hotel is actually a condominium complex with extra rooms for hotel rental. Because it is not a chain, it does not do lots of advertising, and therefore, those who stay there are actually serious travelers who have researched where they are going to stay.
