Not once was I bothered by kids running, loud neighbors, or showers from next door. Everything is very quiet, and despite it being a large building, it seemed as if we were there by ourselves. If we needed anything, food suggestions, toiletries, extra towels, etc., the staff was quick to help us. Fabio is a great host, and he actually made the visit more personalized because he would say hello everytime I walked in. He would also ask questions about how our trip was going, all the while remembering what we spoke about last. It made us feel really comfortable. I have a large amount of points accumulated with a chain hotel, and I could have easily stayed at one of those brands for free, but I wanted something more private, so I tried The Point, and it was completely worth it. The pictures on the website and on other travel websites are true to how it really looks, and everything is really clean. The Point is also close to everything, but away enough from the hype and noise of I-Drive. I will return upon my next visit to Orlando, and I will definitely recommend it to others. FYI, there is no full blown restaurant on property (they have a bistro with drinks, small bites, coffee, and breakfast), nor is there room service, but there is really no need for them because the rooms have kitchens, and if you feel like eating late, order delivery, or drive/walk close by to grab something. It worked out well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: MarilynSunshine
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Point Resort in Orlando, for 2 days before a cruise and 2 days after. On our first visit we had a studio suite. The room was very spacious, super clean and had a bar fridge, coffee maker, microwave, dishes and cutlery. On our return we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite that had a living room, dining area, full kitchen with a full size fridge, stove, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, blender, washer and dryer as well as being fully stocked with dishes, glasses, cutlery, pots & pans, etc. The hotel was centrally located, close to great malls and restaurants. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a super place to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great for visiting Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: k9rocko
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the bathroom sink was not draining well. We alerted the front desk and the sink was fixed that day. The hotel was fairly quiet but we did hear people in the hall and plumbing noises at times. Our biggest problem was the light coming in through the bedroom curtain. There was a huge security light outside shining on the hotel. If that light needs to be there the curtains should be changed so that light does not come in around the edges. We hung the extra blanket over the window and it helped a little. Otherwise our room was very nice. We purposely look for a hotel with condo-style rooms (having a kitchen). We also booked this particular room because it has a jacuzzi tub which is very helpful after walking around theme parks all day! Everyone on the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was good for visiting Universal Studios and if we visit Universal again we might stay here as long as we could get a room that did not face a huge security light, or the auto shop nearby. The auto shop was a bit noisy, but once they closed down for the weekend there was no more activity there. Frankly the auto shop was a turnoff for many reasons. We drove to Universal because although the hotel has a shuttle, it only goes once a day. I would think with Universal just a couple miles away a shuttle could go every hour. The parking garages at Universal are a LONG walk to the park entrance and a shuttle would be a great service, even if the hotel had to charge a little for it. The hotel is not in walking distance to any restaurants, although there are many a short drive away. We did not use the pool or the restaurant. Overall, nice rooms, great staff, good value. They just need to dim that light!

Reviews.Title: “a weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: yticroby
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time. The staff was very friendly. We noticed that every employee that we pass actually said Hello to us. That is rare anymore. The room was very clean when we checked in. Everything worked. The front desk staff was always helpful and polite. We will definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with great service”
Reviews.Author: Jim8655
Reviews.Content: The guest room was a suite with a complete kitchen. Very clean and everything was new. Jacuzzi and large shower included. Front desk was very accomodating and pleasent to work with -very helpful with all questions and concerns from any member of the group I was meeting with. Fabio Garcia, the Assistant guest services manager was terrific! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Orlando area for business or a vacation trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great customer service, great price!”
Reviews.Author: hernameisreo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a trip with several friends and- though we had originally booked two suites- we had some last-minute cancellations and needed to cancel one of our rooms. They gave us no trouble at all with the room cancellation, even though it was on the day we arrived. The suites were very well outfitted with washer/dryer, dishwasher, dishes, silverware, everything you could need. We were very comfortable there. It's not the fanciest resort- don't go there for world-class restaurants, amazing views, over-the-top amenities or direct walk-out-the-door access to Universal. But it's a great price, the suites are very comfortable and well-equipped, it has a great hot tub and a pool, a more-than-adequate fitness center and is very close to Universal and other attractions. For those going to universal studios, it is only about a mile on either the shuttle or a cab. The folks at the front desk were always happy to call a cab for us for dinner or other trips. You could walk there if you had 20 minutes to spare.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel among lesser ones close by”
Reviews.Author: kathykb1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in a junior suite which was very comfortable and accommodating for us for the 2 nights we were there. There was a king-sized bed and a pull-out leather couch with a kitchenette (microwave. fridge, sink, dishes, silverware, etc.) We were in Orlando to go to Universal (the Harry Potter attraction was the real reason) and the hotel couldn't have been better located for that purpose. She was flying out of MCO and getting there early in the morning couldn't have been easier! A very easy 15 minute drive! I was returning to my winter home in southwest Florida and easily found my way back to I-4 without a problem. The hotel was clean, comfortable and safe. We would definitely stay there again. We didn't use the pool (too cold) but it looked very nice from the view from our room. It was more of a resort than a hotel just like it is described.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay anywhere else in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: poppyo47
Reviews.Content: Myself d hubby and a group of friends and family wit children stayed der frm d 28th dec 2010 for 11 nights we have been going to orlando 4 d last 4 yrs but stayed elsewhere we had a fab stay at The Point staff Fabieo,Stephie, wer very friendly we enjoyed it so much wer going bak dis christmas place was spotless clean had every thing u could want full kitchen,flat screen television,washing machine and dryer very central wouldnt stay anywhere else in orlando frm now on Alice O Connor Dublin Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable elegance at a discount vs. a full service resort”
Reviews.Author: Lucky K
Reviews.Content: Restructured condo sales from pre-2008 economy... now a limited "resort" hotel. Stay as high up as available for great all kitchen equipped balcony views. Take advantage of individual foyer entrance to each pair of split entry LUXURIOUS rooms with sumptious beds and either a full kichen with huge bath including full tile with glass door shower or the smaller room with wet bar and typical bath. Excellent CONVENIENT LOCATION (best if driving). For 2 experienced male traveles over 50, we chose the seperate rooms within a common entrance at rates below lesser accomodations. To be fair, when we returned days later for another stay, we swapped the type room and chose the other tower for a view of Universal Studios instead of that of the pool. VALUE for room unmatched, yet as a "hotel" it is more of a motel experience. Expect to be impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn12
Reviews.Content: The Point was just perfect. Great location at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ann47ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from point resort hotel had great time , location is good check in was done very quick, staff could not do enough for us ,rooms are spotless fresh towels everyday,outdoor pool,small bar and bistro not huge menu but your mostly out for meals,i was in junior suite its good enough for couple ,has microwave,coffee maker,fridge, I really missed kettle & toaster then it would have been perfect ,if you want bit more home from go for one bed it has cooker ,washing machine dryer, 2 bed is massive ,for extra few bob i would go for 1 bed, next time and i will go back ,has outdoor pool ,jacuzzi,lovely outdoor area also big plans for kids club play area soon ,less than ten min walk from i-ride ,5 min walk wet n wild, good resraurents close ,lovely new hotel only 2 yr old so rooms still new also have minibus that bring you anywhere like Wallmart, premium outlets ,very cheap ,had great holiday ,

Reviews.Title: “Closest villa-style accommodations to Universal Orlando”
Reviews.Author: DanHat
Reviews.Content: Point Orlando Resort offers family suite, or villa-style, accommodations. It is actually a vacation ownership property. However, like almost all vacation ownership properties in Orlando, the rooms can be rented by the night. The Point was built in 2008, so it is very new compared to most of the hotels in the area. It features a south American motif. You can sense a high level of detail in the decor, and in general there is a subtle sophistication that permeates the property. This hotel is the last one in my list of Universal Partner hotels within walking distance of resort. I have included it because it is the closest villa-style hotel to the parks. It is also by far the most upscale partner hotel within walking distance. Now, it'll be a good 25+ minute walk from here over to Universal. But it is a very simple walk--you just head straight down Universal Blvd--and I think it is surprisingly enjoyable. Now this hotel certainly has some downsides. Given the nature of its larger accommodations and upscale feel, the nightly rate is going to be higher than most of the hotels in the area. In addition to this, because the property is so new, it definitely has a not-quite-finished look and feel to it. In fact, last time I visited (about two months ago), their on-site restaurant still wasn't opened. The other major downside to Point Orlando is that every bed in every room is a king--no double doubles or double queens. There are plenty of sofabeds to be found, but it would sure have been nice to be able to book a 2-bedroom suite with a king in the master and two doubles in the second bedroom. Nonetheless, if you are looking for a bit of elegance, a bit of peace and quite (The Point is somewhat removed from International Drive), yet you want to be able to walk to Universal if you have to, this is a fine selection. You can learn more on Universal Orlando Vacations website: http://res.universalorlandovacations.com/DetailedInformation/Hotel/Standalone.aspx?HotelId=MCOUPOR&RemoteSourceCode=LtmsHotel&DestinationCode=MCO&VendorCode=UNT

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous rooms for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Axidtink
Reviews.Content: The suite was beautiful and included a full working kitchen with washer and dryer, a huge bathroom with a tub and shower and a bedroom. The customer service was wonderful and they upgraded our room for free( we just had to ask at check-in). The room cost us less than $100/ night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: cabler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was only 4 nights but would be sure to go back again. The staff was absolutly wonderful, from the desk, to housekeeping, lounge etc. Not a complaint one.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “It wants to be luxurious but isn't - room was just average”
Reviews.Author: sdnl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a one bedroom executive suite. At first it looked great but when you look better you see it's all a bit worn out. And that's really not what we expected. It's also called a resort (and has a resort fee) but had only some facilities. A small bar for breakfast and a swimming pool. That's it. Next time we're taking another hotel. Good points: - friendly dutch receptionist - the bed was good - the bathroom had a big shower place - the complete kitchen Bad points: - room was dusty - windows in bedroom could not be opened - furniture was damaged - many scratches on the walls

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel/Suite near Universal”
Reviews.Author: PiperSport_Pilot
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice, once in a two bedroom once in a one bedroom and would not stay anywhere else. Rooms are huge, nice living room w/ separate bedroom, amazing location and great pool/pool deck. My wife and I stayed here this last visit just to get away for a night and the last time we got a 2 bedroom with another 2 couples (2 bedroom easily slept 6 adults) and we all went out to Universal City Walk for the night. Excellent times, great memories, would recommend to anybody, business, family, etc. A++++++++ The only negative was that we had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: kroly2011
Reviews.Content: The Point, what a disappointment! For the first time the reviews on trip advisor were nothing that I was expecting. I will never stay there! Good location and good room size, that´s it! I stayed there for 10 days (prepaid) and they only cleaned the room once, what a dirty place to stay! They forgot to replace the room towels at least 3 times! Maids came in to clean and they cleaned my daughter´s perfume. I talked to the housekeep manager, Adriana dos Santos, and she did nothing!!! She just said that the hotel had no responsibility! Do we need to keep kid´s perfumes in a safe? It really ruined my stay in Florida. I definitely do not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: mickey1888
Reviews.Content: The Point was everything we were expecting from reading the reviews on trip advisor.We had the two bedroom suite, it had everything you would want, it was first class.THE BEST THING I CAN SAY IS BOOK THIS HOTEL ,YOU WILL NOT BE DISSAPOINTED. There were six of us, 4 adults and two children(2&10) and our choice of the point made for a brilliant Xmas holiday. CO DOWN, IRELAND.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families needing extra space and a good location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOfFour_Cph
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the two bedroom apartment. Very convenient location and good sized rooms' Would definitely stay here again, if in Orlando and would is absolutely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “extremely clean, spacious, modern and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: ClockworkAlliance
Reviews.Content: My family and I visit orlando regularly for both business and lesiure, now that I have discovered The Point Resort, there is no need to even consider any place else. The staff are very professional, very friendly, very courteous and accomodating. They always address you with a lovely smile and inquire of your stay. The rooms are nicely furnished and well laid out, with Free High Speed internet. I have already encouraged one of my close friends to vist there. Great job guys thanks for making our stay pleasurable and memorable also special thank you to Mr. Hamid Jamai who welcomed us at 3.30 AM, Hamid you;re the ultimate professional and your boss should know this

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pbkjoseph
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place with in-room accommodations for cooking and laundry for our weeks' stay in Orlando. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. It turned out even nicer than we had expected. Room was large- especially the bathroom and very clean. We booked online and were careful to read all the reviews. If you book online, do expect to pay the resort fee on check out- not unreasonable. Online services like Expedia or Travelocity tend to gloss over there are charges are covered by their bookings. We recommend this hotel to anyone going to Orlando. Good locations- close to Universal Studio parks and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean & affordable”
Reviews.Author: jenskiesq
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Point Orlando during our 3-day stay in November 2010. We had a lovely room with a very comfortable bed. The efficiency kitchen was great & helped us to save money (we made our own breakfast and snacks in the room). The shuttles to Universal and Disney were excellent. The bedding and mattresses were clean...spotless, actually. I would recommend this as a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel within the Action”
Reviews.Author: Janny_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at The Point Orlando Resort in a 1 bedroom executive suite. Location is very close to International Drive but far enough away not to be bothered with traffic. Given the time of our stay and the pool not being utilised , I do think it could be noisy during peake times. Parking at the Resort is free. The suite itself was comfortable with small balcony overlooking the pool. 1 bathroom with bath and seperate shower. A king sized bed in the bedroom, sofabed in the lounge and small kitchen which included a washer and dryer. The reasonable resort fee included free wireless internet access, bed making and changes of towels. I did wonder what it was going to take for them to change the tea towel though. I booked this accomodation through the hotel itself and as I had signed up to receive their e-mails , got a free breakfast offer in the form of vouchers for two people for the length of our stay. Even thouugh we did not use all the vouchers, I found this stay to be exceptional value.Check -in was ok but not outstanding. Check-out was the same.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else when I'm in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ant0725
Reviews.Content: A+ service. Comfortable beds. Fridge, oven, & microwave in the junior suite. Close enough to walk to I-drive. Pool. Great price for the amenities! Could use upgraded fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Good under used hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnepatricia
Reviews.Content: This property is new, clean, large and VERY reasonably priced. The rooms come in various sizes - studio, one bedroom and two bedroom. All have at least partial kitchens (studios) and plenty of room. The staff is friendly and helpful. To really enjoy staying here you need a car. There is really nothing within walking distance, including restaurants. While the breakfast is quite adequate, the dinner is NOT. It's referred to as 'tapas', but really it's a very abbreviated bar menu. Great pool area (didn't use it because it never got above 40 degrees while I was there).

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Always Hits the Mark”
Reviews.Author: Special-treats
Reviews.Content: Once again, a brill stay at The Orlando Point Resort, this time in a 2 bedroom suite. Cannot fault this place; the staff, the facilities, location, spot-on. Got a good deal for 8 of us by turning up at Reception and asked what their best rate was - $159 per night. Staff are very, very nice (thanks to Sophia for her helpfulness). I'm hoping to be back maybe April time to see my daughter and as ever, I'll be staying here again. Cannot recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Awesome Room!”
Reviews.Author: JGSWOMAN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here just for one night to get away, and we were very pleased. The pictures on the website were exactly how our one bedroom was. Everything was very clean and new appliances, granite counter tops. There was nothing to complain about. The staff was extremely nice. They allowed us to check out late so we were able to sleep in. I would suggest getting the voucher for the breakfast up front. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “where do I start with this horror”
Reviews.Author: badgeaz
Reviews.Content: Ist let me say This is a hotel for business travelers. 2nd The 2nd night we are there security knocks on our door at 11:45 pm telling us we have a "package" We did not and never opened the door. No apology from the front desk about that. The shuttle service provided by New Way is horrible. The drivers knowledge of the english language is poor at best. All they know is how to get the guests driven to the various parks. They have no knowledge of other things like places to eat etc near the hotel. The concierge consists of a flat panel tv that you do research on your own. The shuttle company also is not aware of the various hours that the theme parks may alter during various times of the year.example seaworld closes at 7 pm on a m onday had to wait till 8 pm for the shuttle and we were the only 2 on the property when it's 33 degrees out. Also 1 dropoff time and 1 pickup time 10pm is not convient for lots of people especially if you have kids which I don't. So overall for the cost we paid for the 7 nights we stayed here I will stay somewhere else nhext time I'm in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is very good.”
Reviews.Author: andrealeite
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel. All utensils were in need at my disposal. The reception staff were very attentive and accommodating. The hotel has an infrastructure that serves all kinds of people. I will return often and recommend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property with beautiful modern and clean suites”
Reviews.Author: YenkoSYC
Reviews.Content: The Point exceeded our expectations. We stayed with 2 young children in a 1 bedroom suite unit. The suite was very clean, spacious, modern and the bathroom was beautiful. The suite is a condo style unit with a very nice kitchen and washer /dryer and all appliances were practically new, perfect for famalies. The layout of the unit is nicely done with a seperate master-bedroom(the kids slept on the pull out couch which was fine for them, since they are 10 and 8 yr olds, for older teenagers you might want to consider the 2 bedroom suite). The staff was very curtious and attentaive. The location was very good about 7 minutes to Universal Studios and about 15 minutes to Disney Parks. The Point has a small private feel to it, the bar is very small and doubles as the breakfeast buffet. We would definetly stay there again and recommend The Point to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Willowbrook604
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly. Front desk very responsive. I called twice - first to have one of the TVs re-programmed and next, to help pull out the sofabed. Housekeeping was sent promptly. Bar is small but adequate to serve all tenants. They even had a continental breakfast buffet that was reasonably priced. Shuttle only comes to pick up once, however, at 8:40. If you want to get to the parks early or return to the hotel for a midday rest you have to call a cab. Front desk will do it for you, but you have to pay the fare whereas the shuttle is free.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious”
Reviews.Author: whatever33157
Reviews.Content: I went for my honeymoon. The hotel was very comfortable and the room was huge! I called reservation services countless times before my arrival and they were always very accomodating. They even upgraded us to free breakfast everyday and we stayed 6 nights. We thought breakfast was delicious and the lady behind the counter was quick to make us a ham and cheese croussaint sandwich even though we arrived there past the breakfast hour (breakfast supposedly ends at 11 am). They have a breakfast buffet Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, but I preferred the ham, egg, and cheese croussaints during the week. The kitchen in the room was awesome, especially since I hate eating out all the time. Although the lobby is not as awe-inspiring as say, The Peabody Hotel, no other hotel can compare to the spacious and well-equipped rooms of The Point Resort. The value for the money was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ver0nicaS
Reviews.Content: My stay was very nice here. I just wish I didn't have to pay so much money for a two bedroom suite when I only needed one! Also, I wish my requests to the hotel was guaranteed and granted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price!”
Reviews.Author: LFranco
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after spending the day in the Universal parks. I wish we had more time to stay in this resort because it was wonderful for the price we paid. We traveled with 4 adults and booked a 2 bedroom suite. We had more than enough room and booked at this hotel because we were looking for a shared common area to spend time together instead of sitting in someone's bedroom. We were not disappointed at all in the room! It was very clean and spacious! The staff were polite throughout our stay, and even allowed us to split up our bill onto 3 different cards as we were checking out without grumbling at all! I was very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hakmum
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't look like much on the outside, but the room was wonderful. Simple and modern decor, very clean, ample room size and a kitchenette. Stayed in a suite. Location very convenient to Universal Studies. Limited shuttle service, but one morning was taken to the studio in a limosine! The staff was very friendly and helpful. I left something valuable in my room at check out and it was found and returned. My room was on the 12th floor and it was very quiet. It is misleading, however, to call this a resort. The pool area was lovely. The restaurant and bar were essentially a small bar that also served a very limited selection of food. Ate at Seasons 51 and at Antonio's nearby. Highly recommend them both.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest employees I have seen in a long time”
Reviews.Author: liz92490
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not large but is nice. Pool area is very nice with a gym and soon to open pool bar. Very well kept. Rooms have a very convenient fridge and microwave which came in handy when we got sick of eating out. The employees were extremely friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome and glad to be here. Free internet is wonderful and nice to not have ti pay for parking

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MotherInDuluth
Reviews.Content: The two bedroom suite is HUGE! The suite was nicely furnished and spotless. We were pleased with the bed comfort, the staff, the location (this was a Universal trip), the bathrooms . . . It would be perfect for grandparents traveling with a family of 3 - 4. For this trip I was with my sister-in-law, teenage daughter and her friend. When you enter the suite, there is a "foyer" and a door (with the door to each suite locked). There are not door stops and the doors do not stay open. We used the plant from the table in the 1 BR suite as a door prop and just flipped the lock on the smaller suite so that it didn't lock. The teens pointed out that there is no full length mirror. The washer/dryer and dishwasher were loud when running if you were in the living room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevedoggy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel great staff great location great holiday.will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ThinkGemini
Reviews.Content: The room was like a small apartment with everything you could possibly need supplied! Very spacious! The internet cord supplied could not reach outside of the bedroom, but we brought our own just in case! The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in! The jetted tub was my go to after every theme park! The shower was also very spacious and the kitchen had everything you would need for a weeks stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: CorkBlakey
Reviews.Content: A great stay with six friends had a ball hotel excellent nothing bad at all to say staff great in particular Fabio

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: robyogajayd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the way but the comfort makes up for it. Very Upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was an aaaaaawwwwsome experience”
Reviews.Author: Naswellw
Reviews.Content: If it could have more private access and HBO this could make it almost perfect. The most important thing is I will definitely return before I try anyone else and I've already recommend a lot of my friends and familes

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: KTMachine7758
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at The Point resort and I now wish I had stayed longer. We attended a concert at the Hard Rock Live and wanted a place close in proximity while not blowing out the budget and this exceeded our expectations. Great view, comfortable sitting areas and bed. Excellent flat screen TV, microwave, full size fridge, coffee maker, washer and dryer, beautiful bathroom. What truly stood out was the incredible customer service and friendly attitudes from all employees we encountered, especially the front desk. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic. Will definetly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: alanandgigi
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is fabulous. Everything you need is there. The location could not be better. This was an excellent experience. Well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: nisha1896
Reviews.Content: I booked my room at Point Orlando after reading Trip Advisor reviews. The room was nice, and the base rate seemed reasonable, but the extra $10.00 per day "resort fee" seems unreasonable. Why not just include this fee in the basic rate? The hotel just didn't have a resort feel. The family in the room next to us in which we shared the same foyer chose to leave their door opened a lot which means we saw and smelled more than we cared to. Plus, parking was a nightmare! There are no rear or side entrances so all guests must enter the front. Be ready for a very long walk to and from the entrance to your car which is the last thing you want to do after spending all day at theme parks. We wanted to spend an extra day in Orlando, but didn't wan't to dole out another $90 at Point Orlando. On the morning we checked out we booked a room on Hotwire for $42 at Spring Hill Suites just down the street. We found that hotel much more comfortable with free amenities including free breakfast. Plus they had a room available and let us check in at 10 AM. My next visit to town will not be at The Point Orlando. I'll take my resort fee elsewhere thank you...

Reviews.Title: “We would stay next visit”
Reviews.Author: NC485
Reviews.Content: Stay above the 2nd floor if light music from the pool/spa area from 7 - 11 will bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Orlando Hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoBunnie
Reviews.Content: As a Native Floridian, I've been to Orlando many, many times and stayed in all sorts of places. This hotel exceeded all of my expectations and will be my first choice when returning to Orlando. The beds were extrememly comfortable (I even found myself searching for the tag on the pillows - no luck, so I could purchase some when I got home). The rooms were very spacious and clean. The staff was super friendly and helpful. And it's in a quiet and convenient location. Fabulous experience all around!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: stuffs_nz
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The room was spacious, clean, tidy and very well presented. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Free parking and internet. Close to attractions on International Drive. Good place to base for theme parks and other sights near Orlando, I.E. Daytona and Kennedy Space Centre.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: JDP1980
Reviews.Content: If you are ever on your way to Universal Studio's this is the place to stay! I couldn't believe the size of the rooms and for under $130 a night. They may not have room service but the pool and friendly staff sure make up for it. I can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BOYNTONCHIC
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the point the other day and loved the hotel. Right off International drive and easy to get to the other major highways in the area. We checked in late a nd looked kind of bedraggled yet the staff was lovely. The room was spotless and very nicely laide out. The best part was the silence. No noise from the halls filtered into the room. I woulld stay there any time I was In the area. Too bad it was so cold out woepuld have loved to gone into their beautiful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location for Universal Studios visitors”
Reviews.Author: HoosierEvilQueen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quiet, clean pool area - rooms were well appointed - staff was knowledgeable and incredibly helpful. Free shuttle to and from Universal, Wet N Wild, and even a shuttle to Magic Kingdom. Saved us some $$$ when it came to parking fees :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dane2992
Reviews.Content: If you want to watch Dvd's, the hotel does not provide dvd players. besides that, it had everything you will need for your trip

Reviews.Title: “You can do better for the same price”
Reviews.Author: justwritingareview
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was friendly. However, the phone in the room would not dial front desk, I asked for a wake up call but never received one, on 2 different occasions (after housekeeping had already been to my room) someone was in my room. I knew this because the first time it had happened I came back to my items moved and 2 lights on that were off when I left. The second time, there was a cable/internet man in my room. He told me the people in the room next to me had poor service and that he needed to be in my room to fix it. As a woman who traveled alone for most of this trip, this was an uneasy feeling. The mattress in the bedroom reminded me of a visit out west...a big mountain between 2 valleys. The mattress on the pull-out sofa had springs showing. I was charged a resort fee after I had arrived, so it was an additional charge I wasn't aware of up front. I saw there was a pool and an exercise center, but most hotels have those. I would not have labeled this a resort. Housekeeping only makes beds. My used towels weren't even replace with new ones. The hotel was very pleasing to the eye but I prefer quality over aesthetics.

Reviews.Title: “The Point Orlando is perfect for families.”
Reviews.Author: larryoberly
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Lobby area is classy and feels like an upscale hotel. Pool area is exceptional. Very close to Universal, Wet and Wild and International Drive. Only 15 minutes to Disney and 1 hour to Cocoa Beach and Airboat rides.

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Juwels66
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Booked a room with washer and dryer so we did not have to pay extra for baggage. Room had full kitchen, nice tv's (but no hbo), even a toaster so we made breakfast each morning before heading off to amusement parks, etc. There are things to do, movies, grocery stores, restaurants all within a mile of this location. Bathroom was a lovely experience with jacuzzi tub and shower stall fit for two. Exceedingly clean and roomy for the price. Front desk attendants very helpful with recommendations, directions, and accommodated our request for printing out boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra few bucks. Trust me, its worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: McStew1
Reviews.Content: After spending many hours reviewing hotels in the Idrive area we went for The Point Resort. I feel that a hotel can make or break a holiday as it really sets up the mood for the whole trip. We had visited Orlando twice before staying in what I would call budget hotels. We paid just under $100 for the executive suite per night and it was money well spent They were great, we checked in at 10am even though the booking said 4pm checkin. The room was fantastic, it had everything you need for a stay of 6 days and was spotless. The pool area had plenty of seating and had a hot tub, free towels and was kept very clean and tidy. The resort has a small bar that we did not use but looked well stocked and cosy. The hotel is just behind Wet & Wild so is very handy for Universal Studios and there is also an Iride stop just outside. You get what you pay for in this life and in this case its true. For an extra say $30 per night we got a hotel way above the level of those in the area which made our holiday. Hope this helps some people do the same.

Reviews.Title: “An Ok place but not the luxurious apartments promised.”
Reviews.Author: sassysassy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 15 nights from last month. Loved the look and sound of its description. On arrival, the receptionist was jovial and welcomed us (hubby, daughter and I) to a two bedroom luxury apartment on the third floor in tower one. Our arrival was pretty late so we made use of the "welcome coffee" that awaited us and retired for the night. We had noticed that the walls were in need of refreshing- a splash of paint to cover the many-scuffed and stained walls. However, we have stayed in worse places. I found it hard to get to sleep because of a droning noise. I turned off the A/C but that wasn't the source of the drone. I discovered that right next to the building, there was a small building that I think was a powerhouse or pump for the pool or electricity. I bought earplugs from Walgreens and problem solved! However, I now learn that the higher the floor, the less the noise. In daylight, the many stains on the carpet was very obvious. I was put off a walking in socked feet bit. However, we decided not to complain as we didn't want to waste time looking for another suite so close to the Halloween rush. We made a point of staying out as much as possible. We did make use of the lovely swimming pool and hot tub and also their shuttles to Disney were excellent! The maids came in every day to make the beds and empty bins as promised. We were taken aback by the resort fee as other, who have pointed out on this site. To conclude. The Point is an OK place but in dire need of a lick of paint. The carpets need steaming and the third floor tower one is noisy. The pool is nice as is the hot tub. The shuttles are dependable. I did expect better cleanliness for the price I paid for the suite. I would go back but only if painted and deep-cleaned carpets but not tower one third floor.

Reviews.Title: “The Point was elegant, quiet, clean and spacious.”
Reviews.Author: BetsyN
Reviews.Content: I really liked The Point. We had a one bedroom suite which included a full kitchen. The room looked new and was very clean. We really used the kitchen, which includes cooking utensils, pans, dishes, cups, silverware, etc. Full size frig, stove, dishwasher and washer/dryer - all worked fine. Having the kitchen saved us a lot of money because we ate at our room instead of the parks. We also did laundry, with detergent provided by the hotel. The stackable units do not hold regular size loads of laundry, but it was fine for us. You are close to I-4 and Universal Blvd, but away from the worst traffic. It's about 10 miles to Disney World. The pool was clean and enjoyable - pool towels provided so don't pack your beach towels! We did not check out the bar/breakfast offerings, we ate in our room. We really enjoyed The Point and it will be our first choice when we return to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cmorr84
Reviews.Content: I chose this resort based on the extraordinary reviews I noticed on-line, but I've been disappointed from time to time with such reviews. However, this time the reviews were right! The cleanliness, service, value, and location of the resort were beyond my expectations. The staff are so courteous and willing to meet the needs of special request. I surprised my sister and brother-in-law with an Anniversary weekend and the staff went out of their way to make this weekend even more special, providing a free upgrade to say the least. The resort is in such a perfect location that everything you want to go to on International Drive is just minutes away. Pointe Orlando is only about 5 minutes away which is where I took them to BB Kings Pointe Orlando for dinner, dancing, great drinks, live band and so much fun. The rooms were spectacular at the resort. The Executive Suite is warm, cozy, sufficient and comfortable, but the One Bedroom Suite w/ full kitchen, living room and dining room are, a beautiful bedroom, and bathroom w/ jacuzzi tub and separate shower is out of this world gorgeous. The views are wonderful. The description of these rooms don't do it justice. It is so much better than described. The only thing I could say requires improvement is the breakfast buffet selection, but I am sure they will adjust this easily. This is now my resort of choice whenever I travel to Orlando. It was definitely beyond my expectations and better than all the resorts of its value/class,

Reviews.Title: “Very hard to find faults with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GBland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a studio room which was more than adequate for us. The room had a kitchenette, ensuite, sofa and huge bed. No balcony but then we didn't need one. Hotel was quiet, and staff very friendly. Pool nice and a suntrap from midday onwards. Is walking distance of restaurants and nightlife but you don't hear anything as it just far enough away to be peaceful. We hired a car but walked most places. We would recommend active people like ourselves walk to universal. Pleasant walk that only takes a half hour. Wet & Wild 5 mins walk away. Only minor gripes about the hotel - studio room only had a microwave and coffee maker (no oven or kettle) I can't eat microwave foods and also can't drink coffee, so no hot food or drinks for us. Also would have liked housecleaning to brush the ensuite floor each day as it looked quite dirty by the end of our 8 day stay. Bar was small but nice, though never ate there. In all I would return - brilliant value. Have one slight concern the new Development plans will block the sun from the pool area, but I could be wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Make a Point and stay at The Point!”
Reviews.Author: dts2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in October.We had a studio apartment and the only drawback was the lack of a kettle in the kitchenette.We asked for, and were given, a toaster.The rooms were very comfortable and airy and the staff were most helpfull. There are KFC, Wallgreens and iHop within 5 mins walk. Wet n Wild is a short walk away and Universal is a 20 min walk or a $7.00 taxi. Caution: when ordering a cab at Reception ask for one with a meter.Cabs without meters charged $12.00 for trip to Universal.We look forward to our next visit!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kieran23
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from vacation in Orlando and i have to say what a wonderful time we had staying at the Point Orlando Resort. We stayed in a two bed family suite and i have to say we had plenty of space and the facilities provided in the room were second to none. the location of the Point is excellent. it is located just off I-Drive and within minutes of the I-Trolley. all the theme parks are not far from the hotel and they provide a shuttle bus to magic kingdom, Universal and Sea world. the Point Resort provides a central location for your vacation and i cannot speak highly enough of it. we will certainly stay in the Point when we return for our next vacation in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the resort immensely”
Reviews.Author: a_k_m_gn
Reviews.Content: The Point Resort was clean, convenient with full kitchen and laundry available in the condo and is close to most tourist attractions. The first hotel I've slept through the night in, as it was very quiet and the bed was so comfortable. If there were one draw back, I would say that they could offer more transportation options to and from parks. I had great difficulty returning from one on one occasion. Overall, I would certainly stay there again, the value for the money was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel convenient to Universal”
Reviews.Author: neilleucadian
Reviews.Content: This was a comfortable, clean hotel, with super attentive and efficient staff. Our family stayed here 3 nights, and enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi area and in-room internet connection. There was a free shuttle to Universal theme parks (5-10 minute drive), and it's also close to International Drive, which has numerous restaurants and shops. We liked having a washer and dryer in the room, with a package of detergent. The one negative was the breakfast, which was expensive and not very good. I would recommend eating elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: pdemarine
Reviews.Content: Before I stayed here I had a few questions I couldn't find the answers to so I will answer them here for you. The first was the resort fee. The resort fee was $9.99 a night and there was about $8.00 a night in sales tax. The second was internet access. There was no wireless internet access in the room but it was available in the lobby area. Upon checking in to my room I located a labeled internet hard line hidden behind the LCD TV in the living room for internet access. The third question I had was room balcony's. Every one and two bedroom suite had a balcony. There are studios available that do not have a balcony but I stayed in a one bedroom suite. There is no balcony furniture at the resort which is understandable for safety reasons (I would hate it if a chair was thrown at my head while walking to my car). As for the room the furniture was nice. The room had a stacked washer/dryer, dishwasher, oven, microwave, dishes, silverware etc. My only complaint was the low pressure water saving shower head in the room. I would recommend booking on their website for the best rate. You can get a reduced rate for all sorts of things. Just like them on facebook and you can get $20+ off a night.

Reviews.Title: “good value, clean hotel, close to universal”
Reviews.Author: qbea
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights with spouse in a 1bedroom suite. His sister, nephew and friends stayed for 2 nights in a 2 bedroom suite next door. When we 1st arrived were disappointed by the appearance on the outside, the lobby and the hallways. Do not be fooled. the expenses for this hotel were put into the rooms themselves and maintaining. each suite had a separate kitchen and living room w/pull out couches, a table and 4 chairs, flat screen tv in living room, another tv in bedroom, bathrooms with jetted tubs and showers, dishwashers, washers & dryers, dishes, utensils, coffee pots, even a teapot! hotel supplied laundry detegerant and dishwasher detergent. pool is not very deep 5 ft, but open early and closes at 11pm. jacuzzi nice. cannot ask for a better place to stay for the money. took a shuttle from the airport - around $60 for 2 ppl R/T (Mears shuttle must pay in advance) and a cab ride from hotel to universal ranged between $6 to $8 - how can you miss? can walk to wet & wild - about 1 1/2 blocks and 3 blocks to i4 where you can ride the trolley cheaply. only disappointment was 'restaurant' which was really a bar. there was a brkfst buffet for $9 per person-it was ok. closed for lunch and reopened at 5pm-but I wouldn't eat there. can get delivery from local restaurants or walk somewhere else. everything else was good and we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “one word= awesome”
Reviews.Author: SEANB12
Reviews.Content: stayed here in nov 2009 got a great deal i paid £1550 for two persons and im going back this year same dates although the price has gone up to near £2000 i had to return to this place, the rooms are top class,staff are A+ everything about this place is so good. Only one word can decribe it awesome. Would recommend this place to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: jmarian
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from The Point Resort Orlando having stayed there with my two sons and their wives and we were absolutley delighted with the accommodation and proximity to so many amenities!! Wet and wild within a five to ten minute walk and a short taxi ride to Universal, roughly 5 TO 6 Dollars. Be careful to ask for a taxi with a meter as other cars have a standard charge of 12 Dollars. Staff were very helpful and rooms were clean and spacious. No Kettle in the i bed suite but a microwave to heat stuff in. Lots of cutlery and plates/ cups, if you want to eat in and Wallgreens within a ten min walk for groceries cosmetics if you wish to availof this. Kentucky Chicken beside Wallgreens and Dennys if you want a nice breakfast,though the hotel does provide buffet breakfast also. Would definitely reccommend this hotel and would stay there again. well done The Point!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Beat”
Reviews.Author: Diarmaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Point for 3 nights, whilst in the Orlando - International Drive area. It's very close to some of the big attractions. Universal Studios is minutes away (by complementary shuttle). Wet and Wild is about a 5-10 minute walk. Sea World/Aquatica also very close by. The hotel is located just off International Drive and is a bit isolated in that sense. However, the rooms (we got a complementary upgrade) were stunning. Very spacious, huge bathroom, kitchen area, living room. The rooms were also spotless and modern. The staff at all times were extremely helpful and there are free shuttles to the parks. The outdoor pool (with jacuzzi) was also excellent. Free parking was also provided. For the price, this hotel offered amazing value for money especially with the suite we were given. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE, RIGHT BY UNIVERSAL!”
Reviews.Author: angelxxoh
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Its clean, convienently placed, and you cannot hear ANYTHING thru the walls. =] We come every year and have absolutely nothing bad to say! You CANNOT beat the price, either! SUCH a WONDERFUL quality room for the price. right down the road from universal studios/islands of adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Very inviting and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shayliz
Reviews.Content: Check-in process was simple.. our room was on the 8th floor and was great. We had a 1 bedroom suite with a kitchen & washer/dryer. The kitchen was a nice size and the room was well laid out. Our bed was very comfortable and the size of the master bath was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest room I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: ThisGuy10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online for my wife and I for our honeymoon. We wanted a suite w/ a king sized bed. When we first walked in, the first thing we noticed was how clean it was. I used to work at a hospital and have seen sterile operating theaters w/ more dirt on the floors. The bathroom was big enough to play hockey in, huge garden style tub, walk-in shower, large granite-top counter w/ sink, separate toilet closet, full size linen closet, beautiful waxed tile floor. I'm not kidding when I say you could have eaten off the floor it was so clean. Towels were replaced daily. The bed was so comfortable, we missed breakfast all three mornings we were there. Pillows were very comfortable, not too firm or too soft. They were the short style that most places have switched to, but there were some longer ones in the closet, as well as extra sheets. The kitchen was fully equipped w/ a full size fridge, range, dishwasher and stackable W/D, as well as dinner ware for 6 people, pots and pans, a butcher block and jar of kitchen gadgets. If we had stayed longer, I would have hit the grocery store and cooked for us. According to some literature in the room and in the lobby, this hotel has "ownership opportunities" which usually means "time-share." Nothing in the booking info mentioned TS, or I probably would have booked elsewhere. That said, at no time were we ever asked to attend the "Presentation" or in any other way approached by anyone about anything TS related. We spent most of our time at the theme parks, but coming back at night truly felt like coming home. Nothing about the room felt hotel-ish. There were ceiling fans in both rooms, central A/C, good size flat panel TV in the living room, decent TV for the bedroom, but we didn't watch much TV. Parking was adequate, we were issued a permit for dashboard display. They do have on-site security as well as a well-lit parking lot. It's a little bit of a drive if you're going to do Disney, approx. 15-25 min depending on traffic, but is a perfect spot if you're doing Universal like we did, literally down the street. It took us longer to find a spot in parking garage than it did to get there from the hotel. Lots of shops and restaurants are within a few minutes drive. I hope everyone's experience at this hotel is as good as mine was.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOLIDAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: ILoveHolidays555
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and this was easy the best holiday i have ever been too i went for 14 nights can came back on the 14th oct , and i must saay i loved every second of it , i traveled with my boyfriend and his parents. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment , ( me and my boyfriend got ther suite) , the hotel room was very comfotable had a small kitchen and bathroom with an over bath shower it also had a lounge (converts to sofa bed) and eating area. The suite has a large lounge area leading on to a balcony , the kitchen was all granite work tops and had an huge fridge as well as a huge oven , micro wave and washer and dryer.then a seprate bedroom with agaiin a huge cosy bed, leading through a seprate door to a massive bathroom jet bath, walk in shower LOVELY :) The location couldnt be anymore better 2 mins up the road is wet and wild , 5 mmins in the car and your at universal , 10mins and your at sea world and aquatica , and just off the interstate your at disney .. loads of resturants around the area and if you are looking to stay defo make a trip one night to congo river crazy golf , it has live gators and if your lucky like me you might get to hold one , defo have a good chat with congo's assitant manager phillip ,, This hotel and holiday in general had such an affect on us all his parents are considering buying one of the rooms and i sat crying cause i had to come home , Florida its self is very magical and this hotel just makes it that little more special

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value and location but with small comprimise”
Reviews.Author: erniesands
Reviews.Content: Superb location just off international drive but very quiet and peaceful. Very cheap for the area and the rooms/beds were very spacious, clean and confortable. Great pool area with snacks machine, drinks and decent gym. The compromise is the food service......there is none. No breakfast facilities were offered except on our first day (don't know why one day but no more) and the choice was limited then. Most of the staff are great with a few mediocre eceptions. Stay here if budget is important, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “brillant 10 days in the point”
Reviews.Author: christinecostello1
Reviews.Content: we had a 2 bedroom "suite" as we had two teenage girls with us. Location was just off I Drive so was very close to Universal, but the resort provided shuttle bus to both Disney and Universal the rooms where really great, with all the facilities we needed Staff where great, we would have no qualms about going back

Reviews.Title: “Convenient at the right price”
Reviews.Author: legallightworker
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on way to parks. Great staff. Upgraded to 1 br suite. Overlooked Wet nWild, convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: victoria1989_2
Reviews.Content: The Point Orlando had everything we needed for our stay while going to Universal studios. The shuttle was great and only took a couple minutes to get to the park. One day we decided to walk back as it is only one mile. The location is central with many good restaurants only minutes away and several malls near by.

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: JustinBuckley
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed a night in October for her birthday so we could go to both of Universals parks. The hotel says they provide shuttles back and forth. What they should say is that the hotel employs a guy with an expedition to take 5-8 people at a time over to the park. There was ~20 people waiting at 8:40 am for a ride over to get to the park before it opened to see the Harry Potter experience at Universal. Why not invest in a bus or shuttle? Don't most people come to the resort to attend the parks? Also the hotel makes no effort in organizing this matter. The first people to jump in the van go tot the park which I'm sure you can imagine gets tense. I shouldn't have to fight with other people on my vacation to get a ride to the park. The hotel is closer than other hotels in the area but after a long day at the parks a 2 mile walk is the last thing you want to do. On a positive note the rooms were very clean and nice, which is very important. I'm not a very picky person at all, but I do expect to get good service when I spend $140 to stay at your hotel. I don't think that is unreasonable and I feel the experience was not worth that price tag.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel very friendly”
Reviews.Author: grace1967
Reviews.Content: this is the second time we have stayed at the point,the staff and the hotel fascilities are excellent. we asked to be moved to a bigger room and were moved the following day with only a small upgrade cost which was very good customer service. the pool area is very good and will be much better with the new tiki bar which sadly was not finished before our depature. i cannot recommend this hotel any higher as ihave been holidaying in florida for the last 18 yrs and this is the best hotel i have stayed in. thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: H0pscotch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Point Orlando Resort in August for 2 weeks and couldn't really fault it. We had a one bedroom apartment, for me, my husband and two children (11 & 16). Kitchen and bathroom were both fabulous, with everything in them, that you could possibly need. My only concern on arrival was the sofa bed, as my eldest son is 6'2" and it did seem a bit small and the mattress a bit thin, but he seemed to be ok in it. The pool area was good and judging by the building work going on, they are building some sort of pool bar, which will give it more of a hotel feel. They are also building another tower, which is due to be finished later this year, but I think where it is being built, it will block the sun during the day and this might be a bit frustrating for some people, when they are having a day by the pool. Other than that, the location was good, you can walk to Wet & Wild and Universal Studios is 5 minutes away in the car. There are also some restaurants within walking distance, which saves taking the car every night. We had a fantastic holiday and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but not a resort”
Reviews.Author: dwhiteh2
Reviews.Content: I live in Tampa and have stayed in Orlando more than a 100 times at various Disney properties, timeshares and hotels. I was glad to find a "new" property (both in terms of age and my experience with it) that offered a full kitchen, living room and king size bed for my family of four on a quick Disney (3 day) trip. I was looking for a good standby when Disney resorts are packed/ too expensive or when my timeshare gets old (they still call me to buy even though I own). I felt a little misled as the term "resort" isn't appropriate for this property. It's a hotel, a nice hotel with a full kitchen in room, but a hotel. Check in was fast and easy, with no line. I paid a government rate at 103 per night. The hotel charges a mandatory "resort fee" of $10 per night. This covers your internet usage in room and the pool. I was really disappointed by this fee. I never used the internet and the pool should be included with the room rate. The hotel's "restaurant" was really just a small bar with 3 tables. We didn't eat the breakfast buffet at $10 per adult as we brought groceries and had a hot breakfast in room. They did provide "buy one adult buffet get one" coupons upon our request though. The first room we were given had the intense odor of cigarettes as soon as we opened the door. The desk staff quickly got me into a different room that was great. It looked like it was less than 6 months old. I was disappointed that the tv in the bedroom wasn't HD but then again no HD receiver was in the room so it wasn't 720/1080 anyway. There wasn't a DVD player either. The channels went from 2-77 but all the kids channels and TLC, Discover were there so it worked. The pool and hot tub were nice and there was no crowd even on a Saturday which at most resorts (Disney, Westgate, etc.) is never the case. All children had parental accompaniment. There wasn't a pool bar, but I don't drink so I liked that. There were a group of late 20, 30 something's who appeared to be drinking but they were reserved. I saw a small weight room but never took advantage of it as I was only there for 2 nights. I really disliked the fact that the property is unsecured/ungated. The door is open 24/7 with the desk staff the only prevention from a bad guy coming in. I got several "pizza flyers" under my door daily. I did appreciate a OPD officer running radar outside on both nights. It was an off duty gig paid for by the city though. As a law enforcement officer myself I asked him about the crime rate and he indicated it was a good area. So overall, I gave it a 3.5/5 because of the smoked in room, no security/gate and lack of the amenities I'm used to at a resort (on site movie rental, real restaurant, game room/activities for the kids). For the price I think I'll continue searching for a Disney, timeshare standby. In addition, this hotel is near Universal and pirates dinner theater, but really too far from Disney (traffic is crazy on I4). I would use this resort again for business travel but not for family vacation unless I could get it for around $70/ night with no resort fee and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “22 nights at the Point .GREAT ||||”
Reviews.Author: gdi4one
Reviews.Content: Just returned 5th Oct after 22 nights in Florida sunshine. 1st time at the Point .We opted for the one bedroomed appartment which came with luxary bathroom to include jacuzi bath and large walk-in shower ideal to refresh after the 91 % humidity at the parks.The kitchen area was complete with all moden appliances from full size cooker , dishwasher , to washer and dryer but best was full size american fridge to keep the bud cool and the ice on tap.The seperate bedroom and the ballcony was a great addition to give a feeling of space.It was like a self contained appartment with the advantage of having front desk and daily clean towels and bed making with rooms getting the full monty once a week. Free transport to all parks a good help to a non USA driver like me but for Disney it was a 9 am pick up then 10 pm return which would be a headache with small kids, but we would use transport there and with been frequent Orlando visitors catch Linx and I-Trolley transport for return.From Universal its only a 10 to 15 minute walk and the green line trolley passes right outside the Point from Seaworld [14 days unlimited use trolley tickets for 17$] Pool clean plenty of sun-beds free pool towels. Never used gym but looked okay. Very freindly staff the best we ve had 10 minute walk to I-Drive for choice of resturants but we would jump on trolley which runs every 30 minutes and head for Buhama Breeze or Miller Ale House for my 20oz porterhouse steak for 16$ and a pitch [4 pints] of miller larger for 6$ This year flew from Newcastle to Amsterdam the onto Orlando International and return with Martin Air NEVER AGAIN EVER EVER EVER !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!ARRRRR

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: MCKENNA86
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband, son and daughter in law stayed at this hotel for two weeks, we booked a two bedroom suite which was ideal for the four of us.Fully equipped kitchen and everything we needed on hand.Staff were very friendly and helpful maid was excellent couldnt do enough for us.Stayed on the 9th floor and had excellent views up i drive even got to see Disney fireworks every night from balcony.only downfall was that there was no furniture in balcony so we had to carry out dining chairs if we wanted to sit for a while.Other than that everything was excellent and we had a great time.Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: rafaborrero
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here and it was a great as the first. I was in a suite, next time I'll try the one bedroom since it has a small kitchen and a balcony. The shuttle to Universal was free, on time with a good drop-off and pick-up schedule. The rooms themselves are very modern and clean. Overall I love this hotel, I plan to stay here for all my non-Disney Orlando trips.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good stay with no unpleasant memories”
Reviews.Author: krissysm0m
Reviews.Content: House keeping is partial so remember to clean up and pack away the kitchen. Make sure to put dirty towels on the floor or they leave it for you to use again. Don't forget to check out the turtles in the pond.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: drpoopa
Reviews.Content: All of the employees that I came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. The room was great! We were in a jr suite which had a kitchen sink, fridge, microwave, cups, plates and silverware, couch, table and king sized bed. You can walk to Wet & Wild, you could also walk to Universal Studios but it is a little further. The hotel has transportation to Universal, Sea World and Disney. We walked to the restaurant that we wanted to eat at, but there is public transportation called the I Ride which,for $4 for one day, will take you anyplace on International Drive. The only thing that I wish the hotel had was a larger restaurant, but there are plenty in the area. I strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous space, lovely staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RoseandFamily
Reviews.Content: The price was EXTREMELY reasonable for what you get - and we also got the AAA discount when requested - we were traveling with children (11 and 8) for a long weekend (Thurs - Sun) to visit Universal. We opted for a 1 bedroom suite, with a pull out sofa in the living room. We got to the hotel very early, @ 9:30am. God bless the Point - we were allowed to check in as the room was available - that alone made us LOVE the place! We got settled, and had a great stay. The kitchenette was well appointed, including an icemaker in the freezer and an ice bucket, a full sized stove, D/W, etc, and we even utilized the washer/dryer for a load of laundry. The suite was VERY roomy - SO much better than a 1 room at 3x the price in an on-site hotel. The pool was good-sized, with pool toys for the kids, and a hot tub -although there was construction going on, we noticed nothing(ie noise and disruption). We had called prior to coming and requested an upper floor with views of Universal - got the top floor with a great view. Flat screen TV in main room, regular one in bedroom (but who cares?! - we didn't!) We did only get 3 towels in the room, with 4 people checked in, but promptly received more after requesting (within 10 minutes) Bed was super comfy. On day of departure, we were able to get a late check out, and hung out at the pool as long as we wanted - there was a place to change, and they held your bags for you behind the front desk. If you want an "all-in-one" kind of place, you'd be slightly disappointed, as there was no restaurant, but you can get drinks and apps(we got some beers, but no food). Breakfast was good but a little pricey. I am glad we didn't go for the 2 bedroom - the way they're set up, they are actually a 1-bedroom and a studio with 2 doors that open to each other in a foyer. I personally wouldn't feel comfortable with little kids being in a different area than ours. For older children (or adults, of course) it would be a fine arrangement. Highly recommend, and would DEFINITELY stay there again - THANK YOU to all the staff at the Point!! **A couple of points for getting around, not really related to the hotel. The trip to/from the airport is @ $35 via a regular yellow cab. If the hotel calls their car service, it's $50. To Universal, it's @ $6-7 taxi, with the car service, $8 - 12. I DON'T recommend the i-Ride trolley to the park - it's cheap, but it drops you off FAR from the park - 10 minute hike at a good pace. You're better off springing for the taxi, as once you're at the entrance, it's another hike INTO the park. Renting a car comes in most handy for getting around to the restaurants, malls, etc in the evening. For our short stay, I think NOT renting a car was the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dotty186487
Reviews.Content: hotel was very good stayed for 3 weeks near a lot of attractions the grounds were kept in pristine condition by the hard working gardeners, the maids were very forgetful some days forgeting to leave our basic essentials, we will definatley be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: ucfpanda11
Reviews.Content: Room accomidations were amazing. Just went for a night away from home and really enjoyed having luxury at a great rate. I would highly reccomend to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: chelmcp
Reviews.Content: On the surface, the 'resort' looks very nice. When you get there, it's a little different. The nearest restaurants are at least a quarter of a mile away. There is a little deli in the hotel that serves very minimal fare. Housekeeping was mediocre, a dirty plate was left in my sink for 2 days without housekeeping picking it up. I was there for a class, and one of the managers was very kind to lend us a conference room for an evening to study, she was terrific. The front desk staff was also very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great job,great stay”
Reviews.Author: carolinaboss
Reviews.Content: Went on a much needed vacation with family-service, staff, accomadations were top notch-my family had the time of our lives-A+

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful...will definitely go again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sexyanne
Reviews.Content: The entrance was wonderful...The front desk staff checked us in with ease and even gave us an upgrade because we needed to do laundry. The suite was awesome and really reallly clean. The pool is nice and there is a gym as well. Will definitely return soon. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Truly a gem and at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to universal”
Reviews.Author: Buddy-Austin
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a great package price. The hotel and room was clean and the staff was very friendly. Helped me find places to eat and watch the game on Saturday night. The bed was firm and very comfortable. Nice pool. Work out room could use some primping but was overall a good place to stay The hotel has a free shuttle to Universal studios so you do not have to worry about the parking hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: starlette7886
Reviews.Content: My husband and I l-o-v-e-d this hotel! The prices were very reasonable for the type of room we stayed in, which was the grande suite, which included a full kitchen, bath (with a whirpool tub), bedroom (with king sized bed), and living area (with a sleeper sofa). The bed was amazing and likely the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on! My husband raved about hom much he loved the bed, kitchen (which had a full fridge, a dishwasher, and plenty of dishes, pots, and pans), and just the room in general. The room felt more like a 1br condo than a hotel room. The only thing I wasn't really happy about was that the website advised there was bellhop service, which was not present when we stayed. We were told a luggage carrier was in the coat closet in the lobby and we were more than welcome to use it, but there was no one to help us get our bags and food we brought to our room (which was on the 5th floor at the end of the hall). It was a minor hiccup and something my husband and I didn't really mind, considering they made up for it by giving us an extra room key for free to get back in our room when our door slammed shut on us while we were trying to pack up; my husband and I were half asleep and forgot to grab a key, and they were so nice about it. This hotel is starting to offer ownership opportuinities, and my husband and I are looking into ownership of one of the 1br suites should our jobs send us to Orlando like we think they might. We loved the place that much. It's only a block away from Wet-N-Wild, about a mile from Universal, and about a half mile from I-4 if you're headed to Mickey Land. International Drive is only about a block away as well. The greatest thing about this hotel was that it was close to the attractions, but not right in the middle of them. It wasn't like staying in other hotels in the Universal area where you can't sleep because all you can hear outside your window is the bass coming from the attractions at CityWalk. All in all, this is probably one of the better kept secrets where lodging is concerned. I've spent double the money for rooms in Orlando that didn't offer a quarter of what this hotel offers. I highly suggest you look into this hotel. Tip: Definitely spend the extra little bit per night on the grande suite over the junior suite, and either go grocery shopping once you get there (The Wal-Mart on John Young Pkwy. is only about 4 mi. away) or pack a cooler. We all know just how expensive eating out in Orlando is, and the full kitchen in the grande suite will save you a TON of cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Fair Location”
Reviews.Author: WestmeathPat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2009. We booked a suite on the 9th floor with a view of Universal Studios in the distance. The room was amazing with a great bathroom - more than a couple would need. The balcony was a good size. There was also several places to store luggage and shopping out of the way which helps keep the room tidy. The main drawback with this hotel is the location - its just a little bit out of the way, maybe 10 minutes walk from I drive (and the excellent I ride trolley) and another 10 to supermarkets, shops etc . This does not sound like much, but in the Orlando heat it was too far to carry groceries, beer, bottles of water etc. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel if you are renting a car - there is plenty of parking. The staff were all ok - nothing special but nothing rude. There was no breakfast available but great Starbucks coffee and a few Danish pastries. When we travelled, the hotel had free transfers to the parks - ESSENTIAL if you are not renting a car. If you are on foot, get to the nearest shop and buy a I Ride Trolley bus pass for the duration of your stay - you will use it more than you think!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, central and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rhona123
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Orlando for many years and have stayed in many hotels and resorts around the International Drive and Universal Blvd areas. I would recommend the Point Orlando Resort for any family or group of friends who are looking for very comfortable accommodation with all the facilities of home, that is central to all the parks, restaurants and shops. We would all visit the Point Orlando Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sophisticated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: buzybee04
Reviews.Content: Just Minutes from Universal, free transportation & beautiful accomodations. Very tranquil.

Reviews.Title: “meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: stevesdyna
Reviews.Content: nice and clean,pool was good. close to everything there.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: Beauty08
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms were definitely clean and the location was great. For the right price I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: redcon58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Point Orlando Resort for thee weeks in August 2010 and it was simply the best hotel experience ever for me and my extended family. The rooms were amazing, spacious, clean with everything we wanted. All the staff especially Fabio and the ladies on reception desk were the best I have experienced anywhere and a great asset for this hotel. They are building a third tower and poolside bar which will improve the facility even more. Location was close(5 mins) to intrenational drive attractions. and i ride trolley stop is 2 mins away. Complimentary transfer to disney and universal and seaworld parks was great as we did not hire car. Please stay at this hotel if you are in orlando. You wont find better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: rogue149
Reviews.Content: This is our last night at the Point after a 2 wk holiday and I have to say it has been an absolute pleasure staying here, complete independence yet help at hand if needed. Like all the other reviews say this is a great place to stay especially for the comfort of the accomodation, the quality of the rooms and peace and quiet in general of the hotel, fresh ,clean towels every day the front desk staff were all very helpfull, I didn't get all their names but a big thank you to Fabio for getting the boarding passes printed out for me..yes they will print your online boarding passes for you. The hotel is very close to the Universal and Wet and Wild parks, wet and wild is just a 5 minute walk , prime outlets a 15 minuteride on the bus. Having a car was a godsend it really felt like home from home.....i would recommend anyone to stay here as it is a great base and away from the hustle and bustel of I - Drive...thank you Pointe Orlano Resort...I hope to be back in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel near Universal Studios.”
Reviews.Author: LisaC416
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 1 mile away from Universal Studios/CityWalk attractions. The cab ride was definitely affordable and pleasant. The hotel room was comfortable, clean, and spacious. The hotel staff was very courtesy in trying to making our stay the most comfortable. The only con was the hot and cold settings in the shower were reversed. As for that, no other complaints. I definitely recommend this hotel to others.
