Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious accomodations with every convenience.”
Reviews.Author: psychotekkie
Reviews.Content: Everything at this hotel was great. Very clean. Lots of space. Large bathroom with accessible tub. We felt it was an excellent value for the price. Having a fridge, washer and dryer in our suite was very convenient as well. Very close to Universal studios, so we didn't have to go far at the end of a long day. Was pleasantly surprised one evening when we returned to find a gentleman in the foyer offering a free chair massage (to advertise for additional in-room services, of course, but he was giving a full 1/2 hour massage for free). Both my husband and I were able to take advantage of this service.... ahhhh so nice! We also took some time to relax by the pool, which was well kept, with lots of warm towels available. I can't think of one thing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel walking distance to attractions”
Reviews.Author: stevoandjen
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff.Walking distance to some major attractions including Universal Studios and City Walk and Wet n Wild.Pool area and roooms were also of excellent standard.Would definately return at a later date.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Eire931963
Reviews.Content: Where can i start, well everything about this hotel is first class, location, decor, spotlessly clean, and excellent staff. Rooms are huge with large tvs throughout, leather sofas, American style fridge freezer, cooker, dishwasher, washing machine/dryer etc, and beautiful bathrooms, lovely pool area. We stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment, and it was brilliant for us and our 2 children, plenty of room with air-con, ceiling fans, balcony etc. Location , down the road from wet and wild, i trolley stop across the road from hotel, about i mile from universal and islands of adventure, plenty of restaurants and bars close by, about 5 min walk. Complimentary shuttle bus to and from the parks from the hotel. A special word of thanks to "Fabio" on the front desk, nothing was a problem for him, and he made our holiday to the point orlando resort one of the best ever, "thank you Fabio". And thanks to all the staff. Cheers, Tommy, Sligo , Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: zrez
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a studio suite, however when we arrived to the hotel, the room did not seem to be fully cleaned and re-stocked. We called concierge at the front desk, who was very apologetic and helpful. They ended up upgrading us to a 1 bedroom suite right a way, without any problems. The suite was extremely spacious, clean and comfortable. Overall the staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel is located in a convenient location, close to all the parks and downtown. We will definitely stay again at "the point orlando" on our next visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed based on all the other reviews - and the Point met my expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: rooster7777
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were headed to Universal studios and Islands of Adventure for our anniversary trip and booked the Point based on all the great reviews here on Tripadvisor. I have to say, this hotel lived up to the hype. Angela at the front desk was wonderful to us and we got upgraded from the Studio suite to the 1BR Suite, which is great for the awesome full-size kitchen area and the extra amenities. We didn't eat in the hotel at all so I can't comment on their buffet breakfast but it was nice to be able to get a Starbucks latte right in the lobby area. The location is absolutely perfect for Universal. Pool was of a good size, clean, etc. We found the rooms quiet and really nice overall. Only thing it was missing was having a DVD player in the living room to watch some movies on that flat screen, but that's minimal. The shower was great but if I had to lodge one complaint, it would be that the jet tub in this suite is a bit small and unimpressive. I was hoping for one of those really awesome jacuzzi tubs and this wasn't it. Overall, just a great experience and excellent value for the price paid!

Reviews.Title: “sorry we did not stay for 3 weeks”
Reviews.Author: tomatoe10
Reviews.Content: we had one bed room suite with pull out bed in sitting-room for kids. Facilities and location were excellent with the added bonus of a washing machine and dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsmce
Reviews.Content: Meyself, husband, mum and daughter stayed in a 2 bed apartment. What can I say, absolutely fantastic. The two bed apartment was really like two apartments in one. We had two seperate doors and where my mum and daughter stayed they had their own living room, fully fitted kitchen, bedroom, bathroom with walk in shower and jacuzzi. My husband and I then had what I would call a "studio" apartment. We had a balcony which we could clearly see Universal and Wet N Wild. The hotel was extremely clean and the staff were very helpful in ordering taxis for us and also helping with any enquiries. The pool area was great and very relaxing. The gym was ok, but when I went to use it both running machines were not working, which was a bit of a disappointment for me. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and hopefully when I return to Florida again I will most definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accomodations & considerate staff make this a perfect vacation destination location & it is close to everything”
Reviews.Author: babeladyj
Reviews.Content: I can not explain how Wonderful this resort has been for all our needs and wants. The price is surprisingly very affordable. The rooms are roomy, spotlessly clean, and the furniture is very comfortable. I do highly recommend the one or two bedroom units. They have a complete kitchen and you can save a lot of vacation money eating in. There are grocery store a short drive away. The bathroom is very, very nice. It has a tiled walk in shower AND a whirlpool deep tub. There is a washer and dryer in the unit, a balcony, individual climate control for the unit, the bed is extremely comfortable and the linens and towels are soft and well made. The pool and whirlpool spa are great and the poolside area is a very inviting place to relax and unwind from a busy day. The most pleasant surprise we had was at poolside. My husband forgot that glass was not allowed and took a bottle of beer to the pool. A very nice security guard named GLENN approached us with 2 plastic cups and ice and asked if he could provide those for our use and remove the glass bottle. He was respectful, kind, and resolved our mistake while making us feel that he truely wanted us to have a pleasant stay at this resort. It was a charming way to enforce the pool rules and make us feel relaxed and welcome. We have felt that everyone working here is pleased that we chose to stay here The Point Orlando Resorts is the only place we will stay when we are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KarriBliss
Reviews.Content: My 6 year old son and I take frequent Orlando trips, normally visiting the Disney parks. This trip we wanted to try something new and planned to visit Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure and Wet -n- Wild. I am not familiar with this area, (about 8 miles from the Disney area I am used to) and checked out many hotels in the vicinity on AAA.com. The Point caught my attention because of how NICE the resort looked in the pictures, and the very affordable nightly rate, in addition to the location to the parks we would be visiting. I figured I would take a chance and try it. I was very happily surprised - it was even BETTER than I expected. The entire resort is very clean and well-kept. The rooms are spacious, beautiful and comfortable. It was practically across the street from Wet -n- Wild, and a 5 minute (or less) drive to Universal & Islands of Adventure. There is no question we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Orlando vacation”
Reviews.Author: sparkletwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Point from Aug 15-20th. Overall we had a great stay. We had a one bedroom suite which was very well equipped. The full kitchen was great for cooking meals and the washer and dryer combo was very helpful. The beds are fantastic and the jetted tub was definitely a plus. The room was very clean and modern. When we first checked in we were were facing the side parking lot. We called to the front desk and were immediately told we could move to the 11th floor facing the pool without any questions asked. The view at night was great and we could even see fireworks one night from our balcony. We visited Disney and Universal during our stay and the the hotel was a great central location. The only drawback was breakfast. I feel if you are paying a resort fee, at least coffee should be free. But it was Starbucks coffee so I guess they have to pay for it some way. Breakfast was $9 a person and it didn't look like it included very much. You could definitely get a better breakfast outside of the hotel for this price. All in all, we loved staying here and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal!”
Reviews.Author: Soderbee
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. Room was not as big as I thought it would be. Generic features, such as old tv in bedroom. Ackward doors leading into bathroom/bedroom/living rm. Kitchen had very nice ammenities. Balcony did not have any chairs. Hot tub down by pool was broken. It was only minutes to Universal which was very nice! Would stay again for good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.... but”
Reviews.Author: kanekevtar
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good in almost all repsects. The staff was freindly and the accomodations were more than adequates. We had only two concerns during our stay. The first was that the site in under construction which is not indicated anywhere on The Point's website. The second was that the hotel charges a resort fee each day for the use of their facilities (pool, exercise room, etc) and most of the exercise equipment was not in working order. The equipment had signes on the individual machines and when I inquired about when it would be fixed, the front desk staff seemed completely unaware there was any such problem. If the hotel is going to charge a fee for its use, all of it should be in working order. Otherwise we had a reaaly good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A brillinat hotel, excellent location, quiet, comfortable and excellent facilties in your room”
Reviews.Author: darrenrace
Reviews.Content: Great location, just off international drive. Great FREE parking. Comfortable and quiet rooms with superb facilities which allow you to stock up on breakfast if required, tea, coffee. The washing and drying facilties in the rooms are excellent and excellent to keep the kids and family clothes clean. A great hotel, nothing to complain about, would recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, really friendly staff, hope to visit again.”
Reviews.Author: lisabDublin
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel and we hope to visit again. We stayed in a one bedroom suite for nine nights, really spacious,quiet and clean,large bedroom with king size bed, large bathroom and living area with fully equipped kitchen, air conditioning and balcony. Amazing value for money. All the staff in the hotel were extremely helpful and friendly and made us feel very welcome. There is plenty of free parking on site and free shuttles to the theme parks. The hotel is also in an excellent location, right next to Wet n' Wild and very close to Universal Studios, International Drive, the Outlets etc. After leaving the hotel and travelling around Florida we returned to The Point Resort for the last night of our holiday before flying home from Orlando.This time we stayed in a junior suite, this was also extremely spacious and clean with king size bed, large bathroom and a smaller kitchen comprising sink, microwave, fridge, cutlery, dishes etc. This is one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in, can't praise it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are not insulated very well but clean”
Reviews.Author: BellaMiyagijax
Reviews.Content: No breakfast...had to pay for coffee in the lobby but was still charged a $10 "resort fee."

Reviews.Title: “very spacious accommodation with top of the range facilities”
Reviews.Author: miranda60
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in various hotels in orlando but this was far the best. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was a one bedroom joining a 1 bed studio. we had so much space it was great. It had a fully equipt kitchen with fridge/dishwasher/washing machine/dryer/cooker/microwave and your plates pots and pans there was nothing missing. The hotel is in a great location walking distance from international drive with a T.G.I accross the road. All the staff at the hotel took the time to talk to you and give you help, nothing was too much trouble. On my return we realised we had left some keys in the room, i emailed them on thursday and they replied the next day saying they found the keys and how would i like them sent. Great service from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debabrata19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort recently. Excellent rooms and facilities. The pool was the high point of this hotel. Though we stayed in a double room, it is possible to get a room with a kitchenette for you to cook small meals. The place is located very well. There are shops / eateries at walking / driving distances. Exciting place.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!! A+++”
Reviews.Author: jbone350
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. This was the best hotel stay we have ever had. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. It's right in the middle of everything you need, and just down the street from universal which was good since we went there 2 days. The room was the nicest room we have ever stayed in, just cant say enough about the point. We will stay there everytime we come to orlando from now on.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER FRIENDLY STAFF!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TampaGirl39
Reviews.Content: We live in the Tampa Bay area and booked 2 suites with family members. I was amazed that the room had everything you could possibly need. The kitchen was fully stocked with every utensil thinkable, the washer and dryer came with detergent as did the dishwasher. Traveling with 4 small children, it was so nice to be able to cook dinners and breakfast. The rooms were extremely clean and the bathroom was beautiful and very spacious. Any time we were in the hallways, elevators or at the pool staff members welcomed us and asked if there was anything that we needed. Everyone was genuinely nice! The pool area was so nice and had plenty of tables and chairs and was not overcrowded at all. I would HIGHLY reccomend his hotel for anyone traveling with children as it is extremely kid friendly. Can't wait to go back again, we are already planning another trip next month just to get away for the weekend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel/resort”
Reviews.Author: marear
Reviews.Content: Outstanding value, customer service, and location. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Orlando, none comes close to The Point. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious celan rooms”
Reviews.Author: maz62
Reviews.Content: Well situated, with very large and well equipped rooms. If you enjoy spending days around the pool, this area is quite small and shaded in the earlier part of the day. There was some building noise but not very problematic. Liked the fact that we had all the facilities of an apartment, but wih some hotel facilities too. All staff we encountered were extremely polite and helpful. Parking was not a problem as some other people have stated. It was very busy when we there, but overflow carpark is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel. We will be back again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cherefamily
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was very clean and the staff was great. We booked a 1 bedroom suite. It was very spacious and we all were very comfortable. The pool was nice and it is very close to everything. We were there for 4 nights and went to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure while there. The staff was very nice and the breakfast was great!! We got to ask for it to go and took it to our room and ate it there. The king bed was comfortable. We had our 4 irls with us so we brought an airbed and hooked it up so 2 girls slept on the sofa bed and the other 2 on the airbed. The only thing that bothered me was the room we received had a bad view. We were viewing a car lot and there was a light outside that felt like it shined right into our room. Also our key stopped working the 2nd night there. We had to wait about 20 minutes for someone to let us in. It also didnt work the following day either but again we were let in and given new keys. Besides that we really enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: MaryBerkowitz
Reviews.Content: The size and convenience of the room was great. Having a washer and dryer right in the room was a life saver, particularly when traveling with two teenage boys. It was also great to have a full kitchen facility.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: brendarivers47
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, very nice staff, the beds are soooo comfortable, very clean rooms. Just watch out for the fees if your not use to Resort concept vs. Hotel rooms. But would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mamarosey99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Point with our two children ages 9 & 12. We LOVED the hotel. It was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. A special thank you to Angela and Danielle. Very convenient to get to Universal, Sea World and Wet N Wild. The transportation to the parks was great. We had an AWESOME vacation and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: lostatos
Reviews.Content: comfortable rooms and excellent services. There are also excellent location if you plan to visit Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sunwing_10
Reviews.Content: Overall, The Point has everything you will need in a hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and it was very large and worked perfectly for a family of 4. The hotel is clean and attractive and felt welcoming. The pool was usually quite busy bet never felt crowded. The only complaint I have is that we needed to take taxis to go to restaurants for dinner, to go shopping, if we wanted to leave the theme parks early etc. The taxi fare was never more than $15, but it adds up. The shuttle services to Universal/Disney/Sea World was great, but only has 1 pick-up and 1 drop-off time, so if you want to leave later/earlier then you will need to take a taxi. Other than that, great hotel, friendly staff, good location! We definitely enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Staff great, room clean.”
Reviews.Author: prequinn
Reviews.Content: This resort was clean and inviting. It is close to restaurants and Universal. The room had a small kitchenette. The "resort" did not have an ice maker nor any snack machines. We only stayed one night so we didn't use the pool. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I loved everything about staying at Point Orlando Resort!”
Reviews.Author: judyblueBayShore
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely comfortable and friendly resort. It is so low key and an easy breezy place to stay. I would recommend this hotel to everyone-young, old, families with little kids or teenagers, etc. From Sophia at the front desk to the bar keeps, to the maids, groundskeepers & security guards- all were genuinely friendly and pleasant w/out being "over the top." I felt very happy, safe and comfortable while staying therebetween our days @ Universal and Isle of Adventure. FYI: We walked across the street to an adjacent hotel (which will remain nameless)- What a difference! LINES, LINES AND MORE LINES!! It was extremely crowded and very hot. Stansions up all over the place for the many lines that snaked through the entire lobby! We were ignored when waiting to ask a simple question. Pool area was packed...it was like walking into a bad dream! This experience made me realize, even moreso, just HOW FORTUNATE MY TEENAGE BOYS & I WERE TO HAVE CHOSEN THE POINT ORLANDO RESORT! It was a REAL TREAT TO STAY @ POINT ORLANDO RESORT- - - They'll take such good care of you! Definitely will stay there again...and my advice to anyone who sees this would be to stop searching through the myriad of hotels in this area and BOOK A RESERVATION WITH POINT ORLANDO RESORT!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: baltimorejoe1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for the money, clean, quiet, centrally located to attractions and shopping, staff was great, free parking, free internet, reasonable "resort fee", nothing hidden.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: jamesshiel
Reviews.Content: great hotel for the price. everything was near perfect. only downfall was there was no restaraunt on site because they are in process of building it. consruction was out of way and did not affect our stay. we were just a few months early and couldn't take advantage of the finished product. will definitly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pauljune_1968
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday in orlando where we stayed at the point resort. We found the hotel sevice to be exceptional and had absolutely no problem with any staff in any way. Everyone very helpfull and informative as it was our first time in orlando. The rooms are spacious and very clean and when we return to orlando, we will be staying here again. June Hillhouse

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: bratman717
Reviews.Content: super place found at last minute price was great hotel was better rooms are super

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frida03
Reviews.Content: A AAA+++ hotel, I was in 3 hotels during my trip and these one was the best in every aspect!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely return to this hotel in the future”
Reviews.Author: walsh11
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at point resort, staff were very nice and helpful with information on taxis, where to eat, bus times, takeaways etc. We did not drive so we found the I-ride trolley (bus service) great. It takes you to two of the big retail outlets, Prime and Orlando Premium outlets, where there are loads of designer shops, food courts etc. Our hotel ran a shuttle service to Disney, Universal and Seaworld once a day in the morning and returned between 8 and 10pm, depending on which park you choose. We found Walgreens very handy, on International drive, for food and gifts etc. My kids 9 and 11 loved the hotel. We had a one bedroom suite which was great, with a large bathroom and the kitchen had all the utensils you could ask for. When we were leaving they had started to build on phase 3 of the hotel, keep this in mind when booking, it did not bother us as we were gone for most of the day. If you use the taxi services, ask for a receipt, as it makes it easier to trace, just in case you leave something behind!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Getaway2Discover
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. If you're looking for a superb place to stay, I would highly recommend this resort. Our family of 5 stayed in a beautiful and spacious 2 bedroom suite. There were no surprises. The suite was exactly what we had hoped for and more. The resort had shuttle services available to Sea World, Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Universal Studios and others. You are able to transfer to other Disney theme parks at Epcot's drop off (at no charge). Enjoy your stay in Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Superb - we will back”
Reviews.Author: RedLichtieArbroath
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 weeks in July. We booked a 2 bedroom suite for myself, my wife and 2 kids. The first night we arrived after our nine hour flight from Scotland, we all rushed into the room and started saying"look at this - this is brilliant- this 3 week stay will be awesome". We had a suite on the ground floor with pool view which was a fantastic location- it was so easy coming back to the room after being at the pool and even able to take out sandwiches, drinks etc to eat at poolside at the poolside table. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and friendly and if you were short of anything in the room you just asked the desk and it was there in seconds. The second night we were there, we could not get the oven to operate as we were unsure how to work it- we phoned the front desk and the handyman turned up at our door in about 1 minute, explained how to operate and even gave us one of his recipe ideas for spaghetti sauce. The rooms were spacious, clean and everything worked. It was so central off I-Drive but quiet as well as it is set back off Universal Boulevard but close to stores, restaurants and all the main parks- Universal, Seaworld, are minutes away. The pool opens at 7am and shuts at 11 pm prompt, but up till then it is busy with a great night-time atmosphere and everyone enjoying the warm evenings at poolside, Security is also good but not intimidating. We cannot fault this hotel in anyway and we will be back that's for sure- in fact when we checked out the assistant manager said if we come back we should phone her directly and she will give us the best rates- we already looking forward to our next trip to the best vacation location in the world and the Point Orlando will be our preffered stay

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: travelsexykim
Reviews.Content: My honey and I went to Orlando for a long weekend and I decided to book us here because the reviews were so great. This resort is a hidden gem. I have been to Orlando several hundreds of times since I am only 90 minutes away and I had never heard of this place. We were in a one bedroom suite and there was plenty of room. The jacuzzi bathtub was an added bonus. We will definetely be returning. When in Orlando. Please check this place. Great location and great price. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I will most certainly be back!”
Reviews.Author: jmac350
Reviews.Content: We reserved the Junior suite and were upgraded to a one bedroom unit when Fabio found out this was our first stay at The Point. The room was clean beyond my expectations, quiet, comfortable and convenient to shopping and attractions. The bartender was friendly and considerate. I'm so pleased we found a place to count on when visiting Orlando. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: alysen19
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was close to Universal Studios. The shuttle only runs once a day though, so we had to take a taxi back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: nurseLuvs2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Point for 3 nights with our 8 year old daughter for our trip to Universal Studios. The location is great for Universal...about a 2 minute drive. And it is also very close to a Walgreens, which is nice to have nearby. The suite was very clean upon arrival... and they also stock the suite with a little Tide detergent and dish washing liquid, which was nice. It was great to be able to wash a load of clothes after getting them all sweaty and stinky in the parks! Check in was easy and there were no hidden charges on check-out. Be aware there is a "resort fee"...which was about $10 per day when we were there... The tub was heavenly... so nice to soak and put on the jets after a long day in the park! My only complaints...the pillows are horrible, and my daughter said the pullout sofa wasn't very comfortable either. We had a room with a pool view, and we felt the room was quiet enough. Overall a great value for what we paid.....I would stay again, but would be sure to bring some pillows from home, and possibly get a 2 bedroom suite next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: starr075
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Point during a family time visit with my 2 yr. old grandson...the room was excellent. There was space for him to play as well as sleep... The room was set up with a crib and high chair as well which was a terrific. Not only was it clean it was comfortable with a view of the pool, great location to theme parks and shopping..(the shopping was for me):) and even great family resturants. Would I stay here again most certainly!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly and great staff !!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: outNabout23
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at " The Point " hotel in Orlando 5 times. Obviously it is my # 1 pick for good service, cleanliness, friendly and accomodating staff and good value. You really feel at home in this all suites hotel. My last visit was with my sister and her 2 year old grandson. The hotel set us up with a crib and a high chair upon request. We had the 1 bedroom suite which was perfect for our needs. I can't thank Fabio ( the manager ) enough for all the help he assisted us with in making our stay at the Point the best vacation ever. The proximity to all that Orlando offers is fabulous. Would not stay anywhere else . Highly recommend this hotel for all of it's friendly and homey atmosphere. Note: The beds and the bedding are of the best quality I've seen in 5 star hotels. Great night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room/suite. Cleaning service SUCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: tawnyowl37
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely! Lots of space. Full kitchen. BUT! Cleaning SUCKS! Hair in the shower (before we even used it), cheerios/food debris in the pull out couch, they replaced enough towels for two people but we were three, and one of my pillows lacked a pillow case. It is a shame cause the place rocks...but the cleaning...even cheap motels are better!

Reviews.Title: “Point Orlando is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MomUsingDaughtersFB
Reviews.Content: I am vegan -- thus having the use of a kitchen while on vacation is imperative. This limited my choices of hotels. Imagine my delight in finding The Point Orlando -- which is both lovely and cost efficient. I traveled with my two almost adult children, so I opted for the 2 bedroom suite. It was perfect. It is actually a 1 bedroom 2 room suite connected by a common foyer to a studio apartment. Both sides had a king bed along with a leather couch that folded out to a queen size bed. The 2 room suite had a full size, fully supplied kitchen (service for 8) and the studio had a mini-frig with wet bar (service for 4). Each apartment had a locking door in addition to the "suite" door connecting the hall to the foyer. This had the added effect of muting noise in the hallway. This layout allowed my teen son to have privacy -- and us (mother and older sister) to have some privacy as well. (Best part for the ladies -- the jacuzzi tub AND separate large, well lit shower stall in the 2 room suite.) The location was also perfect for us, as we spent our "park" time at the Universal Studio/Sea World properties. From door to parking deck was less than 10 minutes to the Universal parks and less than 15 minutes to Sea World and Aquatica. Wet & Wild water park was about a block away. We did not go to Disney -- however, my understanding is that it, too, is less than 15 to 20 minutes away. Also, the hotel has complimentary "bus" service to and from the parks (once going in am, once coming back in pm) for those who don't have transportation. The ONLY complaint (from the kids) was that there wasn't a DVD player -- which we solved by purchasing an S-video cord from WalMart (also less than 10 minutes away) and hooking the lap top to the TV. For those who prefer to eat out -- the hotel has a wonderful buffet breakfast with numerous choices and there are numerous restaurants with a variety of cuisines in the area. There is also a bar (in the evenings) along with tapas. Oh -- and for those who prefer to shop organically -- Whole Foods is less than 10 minutes away -- and is near the WalMart.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for your money”
Reviews.Author: katerinio_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel exeeded my expectations. I was expecting a no frills hotel. Upon arrival we entered a beautiful lobby with attentive staff. We arrived at 10 am and check in was not until 4 pm. Staff held our luggage, let us use the pool and called us on our cell phone at 1 pm when the room was ready ( 3 hrs before check in). We were 2 adults and 3 teenagers and had a 2 bdrm suite. Rooms were beautiful complete with sofa, dining table and chairs, tv, etc. Large room with master bedroom also had a full kitchen, dishwasher, washer/dryer as well as a shower and jacuzzi in master bathroom. Pool is also a great asset. Hotel is approx 2-3 miles from Universal theme parks. There is a free shuttle from the hotel which departs at 8:40 in the morning and also leaves Universal at 8:20 in the evening. Otherwise a cab will cost you between 7-8 dollars. Wet and wild is about 1/2 a mile down and across the street (walking distance). One drawback to the hotel is the food. They provide a very limited breakfast buffet for about $ 11 per person. In the evening 5-11 pm the provide a bar which also serves tapas. That's about it for on site food. Staff provided us with plenty of take out menus and we were able to order and they delivered food to our door. Walgreens is also 1/2 mile down the road and the have a reasonable price food mart so we were able to buy water, milk, juice, eggs, bread, cereal, etc to make our own breakfast in our room. Definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: kttsv
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean, great rooms, fantasitc beds. Kitchen facilites are good, couch very compfortable. No wireless but plug in is lightning fast.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising inside quality compared to the outside which is not nearly as nice”
Reviews.Author: Davidleeb71
Reviews.Content: Parking didn't seem great but had a patrol. I did not see a way to get into the hotel from the back but that was OK too. The inside is nice and the rooms are great. The accomodations were great. The breakfast with a 2-4-1 booked into our rate was OK for 2 for $10 but I would not have paid that much more for oatmeal, eggs, pork and cereal. But everything was nicely displayed. Room had no Internet access but the lobby did. The business center was not free but was reasonable at $0.25 a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: samp5267
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando the week of July 12th for the YBOA girls basketball tournament. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The hotel was in a good location if you were attending the Disney parks, which we did not have time to do because we were running between games. The hotel was clean with nice appointments. There is a very small bar area, which is used for breakfast and drinks in the evening. I don't think room service is available because some rooms have kitchens. I did not see the pool, but I heard it was a nice little pool and it served the needs of the people staying in the hotel. Overall I enjoyed what little time I was able to spend in the hotel and I fully reconmend this as a possible stay for a couple and maybe older children. There is not much for small children to occupy their time beside the pool. My room was clean or so I thought. On the last day our daughter stayed with us because we had to leave for the airport early, but all week she stayed in a group home with the rest of the team. Anyway, we pulled out the sofa bed to prepare for her to sleep on, but as soon as we pulled it out the FISH smell lit up the whole room. This would be my only concern is to check the pull out bed. We had no need for it all week but the one time we did, it was not suitable to use. Just double check your room for cleanliness, as you should do for all hotel rooms. Enjoy your stay, you won't be dissappointed

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Labllove214
Reviews.Content: All I can say is really clean, very spacious, beautiful accomodations and a superb Front Desk staff, and a special thank you to Danielle for all the help with the Sea World tickets and the boarding passes! Housekeeping was on target as well! Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kinanna
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms. Really close to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spacious Apartments with great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: BTSAB
Reviews.Content: Only back from a 3 week stay at the Point Resort, we had a fantastic holiday, the 2 bed apartment we stayed in was very spaciuos with all modern day mod cons etc cooker, fridge, freezer,microwave,washing machine,dryer, internet the lot. Rooms were cleaned every day, great pool and a very well maintained resort. The staff at the front desk were superb and very accomodating to our every need, in particular Angela and staff who made a huge contribution to making sure everything was done for us, very much appreciated to you all for this...

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! x 100”
Reviews.Author: iloveulongtime
Reviews.Content: This was an AMAZING hotel! My wife, two young kids (baby and 3 year old) stayed in a studio suite. This place was clean. First, when we entered, the lobby looked great, the staff were VERY friendly and ALWAYS greeted us with a smile during our 10 day stay! The room was very clean and room service was very efficient....the small kitchen and fridge were a MUST! We loved everything about it! The pool and towels were great. The location was also another plus, 15 min from Disney...5 min from Universal. We plan on going again! Someone said something about the parking...ya...it's in the back..sometimes..you have to walk a little bit...but it was very well lit....and security was always present at night.....OVERALL..AMAZING!!! and we will be visiting again! (The only down thing was that you had to pay for the Internet)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with a very good location.”
Reviews.Author: ECanto
Reviews.Content: Large and Confortable rooms. Excellent staff and a great location, very close to Universal Studios e not so far from Disney. We recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!TOTALLY WANT TO STAY AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: KarinaViana
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel to anybody that looks for a nice room,clean room and great assistance!Awesome customer service, they really understood my needs and made everything possible to be an awesome stay.I'll definitely want to stay again when I go to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianej01
Reviews.Content: I thought I had already reviewed this hotel, its only on checking back that I realise I hadn't. The hotel is fantastic, we were very happy with everything from the reception staff , to the room, the location and even the aircon. My husband has trouble with walking and has a disabled badge, we were always able to park in a spot near the entrance our room overlooked the car park and there was always plenty of spaces. The hotel was spotless, the rooms were cleaned lightly daily with a full clean once a week. Towels were changed daily. The bed was far too comfortable and the aircon was lovely. All the staff were friendy even the handy man [think it was Tim], had time to chat. I was accidentally overcharged [I upgraded from a studio to a one bedroom] I emailed and it was refunded straightaway with apologies. I can't recommend this hotel too highly and it will be my first choice for Orlando if we go again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cukoo4Travel
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is by far one of the most enjoyable stays we've had in a long time! The Point Resort is a fantastic hotel! We stayed here for 2 weeks during June this year and would do anything to stay there again. Very good value for money. The rooms were cleaned everyday.Towels and linen were changed and replenished daily. They have a good hairdryer so no need to take your own, (although my own didnt work due to voltage differences in the USA). They had great shampoo products topped up everyday, so no need to lug around large shampoo bottle in your suitcase. They have safety deposit boxes that are great and very safe! They also have a little business room where you can top up a little card and use internet time. They have a printer in there too for those needing it. The pool is a good size, and the hot whirlpool tub was bigger than I thought it would be. The location is fantastic as its on Universal Blvd, just off International Drive!!! Everything was so close by.... a huge Mc Donalds... Burger King, Dunkin Doughnuts, Pirates Dinner Adventure, Sea World Parks, Disney Parks, Malls... its central to everything you need. The staff were absolutely wonderful on reception, especially Sophia, Angela, Danielle and Fabio. They were all brilliant and made our stay extra special! x Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “The Point-what a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Royalty42
Reviews.Content: At the recommendation of a friend who was there before, we stayed at The Point this month for about ten days with our extended family and we had a wonderful time! The lady at the frontdesk was so sweet and welcoming, actually the whole staff was great and very friendly, but she especially made us feel at home from the moment we came in. She always seemed happy to see us and helped us out several times during our stay with information about restaurants and tickets and printed our boarding passes. She really made us feel at home. We noticed that the hotel is very busy but the staff was always smiling and ready to help us with any request. We had two two-bedroom suites, perfect for our big family and we loved the suites. Big and roomy and beautifully decorated, with everything in the kitchen what we needed and more and very clean (and the beds are great). Kudo's for the housekeeping staff, they also do a wonderful job and are friendly too. The locations is perfect, close to everything! I just read a review from somebody complaining about the parking. I don't know why. Parking is in front and next to the hotel and we understand not everybody can park next to the entrance, that is impossible with any hotel. There is not even a fee for parking but it is part of the hotel fee as is the Internet access (handy for our kids) and several other services. Besides that the nightly rates are very reasonable for what you get.We most definately will return to The Point every time we come to Orlando. We are already looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it is all cracked up to be!”
Reviews.Author: meomy87
Reviews.Content: I guess I will start with the parking lot that is too far to the front entrance. You pull up to check out and then go around back to the parking lot that is pretty far from the lobby. The front desk manager was patronizing and arrogant. They did not seem welcoming at all!! When I got to my room, it was not what was expected. I booked the JR. Suite and I am not sure why they called it a suite, because it did not have a balcony or a jacuzzi. I remember the website saying it had those ammentitie when I booked it. When I questioned it with the front desk manager, he said he would call back and never did. He seemed annoyed that I would even question the room. The room was fairly clean; however, I could see little stains on the rugs and dust in areas not used often. Behind end tables etc. The pool was not as nice as it looked on the website. It wasnt terrible however, the big palmetto bug crawling out of the pool led to my demise. I know this was not the hotels fault. The Front desk also did not tell you about the ammenities of the hotel. I was glad i only stayed one night. I have to say I was spoiled from the last hotel I stayed for 4 days. I did not feel welcome at this hotel, and I will not go back. The good thing about the hotel is the distance to Universal and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for nice price!”
Reviews.Author: JEmery73
Reviews.Content: As part of our company's ESM program the room was a great value and being a last minute idea I was really pleasently suprised. Wish I had a few extra days to spend there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at The Point...Can't Wait To Stay There Again!!”
Reviews.Author: Sultana2929
Reviews.Content: Considering the many choices of hotels in Orlando, we chose to stay at The Point based on the great reviews it received on Tripadvisor. We are glad we did, because of all the different places we have stayed at in the past, The Point Orlando definitely tops all of them. We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite which was very spacious and luxurious with a beautiful kitchen and washer and dryer. The location is superb as we were only a few minutes away from Wet & Wild, Universal Studios and International Drive. The free shuttle service was great as well. What stood out more than anything, however, is the customer service of the entire staff, especially the people at the front desk. From the moment we checked in, we were welcomed with a big smile by front desk agent, Sophia. She is very familiar with the restaurants and activities in the area and gave us some great tips which we made use of. Her customer service went above and beyond every time. All in all, we just felt like every detail was attended to and there was someone to take care of our every need. All we had left to do was just enjoy ourselves and relax, which was exactly what we were looking to do. Between the location, cleanliness and the great & knowledgeable staff, we highly recommend this amazing resort to anyone visiting Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ameli123
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here based on the reviews we read. It was a very good decision and loved the place. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and it had everything we needed. This place is very clean and well maintained. Pool was super clean. Great location, just 5 minute drive to Universal. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for better”
Reviews.Author: mtl86
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe this was a 3.5 star! The beds were comfortable, the 1 bedroom suite was very clean and modernly furnished. The bathroom was huge! The service excellent, the pool area very quiet. A definite must, especially if you are planning to go to Universal or Wet n Wild which are so closeby! My only advice would be not to count on the sleeper sofa for a comfortable sleep - our 8 year old son did not complain however it would not sleep an adult comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “As always. A great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Javy_man187
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the point several times and each time was better than the last. Great staff again as always. I recommend this place for couples, families and professionals. For the couples its a nice weekend getaway with all attractions just minutes away if thats what u want. Plenty of restaurants near by. Comfy rooms and suites. Bottom line, if you stay at The Point you will be very happy and without a doubt leave with a great memory.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular,Simply Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: lmaze
Reviews.Content: The Point Resort was in the perfect spot for all of the theme parks, mainly wet n wild (5-8) minute walk. we caught the I-Trolley directly in front of the hotel for $1.25 adult children ride free directly to seaworld aquactic park & seaworld. Once at seaworld there is a shuttle that takes you to seaworld aquactic waterpark. You can also walk up to international drive (5-8 min) theres an I-hop, Red Lobster, KFC, Wendy's , walgreens very convenient. The I trolly also takes you to Universal studios, u get off and walkmaybe 10 mins to the entrance to Universal Studios. The I trolley also takes you up and down International drive that has lots of shopping, attractions, movie theatres, malls, outlets. The Point Resort location is awesome and the staff is amazing, the hotel is beautiful, absolutely beautiful. My daughter and I had the studio and it was more than enough for 2 people. thy also have 1 or 2 bedrooms that are spectacular with more than reasonal prices. enjoy and make sure you check out The Point Resort! It was a blast!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: elcolombiano218
Reviews.Content: Straight to the point Staff – professional, well mannered, and friendly. I had the studio – VERY clean, and very spacious. The little kitchen had everything you need. Awesome hotel! Will come again! Will recommend! Has a 'resort fee' of like 10$

Reviews.Title: “I was totally amazed.”
Reviews.Author: twinkleyesarah
Reviews.Content: The lobby was beautiful. Then we got to our room and it had a kitchen with a stove/oven, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, nice-sized fridge, washing machine, and dryer. They provided soap for the dishwasher and washing machine. There was also wired internet in the living room. In the master bathroom we had a jet bath and a shower. The bedroom had a big king-sized bed. The decorations of the room were wonderful too. Granite countertops, shiny tile in the bathroom, and beautiful paintings in the bedroom and living room. I never got in the pool, but it looked lovely. Wet n Wild was practically right across the street and the Festival Bay Mall(which I loved) was prettty close also. Not to mention the price was really good for the quality of the resort. I felt like royalty in luxury. I would absolutely go there again. P.S. The would thing I do complain about is the parking. The parking lot was almost completely full in the evenings when everybody got back. Also, because they are building a 3rd tower, they definitely need to expand their parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is--and that's a good thing!”
Reviews.Author: drlen
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot--much of it business related--and when it comes to hotels, most nights are spent in well recognized brand names at the mid-upper level cost range. So, when it came time to visit the new Harry Potter theme park at Universal, we went searching for a good hotel at reasonable price to house our group of 5 which included a mom, dad, and three teenagers/young adults. We ended up at The Point Orlando Resort, and I have to say we were definitely not disappointed. As the headline says, it is what it is, and that's a good thing. The Point is a reasonably new hotel, which in fact is better described as a "condo hotel." It is very clean, everything functions, and the rooms are very adequate. We were in a sutie which was actually two rooms: one, a standard room with a king bed and a kitchenette, next to which was a junior suite which had a full kitchen, refrigerator, small living room and a bedroom. The furniture is adequate, the beds comfortable, and everything fairly basic. Nice, large bathroom in the junior suite, and as noted the room was clean and well maintained. There is a small breakfast restaurant downstairs, but no other restaurants on the property. Not a major problem, since there are tons of places to eat nearby. The pool is nice, but not overly large There is a small "functional" fitness center. What really struck us was how pleasant and accomodating the front desk staff was to us. We decided to stay an extra night, and they were very accomodating. Parking is on site, without charge. Location is fine, near the intersections of Universal and International Drives, about a mile from Universal Studios. Bottom line, not dramatic but very functional and pleasant. We would definitely stay here again if we brought family to visit the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, good location and well appointed apartments”
Reviews.Author: Dave_and_Helen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in apartment 404 which is a 1 bedroom condo ( as they like to call them). Good quality fixtures and nice qualilty furnishings. Huge bed ( so big you may need to contact your partner by text !) Jet bath plus shower (free shampoo/shower gel etc) Well equipped kitchen. Large Fridge has an ice maker. We liked that you are provided with washing up liquid, sponge/scourer dish washer powder, washing powder, kitchen roll and filter coffee. When you use something it is usually replaced during daily room refresh by housekeeping. Free Wired internet in room and free wi-fi in reception. Free local phone calls. Rooms were very quiet and with good blackout curtains (needed as very bright security lights outside). Not much of a view or balcony but we didn't find it an issue. There isn't a safe in the room but free safety deposit box at reception. The Hotel feels safe and secure and we often saw security staff outside the bulding. All the staff are very pleasant and helpful. Thanks to Lauren and Fabio who were at the bar and made us feel very welcome on our first night (its just a shame Lauren introduced my wife to Grey Goose Vodka, as she now likes it a bit too much !) . Fabio also very kindly offered us a late check out on our last day when he realised we had a later flight home. When I asked about using the business center to print out an email, reception offered to print it for me for no charge. It was gestures like this that helped make our stay so enjoyable. A short walk gets you to International drive with a good choice of places to eat and drink. There is also a supermarket nearby. The hotel is less than 2 miles from the Universal Theme park - but we wouldn't recommend walking to it. Pool area is nice, not huge but big enough and we always found free sunbeds. There are vending machines by pool for snacks and drinks, but you can take your own drinks (no glass for safety) as there is no pool bar. It is worth mentioning that the hotel is building a 3rd tower next to the pool so there can be building noise, but most people are out during the day so there was only once in 2 weeks that it affected us when using the pool. We never heard any building noise when we were in the room. This was our 3rd time in Orlando and the this is best place we have found, we would definitely stay again. Well Done Point Orlando, Keep up the good work ! Dave & Helen Walsh

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasminecLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so lovely I loved it, I went with my friends and 2 children, We had a 2 bedroom apartment . The bathroom was so big and the beds was comfortable. The rooms where very clean. I wasn't to happy with the staff they didn't seem friendly. And when we was leaving we had to pay extras for the gym which we didn't even use, that really pissed me off.Overall the hotel is nice good location .

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Orlando property”
Reviews.Author: scarlett027
Reviews.Content: This property is a hidden gem. Clean, excellent, knowledgeable, friendly staff. This affordable property has a great location on the I-Drive-near to Universal and City Walk, Disney and Seaworld and Cocoa Beach. The pool is nice size and the suites are roomy, clean and very comfortable. I recommend this for business and vacation travel for everyone. Bathrooms very well lit, modern with whirlpool tub. Our family will go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: dmarie45
Reviews.Content: I truly loved this hotel, not only because it was clean and had great staff which was nice and helpful but because I didn't have to drive far to the parks. I went to Universal and Island of Adventure theme parks and it was only a mile to the parks. The water park (wild waters) and City walk is also right down the road as well. I would have to say this was absolutely without a doubt the best room I have been in. Thank you to the staff for a great and relaxing stay. dawn

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and the location”
Reviews.Author: Dallas327
Reviews.Content: It is the right location for all the activites and sites

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: gaveareview
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Point for three nights during our vacation to the theme parks. The hotel was right across the street from Wet and Wild, about 5 minutes from Universal and 15 from Disney. We were greeted by a friendly receptionist and a very clean lobby. Our one bedroom suite was exactly like the photos showed! We were on the 10th floor overlooking universal... great view. The pool was nice and the resort is currently building a pool side bar and grill. Overall great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - great suite, friendly staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: fivesheds
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and we were very impressed by the quality of the accomodation. The kitchen was very well equipped; one of the bathrooms also had spa bath fitted & large shower area; TV lounge area in our room had a flat screen with good channel selection. The hotel staff we met were all very helpful. Each suite room is air conditioned (a must !) & comfortable. We had a suite on the upper floors & offered good views over to Universal area & Int Drive areas. Universal is about 25 mins walk away or 5 min drive & hotel offered an efficient courtesy bus option as well. Convenient for Universal Boulevard; Int Drive.& access to main routes (e.g. I-4). Hotel is located just off Universal Boulevard that is quieter & less built up than Int Drive. Parking at Hotel is also easy. Hotel reception area is really nice & we used the pool on most days. The Point is a really good option for a 2 week stay; having kitchen, washing machine, dryer facilities was really useful. Hotel had a breakfast option & night bar though we did not try. The GYM facilities also looked good though did not use ! A safe facility is available at reception only & we used. We really enjoyed our stay at The Point & hotel met / even exceeded expecatations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: leehealy
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 14 days from the 11th may to the 25th inclusive in a two bedroomed suite and i couldnt find a fault in anything, rooms were very spacious and spotless fully equipped with full kitchen amenities: cooker, fridge freezer, washing machine/tumble dryer, dishwasher etc. seperate bedroom had kitchenette and coffee making facilities as well as seperate bathroom facilities. situated approx 5 minute stroll from international drive and all its restaurants and bars and theres an i-ride trolley stop outside the hotel which brings you all up along international drive to the outlets and sea world and passes for that were only $17 for the two weeks. overall i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for comfort and an ideal location, the staff couldnt be more helpful in particular Fabio in guest services who was a major help to my party when it came to helping out with a member of my party who was in a wheelchair and i would recommend it to anyone looking for wheelchair accessible bathrooms and shower facilities. we greatly enjoyed our stay here and we will return to this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel, with a great staff, in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: appydad
Reviews.Content: The Point Orlando Resort is a great hotel. I stayed there with my 2 children May 29-31, 2010. The staff is very professional, courteous, friendly, and knowledgeable. The 1 bedroom suite was great and the king bed was very comfortable. The pool is a good size and at one end the depth goes down to 3 feet and a few inches, which is just right for kids. There is a good fitness center near the pool. The breakfast buffet is really good, too, and came with a large fresh fruit salad and Starbucks coffee. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Wet N Wild and several good restaurants. There was nothing I did not like about the hotel and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: bigmcd
Reviews.Content: the mcdonald clan stayed at the point resort as it is now called for 2 weeks ,magic place to stay ,just off i-drive behind wet and wild water park .we had the 2bedroom 2 bathroom suite loads of room for us 5 adults and 1 child.the double beds were huge and so comfy.the sofa beds not as comfy and they stink,not a dirty smell it is just what they are made out of. maid service is limited, beds made everyday and you had to change the sheets yourself.there is a resort fee of $5 perday to cover things like poolside towels and the maid service ,it is a bit of a con but if you know about it before you go the stylish apartment is well worth it for the wee bit extra.you can walk to universal studios from here its a nice 15-20 min walk . the free shuttle service was great if you wanted togo to the parks all day and i mean all day because they take you there and if you wanted to come back to the hotel it was a 10pm pick up and you were dropped of at 9am still we had a great time and the reception staff were brilliant and so friendly

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: deddy4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 14 year old and friend to Universal Studios. I found the Point on line and took my chances. We realized after we arrived that the 1 bedroom suite would be too small for us and 2 teenage boys and upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite for, all considering, a minimum charge. What a blessing, and Fabio at the front desk was so accommidating for us. The kitchen was well stocked with new appliances. We are looking forward to returning soon when the full restaurant and tiki bar are finished being built. A suggestion was made regading guests letting several (15) friends visit the pool. Not sure how they can do that except maybe ask them for they're room number, etc., but there were no towels for the paying guests. Lauren at the bar was a pleasure to visit with, very sweet. I suggest anyone looking for a place near the Parks and Wet and Wild to check this place out, you wont be disaPOINTed!! D. Eddy - Tarpon Springs, FL

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home (for us), though not sure about the rest of you lot...”
Reviews.Author: version3point1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Grand Suite for 10 days and it is bigger than a lot of 1-bedroom flats in London. The staff were friendly and welcoming from the outset and very patient, explaining everything very clearly and helping with any additional queries. The open-plan kitchen was well thought out with a range cooker, microwave, fridge and dishwasher, not to mention a washer/dryer combo and airing cupboard which meant we didn't have to pack as many clothes with us for the 10 days and could easily (and quickly) do one load of washing to replenish us for the week. The bathroom was extremely clean and roomy with a bathtub and shower unit, as well as a linen cupboard. The bedroom was very comfortable and we had a comfortable and clean king bed. All throughout the suite there was a great deal of storage space, which is handy if you are staying a while. There are drawers in the living room area as well as a cupboard, drawers and shelves in the bedroom. In the living room, there was a rather large cupboard by the balcony area that I happened to discover by mistake – it was large enough to fit two large suitcases, a few bags and other junk in there, keeping the rest of the room clutter free. There were enough hangers in the cupboard to store clothes for two people for a week. There is a high-speed Internet connection in the living room, but this is only via ethernet cable and admittedly I had to ask about where to find it as it was hidden behind the TV. Complementary Wi-Fi service is in the lobby downstairs, though I hope that this is something that the Management hope to introduce to all rooms in the future. For those of you who couldn't be bothered to read the small print when making your booking on sites like hotels.com or listening to the staff at check-in, the $9.95 daily fee is a compulsory resort fee that isn't hidden like others have suggested. Yes, it is an additional charge on top of your reservation and this covers the parking permit, use of the spa and other leisure facilities, the 'daily refresh' service and the high-speed internet in the living room. I'm not sure why they don't bundle it in, but make sure you've read and understood what it's for and that it's there, so that if it does bother you, you know to look elsewhere. Location-wise, the hotel is very well placed. If you're silly enough to follow a sat-nav/GPS and not look at a map of the area beforehand, of course you will have difficulty finding the place as the sat-nav/GPS will direct you along the main road and leave you having to look for a very quick turning. There are THREE ways of accessing the hotel and the parking area – two of which are from main roads – and it is just 20 minutes drive from Orlando International Airport. We weren't really interested in any of the resorts in the area (as we'd come to view a shuttle launch), but it does present a variety of good places to eat in the evening, as well as being well-connected with the I-4 and SR-528 (takes less than an hour to drive up to Titusville or the Kennedy Space Center, and about an hour to drive up to Daytona Beach, both of which are between 60-70 miles away depending on what roads you take). Things that would've made the stay a lot better would've been having a small safe inside the room for a wallet and documents as it would've saved us carrying extra things we didn't need with us as well as making them easily accessible at the time we did need them (as we locked things up in our suitcases). The view from our window was of a car dealership/garage and a very bright light that shone onto the building – this didn't bother us much as we rarely spent time on the balcony or staring out of the bedroom window anyway and at night the curtains were very good, though I can imagine some people might've been bothered by this. We stayed at this place for 10 days this May which is probably ideal for couples or solo travellers as the majority of families on summer holidays haven't really peaked yet. We did not expect or want to spend 10 days in a 'hotel' as we're not into being waited on or having somebody tend after us every five minutes. If you're that shallow and/or bothered about having a flat-screen TV in your living area and/or bedroom, do not stay here. To conclude, I felt a great sense of shame reading some of the reviews on here by people who obviously do not show a great deal of self-responsibilty or common sense. The 'daily refresh' service basically does what it does – gives you fresh towels, makes the bed and takes out the rubbish – there is no full-on house-keeping service here as the place is already advertised as being a self-catering condo accommodation, so if you live like a slob and trash the place or leave all your own hairs in the bathplug, don't expect somebody to clean up after you. If you run out of toilet paper at home, don't you change it yourself? That's why they leave you toilet roll in the cupboards. This also applies to why they give you dishwasher powder – if you use the kitchen utensils or crockery they provide for you, you should be old and mature enough to at least clean something yourself. Obviously, if there's something like already dirty linen or whatnot on your first night of stay, then you should take this up with the management, but all in all, IF YOU CANNOT BE BOTHERED TO CLEAN UP AFTER YOURSELF OR TAKE SOME ACCOUNTABILITY FOR THE WAY YOU ARE OR THE WAY YOU BEHAVE WHEN STAYING IN ACCOMMODATION OTHER THAN YOUR OWN HOUSE, DO NOT COME HERE. This also includes leaving your valuables slung around the place – I'm not excusing any actions where things have allegedly been taken in other reviews, but it's simple – if you don't leave it lying around or in an unlocked case then it doesn't get stolen. We were able to leave over £5000 of our professional photographic equipment, plus a laptop and other valuables safely in our room by simply using common sense and locking them up in our cases when we were not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: StarA00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the junior suite a weekend in May. The hotel was okay but with what we paid staying at a Hampton in would have been just as nice. The decor in the rooms is nice but the TVs aren't flat screens. The pool and the hot tub were really nice. It was great that we could bring our own drinks to the pool. They are missing out on making money by not having a tiki bar but oh well we brought our own beer down. We had a nice view of the pool from pur room 905H. The microwave and kitchenette was great but we didn't use it. There was free high speed internet in the room but not wifi so my boyfriend and i could only check our mail one at a time with our individual lap tops.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel facilities with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Swisserman
Reviews.Content: Our trip started off with a phone call, where the reservations agent was very helpful and nice. Once we arrived the welcome was very good, the desk agent checked us in very quickly and efficiently. We asked the front desk agent for some advice on where to have dinner in the downtown area and he gave us an extensive list of places to chose from. With regards to the room, it is very nice. It has everything one could want or need. However I have two cons about it, the first being that the A/C kept blowing air onto the bed in the middle of the night, which woke me up a few times. And I would recommend asking for a high floor room that does not face the parking lot. I say this because rooms located on the ground floor that give way to the parking lot might be surprised by headlights beeming into the bedroom in the middle of the night. Lastly, the hotel provides a shuttle to Universal only once a day in the morning and back in the evening. My friend and I did not want to take the car and the walk is no walk in the park.Therefore I would recommend to the hotel to provide a shuttle around lunch time for those late risers. Otherwise the hotel is in excellent condition, clean, the staff is very friendly. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AmaRoss
Reviews.Content: First trip to Florida - this suite is all you could ask for. With 2 teenage children and a 7 year old the accommodation and facilities were first class. This would be the case if we were on a straightforward holiday, however, the Icelandic volcano decided t blow and extend our holiday for a further 9 days! don't get me wrong, we could be in a worse place than Orlando, but we were hearing horror stories of how some people were being treated. Not the case with The Point. No problem to stay as long as we needed, but they also recognised our predicament and offered us a reduced rate for our accommodation - which was exactly the same 2 bedroomed suite. All round excellent and would thoroughly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this place.”
Reviews.Author: Hotshot27
Reviews.Content: We spent two great nights at this hotel. We stayed in a 1-bedroom unit. The units are complete living facilities with full kitchen, bath with walk-in shower and jacuzzi tub. Ultra clean and furnished with very nice furniture including a leather hide-a-bed couch. We had an 11th floor balcony overlooking the pretty poool area. The staff is unfailingly polite and attentive to your every need. There is plenty of parking, the place is convenient to all attractions. As a construction manager I noticed the structural quality and excellent interior "fit and finish,' of the building. It is obvious that the manager, Mr. Ross Burke, runs a tight ship. The prices are unbelievably competitive when you consider what you get. Do yourself a favor and sign in at The Point Orlando. Lloyd & Betty Herman Sarasota, FL

Reviews.Title: “the best time i every had in orlando”
Reviews.Author: murphy1059
Reviews.Content: I would like to complement the staff at the point orlando resort. this was the first time i stayed at this resort and i will not go anywhere else! the staff was so nice and welcoming and they knew how to make you feel at home. the location of the resort was perfect for walking to many attractions. the manager i beleive her name was angela was very polite, friendly always had a smile and very informative, she could answer all of our questions. thank you for a wonderful time, hope to see everyone soon for we will definitely be back. i will without a doubt recommend this to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kdmb407
Reviews.Content: For those of you looking for a spacious 2 bedroom suite close to Disney, Universal and SeaWorld...The Point Orlando Resort is a great choice. The Point offers 2 very large rooms that are completely seperated, each with a bath and a great kitchen with full-size appliances including a washer & dryer. The Point is only 3 mintues to Wet & Wild, 5 minutes to Universal Studios, 10 minutes to SeaWorld and an easy 15-20 minute drive to Disney. There are several good restaurants nearby. Breakfast at IHOP was good and I highly recommend Bahama Breeze. Although there are no breathtaking grounds, multiple pools, on-site restaurants or other amenities commonly found at a resort type hotel we found The Point to be perfect for our needs. It is much like staying in a highrise condominum which worked great for us since we were at one of the theme parks from morning until late at night. Why pay for all those resort amenities we would never use? We would stay at The Point again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great service, great rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jax883
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel because of its good location to the universal theme park. Although the hotels pool was under some sort of renovation and was closed down during our stay, the hotel made accomodations for us to have access to another resorts pool, which was fun. The employees at the front desk made us feel like we were at home and went out of their way to provide us with directions and information about the area. The room in which we stayed was large and very clean. The beds were comfortable and I liked the little coffee bar in the lobby. I will definitely be staying at this hotel on my return trip this summer for Harry Potter at universal!!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon - fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrickhall
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 10 nigths on our honeymoon last yr. The hotel was fab, we had a beautiful suite. Pool area really nice. There is no restaurant in this hotel which was a bit of a bummer if it was raining outside, as we did not have any car and when it rains in orlando it really rains. Thankfully this only happend us one night. You can order in from almost any take away in the area, so that's what we did that night :) Otherwise once you find your bearings you are within walking distance to everything, only mins away from the pirate show. There is a bus service from the hotel every morning to all the parks, we got the 7.20am bus most mornings, as the next one after that wasn't till around 10am and this hotel is the first pick up on the route so by time you pick everyone up and get out to parks it's around 9. suites us perfectly but may not suit if you have small kids as they will be tired and also only really one bus back around 5pm. we loved our stay here though and would def go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - not sure about the location”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here as part on an Orlando trip. we had a great rate - paid in advance in the UK. We booked a 1 bed apartment but were upgraded to a gorgeous and huge 2 bed which was more than big enough for the 3 of us - may daughter had a whole apartment to herself. Rooms were confortable, my only criticism is that the air conditioning does not come out in a steady stream - it bursts on and off really loudly and is pointed at the beds so we went from hot to freezing and back to hot again - this kept us awake sometimes. Pool area is quiet and clean, bar dull and not open often. Wouldnt come back to this hotel again - not because of any fault with the hotel - but because we like to walk to a restaurant/bar in the evenings abd I found this part of I Drive quite seedy. I much prefer the other end near to Pointe Orlando. Overall - lovely hotel, great value but would go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped Quarters for the Cash”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Duck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for travelers visiting Universal Studios. I chose it because of this and because they were offering a Florida Resident Rate of $84.00. The room was clean, beds comfortable, and quiet, however nothing special for a junior suite. The drawback was that after additional charges, the rate for 1 night ended up being $125.00 and the room was quite cramped (especially the bathroom). The price did NOT include complimentary breakfast, which is not on par with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Happyones5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a night at The Point to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel was close to several restaurants and entertainment. We spent the evening at CityWalk. We were disappointed that the hotel transportation was not available in the evening. In fact, it only provided transportation one time a day. Therefore, we had to pay for a cab to CityWalk and then back again. While waiting for cab, we had a seat in the hotel lounge. The chairs are in dire need of a deep cleaning. Many stains on the seat covers. We stayed in a one bedroom executive suite that was very clean and spacious. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and probably try the 2 bedroom unit and bring our children.

Reviews.Title: “top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: dumped
Reviews.Content: After being stranded by the volcano we came across this little piece of paradise with fantastic staff and accommodation. They bent over backwards to help us through the stress of our extra stay. We wish we had found this place at the start of our holiday as we would loved to have stayed there. It is in a central postion for access to all the parks and a two minute walk to i-drive. The accommodation was more like 5 star than 3 .5. The amenities were like home from home full kitchen with all mod cons. Living area was spacious and comfortable. The bedroom was very spacious to and so was the bathroom. Great resort and wouldn't hesitate to go back. Thanks very much for your help and understanding. Mr & Mrs W. Holley

Reviews.Title: “The Point was everything we hoped for and more!”
Reviews.Author: kingisking
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our family holiday to Orlando. It was in a great location, very near Wet n Wild waterpark which the kids loved. Also easy for the theme parks and all that Orlando has to offer. The rooms were very clean and nicer in real life than the pics. A good choice for families spending time in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury apartments with friendly and helpfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: markmcrorie
