Reviews.Content: We came across the point orlando when stranded because of flights being put off because of volcanic erruptions, we stayed here for four nights and I just wish I had found this hotel at the beginning of my holiday as this place is pure luxury and the staff and managment were very polite and helpfull they could not do enough to help myself who was there with my 11 year old son. The rates were excellent, this is five star accomodation as far as i am concerned without the five star rates. I stayed in a Five star hotel when arriving in Florida for the fortnight and this place was far better and the staff and managment far superiour and far more helpfull and they deserve all the credit they get and I will certainley come back to this Hotel in future and would recommend it to all my family and friends without hesitating and anybody else. The accomodation was home from home with beutifull furnicions and a kitchen with everything you could dream of and a large bathroom with double shower and jacuzzi bath and spacious bedroom and living accomodation. Everybody else that I spoke to that we got friendly with all said the same and could not agree more. Thanks again to all at the Point Orlando for all your gratefull help, I will certainely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Great service”
Reviews.Author: vendingking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Point for 9 days and had a wonderful time, rooms were great, location was great, very clean and the staff were all fantastic, Jose in perticular. Would recomend and will stay any chance we get

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean -- great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: UtahMikester
Reviews.Content: Our room was HUGE and nicely appointed. The location was near all the activities of International Blvd. Would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “In-room Washer/Dryer saved the day!”
Reviews.Author: Irving_Family
Reviews.Content: Travelling with our (just turned) two year old, I was a bit trepidatious - but The Point was great. They supplied me with a play-pen for sleeping and the in-room W/D set was the best surprise EVER... I didn't even know about it until I opened the "closet" in the kitchen. The king bed in the bedroom was a bit lumpy, but you're so beat out by the end of the day it makes no difference. The hotel was very quiet and beautifully designed. After all said and done The Point made the trip so easy. Just a note - DON'T forget your room key when you go to the pool - you can't get back in the building... learned that one the hard way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: WaterboyUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 bedroom apartment- 2 adults +1 child (8). The door from corridor leads 2 separate apartments each with locking rooms- we kept it open for my daughter for security. The minor apt had king size bed , kitchen area, sofa, bathroom with bath. The major apt had large lounge area with full kitchen area including full size fridge, washing machine, dryer, cooker, dishwasher and microwave and all crockery , glasses etc. All spotlessly clean. Large bathroom with jaccuzzi bath, big shower space . Our room overlooked Orlando to the North and was on11th floor- great views of lights at night and quiet. Maid service was excellent and they replaced washing powder and washing up liquid if used (cost was $5/day +tax). Free wifi. We used the room to have breakfast every day as all facilities were available and staff had directed us to Publix to get all provisions. Value for money was fantastic given the swimming pool as well (with free towels) and it is in good location just down from WetnWild and off noisy Intl Drive. Also on I ride route . We like it so much we went back at the end of our 2 week Florida fly drive.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: micra1
Reviews.Content: Hi, We have just returned from this hotel, (two adults, two kids aged 12 and 14). We had a two bed 'lock off' on the top floor - the kids slept in the smaller apartment, we had the other. It wouldn't have done for smaller kids, but the level of privacy it gave us was much appreciated. The apartment was spotless and cleaned well when we we chose to have the room serviced, (we didn't have to pay extra). It was well-equipped and we cooked most days - my oldest has food allergies and we really appreciated having the s/c facilities. The hotel was quiet - we never heard a peep from our neighbours. The desk staff were courteous and helpful and we didn't have to pay extra for a security box. (Another rather bizarre plus was that on the night we needed to go to the ER - long story - we were only round the corner from the rather impressive facilities at Dr Phillips Hospital) I only used the pool once but it was lovely - my only reservation in that it was in the shade until early afternoon and it could benefit from a pool bar. My only real quibble with this lovely accommodation was that the beds were a little too soft. However, it's in a perfect location for Universal and we felt very safe there. I would definitely go back to the Point again - I heartily recommend it for people who are not looking for a high level of hotel interference, (no pushy door staff, for example), but want the security of desk staff. However, if you want a bar/restaurant/bell hops, etc. then this isn't the place for you. Please pm me if you would like any other info. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value - beds not the best”
Reviews.Author: miltongatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights - just needed a place to crash near Universal theme parks. Only 5 minute drive to Universal - plenty or restaurants within walking distance. Great two bedroom suite with full kitchen, two bathrooms, two kings size beds and two sleeper sofas. Mattresses were very soft - not sure why they went cheap with those when everything else was top notch (even granite in kitchen and bathrooms). No restaurant on-site. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderfull time.Staff,Jose,Tim and Angela were great. My wife and I will return next year.”
Reviews.Author: EXPOSBath_Ontario
Reviews.Content: Not one negative to our experiance.Probably the best experiance we have had in Florida in the five years we have travelled there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: lenastele
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and clean. I was surprized that our room was like an actual fully equiped one-bedroom apartment and for a change the rooms looked much better in life than on the pictures!! It is close to the waterpark wet'n wild but doesnt have much more around it. However, nothing is too far away in Orlando. This year we are planing another trip to Orlando and I definitelly will book our rooms there.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever! In superb hotel with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: neilio75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at th point orlando resort in mid march this year.Not only was it the best holiday we have ever had ,but it was the best hotel with incredibly helpful staff too.We were a bit worried before we went as we have a 4 year old boy and a 15 month old daughter and thought the hotel maybe not cater very well for all of us.But it did,we ate out very little and asked reception(of which the most helpful was Jose) for some take away menus and recommendations for places to deliver us food. Every single thing that was recommended was delicious.The Point Orlando really was the cherry on the cake for us,a well situated hotel with good amenities and excellent staff. Neil Rogerson Cumbria,England. NEILROGERSON@SKY.COM

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: oscart
Reviews.Content: Overall this resort is excellent, but I don't believe it should be judged as a hotel, as there are better with more facilities, but if like me you don't want to use a pool, gym, or eat in the resort (there are hundreds of restaurants within 15 mins, why would you want to eat in the resort each day) then as an apartment/condo it really is very good and hard to beat. I appreciated the space, quality of furnishings (on a par with the very expensive Loews Portofino Bay Hotel at Universal which I've stayed in), large bathroom and shower cubicles, appliances including iron, hairdryer, fridegfreezer, blender (for those margaritas!), starbucks coffee available in the lobby cafe, 2 TVs and internet for which a cable was provided in room meaning I didn't even need to use my wireless, simply plugged in and opened up my internet browser for instant access. Only bad points for me were the beds and pillows which i found far too soft, and the service charge which stated it included 'light cleaning', for which in my opinion chagning towels and emptying trash doesn't cover, and the fact that on 1 or 2 occasions our room wasn't serviced, but the daily charge of course still applies. I would however gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Jamunson03
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really called The Point, nobody seems to know where it is located. If you have a room like ours, you have a wonderful view of a questionable auto shop. Don't be fulled by the "free shuttle" to Sea World and Universal...there is only one a day, miss it and you either pay a small fortune to get a taxi or wait for the I Trolly. I Trolly is great, but you have to wait sometimes. Oh, the hotel told us they sold the Trolly passes, but they don"t you have to go to another hotel to purchase. No place to eat at The Point, unless you like tapasse for a meal. The only meal is breakfast and it is nothing to write home about. So be prepared to go else where for a meal. Staff not very nice either. To busy chatting with each other and not intrested in customers. When I called to confirm they told me that I would think this place was better than Portofino Bay.....hardly folks. I would rather pay the price to be a resort property. THan to top it off, there is a "resort fee" they hit you with after your stay...what...this is not a resort..is was a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but don't waste your money with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Paty_0916
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from Orlando. We found this hotel on tripadvisor, read the reviews and booked w/ bed & breakfast. Well, great location. You can walk to Wet n Wild, and to Universal Studios. Staff super friendly. Loved the room, very spacious. However, there are two things that we would not recommend: DO NOT BOOK BED & BREAKFAST! The breakfast area is in the lobby and it only has 5 tables, which makes impossible to sit and eat. Also, the breakfast is very very poor. We paid $10 per person and it was totally not worthy! Also, DO NOT USE JACUZZI except if you bring your own cleaning products like we did otherwise, you might see "unwanted hair". Besides these 2 things, everything else was great and we are most likely to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Holiday Stay in an Above Average Condo setting”
Reviews.Author: edben
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean property and hotel with good amenities. Located just off of International Drive and within walking distance to Universal Studios. We stayed in a spacious one bedroom apartment that was fully equiped, clean, comfortable and furnished in a modern, attractive setting. The staff was courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable and roomy - we really enjoyed this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie0928
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel by chance on the web and chose it mainly for the close location to City Walk. Everyone was very friendly and this was super easy to check in and get to our room. Very accomodating staff and our expectations were exceeded. I highly recommend this hotel. Very pretty rooms and bathrooms and the bed was very very comfortable. Did not use the pool due to the cool weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! A few blocks from Universal Studios!”
Reviews.Author: Neolca
Reviews.Content: This was such a great place to stay. My boyfriend and I (we're both 28 yrs old and wanted to act like kids and go to the theme parks) stayed in a one-bedroom suite for three days. The suite had a kitchen with all utensils, plates, pans, and cups. The bathroom was huge with a jacuzzi tub. The king-size bed was super comfortable! Loved the fact that after a long day at Universal I could sleep in the bedroom while my boyfriend was in the living room watching t.v - with that said, the walls are NOT thin so I slept soundly :) As for the location, it was very easy to drive over to Universal Studios since it was down the street. It's also down the street from International Drive and Sand Lake Ave, which is filled with stores (Whole Foods, Publix, Mc D's, Panera, etc.). Unlike many of the hotels around that area, each room had a balcony, which I found really nice to have. I didn't go into the pool but it looked nice and clean. Breakfast isn't included but went to Whole Foods and made breakfast every morning. Overall, awesome time and will stay here again whenever I get back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TheCraigsScotland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this location on quite a few occasions. The one bedroom suite is what we usually ask for as we feel having the sitting room separate from the bedroom is a lot more practical especially in the morning when one wants to get up early and the other prefers a lie in. This hotel is located quite conveniently for all the major attractions (even if you dont have a car) as you are only a 5 minute walk to I.Drive where there is ample public transport. Restaurants in the vicinity of this place include Chillis, Fridays, The Black Angus Steakhouse and George and the Dragon (especially for British visitors) George and the Dragon show all Premiership games and SPL games involving Rangers. The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly. The pool area with a hot tub jacussi is excellent (fitness centre at side of pool). My wife and myself are returning in November 2010 and we can hardly wait.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveL427
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia having read the positive reviews and were delighted with our choice. The hotel is well situated, extremely clean and the suites were well equipped. The staff were polite and friendly, parking was not a problem and the pool was well maintained with plenty of loungers etc. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get what I was promised.”
Reviews.Author: workinghardNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through American Express and reserved a one bedroom suite with breakfast. After arguing for 3 days that I had breakfast included in my reservation, upon checking out I showed the front desk a copy of my itinerary, stating I was entitled to breakfast. However, they only refunded me one day's breakfast instead of 3 days. I was very disappointed that they did not do the right thing. The bar was only opened one night and I did not see their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - will come again!”
Reviews.Author: revbingo
Reviews.Content: I can’t really fault this hotel in any way. Check in was a breeze with very helpful staff in reception. When booking the holiday, I requested a room quit high up, looking over Universal Studios which we were given! On the night of the shuttle launch, the staff bent over backwards to help us get a really good view. The rooms were cleaned as described (towels replaced, bed made, trash taken out etc). All staff were courteous and polite. The one bedroomed ’apartment’ was amazing, with a beautiful kitchen, washing/drying machine, TV in living room and bedroom. The only ’fault’ was the shuttle service to the theme parks. It took over an hour to get to Universal Studios as the shuttle picked us up first before continuing to other hotels and a trip to SeaWorld first. We ended up walking to Universal Studios in the end as we had 2 week passes and it was only a 20-25 min walk away. There was a Walgreens store about a 10 min walk away which was fine for our grocery shopping. It was a shame it rained a lot during our stay and was bitterly cold. Because of the rain, the walk to the closest shops was a pain. However, the location would not be a problem for typical Florida weather. The hotel made the stay most enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2cent2
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Orlando and have to say that we enjoyed the hospitality and cleanliness of The Point Orlando Resort. After 6 days, we felt very content with the hotel and knew the names of several staff members who were all very friendly, helpful and accomodating. We want to send a special thanks to Dominic with his wicked sense of humour and to the ladies at the front desk who always had a smile. The rooms were spotless, simply but amply appointed suites with very comfy cozy beds. When we come back to Orlando we will certainly come back. Thanks, W & S

Reviews.Title: “Loved my Stay!! Great Staff, Large rooms,Internet & work space!”
Reviews.Author: cadydidalot
Reviews.Content: The JR suite was perfect for my stay. The bed was comfortable. Loved the free hi-speed internet and there was plenty of space to work in the room. The entire staff was wonderful, cheerful, and eager to of assistance. The manager helped me with my bags and of course refused a tip. The location is just a few minutes from many attractions, several restaurants, shopping, and easy access to the Interstate. Plenty of parking and did not have to pay a ridiculous amount of money for extras. I will stay here again and can't wait to go down to relax with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “The Point Orlando Resort is one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: nolagirlatlanta
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay in the Point Orlando Resort. We reserved a 2 bedroom suite, which was really 2 seperate apartments ( a 1 bedroom and an efficiency) located next to each other in the suite. This building is a former condominium with all the great ammenities and upgrades that come with living in a condo. My children (ages 5, 7 &12) were very excited about having their own "apartment". The suite was actually big enough for 8 people. Both beds were king sized and both rooms had queen size sofa beds. Our room was on the first floor, right past the lobby. The one bedroom suite had a well equipped modern kitchen including a top and bottom washing machine and dryer. There was also a dishwasher and full utensils, plates, glasses, pots, pans and microwave trays and supplies. The efficiency suite had a mini kitchen with a sink, mini fridge, microwave and all the same plates, glasses, etc. All detergents are supplied by the hotel on a daily basis, along with a daily service with clean towels replenished, garbage emptied, beds made, etc. The reception staff were very helpful and polite. The hotel pool was excellent! The pool restroom was very clean as was the entire area around the pool. It was a very serene environment. We were very happy with our choice of hotel and would strongly recommend it to families visiting the Orlando area. It's near family friendly restaurants (even a Chuck E Cheeses) and other family friendly activities and amusements, including the Wet & Wild water park. It is by far one of the best hotels in Orlando. Be sure to check out their inclusive packages. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: North_Sydney
Reviews.Content: The reviews are all true lovely accommodation. Just don't use the fold out sofa. Smells of dead fish, they are brand new and apparently all smell the same. They changed ours over straight away. It still smelled.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PoppyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, apartment resort, we have stayed in some of the best hotels around the world, but we have never enjoyed a stay so much as we did at the Point Orlando Resort, Universal Blvd, please stay at this hotel you will not regret your choice. Central location but you will need a car to get further a field, we hired a car for the first time in USA we also rented a SATNAV which was invaluable. We will definately return to The Point Orlando Resort hotel, the staff could not have been more helpful, you will not be dissapointed with this hotel, we stayed in room 1209 on the 12th floor the views were amazing, ask for a room on the upper floors, just book it:), free wi fi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean great hotel. Poor service! Beware of extra hotel cost!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Music89
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days. Rooms were beautiful and clean bathroom, full kitchen, living room, bedroom felt small. *** BEWARE OF EXTRA HOTEL FEE'S!!! *** SERVICE IS NOT GOOD!! ** Guest services is only 1 person at a time and most of the time they are not sure what they are doing. Upon our arrival, I noticed that our linens in our bedroom had some strains of hairs which is not mine, because we didn't use it yet nor did we sat on the bed yet... the color is darker than my brunette hair. I asked guest services to changed my linen and they said ****"CHANGE LINEN IS EXTRA CHARGE!!!!*** ***POOR SERVICE***This is just crazy! I finally looked through the closets and found a bedsheet and changed it myself. Toilet ran out, when we returned.. was not replace. we had to look through the cabinets to find 1 toilet paper. they don't replenish it for you. (IS CHANGING TOILET EXTRA COST TO!!???) Hotel includes free parking, high-speed internet (not wi-fi, only accessible in living room), Refresh service - replacing towels daily, removing trash and making beds only. ALL THIS IS $9.99 which is hotel fee as an extra cost which is automatically put in your bill. So this is basically is ***NOT FREE*** but is charged to you. For other Full Maid Cleaning: (optional) vacuum, change linens and do normal hotel stuff but here they charge you for it!!! Junior/Studio Suite $10 per day One Bedroom Suite $15 per day Two Bedroom Stuie $25 per day This hotel has the potential to be 4 star but its " 3 STAR *.. With this beautiful hotel its a shame. It had sooo much potential. But with their POOOR SERVICE, EXTRA SERVICE CHARGES! they will continue to be 3 star. Not really a resort, more like renting a condo or an apartment. I would suggest this to my friends, but be very very careful and DON'T EXPECT ANY SERVICE OR HELP FROM GUEST SERVICES!! NO SAFE IN THE ROOM! LOCK EVERYTHING!!!! For the price, its better if you rent a house with a pool!!! They have a lot in florida that's a compound of house rentals with pool. Same price as this and also not much service. So better that than this! or CHECK OUT HILTON... One good thing is that "hotel is clean"!!! POOR SERVICE! ... SERVICE IS EQUALLY AS IMPORTANT IN HAVING A HOTEL AND ITS THE ONE THING PEOPLE WILL REMEMBER!!! .. HOW YOU TREAT YOUR GUEST!!!... though I complained about small little things.. but small things add up and its what stays with me.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star resort”
Reviews.Author: realm
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel the best we've ever stayed in, in 5 years of visiting Orlando. From the friendly front desk staff to the extra roomy suites, which had king sized beds, jacuzzi bath and walk-in shower to the fully stocked kitchen (every cooking utensil you will ever need) to your very own washer and dryer (no more communiel laundrys and buying rolls of quarters).We stayed between Dec-09 to Jan-10 the weather wasn't that great but staying in doors with two kids wasn't a problem because they had their own studio apartment interconnected to our suite.Maid service is a daily bed making service,towel change and light clean, if you want an extra clean it's $25.00 but we never needed it as broom and mop are supplied if you need them. On a whole this hotel is only new but will certainly be a hot spot in the years to come, just one black mark was no safes in room but safety deposit boxs are provided at front desk free of charge. we will certainly be back!!

Reviews.Title: “The Point Orlando didn't Dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: gripper67
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 day stay in the Point Orlando Resort. We had booked a 2 bedroom suite, which was really 2 seperate appartments joined together. My daughters (7+10) were really excited about having their own apartment. The Suite was big enough for 8 people. Our room was on the ground floor overlooking the pool area, we had initial reservations about the location of the room but these were unfounded. Even when it was warm enough to use the pool we couldnt hear the people in the pool. The room had a well equipped kitchen including a washing machine, tumble dryer and a dishwasher (all detergents supplied by the hotel on a daily basis). The rooms were serviced daily with clean towels etc. The reception staff were very helpful and polite. We asked for a late check out as our flight wasn’t until late afternoon, this wasn’t a problem. All in all we were very happy with our choice of hotel and would strongly recommend it to families visiting the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Point Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: lilshoppinggal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, traveling with our teenage daughter and son spent 5 nights at the Point Orlando. I am definitely hard to please as far as cleanliness is concerned, and the Point completely met my standards. Everything from the flooring to bathrooms to the kitchen was very clean. The rooms were very spacious and inviting. We loved the adjoining room style that the Point offered - excellent for our teenagers to have their own space. The pool and hot tub area was kept very clean. My only complaint (and a minor one) would be that the clean towel supply is not adequately maintained (we had to ask the front desk 3 times to get housekeeping to bring down new towels). The hotel is located very close to all the major theme parks, but just slightly off the main arteries which we particularly liked. Lots of great places nearby to eat and lots of things to keep the teenagers happy. I would most definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “BRAND NEW HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kathrine1985
Reviews.Content: When looking at this hotel on the brochure before we got to orlando it looked perfect, brand new, and when we got there it was exact to the brochure. The hotel is not on he main strip, just the road behind, in a nice quiet spot by wet and wild. The hotel was gorgeous, spotless, loved it. The staff were very friendly, loved there accent, and showed us to our room. Our room was like an apartment, could of easily lived there, felt right at home. The hotel was in a good location, very easy to get to everything, and not far from were you get the bus. The nightlife was not far either, didnt cost much in a taxi, it was perfect. In the room there was everything you needed, big fridge, big microwave everything was big. Fully equipped kitchen, to put our shopping in, as i said we could easily live there. It had a nice sitting area and dining area, with flat screen tv and balcony. Lovely comfy bed, with tv again, which went on to a huge bathroom with jacuzzi. The only thing is when i went the hotel was only new, and it didnt have a restaurant or bar, but there might be one now. The pool was an ideal size, like lying by that as it was very quiet, not many staying there at that time but it might be busier now. I would go back, definately five star quality, very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new and comfortable ... but small irritations.”
Reviews.Author: Blondie_T
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-bedroom apartment (I think it’s called executive on the website) & ended up on the 11th floor – the views were amazing! The apartment was all you could want for a 10-day stay over Christmas, with a separate bedroom and full kitchen. The communal areas were gorgeous & also felt new. Swimming pool was well lit up after dark and there was a hot tub that was really, really warm. There was ample parking, which is handy as most holidays to Florida are “fly drive” & the Internet access is free in the rooms if you bring a laptop. It would have been handy to have a safe in the room as every time the room was to be cleaned (only asked twice during stay) I felt I had to take all my valuables (e.g. camcorder, laptop, cash & cameras) out with me, but had a car so that wasn’t a problem. Staff were fine but verged on lax, as we found it difficult to figure out some things (e.g. oven – why isn’t there just an “on” switch? Also, the fitness suite is not an easy place to find, but I suppose I should’ve just asked). Also, the bar/cafe area could have been more comfortable & open more as there was little/no nightlife in/around Orlando. However, if I went back to Florida/Orlando would definitely stay at the “Orlando Point” again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK but would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: jenn4dex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel becuase of the reviews on Trip Advisor and we visited Orlando for a convention. The rooms were indeed large and clean and new but after two nights staying there, our backs were killing us, I think the beds were too soft. They seemed comfortable but were not after a couple of nights. The location is weird, a few miles from the convention center, kind of in the middle of nowhere and there is absolutely no view. The view from our room was an auto body shop. There is no gym, so if you would like to use one, the only machine operable in their so called gym is an elytipcal machine. That's it, everything else is broken. The food in the cafe was pretty bad, we tried that once for breakfast, they could not even toast bread. The front staff was very helpful though and our room had a microwave and a fridge and was clean. We checked out to stay at a Marriott hotel for the remainder of our trip, as we always get comfortable beds there...

Reviews.Title: “Unexciting hotel but great value”
Reviews.Author: billbobaggins999
Reviews.Content: Found hotel at short notice based on reviews on Tripadvisor. Base for 2 nights in Orlando prior to flying home. We visited one park, and spent the rest of the time shopping. Convenient location for International Drive and two big shopping areas. - Hotel is a 12 story block which to my mind was quite dull in terms of decor, but modern, clean and having all necessary mod-cons. - pool and pool area is of a high standard. - cafe/restaurant is limited but serves a purpose if you can't be bothered going out for a snack. - hotel front desk were very accommodating and helpful, rated them 5 stars (one Greek and one Netherlands member of staff). - we upgraded to a suite which was spacious and had a small kitchen. - impressive views of Orlando (what there is to see!). Good value for money for price.

Reviews.Title: “Could not say enough about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in November and we loved it. The staff were beyond accomodating. We enquired about places to eat, golf courses, places to visit and they always went out of their way to help us. It was a pleasure to deal with them. The hotel itself was great...clean, spacious and a great location. We were looking for a self serving apartment and that is exactly what we got, overlooking the pool.Universal Studios is just up the road which was very handy. We went to City Walk for a few drinks and the park during the day. There was a bus stop right outside the hotel for the I-HOP which really brings you to most destinations in Orlando...seaworld/aquatica/both outlet centres..at only $8 for 4 days. While its not a plush hotel it serves its function for a family holiday/couples/friends etc etc I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and we will definately be going back..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VanSamJee
Reviews.Content: Back after a week's stay at the Point Orlando Resort in a 1 bedroom suite. Lacks the upscale resort feel, but scores high in other areas. Located on a street where traffic noise is minimal. Fully equipped kitchen. We shopped at Whole Foods and made dinner and carried lunch with us to the parks. Free high speed internet. Good sized bathroom, washer dryer. Comfortable king size bed. Good tv. Courteous hotel staff. Decent sized pool. Was never crowded. Not too far from the theme parks. We had rented a car and were able to get to all the disney parks in about 15 - 25 mins. I wonder what a hilton or marriott with all these facilities cost in peak season?

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel,clean,spotless,can'nt please some people”
Reviews.Author: r800x
Reviews.Content: we stayed on floor 5,could not fault the bedroom,bathroom and living area,,everything there that was needed for your stay,,,5 star bathroom,,was not botherd by noise in a hole 2 week stay,,if it stay's as good and clean and no scum useing it,and waseing it,,i would alwasy use this place,,nice clean pool area with hotel towels and hot tube there is also aircon in the gym area,,

Reviews.Title: “A home from home just off I-drive”
Reviews.Author: puddletink
Reviews.Content: I can't think of one negative thing to say about this hotel. From the minute we arrived until the minute we left our whole experience was excellent. Reception is small but immaculate and the staff very helpful. Arrived 2.00 pm and were able to check in immediately. Stayed in one bedroom apartment no. 701S with a pool view. Very well equiped kitchen with large fridge/freezer, full size cooker, microwave, dishwasher, washer/dryer, toaster, blender, coffee maker and a full compliment of tableware, pans, untensils etc. Living area with leather settee/bed, dining table and four chairs and flat screen TV and doors out onto the balcony. Bedroom also had a TV and a very large comfortable bed. The bathroom was huge with a storage cupboard, jaccuzi bath, large shower cubicle, vanity unit and a separate toilet. Towels changed daily, bedding twice weekly. Dishwashing power, soap powder, washing up liquid, paper towels, tea towels and coffee supplied daily. If you needed more you only had to ask and it was delivered within 10 minutes. Rooms are very quite and we didn't hear any noise from the room next door or the corridor. The pool area was lovely with plenty of loungers and a hot tub. The pool was a lovely temperature and very clean and never busy. There is no bar area at the pool so you are able to take your own drinks/snacks. It was nice to sit on an evening with a glass of wine whist Little Puddle played in the pool with the other children. The hotel offers a shuttle to the parks which ran at 7.30-10.30 to Disney and 9.00 to Universal and Seaworld. It's a 10 minute walk to Wet n Wild. There is a trolly stop right outside the hotel and it's a 10 minute walk to I-drive. All in all this hotel is the best we have stayed in in Orlando and we are already planning on staying here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 8nick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Point Resort after booking with Expedia. Stayed for 3 nights as we were travelling around south Florida and Orlando was our 3rd stop to experience universal studios. The hotel was in a great location in my opinion. We were driving but didn't need to use the car during the day as there was a shuttle service provided free by the hotel to get to Universal Studios. We didn't even use this bus on the way back as it was a pleasant 15-20 minute walk back. As for the hotel room - Great value for money. We booked a studio but was checked into a one bedroom apartment as a free upgrade, which contained a full kitchen with more than the necessary amenities including a dish washer, washer and drier and a huge fridge/freezer. The building looks brand new and the apartment was in the say state. The bathroom was excellent having a separate shower and bath with jets. The Bed was hugh, the air con was nice a cool as well as being quiet when operational and the balcony view was of the hotels pool and hot tub. I recommend the use of this hot tub, it was fab. It was lovely a hot and a night time dip was the norm for us as a chill out. OVERAL. Check-in was nice and smooth, Check-out was nice and smooth without any hidden costs added to our bill. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our experience was great. If we go back to Orlando. The Point will be the first hotel to enquire about.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Idriveor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here sept into oct for 2 weeks. Really lovely rooms, and as its a relatively new resort, everything was in excellent condition. We stayed in a 1 bedroom exec, the bed was like a super kingsize, and it was heavenly!! Bathroom was lovely and modern, as was the rest of the apt. Flat screen tv in living area, and a tv in the bedroom also. Free internet which was great (if you have a laptop..take it with you, so handy). All you will need is in the apt..washer/dryer, dishwasher, utensils, cooker, microwave, large fridge etc. Great having a balcony, as a lot of Orlando hotels do not have them..we could even see the disney fireworks in the distance from our 7th floor room. Maids in every day, but tended to only change the towels and make the bed. They told us they only change the bedlinen if you request it in advance! Not much happening downstairs..saw a little bar in the lobby, but it didn't seem to be open much (maybe as it was not peak season). Pool was great! Plenty of beds and never packed! My husband used the gym, which was small but adequate. He was disappointed though that they had no tv in there. We hired a car, but it was still within a 10 walk to I-Drive. All in all, we would definitely recommend this resort to anybody. Just remember that they charge a resort fee on departure, which is almost $10 per day. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Don't Understand Rave Reviews”
Reviews.Author: ckielt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10/12 - 10/15 w/ my wife and 8-year-old son. The hotel was OK but it is no luxury resort; more like a Marriott Residence Inn. That's not bad, but the property isn't as advertised. The $9.95 daily "resort fee" is a rip-off. They have a nice pool, yes, but so does every decent hotel in Florida. The "fitness center" is four old machines in a tiny room. Mattress on sleeper sofa was thin and uncomfortable. Our son climbed into bed w/ us every night. Beware of shuttle claim: there's only 1 each day at 9 a.m. and the only return from Universal is 6:30 p.m. There aren't any sheer drapes on windows, only blackout curtains. This means it's pitch black or you're completely visible at night. The "bar" was open on 1 morning during a 4-day stay. Housekeeping was lacking. Had to call for towels 2 times and maid failed to wash our dishes 1 day. Business Center is a rip-off. $0.25/min. for Internet access. every hotel I frequent offers it free. That said, for $89 it was a good value. Tip: There's a Whole Foods nearby on Turkey Lake Rd. It has a buffet and excellent groceries. Good restaurants in the same plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite hotel let down by housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: LizandDan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 16 nights in Sep/Oct. Checked in with no issues and found the staff friendly and helpful. Lobby is impressive, clean and bright. The room was superb, with tasteful, modern decor, useful items like washing powder and washing up liquid. It was well equiped to cook with, but they have the worst pans we've ever used. Everything stuck to them even using loads of oil. We had a good view of the pool area, everything worked well and was easy to use. The bed was incredibly comfortable, but the aircon was too noisy to have on over night. Lovely jacuzzi bath. The pool area was perfect; quiet, plenty of towels, water not overly deep at any point. Did not make use of food or drinks there, so cannot comment. Location is good in some ways, as it is reasonably close to i-drive and the parks, but not too noisy. In hindsight we would stay nearer to the action, as the i-trolley is for the bus that runs alongside, not on, i-drive and it is every 30 minutes. So lots of plus points, but a real negative was the room service. We noticed that all that was done in our room during the service was the provision of clean, dry towels and the bed being made. It was not cleaned at all. We found out after raising the issue that a new management company has recently taken over and they only clean the room the day that you arrive and the day that you leave! As we were there for 16 days we found this completely unacceptable and after much insistance it was cleaned once. Room service have until 4:30 to do the rooms. When you have spent all day walking around a park (in the heat) and get back at 3pm you might fancy a shower (no dry towels) or a nap (unmade bed). It's not so much that as knowing that if you do have a nap the maid will be along to wake you to make the bed and change the towels. We'd never stayed anywhere that didn't make it a policy to have rooms done by midday. We were told that they only had 1 maid for the whole place. Not very good for a hotel that is 5 star in every other respect. We eventually got tired of calling down to ask for things that were not replenished - toilet roll, bath mat, water, washing powder. We also got back to our room 3 times to find it not serviced at all. On holiday you don't want to spend time complaining, so we left it till the last day and queried the resort fee and it was waived immediately to their credit. Word of warning do not get them to call you a taxi. The first time our taxi did not turn up and as there was only one person serving on reception (a regular theme) with about 4 people waiting. Second time the taxi cost us twice as much as one directly from Universal through Mears. Noticed the receptionist was 'taken care of' by the taxi driver, but we felt taken advantage of. The shuttle service we only used once (fancied a break from driving to have a drink) and vowed never again. It was 15 minutes late, the seatbelts didn't work and we were lucky to get there alive! The journey on the way back which would have taken 15 minutes in the car, took 1.5 hours. I know that the hotel cannot help some of those points, but safety should be something of importance to their guests. I would recommend it based upon the quality of the room, the staff were friendly and helpful (I blame the new management company for housekeeping issues), but I still find it incredibly strange to stay at such a nice hotel and not have the rooms cleaned. We would not stay there again because we would prefer a location nearer to i-drive and with more reliable room service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel!! Cant wait to go again!”
Reviews.Author: Aimeye2003
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Point Orlando. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean. the pool area was spotless. Very nice to have a full kitchen and washer and dryer. We traveled with a baby and they provided us with a pack and play for him to sleep. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, not customer-friendly”
Reviews.Author: SlowdragAustria
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation after reading the excellent reviews on TA. The good points: the hotel is located near the theme parks. The bad points: location near the theme parks means you are in the middle of nowhere, or better, in the epicentre of hundreds of junk food providers. At check-in the receptionist first gave us hotel key cards which did not suit the allotted room and, worse, after all the trouble going up and down the elevator and to and fro the reception, we realized that we had received access to more than the allocated hotel room (!), i.e. we had access to the room of our neighbours as well. Furthermore, our room had already been occupied by other guests! One of the guests told us that he had arrived the same day and the same thing had happened to him as well. Avoid the breakfast in the hotel, it is poor by European standards. The remote control had one battery missing. We left it there for the housekeeping woman but she ignored it and did not replace the battery. Next annoyance: We wanted to print out tickets for the KSC using the printer in the “business centre”. After purchasing a card for the computer and the printer (which by the way had run out of paper) I realized that the computer did not have Adobe Reader installed! Hence I had to download Adobe to print out the tickets using up several more dollars of my account. I informed the receptionist that you cannot call something a business centre with important software not installed on the computer. I was told that the “business centre” was run by another company and that I could contact them if I liked. No intention on his side to give me some discount to compensate for these mishaps.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you get an online deal”
Reviews.Author: OttawaSenator
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to most attractions but we had a car so that did make it easier. It was very clean, had a nice pool and the rooms were large enough and quiet. The only problem I would have is the lack of a concierge to help us pick out something to do at night. We ended up asking the front desk girl and she really didn't help us. All in all, we booked this hotel online and got a great deal so we were happy with what we paid for. We really only used the hotel to sleep so we wanted something clean, new, and close to stuff. This hotel satisfied our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, pool, and room”
Reviews.Author: PAngel143
Reviews.Content: For our anniversary weekend, we decided to resort-hop and try 2 resorts in 3 days. Great location if your visiting Orlando. It's right by International drive, down from Wet-n-Wild, so it's close to all the attractions. I paid around $ 110 a night and expected just a mediocre room and hotel. But overall, it was very nice. Love the decor, it's definitely my style. The pool was gorgeous with its building view in the background. I absolutely enjoyed that. The room was pretty big and decorated nicely. They even have free water bottles for us to drink. Our window view from afar was great, with I-Drive, and downtown in the far distance. Only thing was when we looked down, it was an area for a few broken down cars/junk yard I guess. Overall, it's great though, just a 5 minute drive down the road and your in the area for lots of dining and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “It was very nice on the inside.”
Reviews.Author: Nevarena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this one night stay through HotWire. We were nervous upon arrival as the location of this hotel is a bit awkward. It is on a side road behind a larger hotel. The surrounding views are not very appealing. This, however, is not the responsibility of the hotel itself. The lobby and room were beautiful though. Our room (12th floor) had a wonderful view of the pool but was included in a two room area. Specifically...there were two rooms situated together after entering a "front door." Our key opened that door as well as the door to our room. This would be great if booking two rooms together but could also be viewed otherwise if you are not comfortable with this set-up. I thought I should mention it since I could not remember reading this in any previous reviews. This staff was super professional and accommodating and the room was immaculate. The best feature....the super soft, comfortable and all around wonderful bed. It was a very nice stay for such a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: YAMR1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks, and i can honestly say this is the best hotel i have stayed in after 8 visits to Orlando. The room was a 2 bedroom executive suite, it was immaculate. when we arrived, the maids cleaned everyday, we wanted for nothing. The staff were freindly, the pool clean with towels provided, plenty of loungers. Hope this helps you, all i can say is i wouldn't hesitate stopping here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuckerUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: stayed here aug 09 what can i say this hotel was great staff very friendly,rooms cleaned every day,internet in rooms,beds so soft, the only thing was we have to have handicapped room and the only room was on the ground floor it would have been better on a higher floor as when you have someone handicapped you are limited to what you can do and to have a higher room with views would have been a lot better but could not falt this hotel at all will hopefully be back next year

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rhino33
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the last Two weeks of August and found everything just perfect. Check-in was very quick and friendly. Also I had e-mailed a request for a high room with a pool view and was granted my request with a 12th floor double suite overlooking the whole of Orlando with views of Seaworld and Disney where we could watch the nightly fireworks displays from our balcony. The rooms were very clean and well equipped with every appliance you would need. The pool was clean and had ample chairs with free towels supplied. Overall we could not fault anything with this place and look forward to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Happytravellers73Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point Orlando for 2 weeks at the beginning of August. The hotel and facilities were excellent and the staff friendly and helpful (Carmen made us feel especially welcome when we arrived, showing us our location on maps and giving us a general overview of the surrounding area). The room was beautifully appointed and very much a home from home. Our room overlooked the pool, which had plenty of loungers and towels. We didn't hire a car this trip, but the I-Ride bus service along International Drive (about a 5 mins walk away) and Universal Boulevard (with a stop right outside the hotel) was good. A car would have been handy for getting groceries etc, although there is a Walmart relatively nearby and a great Publix supermarket at the South end of International Drive, accessible by the I-Ride bus service. We can thoroughly recommend this hotel and will stay again on our next trip to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Excellent rates - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: valg31798
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to do a last minute get-away to Orlando and visit Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. We live in Miami and going up to Orlando is never a problem. We normally stay within the park but were a bit underwhelmed by the service, quality and lack of customer received during our last stay there. So - we decided to go look around for hotels within the area that were fairly priced and offered some amenities for the children like a pool and near-by restaurants. The Point exceeded our expectations. First of all - the hotel is extremely close to Universal and water parks near-by. The hotel staff was amazing with a friendly smile from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out. Housekeeping was by far one of the best we've ever experienced. AND THIS IS COMING FROM FOLKS WHO USUALLY STAY AT THE RITZ, MANDARIN and LOWES type properties... the rates were great too! We stayed in a one bedroom suite with an adjoining second bedroom. It offered privacy to us while the kids stayed in the other room and living room areas. In addition - the kitchen is fully equipped so we saved even more money by having breakfast inside our suite and prepare snacks to eat while in the park. The rooms are tastefully and beautifuly decorated with up to date plasma TV's and great kitchen appliances. The bathrooms where spotless! There was lots of parking and never an issue. Overall - it was a great place to stay and we look forward in coming back. Lowes Hotels you may be right on site at the park but you should learn a few things about the Point Orlando and Premier Resorts - my new Orlando Resort destination. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wow! A* Star accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Sannmarie9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the last two weeks of July 2009. When I arrived at the hotel I was greated by friendly staff, and throughout my stay these individuals always greated you with a smile and over extended themselves. I stayed in a two bed suite with my parents. The appartment that we stayed was on the 3rd floor and as you entered the appartment you was greeted by a small hallway, where there were two separate doors. Room S which was the main suite with a large kitchen, living room and separate master bathroom and separate master bedroom. This room also had a balcony. I had complete privacy becauses I had my own appartment room H which was an open planned studio with a kitchenette. In summary the rooms were of a high standard 4.5 plus, the rooms were cleaned every day by polite maids. The bed was to die for, I had a queen size bed, feather down quilts and pillows for which I could sleep in all day. I used their private gym, which was small but adequate, there is also a jacuzzi and a large pool outside which was maintained and cleaned regularly. When you went to the pool area the staff would leave towels carefully prepared for you on the deck chairs. A fantastic hotel and holiday for which I will be returning to next year 2010. Just a word of warning, on our first day we asked the only male receptionist to order us a taxi, a man in a ford SUV who was hispanic and did not speak very good English said that he was the taxi. He took us to WALMART and over charged us by $35 bucks and when i looked in the drivers car I noticed that he was not a registered taxi. In fact, he was a friend of the hispanic male receptionist. When I told the female receptionist she looked shocked that i had paid so much to go to walmart. I did not follow up this issue however if you need a taxi make sure you talk to one of the female receptionists instead of the male one, as they will order a registered taxi. Also if you can afford it hire a car its a lot cheaper as this is a self catering hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little haven just off International drive. The perfect alternative to a villa”
Reviews.Author: thereids11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for ten nights with my husband and three daughters aged 12, 15 and 16. Stayed in a two bedroon suite which gave the girls space on their own and my husband and I a beautiful master bedroon ensuite and lounge with kitchen. Luxurious accomodation. Spotless. Maid service daily and pool towels supplied. 4 minutes drive from Universal resort and walkable to Wet & Wild and International Drive. Requested 4th floor with pool view and got exactly that. Free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding balance of luxury, value, amenities, and location”
Reviews.Author: HappyDocNY
Reviews.Content: Located only steps away from Wet-n-Wild, and within walking distance from International Drive's action, the Point offers a great mix of qualities. Reservations and check-in were fast and courteous. I received an upgrade from studio suite to a one bedroom suite when I checked in without as much as asking. The super friendly desk staff said merely, "it's complementary". Complementary indeed! Room was spotless, modern and spacious on 8th floor with a nice view from the balcony. Kitchen was granite countered with every convenience found at home right down to the pots, pans, and cutlery in the drawer. Washer and dryer were in the closet with complementary soap. TV was good in both the living room and bedroom, though I wasn't able to watch my DVD's. A cheap DVD player would be a possibility here. No mini-bar here so no snack or drink options during late night. Pool was nice, clean, and more spacious than comparable hotels I've seen in the area. Towels ran out fast so I'm glad I took my room towel down. A small snack-bar/restaurant/bar is open for business for breakfast and reopens in the evening from 8 to midnight for drinks and light faire. Internet connection is included but in foregoing wireless, the Point instead offers an extended cable for your laptop's port. Parking was patrolled by a security guard on foot. Though perimeter parking filled quickly an overflow lot is several hundred feet, well lit, and guarded. At just over a hundred dollars per night, the value was good and the comfort and convenience great. The Point's planners and it's staff have done a great job and, with the few exceptions mentioned, have a winning combination. I for one will return here whenever I'm in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ArabKenny
Reviews.Content: My family and I have recently returned from a 3 week stay at Point Orlando. We had initially booked accomodation at Enclave Suites nearby with Virgin holidays, but after some dodgy reviews we cancelled that and re-arranged at Point Orlando.It was the best decision we could have possibly made. I cannot over-emphasise just how good this place is. We have vacationed in Orlando on frequent occasions and this is by far and away the best accomodation we have stayed in. It simply ticks every box. Location, facilities, room size and quality, cleanliness - it's got it all. It is our complete intention to return there for future trips. By the way, I cannot understand why people say there was no 'net access in the rooms. There are high speed wired connections in the room which I used daily with my laptop (at no charge!). My only (minor) gripe for management, is that there should perhaps be more trash cans in place around the pool area. A number of times we found discarded beer bottle tops lying upside down around the pool just waiting for a kid to stand on and lacerate their foot. Obviously it's ignorant people chucking them away in the first place that causes the issue, however I did observe that there weren't many receptacles for trash by the pool and so hopefully provsion of more would help to correct this problem. Overall though, just an absolutely terrific place and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but beware...”
Reviews.Author: metiki1
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful with nice rooms and swimming pool. Location is Although our reservation for a two bedroom suite was change to a single room, management attempted to correct the issue and we had to change rooms after for the first night. For the beware part of my vacation. Signs in the parking lot tell visitors to remove valuables from the vehicles. We took everything inside. We left the room for about an hour to go to the pool. Maids came in to clean and they really cleaned us out. $200 from a wallet was taken. Management can read the card scanner to determine who was in/ out of the room, yet they would not rectify the situation. We had to contact the Orland PD, and they took fingerprints and opened a case for us. We have now returned hope and are waiting for the results. Management really let us down in the time of need. This took aware from the grandeur of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, service a little lacking”
Reviews.Author: ToddNugent
Reviews.Content: We booked this thru orbitz after reading the good reviews here. Checkin was easy and although we asked for an upgrade after seeing how small the studio is, the front desk clerk refused to accommodate. The room is nicely furnished and clean with a small kitchenette and a balcony that overlooks the parking lot where one can see Wet & Wild in the distance. It would have been nicer if we had a bigger room, oh well, we spent most of the time at the theme parks anyway. Parking was ok, the pool was ok. Overall, decent location and room, service a little lacking though. I wouldn't stay again knowing that there are better hotels in the area for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Paace In Orlando”
Reviews.Author: fancy12475
Reviews.Content: When you book through a travel deal such as Orbitz you always wonder what kind of surprises (good or bad) you might run into. I was pleasantly surprised i must say at the Point Resort. Once we arrived we decided we would like a little more privacy in the room than the original booked suite. It was only a matter of asking for an upgrade and we were immediatly taken care of. We even arrived much eariler than our check out time and were let right in the room. The washer and dryer units in the room were a god send. There were several days of being caught out in the lovely florida rain that the dryer was awesome. I would highly recomend a stay at the Point Resort. I have nothing but good to say about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay except for fees that we didn't know about”
Reviews.Author: st3ph12345
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent at this hotel except that there were extra fees if you had house keeping and there were hotel taxes each day you stayed there. We stayed there for six days and they charged as ninety nine dollars extra( we booked a package off orbitz). Staff was very friendly and they recommended nearby locations were we could eat, shop, and etc. In addition, if you book an executive suite or a two bedroom suite be on the lookout for the laundry machine. Apparently it likes to eat underwear and bikini padding. I lost some of my laundry while washing them in the washer. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, but do not put any delicates of laundry in there or it will be eaten by the evil laundry machine. View was very nice aswell. One more thing the sofa bed wasn't very comfortable, but the room was still very nice, and the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel---great value”
Reviews.Author: ATLJagsMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply amazing. My girlfriend and I got a junior suite, and we were blown away by the comfort level and amenities. The walk-in shower was very nice, and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had a room on the 10th floor, and it was a nice view. The swimming pool area looked nice, but we never got to the pool. The ceiling fans in the bedroom and living room were really great. The only negative was that the washer and dryer are cheaper units and are extremely noisy. But that's a minor thing. Be careful about the cab companies that the hotel recommends, and do your own homework on researching cab rates. We made a 1.5 trip to the Citiwalk with a cab company the front desk recommended, and it was $10 one way. Probably could've found a better deal ourselves. In fact, we simply walked back to the hotel after a night at the Citiwalk, and it's a nice walk. The other gripe was that breakfast isn't included in the price of the hotel, so you have to pay for overpriced danishes and muffins. Go somewhere else for breakfast options. Overall, this hotel blew us away with the comfort and value.

Reviews.Title: “LAST MINUTE JULY 4TH WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDAGIRL353
Reviews.Content: We made last minute arrangements and booked online on July 3rd for the July 4th holiday. We were lucky to have found such a great place at a great price. I was a little worried thinking how could I get a place for $79/night on July 4th weekend and it be decent. Well...I was shocked. We got a 1 bedroom with separate living area and a full kitchen. The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub, marble tile and a very large walk in shower. Bed was comforable and the room was very clean. It even had a washer and dryer. Great place, I would highly recommend. Do wish they had some type of continental breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Brill, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: minniemouseIreland
Reviews.Content: im just back from my 14nites stay in this hotel,i dont no where to start.i had my 2 children with me aged 14 an 11,we had a doudle room suite so the children had there own room with kitchen,an our room was fab,the kitchen had every thing in that u need, we went shoping in wallmart for our food which is just a short distance away.the maids are in every day to clean your room.i go back here again..the only thing that i was dissapointed with was the fact the room didnt have a safe an reciption only have a few of them..could do with having a bar so my husband said!!!FAB HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “HoneyMoon of Hell”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoIlConcerned
Reviews.Content: The problems that we experienced were that the hot water for the shower did not get hot and the refrigerater did not get cold enough. The pool was dirty and it had large ants in it my daughter started screaming when she seen the ants.They really should clean there pool more often like on a daily basis because someone is going to get sick.And please make sure you get all your belongings out of your room because we left a few items and we called the resort lost and found and left a message sevaral times so someone could call us back but we never received a call back so our experience was not so great.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: BLUSHING-BRIDETOBE
Reviews.Content: we just spent 13 lovely nights at the point, we loved everything about it close to all the action but a block back from all the hustle and bustle of international drive. was hoping to return next year but are now charging 3 times as much as we paid this year so a little dissapointing $129-$199 per night for next april/may time, we can stay at hilton 5 star for that. but all in all we really enjoyed our saty and deserve to be moving up the rankings on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jovip
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel and found it to be very clean, spacious and comfortable. I arrived before check in time and was able to store my bags at the hotel until my room was ready. The staff was friendly but I sense there are some who are less experienced than others. I had a couple of glitches in my stay that are worth mentioning. I was awakened at midnight by a phone call from a male hotel staff member who said he was calling to make sure that someone was actually staying in my unit. (??) On the final night of my stay, my key card would not open my door. I took it to the front desk and was given another which also failed to open my door. After my third trip to the desk a security guard accompanied me to my room with an electronic device which also failed to open my door. A gentleman from housekeeping was called and between the two of them and the electronic device, I was able to gain entry to my room. Also, on one visit to the gym, I found the door was locked (early afternoon). I had visited the gym the day before and found it to be well equipped. The pool area was great! Wireless access in the room worked well and was free. There is no ice machine--probably because so many of the units have full size refrigerators with ice makers. I was in a room with a mini fridge so no ice was available. Decent location--short walk to restaurants, tourist shops , etc.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: 00ema00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week and couldn’t fault a thing! We had a 1 bed executive suite which was great and had full kitchen with washing machine and dryer. Pool was lovely, didn’t use much as didn’t have time but wish we could have as was lovely and warm and not busy so plenty of sun beds all the time. Staff were friendly, whole hotel always spotless. Location 2 minute from International Drive. All in all brilliant hotel with huge rooms for great price!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Point Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: AddictedToTravel35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Point Orlando after a cruise and we really wished we had booked for more than one day. The hotel is located in a great location, very close to Universal. We booked the 1 bedroom suite. The suite was very spacious and reminded us of a condo more than a hotel room. It had a fully equipped kitchen as well as a washer and dryer. When we book our next trip to Orlando with the kids, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: =JORMEG
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone, I have stayed in a few hotels in Orlando and this is one of my favourite places. The rooms are clean, the decor is lovely and the bed is huge (and comfortable). I stayed in the one bedroom apartment, which was fine for two adults and two children. The rolled up towels on the sunbeds in the morning was a lovely touch. I was also impressed how clean the pool, pool area and pool toilets were, the staff were really helpful and friendly and the reception area is beautiful. We loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone that's going to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwhitted
Reviews.Content: I want to say how much I love this hotel! We stayed in the 2 br suite since we always ask my parents to go along with us. There is so much space and privacy between the 2 bedrooms. Everyone is so nice and we were treated like valued guests. The hotel and rooms were spotless! I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE! We will always stay there when we head to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “they thought of everything”
Reviews.Author: Kazz101Kazz101
Reviews.Content: just returned from 12 night stay at this hotel. What a really great place to stay. From the moment we checked in the staff were really polite and helpful, asking what floor would suit us and which side of the hotel we wanted. I asked the receptionist for a high floor that was in sun in the morning and straight away she recommended 11th floor room 1102 perfect. The room when we entered was hugh and spotless clean. We choose to stay in the 2 bedroom suite with a king bed in each and a double sofa bed , each had a private bathroom and kitchen. This hotel caters for everything you need they even give you washing up liquid, clothes detergent ,dish washing powder, tea towels ,cloths ,coffee and fresh towels everyday when you require them. The kitchen is the best equipped i have ever stayed in . Its rare to find a hotel that actually give you a proper mug to drink your morning cuppa from . The pool area is spotless clean with staff constantly put out fresh towels. The immediate area is quiet but 5 minutes up the road is tgi friday and abc supermarket. ABC supermarket is a ripoff but walmart have opened a new store just left off sandlake road passed mc donalds. Publix supermarket is down by premium outlets so if you get the linx 42 to premium outlet the bus man if asked will tell you which stop to get off its just one stop before the premiums . This is a higher class supermarket then walmart you can buy normal tasting breads not so sweet. Overall we had a wonderful stay in the point orlando resort hotel and would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Underated ,high standard accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: ben101
Reviews.Content: The point resort should be top 5 easy ,by far the nicest place i've stayed in orlando and this was my 5th time.The standard of rooms is superb,especially if you book a double executive suite,well worth that little bit extra ,we booked through 1800hotels.ie which were far cheaper than anyone else. .There's basically three kinds of room which you can see a floor plan of on their website.1 bed studio no balcony,1 bedroom apartment with living room plus balcony and finally 2 bedroom suite which is basically the first two rooms together ,great value!!! The last two room options are equiped with 32" flat screen T.V. ,Whilpool dishwasher,washing machine ,dryer,full size cooker ,fridge freezer,iron, hairdryer ,microwave ,coffee machine ,blender ,etc.i could go on.Because they are so well equiped we found that we spent less money than usual eating out and on laundry as they really have thought of everything. The staff ,especially the cleaners,were lovely and couldn't do enough.They clean every day,unless you don't want them to. One thing to keep in mind is that there are no safes but there are safety deposit boxes and the lady at reception informed me that they are in the process of putting safes in the rooms.Fair enough as it is a large relatively new place so these things can take time. Highly recommended,will definitely return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel let down by poor service and no safes”
Reviews.Author: saz29
Reviews.Content: We visit Florida annually and were delighted to find this hidden gem of a hotel. The norm standard of accommodation is average however this hotel is fantastic value for money, the rooms are great and the pool was one you want to chill out by - which isn't often the case at neighbouring hotels. We stayed for 9 nights, and then returned a few days later for a further 3 nights. Only concern at start was the lack of room safes - we did enquire and were advised as a new hotel safes were on order and if made us feel better to hide valuables around the room. Following a break for a few nights we returned to the hotel for 3 nights. Unfortunately on the 2nd day of our stay a item of jewellery went missing - it was a new purchase and had been in a box inside a suitcase in our bedroom. The box was left but the contents gone! Initially the query was dealt with by one member of staff who had been fantastic our whole stay. Unfortunately this wasn't the person able to deal with our issue and its at this stage the customer service provided was questionable. Our last day was spent at the hotel which wasn't our plan and had my requests been actioned in the morning when I asked then our day wouldn't have been wasted. No apology or acknowledgement for our wasted day was mentioned by the hotel - a bit of empathy would have been good. I was unable to file a police report until the hotel had followed basic procedures and these didn't happen till late on. I never expected to get any monies back for the missing item however I was disappointed and still am that the hotel didn't provide good customer service. Communication was minimal and had to do all the chasing. I'm reasonable and didn't want poor service over a couple of days to bring down our entire stay which until then had been fantastic. So I highlighted my concerns to the hotel via correspondence however they haven't been acknowledged and just confirms their poor level of customer service. Unfortunately I wont be staying in the hotel again as the situation could have been handled better - even acknowledging my concerns would have appeased me. Never once did I feel they went the extra mile with the whole situation. Its a horrible feeling to think that someone has been through your belongings and you should havent to go through that anywhere especially on holiday and it would be good for management to think what service they would expect if it happened to them. I would recommend this hotel but a word to the wise be very careful about the valuables you take & purchase as the hotel is yet to have room safes and through our experience the management made it very clear they take no responsibility when things do go missing!

Reviews.Title: “A Wounderful Hotel With A Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: filpo2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this wounderful hotel In April 30,2009-May 03,2009 and words could not explain how happy and pleased I am was with the stay. I stayed in a One bedroom executive suite and everything was perfect. They have a fully equipped kitchen you dont even have to take anything with you on you trip they provied everything and I mean everything for the kitchen!!! The room is spacious and the bathroom is beautiful. The price is very reasonable, great customer service, very comfortable and the location is close to everything. I am going back this month (may) for vacation with my daughter and husband and I could not think of a better hotel to stay in. Especially with a child I think is better to have a well equipped room. Isis M.

Reviews.Title: “New with very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: golfwhenever
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 only spent two nights here for an impromptu trip to Universal. We had a junior suite and it was a very nice room. Everything is new, so it would be tough to be bad. The bathroom has a granite countertop and the efficiency has a small refrigerator, microwave, sink with a quartz countertop. Our room had a king sized bed that was very comfortable. It also had a pullout queen sized couch. While the couch was nice and comfortable, the pullout bed was like most pullouts, barbaric. Hotels would be better off giving customers aerobeds instead of pullout beds or cots. The hotel has a very nice pool area with a good sized outdoor pool and a small hot tub. Again everything is new so it all looks very nice. I've never stayed anywhere for $88/night that even came close to this nice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: amalitta
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel! We were in an executive suite, complete with a full kitchenette, washer/dryer, coffee maker, blender, toaster and flat screen TVs. We had a balcony that overlooked downtown Orlando. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! The front desk staff were very pleasant, as were the maintenance and housekeeping staff. The pool was beautiful! Always a sun chair to be found and the pool was kept immaculate. We went to the local Publix (take a left on Universal Blvd. from Carrier Dr. and it should be about 2 miles down Universal on your right hand side) to stock up on breakfast food, snacks, coffee and drinks, so we could save some money -- this worked out wonderfully. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone planning on staying here for business or pleasure. It is located about a 1/2 mile from International Drive, but they did have shuttles traveling every 10-15 minutes to the conference center for the ACC conference.

HotelInfo.Name: The Point Orlando Resort
